author: BuenaJay
text: Came here recently after a few years after my last visit. I can say that the quality of service, food, and atmosphere has been very consistent. Came in to watch the Mets game and the NBA finals and the atmosphere was fun and electric.

author: Denis Borisenkov
text: There is one place in Queens that has really caught my eye: the prices are pleasing to the eye, and the food is excellent. It is also a paradise for sports fans - there is a broadcast for every taste! The waitresses are charming, always ‚Ä¶

The wings were absolutely delicious, crispy, flavorful, and just the right amount of heat. Great service, cold drinks, and a fun vibe made it an awesome night out. Definitely coming back for the next game!

author: Kai Mendez
text: Honestly, this place is a hidden gem! A Mexican restaurant with the most beautiful touch: amazing Venezuelan people running it with so much love and kindness. From the moment you walk in, you feel like family. ‚Ä¶

text: The service was incredibleee and the food was really good! It has a lot of variety for such a small place‚Äîcozy atmosphere and reasonable prices right in the heart of Dumbo. A great spot to stop by for a drink! Thanks to all the staff who were very kind.

The fact that it's steps from the subway so I don't have to drive after so many margaritas is a bonus.

text: They were full on a random Monday at lunch. I understand why after trying it, it was so good. I got their lunch specials which was like $14 per person. It came with a soup, a main dish, and a pineapple juice. I‚Äôd love to go back again.

The restaurant is huge....  Noise quality outside was very nice. Views outside breath taking especially if you go before sunset.

I absolutely LOVE this place!!!

text: a beautiful restaurant with a stunning view but sadly the food does not live up to the atmosphere. extremely mediocre cuts of steak for steep prices. the fries came soggy and cold and the steak completely lacked flavour. it was also very hot in the restaurant and we asked our server about it but no changes were made.

author: Alison J
text: We were so happy to be seated on the harbor at P.J. Clarkes. Kobe seated us and we enjoyed chatting with him. The other servers were also attentive. I had the New York steak, Fries and a nice glass of Brooklyn Lager. While enjoying the sunset, I relized that I could see the Statue of Liberty! What a bonus!

author: Jacob Q.
text: The burger and drinks were delicious but the service was not very attentive. We sat at the bar and ordered got our drinks and food but nobody came back to check on us. I would have got another drink but instead I just sat with an empty ‚Ä¶

author: Mariya Proyss
text: P.J. Clarke‚Äôs on the Hudson combines classic New York charm with beautiful waterfront views. Great burgers, lively atmosphere, and warm service!

author: Steve S
text: My boys and I had lunch here after visiting the 911 Museum.  Excellent location right next to the Hudson River.  Ample outdoor seating. ‚Ä¶

author: G C
text: I love P.G.Clarkes. I been almost to all of their locations. Always good food and service. But this one is my favorite. Beautiful view, calming environment and excellent service. We stop for drinks and food. Best way to finish a Sunday walk.

author: Calen Heise
text: Came here with my girlfriend on a Sunday afternoon. The brunch buffet and unlimited selection of certain cocktails for 2 hours was amazing. The service kept coming with the drinks and the food was amazing. Drinks were very delicious and strong. Highly recommend for brunch.

author: Kyle McCarthy
text: Great food and buzzy Latino vibe. Expect (loud even outside!) music, as the fun well-dressed crowd passes by their patio cafe. Love their appetizers, especially the plantains stuffed with crab and the croquettes. The paella, salmon stuffed with crab, and lechon are always good.. And the sangria and mojitos, a winner.

author: Gaby
text: The chips for my guacamole were insanely stale. The steak in my steak salad was cold. The lettuce in the salad was drowned in avocado‚Ä¶. I couldn‚Äôt taste the dressing or the salad and didn‚Äôt even eat the salad because it was all sticky and ‚Ä¶

author: Martin Olszewski
text:
We completely enjoyed the experience of dining here.

The food was delicious.  We enjoyed , as the appetizer , the beef carpaccio . ‚Ä¶

author: Maryam Bojarian
text: We visited for the first time and had a great experience. Since we had our furry friend with us, we opted to sit outside, which was a pleasant choice. The inside had a cozy ambiance with a charming old-fashioned vibe, making it feel warm ‚Ä¶

text: I've had a wonderful experience at Pappardelle Restaurant. They were able to tend to our diet preferences and were flexible. They made us feel welcomed and relaxed. We also saw the couple next to us got their salad split and we thought it was really cute. 10/10 experience, thank you!

text: Great eggplant parm and chicken parm.  Zabaglione for desert was refreshing and light. Overall a great experience which will definitely be repeated!  The only suggestion would be to update the ambiance music to some selections that don‚Äôt include over-played Sinatra.  Other than that everything was great!

author: Stephanie Chevat
text: Nice restaurant,  the menu offers authentic Italian dishes,  it's freshly prepared and tasty. Portions could be a little more generous.

author: Matt H.
text: As others have said, for the price there are better and much worse places in the area. This is a local family restaurant it seemed to me, this was the charm. Great place for a family dinner, date, business meet up. Very nice atmosphere and the food is very good. You won't regret dinner here.

author: Felipe Ghosen
text: I had an incredible dining experience at Pappardella! From the moment I walked in, the atmosphere felt warm and authentic ‚Äî cozy lighting, friendly staff, and that classic Italian charm.

author: Enantiopus kilesa
text: I visited Pappardelle restaurant to celebrate my daughter's birthday, and we had a truly delightful experience. The restaurant has a charming ambiance, with tasteful decor that exudes warmth and elegance, making it a perfect spot for ‚Ä¶

text:
TL:DR- The Smith has really gone downhill

text: I loved the Mac and cheese and the hamburger! We also ordered the shrimp pasta and it was still good but not my favorite (sorry I‚Äôm Italian and very picky with pasta) ‚Ä¶

text:
[i went last year in 2024, but just posting this now]

We chose outdoor seating on a drizzly summer night. The location was nice, there ‚Ä¶

text: Honestly a great experience with Kristine, she was my server today, she gave me a great experience with my girlfriend. I would come again for the Hot chocolate, and the sticky toffee pudding, she was great and honestly just amazing ‚Ä¶

text: I had a reservation for Saturday at 5 PM and was very much looking forward to the experience, as it came highly recommended by a trusted friend. Our meal began pleasantly‚Äîthe calamari appetizer was delightfully light, airy, and ‚Ä¶

text: No matter how many times I give them a second chance, always the same story. Order online, nothing shows up. Good pizza, extremely unreliable

text: Amazing food.   Homemade Chicken Dumplings and Chiang Mai Soup.  Will be back again,  and again.

text:
UPDATED REVIEW 2024:

text: This is some of the best Asian cuisine I‚Äôve had in a long time! Every dish we ordered was outstanding, as were the cocktails. I highly recommend it. My personal favorite was the street food-style Singapore noodles and black pepper prawns.

author: G√∂kay Zeren
text: Great small restaurant serving a diverse range of Southeast Asian cuisine. The appetizers were enjoyable, and the cocktails were well-crafted to complement the dishes. The food was delicious with generous portions. Highly recommended!

text: Pretty decent dim sum for the UWS. Spacious and very very kid friendly. There were plenty of families with their strollers and lots of high chairs. There‚Äôs an area in the back to park strollers or if you have a sleeping baby, you can park ‚Ä¶

text:

The dim sum items are pretty good! And good thing is that many main dishes come ‚Ä¶

text: We looked for a good dim sum restaurant before going to the Natural History Museum and found one on Google. However, the food was not exceptional, and nothing really stood out. We have had better dim sum in other places. The service was decent, and so was the atmosphere.

text: My partner and I had a very nice experience dining here on Easter, food was great, staff was friendly and the menu had several great options. We ended up ordering a few things off of the dim sum menu and were super full by the end of our ‚Ä¶

text: Great sushi! Some of the best I've had in a long time. Great options, quality ingredients, and friendly service. The tacos and sushi bowls are yummy too. But you need to get some sushi there. I would definitely go back!

author: G Frye
text: The Downtown Special rolls were great. We smelled the wonderful ocean as soon as we open the container. It‚Äôs more than enough for our family of five. And we have been order a lot from this place. However, once there was missing ginger and ‚Ä¶

text: Good service and nice interiors. The avocado sushi and the sweet potato roll was good. They served plum wine which is the sweetest one I have ever tried so far. Loved it .

text: Ordered through ubereats. The bags came wet with the Udon we had ordered, as it had lost its cover in transit and was all over the place. The Miso soup came in a paperboard cup whose bottom section had nearly dissolved, so it leaked. The ‚Ä¶

text: Really good sushi drinks and service. There is a plethora of menu options that you can choose from. The place is very clean and service is prompt. I personally loved the Samurai Sushi combo entree.

author: T S
text: I can‚Äôt believe I haven‚Äôt done a review for this place before! The food is so good with unique and interesting rolls and menu options. My absolute favorite go-to menu options are the lobster tacos and the ‚ÄúRa‚Äùckin roll! They never miss! I ‚Ä¶

text: I love coming to Haru Sushi UWS to soothe my sushi cravings from time to time. They have a really good happy hour menu! Great service, good sushi, beautiful presentation!

text: I'm giving this restaurant a top rating even though I barely ate anything - the person who made the reservation didn't know I was vegetarian. Nonetheless I had a great time, as I love experiencing cuisines that I've never been exposed to, ‚Ä¶

text: What a gem tucked away off the main drag. Im hesitant to even mention them because everything about the place is fantastic. Czech beer on tap, a huge menu with tons of great food. Top options from our visit were the duck confit, red ‚Ä¶

text: Came here first time yesterday evening for diner. Glad I found this place! As someone from a similar culinary and cultural background ( Poland ) it is so hard to find good, Central European restaurants in the city. The interior of the ‚Ä¶

text: Since there‚Äôs no decent Hungarian restaurant in the city, I always appreciate other Central European cuisines. Food is great overall, some dishes can be a hit-and-miss.  Czech beer on tap, slightly grumpy service (adds to the authenticity), hot goulash soup (guly√°s for us) with fresh bread and I‚Äôm happy.

text: This is a fun place, but dinner was hit and miss.  The duck confit with red cabbage was delicious, but the salmon disappointed.  Service was OK at best, and it was a nice dining experience.  We will probably not return, as the quality of the food was uneven.    I think this might be the perfect place for a beer and a bite.

author: Martina Ruseva
text: Amazing, very authentic food with generous portions (NJ suburbs sizes) üòÑ I loved the goulash and the palachinke dessert. Worth the trip if you are looking to experience authentic European cuisine ‚Ä¶

text: Yesterday I ate there with friends for the third time. My grandmother was Slovak, so I grew up familiar with a closely related cuisine. Bohemian Spirit is the real thing. Three of us had the Potato and Mushroom Soup, a generous bowl, rich, ‚Ä¶

text: This place has a pool table with enough space to play. That alone is worth the trip, but they also have a back area with  social/mixer vibes. Ffff I don‚Äôt even wanna tell people, ($5 beers is a good deal for me) bartender was polite; beer was ice cold and I‚Äôm glad I found this spot

author: Nia Gaillard (Mint)
text: Coming back to try the food. But I absolutely love their frozen espresso martini. The bartenders are absolutely incredible and nice . Beautiful bar and beautiful atmosphere. I‚Äôm so excited to visit again‚ù§Ô∏èüôèüèº ‚Ä¶

author: Jolie Valentin
text: This place prides itself on being open minded and inclusive. Really? I went in on a weekend night wearing my Magen David and was told by both employees and customers that I was in the wrong bar. So much for inclusion.

author: Tom F
text: Home bar for my Monday pool league. Great staff, great drinks at a good cash price, and plenty of options for events and dances that will satisfy your palate no matter who you are. From raves to theatre to billiards, this place will scratch your itch, guaranteed.

author: Leah V
text: I've been perfoming at and hosting at Parkside for years - I just started my own series there and it has been the most seamless of experiences working with Gavin (and Dex by extension!). I'm given freedom to curate the way I want and have ‚Ä¶

author: Mariette Papic
text: I have been a fan of Parkside for years. It's the last of the truly local bars in the Lower East Side. In the back room open mic events and art reign. In the front, the pool table and the photo booth are my faves. I know the owner (full ‚Ä¶

author: Sebastian Rosen
text: Just divorced my wife and came back to my favorite bar of all time. The bartender poured me a stiff one and asked me about my problems. A beautiful African American woman began twerking on me and I soon forgot my troubles. I love the park side lounge so much. May it live on forever.

author: Lauren Melissa Ellzey
text: I went to Parkside Lounge for a meetup in the back room. The acoustics were good, the live music was nice, the atmosphere was conducive to conversations with friends, and the drinks were decently priced. But it was just that: average. There was a 20 dollar minimum charge for cards.

author: Hilton Webb
text: Went here to listen to a friend Felix Guzman read his poetry and ending loving this little gem with two bars, pool table, performance stage and and all-day until 8pm Happy Hour. What more can you ask of a local watering hole. Too bad I live a $45 Uber ride away or I would come more often than I can.

author: Matthew S
text:
One of the last real dive bars in the LES.

Good beer selection, even better prices. Unpretentious and genuine. ‚Ä¶

author: Paige Amble
text: Excellent service as we felt welcomed and the staff took care of us. The inside was beautiful and made the ambiance great! Had great little appetizer at the beginning which included bread and salami and cheese. Order the special of the days ‚Ä¶

author: Albert Law

Service was really chill and friendly. Definitely coming back!

author: Jun Jii
text:
Great food, lovely wines, friendly staff, nice ambience, and reasonable price tag. (Given it's NYC)
Highly recommended!!

text: My girlfriend and I‚Äôs experience at this restaurant was spectacular.The food was so amazing. The staff was very welcoming and seated us at a table with a beautiful view. We had the pleasure to be served by the manger who gave us a ‚Ä¶

text: üö´Unfortunately this place under the quality of the food.  Despite the fact that their prices have risen three times in less than a year and a half.  Not happy with that, food is ordered at home and the portions are poor.  They raise the ‚Ä¶

They took my steak taco and just threw on American cheese, lettuce and chunks of unseasoned tomatoes. No sour cream or guacamole or anything to add flavor. It was so bland and dry. So disappointed.

text: I went here on a Saturday & they offered a 2 for one drink special which was great.  I had the chicken dumplings which I really enjoyed along with rice.  This place would be great for a date.  It offers a intimate setting.  The service was ‚Ä¶

text: M-thai is a great date venue. It has low lighting with a classy yet casual atmosphere. Service is fast, food is great! Their Thai iced tea is one of the best I've had and I recommend their lemon grass chicken. One downside is that the ‚Ä¶

text: Bad service and bad hostess. First, I live one block away and tried to order a delivery. They totally got the address wrong even though we called numerous times with the correct address. After the delivery never made it we decided to go ‚Ä¶

text: Really good, well-rounded Thai place among the many in Chelsea. I love the pad thai with crispy duck, one of my favorite Thai dishes in the area. A great options for when everyone in the group wants to get something different, because everything's good here.

text: I ordered the Spicy Noodle (other places call this Drunken Noodle or Kee Mao), which is a personal favorite of mine.  It was alright, but not all that great. The thai iced tea I got was very good, and the service was prompt.  I am glad I gave M Thai a try, but I still prefer Room Service.

author: Tom Lewkowitz
text: I don't think delivery has ever taken more than 20 minutes. Consistently decent thai food. Great basil curries and thai dumplings. You can always get a seat, never really crowded.

author: Esther A
text: Great and friendly service (ordered to-go) but the portion size of the rice for the peanut curry lunch was puny. Had to go around the corner to another restaurant and order a side of rice. Won't waste my money here again.

author: Rome Odom
text: One of too many Thai restaurants in Chelsea. The food is good and the modern decorations make this one a little more upscale. Good for birthdays and small groups or even a date.

author: Charlie Andrews
text: Went there for a quick bite to eat and ate the Pad Thai - it didn't disappoint. It was definitely one of the better Pad Thais that I've had in my life. Good food, quick service.

author: Corin Anderson
text: Chicken in ginger sauce, from the "Wok station" part of the menu.  Rice on the side is included.  Exceeds my expectations a little bit.  Cooked well, ginger was evident, and the sauce was light, not syrupy.  I'd go back, especially if I'm staying at the nearby hotel again (across the street).

text: Highly recommended. This place bustling during brunch, so make sure your whole party is there to get seated quickly! This diner has such great charm. It's got lots of open space and sunlight streaming in, which creates a super inviting ‚Ä¶

text: Breakfast in the upper west side with no fuss. Hearty portions, friendly folks, good selection. We were hungry and ordered many side dishes along with our breakfasts‚Ä¶.all was tasty. No wait, quick service, affordable.

text: Food was okay, no complaints, not super tasty nor bad. The portion sizes were huge like every other diner in the states. The orange juice was a bit sour and acidic. Avocado and cheddar sandwich was edible. A 3/5 experience based on food.

Highly Recommend!!!!

Wish they had some bread to start.

Walked by and I knew I had to come in.

text: We knew this place would be good from reviews (decor doesn't give you that impression), but it surpassed our expectations. The salsa they give you was some of the best I've had, roasted veggies that tasted kinda creamy too, so good!! The ‚Ä¶

author: N S
text: Great tacos, not too expensive. Fast and easy service. I came on a Friday around 12:30 and there was only one other table eating, though someone else came in for a pick up order. I got the pulled chicken tacos and the amount of meat per taco was good. They must get busier in the evening. Either way it‚Äôs definitely worth stopping by!

author: Madhulika Murthy
text: One of the best tacos. Haven‚Äôt felt like going back to Los Tacos or any of the other popular ones after eating here. Excellent spicy margaritas. Service is quick and staff is friendly! Definitely one of my fav go to neighborhood joints.

author: Sara Bravmann
text: Ordered a chicken burrito and shrimp quesadilla for delivery - the quesadilla was almost completely flat with almost no filling, and the burrito was all rice with maybe 3 little chicken cubes. Would expect much more for $20 each. Definitely will not be ordering again.

author: RamO Rivera
text: I loved this place, very cozy and the employees are super friendly and attentive if you need anything. Something that for me is a plus is that the owner approached each table to verify that everything is fine and welcome each customer. ‚Ä¶

author: Valeria Cruz
text:
My whole experience was a 15/10
I sat outside with my dog and the waiter greeted us and my pup with water right away. The staff was all so attentive and so nice. I had an appetizer, a torta, a cocktail and dessert. Every single item ordered was PHENOMENAL. I will be coming back regularly.

author: Nicole Louie
text: Friendly staff and great food. We started with guac and chips which were a no brainer appetizer for us. Then we shared birria tacos before eating our own birria burrito and chorizo papas burrito. Everything we had was great and I loved the portion sizes!

author: Danit Tzamit
text: This is just a great place for a casual Mexican lunch. Not to fancy but very tasty. We took the taco and burrito and it was very good. You can also take bowls, nachos and other Mexican specialties. The guacamole was small and overpriced. They also have special days with happy hour etc.

author: Jenny Beth Stenquist
text: We had been searching for a go-to Vietnamese place ahead of winter pho season and boy did we not have to look very far! Plum went above and beyond on all accounts. The plum platter appetizer was a must, especially if you‚Äôre bringing ‚Ä¶

author: FITMS
text: The duck curry is 10/10! The duck was crunchy outside but soft inside, and the curry soup is to die for, I only wish they've given more curry to the bowl since it was sooooo delicious. I would love to return and try their others menu.

author: Latoya McCalla
text: Stop by on a Sunday afternoon as I was in the area. Cute little place, intimate, has bar seatng as well. Hostess was very nice. I was able to sit immediately with no reservation. I decided to start with the ginger ale, the crispy spring ‚Ä¶

author: kandamas Epifano
text:
Plum is such a little gem in the upper west side neighborhood.
Perfect spot when I‚Äôm craving pho or just want something cozy.
Love grabbing a sake pineapple or iced Viet coffee, and their duck curry with lychee is a must every time.highly recommend!

author: Zachary Thomas
text:
Very friendly staff and fast service, but ....
‚Ä¢ Pho portion is pretty smol üò≠
‚Ä¢ The broth is not very tasty ‚Ä¶

author: Ashley B
text: The place is really cute and they are very friendly. However, I would not suggest going here for a Vietnamese coffee. It doesn‚Äôt have anything that you‚Äôre looking for when it comes to Vietnamese iced coffee. They used half-and-half instead ‚Ä¶

author: Josu√© Zamora
text: My wife and I often drop by Plum when we are in the Upper West Side. Everyone is always very kind and welcoming. The food is authentic and delicious, and the ambiance is serene.

author: Ricky Charriez
text: The tofu curry was a superstar! üëåüèº I visited the restaurant looking forward to trying the vegan pho but the tofu curry special caught my eye and I ordered it. Delicious! The curry is made with coconut milk and it has so much flavor. I would ‚Ä¶

author: Jay Buggy
text: the food was average, especially pho was not as good as i expected. but the service was attentive.

author: Colin Lim
text: Small portions, inauthentic taste, very little meat. The kimchi fries were nothing special. When I asked for bean sprouts, lime, and basil, they told me there were already bean sprouts in the soup. Yeah, like five pieces. They also had no ‚Ä¶

author: Lori Lam
text: this AYCE KBBQ spot is now part of my family‚Äôs rotation. the meat is always good and we love that they‚Äôre adding new items to the menu. we always get the cube steak, cast iron steak, pork belly and pork jowl. the staff cooks and cuts the ‚Ä¶

text: Absolutely loved everything about this place! The cat iron has vegetables, kimchi, mushrooms, and onions on it. You pick 3 meats (beef, chicken, poultry, seafood) and staff cooks it for you at the table. The food and sauces were very good ‚Ä¶

text: Let's start from arriving at the parking lot where there is plenty of space.  Once you're parked you will proceed to enter a beautifully designed interior of the restaurant.  The staff will prepare your table while you wait.  The restaurant ‚Ä¶

text: I was impressed by this location. It exceeded my expectations for a place on Staten Island. We have been to a few all you can eat restaurants and this is up there. We didn't have to wait too long to be seated. The waiters were pleasant and ‚Ä¶

text:
First time coming to Cast Iron Pot!!
I came here today with my family for a birthday dinner, and I had such a fun time! ‚Ä¶

A nice place to have gathering either with friends or family to enjoy a nice meal.  Better not to order too much side dishes.

author: CrystalLi (Tiffany)

text: I went to this restaurant last week, i went alone, but im telling you go with your friends. You have two hours to enjoy your bbq meal. I like the foods here. Side dishes are very delicious. And there was a beef soup, my goodness it was ‚Ä¶

author: J W
text: Firstly the service. Our server John, was very slow and not attuned to our needs. He left our meat cooking for too long where pieces were left burnt and crisp. There were also no tongs left on the table for us to cook ourselves, so we can ‚Ä¶

text: The food here is very good and flavorful, everything is fresh and ready so you can get in and out if you're on your lunch break. My only complaint is I don't feel full on one scoop of meat, but I also don't want to pay $20 on lunch after ‚Ä¶

author: Steven Lam
text:
Stopped for dinner as wifey loves tacos, we‚Äôve never been, and it was nearby.

Overall, I was reminded of other burrito/taco chains that serve food in a ‚Ä¶

text: I order from the New Hyde Park Guac Shop for myself and my coworkers every week and the food is consistently delicious. The people there are great too. I highly recommend it!

text: I am totally disgusted. Decided to try Guac Shop Mexican Grill, bought a chicken bowl, got guac and queso, it made the price over $17. For a rice bowl that's insane. Started eating, found a hair in my bow. Never again. That is beyond nasty ‚Ä¶

author: Joy Elizabeth
text: The staff at this location is phenomenal. They treat every guest with respect and provide wonderful customer service. My son loves their quesadillas and the in app promotions really give you more bang for your buck! Everything is so ‚Ä¶

text: I ordered a taco dip for the first time from this location. I was disappointed at the quality, quantity, presentation. The dip was missing queso sauce, and maybe the other sauces too. There was a sprinkling of shredded cheese on top but ‚Ä¶

text: Great fresh dim sum, served quickly and kinda no nonsense. Really friends efficient service and lots of menu options.

author: zhang yan
text: Very delicious food, the waiters did a great job. The environment is very comfortable.

author: anna nguyen
text: The food and service were great! Got here as soon as they opened and it was nice and quiet and not crowded. I was surprised by the high quality food and freshness as well! Everything was delicious and was as good as dim sum I‚Äôve had in Hong Kong!

author: Mimi Coleman
text: Great service, super tasty dim sum, and everything came out fast and fresh. Loved how efficient and friendly the staff were ‚Äî definitely coming back!

author: sofia mercado
text: I‚Äôve come here with my friends multiple times for celebrations. The owner is so kind and generous. Friendly and caring. So accommodating for groups of 10+ too. When we came for my birthday, they gave us a bottle of sake on the house to ‚Ä¶

author: Alex Wiley
text: Great dimsum and service, this is an awesome place for a group dinner in the East village. They execute really well on classic dim sum dishes like BBQ pork buns, scallion pancakes, radish cake and shrimp rice roll. We also loved the ‚Ä¶

author: Amanda
text: Don't let the name Dim Sum Palace fool you, they can do more than just dim sum.  We had a lovely Xmas Eve dinner, steamed grouper fish, ginger & scallion crab, fried rice and eggplants for 4 people. ‚Ä¶

author: Frank Siu
text: Michelin guide did not disappoint! Happy hour on a saturday from 4-7pm, perfect for a dinner. Ordered bunch of tacos and food and every bite was amazing from start to finish! Waiters were very good as well.

author: Lana B. Baroni
text: My husband and I ordered drinks and appetizers. The service was amazing. Prices are ok. The food is good but maybe my expectations were too off, I thought that all their plates would have insects as ingredients. I was kind of disappointed ‚Ä¶

author: Joel A.R.
text:
Quite a nice atmosphere, food is good.

I got attracted to the tortillas, orange and kind of fluffy a tiny bit sweet but ‚Ä¶

text: Came here on a Friday night around 8pm and there were a few open tables for walk ins. The restaurant had a few good options with black ants and grasshoppers. We tried the black ant guacamole and there was an option to have it without the ‚Ä¶

author: KJ
text: Had the Chef Special Menu and the courses were all fresh with different flavors. The final flan made with the black ant topping was sweet and savory, sangria was good, and overall it was an experience. 4/5 for pricing and portions

author: Madhumita Sawant
text: We went for brunch on a Saturday and the pace was super crowded. Since it was a very hot day, everyone was sitting indoors, and it was a bit stuffy. But the food was decent. I really liked my fish tacos. ‚Ä¶

author: Casey Dahl
text: Checked this place out for brunch and it was fantastic!  Everything on the menu sounds delicious so we‚Äôll definitely go back.  I can easily recommend the steak and eggs or the burger.  The drinks are made well too! The mimosa was made with pulpy orange juice which made it taste fresh and refreshing.

author: Justin Rogers-Cooper
text: This is some pretty great Mexican with several unique twists. Nice vibe and atmosphere, and good drinks and cocktails. And not so inventive and precious it doesn‚Äôt fill you up: it does, with generous portions and solid, expected flavors that come with a singular flair. And some exotic choices too if you‚Äôre feeling up for it.

author: Tiffany H.
text: Let me start off with I love their music play list haha as a latin dancer, I just wanted to get up and dance at the restaurant. The atmosphere was relaxed and cozy. We ordered every thing from the happy hour menu. They came out very good. ‚Ä¶

author: Chloe Hawkings
text: We came as a group on Saturday and had the best experience for a bottomless brunch. The food was delicious and the menu offered something for everyone. The bottomless deal is either mimosas or margaritas and our glasses were never empty. The servers were incredible. I would 100% recommend!

author: Chantel P
text: Food was basic. We celebrated our birthday there. Brunch special unlimited light drinks with 1 entree. The bill was all messed up but corrected. The waitress was nice but seemed totally frazzled as she was taking care of all the tables. It ‚Ä¶

text: I visited this restaurant/lounge for a fun event. It was decorated inside and out for the Holiday season, very festive! Our event was upstairs, which was all fancy and fun. I liked the light fixtures that were more like glass lanterns, lit ‚Ä¶

author: Rehema Trimiew
text: They created a deal on pulsd that clearly says full menu for all selections. When we got there they switched the menus on us. My friend went there for a steak, but that wasn't on the reduced deal menu, but it is on their actual menu. I ‚Ä¶

author: Chef Menajem Peretz
text: Well located and the decor is amazing, the have suck a good ambiance. Simple menu but generous portion full of test and well presented. Price are ok taking it to consideration the Location, they have a second floor that is beautiful just for drinks and smoke

author: Timothy Atallah
text: Very fancy, the vibe is it's a classy place with the decadence of hookah. Food was pretty excellent, but not much to write home about. The staff was ok, mostly friendly, the lady who showed us to the table kinda initially had a bad ‚Ä¶

author: Sindhura Gopinath
text: Their brunch deal for 2 for the price of 1 is so so good! The place is quite unique and has a really cool vibe.  Sort of middle eastern vibe blended with some brunch fun. Quite big and a lot of space.  The truffle Mac and cheese and the apple pancakes are really really good!

author: Sabine's Hallway Natural Hair Salon
text: I had my birthday dinner here and it was just fantastic.  The food & drinks were good. However,  the entertainment was spectacular! I've already recommended Le Souk to several people.

author: TheNYfishGuy Felix Miranda
text: The host was attentive and our waitress was awesome.  We both had the salmon and it was delicious!  Don‚Äôt forget to try the tahini appetizer, it was perfect !

author: Shanta Marbury
text: The food was very good. From the time I walked in the door,all staff was hospitable,accommodating and helpful.  The mandatory coat check for $5,too pricey. However overall my group and myself had a GREAT TIME!!!

author: Jess W
text: My favorite bottomless brunch place in New York City! The waiters are great, constantly refilling you‚Äôre drinks. Food is delicious as well. The DJ keeps the crowd lively (especially after 2pm). A lot of birthdays are celebrated and they have sparklers and turn on a song! Pictured is the eggs Benedict.

author: Deb L
text: I‚Äôve had this place bookmarked for quite some time and really wanted to love it. The service was friendly and the food was ok, but mostly too sweet for my taste. The best bites were the appetizers. We ordered the roti canai and the ‚Ä¶

author: Alina Varabyeva
text: Attentive and pleasant service is the best feature of this restaurant. We were not impressed with their food though. Nasi lemak and chicken satay was just ok, we definitely had much better elsewhere.

author: Jolleen Wagner
text: Great spot for a small but mighty variety of well executed Vietnamese, Malaysian, and Thai options. Plus the staff is warm, helpful when it comes to food allergies, and willing to help you navigate the menu if you need.

author: Sapphira Bella
text: 3 stars because I found the food was absolutely MEH. The curries were WAYYYY SALTY!!! Everything was honestly just OK and too salty, and also either overcooked or undercooked and with the same sauce.

author: Lina Yasn√≥ Ovalle

author: Kiara Koval
text: Lovely little spot! Great food, had the rengdan and it was super yummy and authentic. Highly recommend. Everyone was very sweet!

author: Margaret O'Connell
text: Delicious dishes made with love and care at this family restaurant. The owners came originally from Malaysia, and many of the dishes are their own household recipes. The beef rendang, chicken satay, char kway teow, and sambal string beans ‚Ä¶

author: aqua lai
text: One of the best curry laksa I‚Äôve ever had, the lunch set is $13.99 including a drink. I knew this place was gonna be good once I saw a young Asian child doing homework by the cashier. The service was quick and attentive.

author: Hennesys Disla
text: The passion fruit refresher drinks are delicious and fruity. Never had anything like it. The fresh fruit makes a world of a difference.

author: Queen B
text: Love Mama is such a gem! The food is always fresh, flavorful, and perfectly cooked ‚Äî every dish tastes homemade with a modern twist. The staff are super friendly and quick, and the cozy atmosphere makes it a great spot for any occasion. The ‚Ä¶

author: Mag Tulsi
text: Why is this place so underrated? Situated in Manhattan, East Village, this place is a must go when you‚Äôre in the neighborhood. It‚Äôs probably my third visit in the last five years and everytime I come back I leave happy after having the meal ‚Ä¶

author: EJ
text:
Overall: A huge disappointment
Ambience: outdated decor, but very good for solo lunch, quite a few tables are solo diners ‚Ä¶

text: Solid dim sum place if you cannot make it to Chinatown. Some of their bites needed a little bit of seasoning but nothing that their chili oil and sauces couldn‚Äôt fix. I generally liked it and I‚Äôd go back. Their lychee hot tea was awesome. They were also pretty quick to serve up the dim sum.

author: Jovanny Sanchez

Falafel (Taameya) was especially good. Service was warm and the ambiance was excellent. Lots of space between tables and the place is very nicely decorated.

author: BURGER TRUGS
text: spacious, airy, and flooded with natural light, leon‚Äôs is  a welcoming getaway in union square. michelin-star level attention to detail, without the pretentiousness ‚Ä¶

author: Kate Ecker
text: We hosted a 50th anniversary dinner at Leon‚Äôs and it was a totally wonderful experience, through the whole planning process and then the event itself!  Lovely set up of the private dining room, incredibly warm and perfect service and Fantastic Food!  All of our guests agreed-nothing could have been better!  Thank you Leon‚Äôs‚ù§Ô∏è

author: Liz Farris
text: I can‚Äôt decide if the service or the food was better ‚Äî and yes, that‚Äôs possible at places like Leon‚Äôs. We had a group for dinner, and from the moment we sat down to when we paid, everything was top-notch. It‚Äôs the perfect spot for a date or ‚Ä¶

author: Kate Fisher

author: Olena Perez
text: Incredible addition to the neighborhood! Have gone twice this week - highly highly recommend. ‚Ä¶

text: One of my favorite places to grab lunch. Great prices, consistent quality, and delicious food! They also have lots of seating and the food comes out very fast.

author: Ri D
text: I ordered takeout. I ordered the salmon with beef combo teriyaki with brown and white rice. The staff were very friendly! There‚Äôs also indoor seating. It was good but a bit pricey especially because there wasn‚Äôt a lot of meat. The beef was also a little on the tough side. It was worth a try though! Super cute place!

author: WHITE LION
text:
short: It seems like a healthier alternative than many other places in the area

long: It's my second time here. I usually used to go to the Panera next door ‚Ä¶

text:
SERVED NON-VEG (I‚Äôm a vegetarian)

I visited this place for the first time, asked a lot of questions about what ‚Ä¶

text: I‚Äôm so glad I discovered Glaze! The place looks brand new ‚Äî fresh, stylish, spacious, and filled with natural light. It‚Äôs really a pleasure to be there. ‚Ä¶

author: cathy chan
text: This was better than I expected! The steak was perfectly cooked, not chewy at all. The salad dressing was ok probably getting a different flavor next time

text:
Hidden fjord salmon salad - AMAZING.

text: Let me apart by saying the  food was excellent as was our waitress.The food was inspired & unexpected. Inventive combinations & lovely presentation. Our favorites were the gem lettuce salad (addictive), the Stracciatella cheese appetizer ‚Ä¶

text: Food was amazing! They do need more waitstaff but our server was very kind and great, just slow service because on a night like Valentines seemed like only 2 waiters covering the whole restaurant. ‚Ä¶

text: I had a hard time deciding what score I should give this place. It‚Äôs a five star restaurant but we had a four star experience. All dishes we had were creative and it‚Äôs clear the food was made fresh with attention to details and serving. Yet ‚Ä¶

author: Sarah Hui
text: This is a good small restaurant around union square. The inside is romantic and great for a dinner date - wonderful mood lighting that makes it feel almost Parisian. They have a good happy hour special for affordable wine/cocktails. The menu has fresh seasonal items. The food was good but nothing stood out.

author: Michelle Li
text: We sat out in the back garden and the ambience was lovely but you need your mosquito repellent, my friend was but five times! The food was clean tasting and well presented. We had the tomato and cucumber appetizers. I enjoyed the cucumber ‚Ä¶

author: Anastasiia Rudnytska
text: This is one of the places where you want to return. The menu options are really good, and every dish you take it's just simply perfect, despite that some combination might seem a little weird, however you won't want to add there anything else. Our server was really nice and friendly, and the place itself was sparkling clean!

author: Trevor Sumner
text: The food is beautiful but disappointing.  Every dish fell short.  The chicken fried mushrooms with hollandaise were served with more like an aioli than a hollandaise.  It missed the acid to cut through the fried mushrooms which were ‚Ä¶

author: Jennifer Snow
text: Great meal! Small menu of fresh seasonal ingredients. Some plates had unique ingredient combinations ie pana cotta with celery root-but they worked beautifully. The  dishes we ordered were all mid-sized ( healthy appetizer portions). Our table ordered 2 plates each & shared dessert.

author: Matthew Ho
text: Pranakhon is one of my favourite Thai restaurants in the city. The atmosphere is always very lively, and they have such a wide variety of authentic dishes that I'm always very impressed by. ‚Ä¶

author: Sanchita Ochani
text: It‚Äôs a two-story restaurant that‚Äôs absolutely gorgeous, but the tables do feel a little smushed together, which I didn‚Äôt love. That said, the place was packed - practically every table was full - yet the service was impressively quick. We ‚Ä¶

author: Chandni Chandihok
text: Pranakhon in NY is one of those rare places that hits the mark every single time. The ambiance, the warm service, the food ‚Ä¶ I genuinely start drooling just thinking about it. Their Pad Thai is hands-down one of the best I‚Äôve had in my ‚Ä¶

author: Adrien Ferrand
text: Dinner at Manuela was an unforgettable experience from start to finish. The moment you step inside, you‚Äôre surrounded by an atmosphere that blends art, warmth, and sophistication. The space feels like a curated gallery. ‚Ä¶

author: Anna A
text: Manuela in Soho is already my new go-to spot in the city. From the moment you walk in, you realize this is more than just a restaurant. It is a living, breathing art gallery. The walls are lined with gorgeous pieces, and at the heart of it ‚Ä¶

author: Josephine Lee
text: Not gonna lie: Even though I'd done my research, I still half-expected Gene Wilder to start singing about pure imagination when I walked into Manuela and saw the gorgeous rainbow mushroom chandelier. It felt like I had stepped into a candy ‚Ä¶

author: Loren Garcia
text: I had an amazing time dining at Manuela! From start to finish, everything was exceptional. The food was absolutely delicious, every dish was bursting with flavor and beautifully presented. ‚Ä¶

author: Catherine Case
text: Dinner at Manuela in Soho was one of the best meals I have had in a long time. The moment you walk in, you are surrounded by art. The space doubles as a gallery, and the showstopper is the wild, colorful sculpture that spreads over the bar ‚Ä¶

author: Luana Paiva
text: Manuela is a hidden gem in SoHo! This beautiful restaurant is curated by a gallery and features stunning paintings and sculptures. The design choices make the space even more special. Now, let‚Äôs talk about the food: it's ‚Ä¶

author: Rovik Robert
text: Very cool interior decor, especially with all the art. Biscuits are a must order, and I really enjoyed the mushrooms on toast. Fluke crudo was okay at best. Good selection of drinks here as well.

author: Natalie Schmidt
text: Had to come back because of their squash pasta, the food is just wonderful. Love the vibe too, beautiful Art on every wall. The service was amazing too, very patient with me asking lots of questions and helpful with choosing something that ‚Ä¶

author: Liviya David
text: I sat at the bar for a casual dinner. Get those biscuits!!! I had that with a glass of wine and the side salad because I wasn‚Äôt too hungry. The service was great and attentive and the space is beautiful with so much art. Highly recommend for folks looking for a lovely dinner in the area.

author: Dalisha P
text: Where do I begin? I know for my friends and  I we had a ball. I am confused as to what people are complaining about LOL. This place is not only gorgeous but the service and food are great as well. In the heart of soho, we decided to have ‚Ä¶

author: Nena
text: We didn't have a dinner reservation luckily they were able to accommodate us. Appetizer & entrees were exceeded out expectations. Save room for dessert because the tiramisu was worth ordering.  Serving for two was abundant which was nice to enjoy the next day. Service staff was friendly and attentive considering how busy they were.

author: Penny Fun
text: Finally made it here! I always walk by and see this place packed with people, so I made a brunch reservation to try their pasta. Honestly didn‚Äôt expect to love it, but it‚Äôs really good! Light in flavor, not too creamy, and perfectly ‚Ä¶

author: Jason Van
text: Really disappointing experience at La Pecora Bianca SoHo. We ordered the tagliatelle, rigatoni, and cauliflower ‚Äî and honestly, everything was far too salty and soggy. The pasta tasted like it had been sitting out, the sauces were heavy and ‚Ä¶

author: Cristian S
text:
If I could give more than 5 stars, I absolutely would! üåü
Excellent place ‚Äî from the moment you walk in until you leave, the service is outstanding. ‚Ä¶

author: Holly Peace
text: Absolutely delicious! Rigatoni, zucchini fries, and crispy artichoke were all out of this world!! Bella was a very kind and attentive server. The ambiance is soothing and chic. Don‚Äôt skip this place!

author: Juan Diaz
text: La pecora Bianca is located in a beautiful and colorful corner of the heart of Soho, a space that can be enjoyed both inside and out in warm weather. Excellent service, the staff is super friendly and kind, and the quality and flavor of the food are amazing. I highly recommend it! Book table in advance.

author: Maria Clara Quihillalt
text: Delicious italian food. The pictures say more than what I could ever describe the amazing meal we had. Service was spectacular and we even became friends with the table next to us.

author: Pelin Smines
text: Perfect spot for watching people, enjoying the small street outside and having delicious meals. Everything I had was delicious. Especially the local burrata plate. The service is excellent. They use online payment system which works like a charm. I am sad I had so little time to enjoy this place. Fantastic establishment.

author: Nikella Niksen
text:
Wonderful Brunch + Exceptional Service by Alexandra

Had such a lovely brunch experience at Picora Bianca! The food was fresh, ‚Ä¶

author: Louis Shaffer
text: Best pasta anywhere.  Fantastic service.  Appetizers are fantastic.  Bread is great and comes with olive oil and vinaigrette. ‚Ä¶

author: ReedH
text: Another great addition to the growing list of awesome taco spots in NYC. I‚Äôve been to Santo Taco a couple of times now, and every taco I‚Äôve tried has been spot on. The one you have to get, though, is their Mexico City‚Äìstyle steak ‚Ä¶

author: Teck Boon
text: While slightly expensive, the steak taco is really good and the quality of the ingredients are great too. Just a small menu so the food comes out really fast. There‚Äôs quite a few tables available and the turnover is quite quick so it‚Äôs easy to get a table. Their drinks are also very refreshing and great for a summer day.

author: Mayra Bejar
text: The tacos here were quite delicious. The trompo tacos, in particular, were amazing. The service and atmosphere were also pleasant, and it was not crowded during our visit. We also sampled the asada and zucchini tacos, which were enjoyable, ‚Ä¶

author: SEAN GIBBS
text: I went by to try this new taco spot and I was very impressed with how amazing and delicious the tacos was. ‚Ä¶

author: Ali Halawa
text: Had the trompo, carne asada and chicken. These tacos are on the pricier side so if you are trying to maximize flavor yield just put all your chips into multiple trompo‚Äôs. You don‚Äôt need to get anything else. It‚Äôs the best taco in NYC

author: Jack Tuggle
text: Being from California finding good tacos in New York City is pretty tough. I did come across a tacos list on TikTok, which is where I saw this place and it‚Äôs right next to my work so I knew I had to try it. ‚Ä¶

author: Cello Yellow
text: I stopped in for a quick taco and enjoyed the fresh ingredients. Definitely one of the better spots in the city but portions are smaller than standards like Los tacos no 1. I tried the carne asada and washed it down with agua santa (blend ‚Ä¶

author: Diana Leon
text: Our meal at Santo Taco was delicious. The flavor of the tortillas stood out, they‚Äôre truly exceptional. The mushroom taco was a standout, packed with rich, savory flavor. Don‚Äôt skip the Agua Santa it‚Äôs a must-try! And to top it all off, end your meal with the cookie. trust me, you won‚Äôt regret it.

author: Blake Rasmussen
text: An amazing taco spot, excellent tacos and certainly among the best in NYC. The steak was phenomenal, and everything was great. The tortillas are made fresh, sturdy and they stand up to a heap of meat and maintain a great bite.

author: Wendy Harnarine
text: Amazing trompo, carne asada,and delicious carnitas. Tasty salsas & perfect pickled onions & toppings. Every taco was outstanding, freshly made and full of flavor. Highly recommend!

author: Niam Saint Luce
text: I was in Soho last Tuesday and decided to meet up with some friends of mine who were also in the neighborhood. They suggested we visit Little Ruby's since I've never been there and it was close to where we already were. The place was packed ‚Ä¶

author: Adel
text: The place is small and can get quite busy. The food was decent overall. The hotcakes were a bit heavy, but that's expected for pancakes. My breakfast sandwich was flavorful and just enough to satisfy, though the bottom of the bread was ‚Ä¶

author: May TV
text: Food is pretty average and price is standard given the area. I enjoyed the shrimp pasta and appreciated that they were de-veined and had their tails removed. Definitely get the fries with truffle aioli. ‚Ä¶

author: kristene Turco
text:
We went on the spur of the moment for flights, food, coffee, dessert + Blanc de Blanc
A very decadent brunch! The flights were great and Carlos walked us through the ‚Ä¶

author: Tim J.
text: My Fianc√©e and I had the absolute best time here, after wandering in randomly. Liz was the most phenomenal server‚Ä¶classy, knowledgeable, and just an all around amazing person. Everyone was so respectful and kind. Atmosphere super cozy and cute. Highly recommend we will be back!

author: Lance F.
text: Happened into Champers Social Club on our recent visit to NYC and was very happy we did. The decor/ambiance are dreamy, Euro inspired with a touch of kitsch to top it off. Excellent selection of bubbles, by the glass or bottle. ‚Ä¶

author: Neha
text: HOW TO GET IN: I made a reservation same day and it was easy but I am sure a walk in would‚Äôve been fine as well. Everyone here was very welcoming and friendly. The atmosphere is so cute and beautiful inside! I loved the deviled eggs with caviar and I had their mimosa which was great. 10/10 presentation but also good drinks and food.

author: Lauren
text: Came here for brunch and loved it! The vibe is very nyc chic and the food and drinks were great. Perfect spot for a catchup with your bestie. I do think the prices of their cocktails are high considering you only get a coup glass though, which is why I‚Äôm not giving a full 5 stars.

author: Ali Salwa
text: My friend took me to Champers Social Club to celebrate my birthday. This was not our first time, and we came back intentionally for the location, ambiance, atmosphere, and the bubbly! I couldn‚Äôt have been happier celebrating in cozy, ‚Ä¶

author: Ronja Morris
text: I stumbled upon Champers by chance one afternoon and now make a point to come back every time I‚Äôm in New York. The vibe is effortlessly chic and the food and cocktails are always on point. A true gem that never disappoints.

author: Diego Funes
text: Just back at Champers and feeling like royalty! The service was, as always, SUPERB - our server was attentive, friendly, and made us feel like regulars (and we LOVE being regulars here!). The food was FANTASTIC, but let's be real, the real ‚Ä¶

author: S. Orlich
text: A great stop after a long day of shopping. Almost surprising they went French countryside with the interior rather than glam but its charming nonetheless. Service was great and we were quite pleased with our flights.

author: Selina L
text:
Uploaded ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

I made a reservation and visited on Christmas Eve, after previously only having ‚Ä¶

author: B A
text:
I was walking down the street and noticed a long line outside this place, so I thought, why not give it a try? üòÖ
And honestly, it was worth it! I tried the mushroom pizza and it was so ‚Ä¶

author: Carl Foisy
text: Five stars earned. With so many pizza joints in NY, let alone in Little Italy, this place is a stand out. Fresh made pizza, delicious crust, tasty options and super friendly staff. The place was clean, plenty of seating, and again hella ‚Ä¶

author: Sabena Singh
text: After a perfume event over the weekend, Michael and I went to have pizza at Upside Pizza. We got a table which was a nice surprise. Here the pizza is thin crust with a tasty tomato sauce. He got two slices which he found greasy and mopped ‚Ä¶

author: J W
text: I ordered this slice thinking it‚Äôs a vodka slice but it‚Äôs actually named golden something. Service was quick. It‚Äôs NY style thin slice alright but the under carriage flops, and the crust is not crispy. The sauce and cheese are not bad but not great either. And I couldn‚Äôt find any hot pepper or oregano shaker to top up.

author: Ibrahim N
text: Continuing my Ninja Turtles New York Pizza journey, I stopped at UPSIDE. This spot truly delivers an excellent slice. The crust stands out ‚Äì rich, flavorful, and with a crunch that feels almost Italian in character. The balance between ‚Ä¶

author: Stephanie Raspall
text: We visited New York for the weekend and ended up coming to Upside Pizza not once, but 3 times‚Äîyes, it‚Äôs that good! Hands down the best pizza I‚Äôve ever had. The crust is perfectly crispy, the sauce is flavorful, and every slice is made with ‚Ä¶

author: Nino Cruz
text: No complaints here. I was really looking for a good/reliable New York pizza here in SOHO. Did not disappoint at all

author: Jennifer D
text: We got a slice today and it was incredibly burnt and literally smoking. When we said it was burnt they just said the pizza was just like that? They also barely acknowledge you in line and are rude. I used to go here a couple times a week but won‚Äôt come back after today.

author: Andrew Vrana
text: This used to be my go to pizzeria every week, but man they have really screwed things up. ‚Ä¶

author: Ana C
text: Stumbled upon this pizza place üòã.  Had a pepperoni slice.   was great.  Thin, right amount of sauce, lots of pepperoni slices, and they made it hot (temperature). Love Loveeee when a pizza is hot üî•.  August 2024 and a pepperonslicr was ‚Ä¶

author: Susan Baker
text: We stumbled across this pretty little gem by accident, and so glad we did. The food was incredible. Fresh ingredients, simply prepared. We ordered the orecchiette pasta with sausage and broccoli rabe and the bufalini pizza to share. Both ‚Ä¶

author: terecita garcia
text: We had one hour to spare and had an AMAZING one hour here. Did not want to leave. Coming back this weekend to enjoy everything else more. Eric the bartender and Matthew really welcomed us in and made us feel right at home. We had amazing ‚Ä¶

author: Cheeky Panda
text: Absolutely phenomenal! The food was delicious and the service was amazing. The owner was extremely friendly and welcoming, he made the whole experience even more enjoyable! Definitely check this place out if you want some really good authentic Italian food with a great vibe!

author: Audrey Bird
text: I‚Äôve got to say, one of the best and authentically Italian places I‚Äôve been in the US. The service was outstanding - the owner was so nice and we even had 2 kids with us. We loved the homemade pesto so much (and we order it a lot because I ‚Ä¶

author: Alena Babyr
text:
The best pizza in town!
Huge thanks to the chef for his personal touch and for preserving the original recipe year after year. The waiters are always attentive and courteous, which ‚Ä¶

author: Bella Sri
text: I would like to recommend this restaurant. The food is delicious, the service is excellent, and they take great care of their customers

author: Samantha C
text: A true gem for northern Italian traditional plates and Italian classics. Felt like a very European dining experience. Beautiful indoor/outdoor flow. Front windows open up completely, creating a gorgeous rustic dining experience on a summer ‚Ä¶

author: Taylor Ballenger
text: A true taste is Italy! From the moment you walk in, you‚Äôre transported straight to Italy ‚Äî not just by the atmosphere, but by the warmth of the staff and the aroma drifting from the kitchen. Every detail feels intentional: the music, the ‚Ä¶

author: Francesca Renzetti
text: This restaurant reminds me my sweet Italy! If you wanna try the real Italian pizza, you definitely need to come here!!! Amazing staff, always kind and funny! ü§ç ‚Ä¶

author: Zuleima Cabal
text: A truly authentic Italian spot in NYC! The atmosphere, the food, and the service are all outstanding. Erick, the bartender, is absolutely wonderful ‚Äî warm, attentive, and incredibly talented at what he does. And Matthew made the experience ‚Ä¶

author: WK family
text: This is based on quality compared to area fast food restaurants‚Äî each dish was about $10 for the lunch special and they are very small-we try to give a place a second chance look - but it‚Äôs been pretty consistent- the take out containers ‚Ä¶

author: Tank Warner
text:
I ordered 2 dishes with beef:
Beef with Broccoli
Beef with oyster sauce ‚Ä¶

author: Edwin Mota
text: Waited 20 mins for 2 chicken wings.If I wouldn't complained maybe I would Had never got it, since after they gave it to me in 2 minutes üòí leaving review for me to never stop here again. ‚Ä¶

author: Michael Aaron
text:
I really enjoyed the food and atmosphere here. They are very well decorated especially for Halloween.

I had a crock of onion soup. It was nice and hot. They used croutons instead of the slice of bread.

I had a chicken sandwich with micro greens and cheese and avacado. The cheese could have been a little more melted on the sandwich but this is totally nitpicking.

Everything tasted great and the service was quick and friendly. Very locals only vibe. The bartender knew her clients kids and asked them about how they are. This is what it‚Äôs about. I‚Äôd come back.

author: Alex VanOrman
text: They initially told us an hour wait but we've been dying to try it so we said we'd wait. Went across the street to this amazing little bar and they ended up calling us after 35 minutes! We had beautiful weather and got lucky that they sat us in the patio. The atmosphere was super chill and beautiful. The wings were delicious and crispy and the mozzarella sticks were good. Definitely our top 5 wing spot in Buffalo!

author: Jim linaburg
text: Wings and chili cheese fries were great. Service was a little slow to start but once we got served they did a good job. Atmosphere was pretty cool. If ever in Buffalo again, I would probably go back.

author: Marco Lopez
text: So wifey and I are on a typical road tripping vacation.   The hotel staff found out I wanted wings of course.  They recommended Gabriel's gate as a local favorite as opposed to the hyped up one.  The wings were good.  We got mild spice.  Their blue cheese burger was a bit dry considering I ordered it cook medium.  Wifey had a cheese steak sandwich and it was very good.  Especially the next day with a light nuke in the microwave.   The server was fabulously helpful and friendly.  Place was super busy and everyone really seemed to be enjoying the vibe of the place.  It's a shame that we live a few thousand miles away because we would definitely be back.

author: Cat
text: Food was absolutely amazing!! We had multiple recommendations to go here and it did not disappoint. We went for the wings (10, medium heat), chilli cheese fries and spinach bread and everything was beyond delicious. Thank you!

author: Eugene C
text: This restaurant is a true gem. The pasta is absolutely amazing‚Äîfresh, flavorful, and clearly made with care. The staff is incredibly friendly and welcoming, which makes the whole experience even better. It‚Äôs easy to see why this place has been around so long. A wonderful spot for anyone who loves authentic, delicious food paired with genuine hospitality. Highly recommend!

author: Nigel Ottman
text: Best pasta and bread in the 315! Every time I‚Äôve been the food and service has been top notch. Today I had chicken riggies which were incredible! Nice and spicy with delicious pasta and plenty of chicken breast. It‚Äôs hard to get reservations so be prepared to wait, or join the wait list on line. It‚Äôs worth the waitüëç

author: Darth Bane
text: Not my proudest moment choosing to combine gnocchi with carbonara sauce but I was tired of vodka sauces.  So don't make my mistake, but the gnocchi were perfect clouds of goodness and the sauce was still perfect.  The calamari was cooked perfectly, but maybe a tad too much salt.  The hot tomato oil is addictive. Definitely worth the wait.

author: Ellie
text: been wanting to come here for years - finally went the other day, and i was not disappointed! the food was spectacular (especially the bread and hot tom oil to start!) i got the ravioli and it was amazing! do yourself a favor and come to pastabilities if craving some delicious fresh food!

author: Adam Morgan
text: I'm visiting from out of town my friend made a reservation here for us. It's clearly a popular place and I highly recommend getting a reservation. I got a seasonal special (Harissa Glazed Salmon) and the Forbidden Fruit cocktail. Put simply, everything tasted great and the bread served prior to the entree was a nice touch. Staff were prompt, friendly, and helped to troubleshoot a minor miscommunication at the end of our meal. Easy 5 stars from me!

author: Jimmy Liang
text: If you‚Äôve been around Dumbo before, you know that restaurants will charge an arm and a leg for the same dish half the price elsewhere. Not the case here! The food here was really authentic and flavorful, the walls were just covered with notes from visitors all over the world, and the service was incredibly fast considering there were about 2 servers and maybe one guy in the kitchen. The atmosphere is also festive all year round‚Äîjust a cool taco joint overall! Glad I stumbled in and discovered this gem of restaurant! Highly recommend!

author: Kai Mendez
text:
Honestly, this place is a hidden gem! A Mexican restaurant with the most beautiful touch: amazing Venezuelan people running it with so much love and kindness. From the moment you walk in, you feel like family.

I have to highlight Valentina!! her energy is absolutely radiant. She‚Äôs beyond attentive, sweet, and makes you feel at home instantly. She doesn‚Äôt just serve food, she serves joy. People like her make the whole experience unforgettable.

The food? Delicious. The vibe? Warm. The service? Impeccable. I can‚Äôt recommend this spot enough it‚Äôs the kind of place you‚Äôll want to come back to over and over again.

If you‚Äôre looking for a restaurant with incredible flavors and even better people, this is it. Full recommendation from me! üíØ

They made my birthday a whole celebration!!

author: Krishna pino
text: After my running session last Sunday I decided to stop by Pedro‚Äôs to get Mexican food. Everything was delicious, I ordered the Ceviche and a plate with four different tacos. OMG if you are by Dumbo area this is definitely the spot to stop by. The server Stephanie was awesome and super friendly, she took the time to explained to me the menu and also gave me recommendations.

author: Michael L
text: This has been, for years, my favorite restaurant in Dumbo. Solid Mexican food (get the enchiladas, they always hit the spot) good drinks, and damn good prices, especially for the overpriced Dumbo. The fact that it's steps from the subway so I don't have to drive after so many margaritas is a bonus.

author: Mx. Daniels
text: I wouldn‚Äôt recommend the watery bread soup. The music was too loud, I waited close to an hour for my food. I wasn‚Äôt like amazed by most of my food choices. Some of staff were laughing at patrons, including myself. I had this hype up for a long time, and wasn‚Äôt impressed, too hyper stimulating environment for me.

author: Michael Karelis
text: Great little Thai spot with tasty food at reasonable prices. The drunken noodles were delightful. They were able to make it without fish sauce. Would definitely go back next time I‚Äôm in the area.

author: Diana
text: We really enjoyed this restaurant. It was the first time for me but my friend Pat has been there multiple times (her new fav spot!). The store is owned by an elderly couple and I believe they run it on their own. We got take out. We shared the chicken curry puff , amazing with the cucumber sauce! I got the chicken drunken noodles and it was actually one of the best I‚Äôve had so far (even compared with the city), yes it‚Äôs mildly spicy but I love spicy so it had a nice kick and i was happy that it was so flavorful and not heavy!  Pat had the massaman curry and peanut noodles, also delicious! All meals were fresh  and made me feel like this is how they would cook at home. We would definitely go back and keep recommending it !

author: Emily Francisco
text: it was 2 blocks away from the outlet mall and very delish. They prices are kinda pricey but the service and food makes up for it. i got the chicken curry puffs and the viet iced coffee. The coffee was good and sweet and the puffs were flavorful. the cucumber sauce was refreshing. i went around midday and it was pretty empty so i was able to sit inside.

author: Love Love
text: The chicken Pad Se Eew (flat noodle) tastes so much better than I expected, own  by elderly couple. Food taste much better than expensive Thai restaurants in Manhattan.

author: Emma McKenzie
text: Ordered the yellow chicken curry very flavorful and delicious. Also got the Tom yum soup and Pad Thai that hit the spot.

author: Isabelle
text: Overall great experience with all the dishes tasting pretty good; a few of my favorites were the whole steamed fish (great flavors from the soy sauce and ginger on top), salted egg fish fillet, the oxtail soup, all the dumplings. They also serve Sichuan dishes like Mapo tofu but given its a Shanghainese restaurant theres zero spice level to those dishes (still taste good though). Enjoyed dining in the old Shanghai vibes and ambiance

author: Nilima Shet
text: Came here for dinner a few weeks ago and thought it was pretty good overall. We unintentionally got to the restaurant still within dim sum happy hour pricing so got a variety of little things like soup dumplings, scallion pancakes. Overall, solid choices. For main dishes, I really loved the prawns and would definitely recommend. The menu is fairly extensive and we tried a few things but I feel like there's much more! While nothing stood out as truly stellar, it was all fairly good and reasonably priced.

author: Jimmy Lee
text: It's a nice place with premium priced dishes, OK quality food. The smoked carp has a strong earthy taste (ÂúüËÖ•Âë≥Ôºâand overcooked; it doesn't deserves a premium price. The Xiao Long Bao (pork soup dumplings) are not my type since their wraps are too thick. A surprise is that the restaurant offers a curry fried rice where it's difficult to find among other Chinese restaurants.

author: Hayli Bazan
text: Decent but no wow factor. Out of the 4 dishes we got, my favorite was probably the ribs. The poached dumplings in chili oil were good but not spicy at all. The curry chicken dumplings were a generous size but didn‚Äôt have a lot of flavor. The crab was a bit too briny for me. Service was really good though and prices are decent.

author: Francy Z
text: Almost authentic Shanghai dishes which are restricted by the local supplies and frozen imported ingredients. The chief creates the dishes much better than the big name international Shanghai style restaurant in the basement, especially the XiaoLongBao. This is place one can enjoin the moment when dine Real Shanghai dishes. The dishes with the photo below can be rated 9 out of 10. Friendly and knowledge waiter.

author: LaShawn
text:
We had such a great time at Mikado! I was worried about going with young kids who are picky eaters (9 and 7)  The food looked and tasted amazing, the vibe was relaxed and welcoming, and everyone was super friendly. It‚Äôs also really kid-friendly ‚Äî our kids can be tough to please, but they were obsessed. The server even gave them kid chopsticks, which they thought was the coolest thing ever.

The food was awesome all around:

‚Ä¢Yakitori‚Äì tender with a really good sauce. You could tell it was fresh.

‚Ä¢Teriyaki chicken‚Äì soft, flavorful, and the rice was perfect.

‚Ä¢Gyoza ‚Äì veggie dumplings with great texture.

‚Ä¢Maki rolls‚Äì California and shrimp tempura rolls were both hits. We also tried the salmon avocado and cucumber avocado!

‚Ä¢Yuzu dessert‚Äì light, fluffy, and just the right hint of lemon and blueberry. I was really impressed with the flavor and texture and wished the slice was a bit bigger it was so good. We don‚Äôt usually eat dessert so that‚Äôs saying something.

‚Ä¢Matcha pudding-  not our thing, but if you‚Äôre into matcha, and not so sweet dessert you‚Äôll love it.

We‚Äôd 100% come back. The kids were already telling our waitress that next time we‚Äôre in NYC, **this is the first place we‚Äôre going**. Couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better dinner with my boys.

author: Christopher Kong
text:
We have been in search for a new Japanese goto place and I think we have found it!

The decor is very nice and refreshing. Flowers and paint masks add a really nice touch to the atmosphere.

The food is amazing! We had gotten there at lunch and they have a lunch menu. I hear the drinks are great! Most come back to try that out another time.

author: Thanadol Chomphoochan
text: I stopped here by chance as I was running errands in the area. I ordered the premium sushi set. Just for about 60$ total (post-tax and tips), I got a good appetizer dish, a large platter of sushi, and a cute matcha pudding dessert. It turned out to be one of the most enjoyable dinners I've had here. Very good experience for very good price!

author: Bryan from 56th st
text: Very lovely atmosphere with a beautiful maple tree and cherry blossoms adorning the area. Great service and even better food followed. Cocktails were delicious and very appealing to all crowds.

author: Amy Lin
text: the lunch miso black cod bento set was sooo delicious! also recommend the salmon ikura don. great servers and cozy atmosphere

author: perle75nyc
text: Having dinner in a small garden on a breezy summer evening felt even more special because of the beautiful atmosphere ‚Äî it was just perfect. The calamari was slightly overcooked so it was a little bit chewy, but it was well-seasoned and crispy, so still enjoyable. The vongole pasta was also an overcooked, but the clam flavor came through nicely, making it tasty overall. The pork chop was again slightly overcooked, but not dry, and the side dishes, spinach and mashed potatoes were perfectly seasoned and well-prepared, making the whole dish satisfying. The frozen margarita was only $2 until August. It was very refreshing and paired well with the food. The atmosphere was great, and the staff were very friendly, which made the dining experience even more enjoyable.

author: Saint
text: Beautiful small dining spot in the heart of inwood. My go to for a coffee, grilled chicken, or just a short getaway. Outside eating in their backyard.

author: Tania Lopez
text: This place has a wonderful ambiance and vibe. I did my baby shower at this location last year and it was simply a pleasure having the celebration here. The food was amazing and the place is beautifully decorated. I didn‚Äôt need to add much decorations for my celebration. Doing business with the owner / manager, Ines, was straightforward and I had nothing to worry about from the beginning to the end. The prices were reasonable and the owner and staff were professional the whole time. I‚Äôm super glad I didn‚Äôt have any extra stress during this special day! Thank you Garden Cafe!

author: EE Grimshaw
text:
Garden Cafe gets points for being in the right place at the right time, but beyond that, it was pretty mediocre. My top tier chum who literally went to the school of hospitality and I came here for a strategic lunch/rest this past Saturday during the Great Saunter (an annual event I would heartily recommend to anyone physically and mentally able - five stars all around). After not finishing the Saunter last year, I decided at the very least it was important to get off our feet for a bit, and this location made a lot of sense, literally a few buildings away from the official route off Isham Street very close to the halfway point of our adventures. Given how we were feeling at the time, this was definitely within a quarter mile of where we needed it to be before people started getting VERY yowly.

This area of Inwood is really pleasant; I've been over here now a few times and it's super underrated because most people never bother to wander up past the GW Bridge. But it's super chill and gives off some Brooklyn vibes. And optics-wise, Garden Cafe fits right in. True to its name, it has a great outdoor seating area in the back, which was the perfect antidote on a pleasant day with sore feet. The interior though is dimly lit and very claustrophobic; each time we went through (entering and exiting), we had to wait for other people to pass in the area by the restroom/awkward bar area. I'm not sure how you improve that situation without a full-on reno, but it's not the best. The outdoor space helps for sure in that regard.

We needed carbs like the wolf with 16 miles to go on our trek. I went with the strawberry pancakes with a side of scrambled eggs and a vanilla latte (mostly so my chum and I would remain on speaking terms after only having a fraction of my normal coffee intake at the beginning of the day). Everything was fine though nothing to write home about. The pancakes were a little dry and definitely needed the accompanying syrup, and the eggs conversely were wetter than I typically like. They also needed a bit of seasoning but they did what they were supposed to do. In hindsight, the latte might have actually been the best of the lot - it had a visually pleasing design from the milk pour and was tasty. Most of the patrons we saw nearby were on mimosa benders, which sounded fun but we had a job to do. Next time.

This place got a lot of points off for the service. Our waitress was not particularly friendly - very monotone and never smiled, and once our food came? A ghost. We rarely even saw her in the patio area and we probably ended up staying an extra 15 minutes because we literally just couldn't find her to get the check. Really odd unforced error and it was actually close to the point where one of us was going to have to go inside to actively find her to ask for the bill. Not good at all.

It wasn't a terrible meal by any stretch and I think ultimately you give it a thumbs up for providing a spot to rest and eat, but most people would probably consider that the bare minimum requirement of a restaurant. I'm sure you can find better around here.

author: Danny Fernandez
text: The staff is very friendly. Seating is available in the garden and indoors. The menu has great variety and great prices. I've had the chicken sandwich, burger, wrap and many more items on the menu. Great spot for brunch or a quiet meal.

author: Emma Wheeler
text:
‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
We hosted our wedding dinner at Baci & Abbracci on October 10th with 22 guests, and it couldn‚Äôt have been more perfect. The back patio was beautiful and intimate‚Äîexactly the atmosphere we hoped for. From start to finish, communication with the team was seamless, and the service the night of truly exceeded our expectations. Every course was absolutely delicious (as always!), and our guests are still talking about how wonderful the evening was. We‚Äôre so grateful to the entire team for making our celebration feel so special.

author: Carol D
text:
Absolutely loved this place! The fresh black pasta with seafood was incredible .The gnocchi with red beets also outstanding.
and the owners are super friendly, making you feel right at home. A wonderful spot for authentic, modern Italian cuisine, can‚Äôt wait to come back!

author: Crystal Barab√°s
text: The homemade pastas were fresh and well made. The waiters were always filling up our cups with water when needed and coming to ask how we were doing. I really enjoyed my beats gnocchi. It was different and well seasoned.

author: Erika Kapler Chen
text: This restaurant is amazing!! I have come here multiple times, as a local favorite, and they never fail to provide a great experience. The food is great, delicious, and my kids love it. The staff is extremely nice and the food is always hot and tasty. Even if you order takeout, the food comes just as tasty, if you‚Äôre tired, and the delivery is very quick! If you are looking for a new hit Italian place, you should totally come here!

author: Alejandro Reyes
text: Fantastic experience. Popped in on a Tuesday night, one of the quieter nights and it‚Äôs so private, so cozy. Perfect little spontaneous date night. The atmosphere is incredible. The carbonara is delicious and the service phenomenal.

author: Charlie Laramy
text: Always a great time at this place. Not only is it very unique, literally down a graffiti lined alley - very cool in and of itself, it is so very much more. This time we say at their back bar and had drinks and apps. I highly recommend the Devils on Horseback. Great drinks, great food, great staff, great place.

author: Britt
text: One of my favorite restaurants I have ever been to. I went for my 30th birthday dinner and the vibes were immaculate. It was so cozy and homey; it felt like you were visiting a European pub or hunting lodge. It‚Äôs a hidden gem tucked away in an urban art alley. I had the roasted duck and it was superb. I loved the interior design and seating of the place; it was so unique and eclectic and brilliant. Highly recommend.

author: Dana Bashi
