First time trying Ecuadorian food and it was a great experience here. Good food. Big portions. And reasonable prices too. Loved the house green sauce and parking right infront of the restaurant too!

Skirt steak 4.5/5
Mixed seafood ceviche 4/5
Picalo (chicken, sausage Rib) 4/5

author: andrea yarad
text: Really good place , the food and the portions were amazing  , brunch bolon with meat was delicious and sexo de pollo rate 10 stars

author: Melanie
text: We ordered four dishes. The meat was made from a cheap cut of the steak, however it was still made quickly and very well. The server was attentive to my needs as well. 10/10 would recommend considering the service, food quality, and portions that you get per order.

author: Ryan Tammaro
text:
Taste of the pizza was great with a nice char, really great cheese / sauce ratio and nice sourdough taste to the crust.

But it‚Äôs letdown by the small slice size (this was the smallest slice of pizza I‚Äôve ever had), the floppiness of the crust and the cash minimum

author: Darian Feysa
text: Whenever I come to NYC, I try different pizza places. Philomena‚Äôs was DELICIOUS. The Jersey Shore slice is amazing! Owner was incredibly nice, and the atmosphere is warm and welcoming. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

author: Kyana Ifill
text:
UPDATED REVIEW 4/10/2025
The review below was Super Bowl Sunday 2025. The owner Dave was very nice to offer me a free pizza and to give his shop another chance. I‚Äôm on a bit of a review kick so it was unlikely I would have returned any time soon. The ninja turtle was really good, I loved how chewy the crust was and the pizza was quite cheesy how I liked. All the toppings were quite hearty and it  was filling. I would have liked it a little less floppy but I know that would have been quite hard with all the toppings on it. Flavor was quite good so yes I would definitely eat it again. Most of all I appreciate an owner willing to take criticism and eager to correct it and not brush it off. He clearly cares about his product and customers. Please give the pizza a try when you‚Äôre in the neighborhood!

So I ordered takeout online and the regular pie was not an option so I got square. They told me 5 more min, I stepped out and came back and it was another 5 more min. Fairly slow and pizza was not good but I don‚Äôt really like square. I just wanted to prepay and get out. I would go back to try a regular slice but my first experience annoyed me so I won‚Äôt be back soon.

author: june xie
text: Always amazing pizza. Dave cares about his craft! Flavors are balanced, toppings are classic with a subtle delightful twist sometimes, and the crust is always on point. Get a square and a slice, they're very different experiences and you owe it to yourself to try both. For the garlic lovers, the broccoli rabe square is not to be missed. The eggplant slice is a whole meal onto itself!

author: Pete Hatzakos
text: WOW! Was flying out of LGA and I had some time to kill. I've had this spot on my to do list for two years now and finally made it in and wow! I tried the white slice just because I had a light lunch a little earlier and I was blown a away at how airy and fluffy the crust was yet it had an amazing crunch too. I could taste the high quality flours used for the dough and the combo of cheeses. Absolutely hands down the BEST white slice I've ever tried.

author: Calen Heise
text: Came here with my girlfriend on a Sunday afternoon. The brunch buffet and unlimited selection of certain cocktails for 2 hours was amazing. The service kept coming with the drinks and the food was amazing. Drinks were very delicious and strong. Highly recommend for brunch.

author: Kyle McCarthy
text: Great food and buzzy Latino vibe. Expect (loud even outside!) music, as the fun well-dressed crowd passes by their patio cafe. Love their appetizers, especially the plantains stuffed with crab and the croquettes. The paella, salmon stuffed with crab, and lechon are always good.. And the sangria and mojitos, a winner.

author: Gaby
text: The chips for my guacamole were insanely stale. The steak in my steak salad was cold. The lettuce in the salad was drowned in avocado‚Ä¶. I couldn‚Äôt taste the dressing or the salad and didn‚Äôt even eat the salad because it was all sticky and chunky because of all the avocado. Truly disappointed because I‚Äôve been coming here for years. I order 2 of the same mojitos and both tasted differently. One had more lime and liquor than the other. Idk what is happening here but I‚Äôm calling my bank for a refund asap.

author: Des KF
text: I have been to a few of the other locations, so I was looking forward to this visit. When I arrived I parked on the street nearby. I walked in and was greeted by Leaha, and she was great. I sat and started with the limitless brunch, and the food on the buffet was good, and the sangria was ok. I was served by Yuri and Anthony, and they were great. I ordered the octopus for appetizers, and it was delicious! I then had the stuffed red snapper, and it was good but a little sweet! Lastly, I had the brownie dessert, and that was delicious! All in all I had a good experience!

author: Esther P
text:
Visited on a Sunday. We did the All You Can Eat buffet for $39. It included the unlimited drinks. Great vibe, and music. The music wasn‚Äôt too loud where we couldn‚Äôt hear each other and the food was good. Drinks were strong, no complaints. Our waiter was great! And there‚Äôs hookah available too. Just remember to bring cash if you don‚Äôt want to use the ATM.

There was a few people celebrating their birthdays and Mamajuana certainly helps with the celebration. It was nice to see. Def recommend.

author: jessica M
text:
I had a reservation for Saturday at 5 PM and was very much looking forward to the experience, as it came highly recommended by a trusted friend. Our meal began pleasantly‚Äîthe calamari appetizer was delightfully light, airy, and crispy.However, the service we received was disappointing. While we were still enjoying our appetizer, a staff member asked if we had finished, despite the plate being nearly full. It gave the impression that we were being rushed. Later, when our pasta dishes arrived, I requested additional bread for the table. The same gentleman (I use that term loosely)visibly grimaced and replied, ‚ÄúI already brought you bread.‚Äù I clarified i am aware we wanted more, to which he responded, ‚ÄúI‚Äôll bring you more bread, but I‚Äôm going to charge you.‚Äù
This exchange felt unnecessarily dismissive and unprofessional. While I understand there may be policies regarding additional items, the tone and manner in which this was communicated did not align with the warm and welcoming service I expected from your establishment.

author: Nazneen Malik
text: I went back for an encore. The main course was flavorful and delicious. The dessert was yummy as well. The service was attentive and atmosphere stellar. I would live to go back for a quiet evening with some indulgence.

author: Glenn'Philip Operations Manager
text:
Delicious Italian food with the best pasta filled with flavor.  Vegetarian options like minestrone soup filled with vegetables and of course pasta with vegetables. Large indoor and outdoor seating perfect for large parties.  We had 7 people sitting very comfortably.

A 5 star experience!

My friends had clams and enjoyed the food very much.

Friendly staff great service

~> If you like my review please press follow on my google profile.  If you are the owner and you‚Äôre responding to my review and saying thank you please thank me by following me on Google.
Thanks Bali Sky

author: Caitlin Kazunas
text: Nice quiet spot for a good priced and tasty dinner. We came by with no reservation on a Saturday and were sat immediately. Very relaxing inside with a cute interior. Food was delicious and server was nice!

author: Rebex
text:
@ilgustowinebar is an authentic italian restaurant located on the upper west side!

ft:
-pirata livornese: packed with so many delicious seafoods such as clam, mussel, shrimp, salmon, calamari on top of angel hair pasta. this was beyond delicious. the portion size was huge and everything was perfect!
-calamari: such a classic dish, and they make it so well. the outside is crispy and the inside is tender!
-red wine

üìçTrattoria iL Gusto
625 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10024

follow @rebeccatakesnyc for more nyc content!

author: Katherine Ng
text:
West Side Wok is a small, no-frills sushi and poke spot tucked into a convenient corner of the Upper West Side, just steps from a major subway stop. While it‚Äôs not necessarily the kind of place for a long sit-down meal, its location makes it perfect for a quick pickup before heading to one of the many nearby parks.

I tried the spicy poke dish and was genuinely impressed by the freshness of the ingredients. The fish and vegetables tasted like they had been prepped to order, and you can tell the team puts care into the quality of what they serve. That said, the vegetables in the poke were fairly plain‚ÄîI personally would have enjoyed some pickled or marinated elements to add variety and balance to the bowl. The portion of fish wasn‚Äôt overly generous, but they were not shy with the sauces, which added a flavorful kick without overpowering the dish.

Service-wise, they‚Äôve always been reliable and on time with pickup orders. On my visits, they‚Äôve been warm and grateful, especially noticing and appreciating repeat customers‚Äîwhich is rare and always a nice touch in a busy city.

Overall, West Side Wok is a solid neighborhood option when you‚Äôre craving fresh poke or sushi on the go. It‚Äôs convenient, friendly, and consistent‚Äîa dependable spot for a casual meal, especially if you‚Äôre planning to enjoy it outdoors.

author: Fleur Touchard
text: One of our favorite delivery option! Fits the taste of the entire family. We are never disappointed and love to order there as much as we can. I love the chicken noodles soup and pad tai; they are my favorite!

author: Andrew Geha
text: The food here is fine at best, but not good enough to justify the high costs. Their sushi platter was decent, and their scallion pancakes were good. I was disappointed that there was no mention on their website of their cold sesame noodles containing peanut butter sauce. For folks with severe peanut and tree nut allergies, that would be good information to have up front.

author: Yaakov Bressler
text:
Good quality Kosher hole-in-the-wall type take out. Really great Thai food, and sushi too.

Note, there is no indoor seating. Order ahead of time and pickup only. (Or have it delivered.) For pickup, I walked in and ordered. My food was ready in less than 10 minutes, really rapid turnaround!

author: Claudia Greenspan
text: West Side Wok did a great job with our catering order on relatively short notice. They were friendly, flexible, and went out of their way to deliver to us on time and to our specifications. We ordered six large platters of sushi and our guests were delighted with the chef's sushi selections. Thank you West Side Wok!

author: Blake Rasmussen
text: A real gem on the upper east side. The food is excellent - while we didn‚Äôt eat this trip we‚Äôve had the schnitzel in the past. The beers are special - czechvar is a very special, hard to find lager that only select bars will get. Glasses are cleaned and served in the authentic Czech style - via Lukr pour and washed by hand, to ensure the temperature is not too hot to warm the beer and there is no soap residue. The staff is friendly, kind, inviting. This is an incredible place to eat and drink and we‚Äôre so lucky it‚Äôs right here in Manhattan!

author: Jasmin Izad
text:
We heard about this restaurant on social media and had it saved on our to go list for a while. We had never had Czech food and they're the only Czech restaurant in Manhattan. So, we finally decided to take the 1 hour trip and try it out for our date night.
Staff was helpful, warm, and friendly. They answered all our questions and made sure we felt confident about everything. Restaurant itself was clean and inviting, the bathrooms were kept up and everything was good.

We ordered the goulash, jagershnitzel, sviekova, a Czech beer, and fruit pudding for dessert. Unfortunately, both of us got pretty sick by the next morning. I'm not sure if it's just the cuisine itself since we'd never had it before and maybe it was heavy on our system or if something maybe wasn't cooked properly and we didn't catch it since we're not familiar with the dishes. I don't want to point any fingers, because we truelly don't know but this ended up not being a fun experience. I tried calling the restaurant to just let them know, but the line goes to voicemail. We're still recovering from our visit, I personally haven't been able to leave the house because it's been that bad. Not really the experience we were aiming for.

author: Hannah W
text: I'm giving this restaurant a top rating even though I barely ate anything - the person who made the reservation didn't know I was vegetarian. Nonetheless I had a great time, as I love experiencing cuisines that I've never been exposed to, and this time, it was Czech food. We were a party of 7, all carnivores except for me, all drinkers except for me and my husband, and one of them is a beer connoisseur, so I learned that Pilsner, a pale lager, is the most famous Czech beer. The only option on the menu for me was a selection of salads, and I opted for one of my favorite vegetables - beetroot. Their servings are quite generous, and according to my fellow diners, the taste was impeccable. They ordered a lot of beer, and together we ordered a lot of food - salads, appetizers, mains, breads, and desserts. It's a large space, its walls covered with photos and objects of antiquity. One can definitely go around like in a museum and learn a bit about the history of Czech immigrants in New York City. If you love hearty meat dishes, exotic flavors and great beer, this place is definitely for you!

author: Benedict Capacio
text: What a gem tucked away off the main drag. Im hesitant to even mention them because everything about the place is fantastic. Czech beer on tap, a huge menu with tons of great food. Top options from our visit were the duck confit, red cabbage, potato pancakes, and drowned sausages. Apparently they also have brunch which also looks good. I would come back here every week until I try everything on the menu and have a beer each time!

author: Beatrice D.
text: When I stepped into Bohemian Spirit, I felt like I had been teleported straight to the Czech Republic. The interior design is spot on and really captures the atmosphere. I ordered a Pilsner and wasn‚Äôt given water, which actually made me laugh because it reminded me of Prague, where beer is cheaper than water üòÇ. I also had the goulash, overall it was good, though personally I felt it could have been a little better. Still, the experience was enjoyable and worth checking out.

author: James Johnson
text:
We had just made it to town, were hungry, and didn't want to shop around for food. My wife and I dined here the last time we were in town and loved our meal. So, dining hear again was a no brainer.. Del Frisco's it is.

Our second time didn't disappoint either We ordered steaks, cocktails, appetizers and wine.

For the cocktails, she had the Passion Fruit Margarita, and I had the Whistle Pig Barrel Aged Manhattan. The cocktails were on point. Additionally, we both had a glass of Cabernet Sauvignon with our meal.

For the appetizer we went with the Thick-Cut Nueske‚Äôs Bacon and the Charred Octopus. The Bacon was excellent, smokey and delicious. The Octopus was disappointing.  It was overcooked and chewy, so we had to send that one back.

For our main courses, my wife ordered the Braised Angus Short Rib and was  later informed  that it was sold out, so she settled for the Filet Mignon, and I had the Bone-In Prime Ribeye.  For our sides we had fries, broccolini and the Classic Caesar. Oh, and not to mention, that wonderful warm bread for the table. All of the meats were cooked to perfection, the sides were great, but on a side note... the side of fries was way more then we expected. I would say was enough for 5 people.

The steak house itself has a nice sexy ambiance, but still chill enough for the fellas to grab a meal or hang at the bar.

The service was great, our waiter M.D. was very professional and attentive. He was very apologetic for the mess up on the Short Rib order and the over cooked Octopus. Even the Supervisor,  (Kristin), came over and checked on us to make sure we were good and chatted with us about the New York food scene.

Thank you both for a good time.

author: Rosalie Reyes
text: This is my goto place when I have family and friends visiting from overseas. They haven‚Äôt disappointed me so far! The steak ‚Äî cooked perfectly to your liking üòãThe lobster Mac and cheese has good chunks of Lobster, creamy sauce and aldente pasta. We also had the octopus appetizer and it‚Äôs soooo good. Flavorful, right chewiness and good portion size. The other thing I look forward to is their honey bread and  the best part ‚Äî it‚Äôs complementary. üòâ

author: Jerryvan Rosado
text:
Del Frisco‚Äôs offers the kind of classic steakhouse experience that lives up to its reputation. I visited for my birthday at the recommendation of my partner‚Äôs brother, and the evening was exceptional from start to finish.

The centerpiece of our meal was a 34-ounce porterhouse, perfectly cooked to a medium-rare that balanced a charred exterior with a tender, juicy interior. The steak delivered exactly what one expects from a top-tier steakhouse, both in flavor and execution. Accompanying sides often risk being an afterthought, but here the mashed potatoes were a highlight in their own right, rich, buttery, and layered with garlic that enhanced rather than overwhelmed.

For dessert, the kitchen presented a celebratory dish that closed the meal on a high note, a thoughtful and indulgent finish to an already memorable evening.

Del Frisco‚Äôs succeeds in maintaining an atmosphere that feels both refined and celebratory, making it an excellent choice for special occasions. From the quality of the steak to the details in service and presentation, it is a dining experience that justifies its reputation and one I would readily return to.

author: Mansoor Almulla
text:
Del Frisco‚Äôs Double Eagle in New York never disappoints. Every visit feels like a masterclass in how a true steakhouse should be run. The steaks are consistently outstanding‚Äîperfectly cooked to your preference, tender, and full of flavor. You can tell the kitchen takes pride in getting it just right every single time.

One standout for me is their crab cakes. They‚Äôre unlike any I‚Äôve had elsewhere‚Äîperfectly seared, packed with fresh crab, and elevated with a subtle touch of Indian masala that adds just the right amount of warmth and depth without overpowering the delicate seafood. It‚Äôs a unique twist that sets them apart from the typical steakhouse appetizer.

On top of the excellent food, the service is always impeccable. The staff strikes the perfect balance between professionalism and warmth, making you feel genuinely welcomed. The atmosphere is elegant yet lively, which makes it ideal for both business dinners and special occasions.

author: Cindy L
text:
I finally went to Del Frisco's after a couple of friends raved about it. I ordered the usual bone-in ribeye to ensure a fair comparison to the many other steakhouses I've been to. Upon receiving the steak it came overcooked. We ordered medium and it was more like well done. They quickly replaced the dish, even took away our side dishes to ensure we can enjoy the sides hot with our replacement steak.

The replacement quickly came as they happened to have another order of the same temperature and gave us that one instead. To my disappointment, the bone is quite small and they also wet-age their steak, which I find less flavorful.  Both the corn and the mushrooms were good, however, I find their portions are on the smaller side. With the same number of dishes ordered from my favorite steakhouse, I'd be leaving feeling fairly full and satisfied. It wasn't the case at Del Frisco's. Granted, we usually order a mashed potatoes instead but I wanted to try their corn.

Overall, it was a nice dining experience. The service was good and the environment was nice.

author: Paige Amble
text: Excellent service as we felt welcomed and the staff took care of us. The inside was beautiful and made the ambiance great! Had great little appetizer at the beginning which included bread and salami and cheese. Order the special of the days that were well priced for the menu. Had 2 additional fish options. Reservations are recommended but they were kind enough to squeeze us in. For tourists I would recommend trying it even if you feel underdressed as exploring the city deserves a great meal. I recommend!

author: Albert Law
text: I really enjoy dining in the restaurant.  It is a great place to mingle with friends.  This is a very solid restaurant offering Italian food. Pasta and appetizer is nicely made. Like many restaurant the dessert can‚Äôt make me to give them a 5 stars.

author: Kundan Sen
text: Superb Italian restaurant within walking distance of Wall Street. Beautiful, expansive ambiance. Attentive and professional wait staff. The peppers added a level of spice to the usual bread table starters. Calamari and herbed potato wedges were nice for starters. The main course - I went with the homemade black gnocchi with lobster tail, and was lip smashingly delicious to the last bite. Post lunch espresso was served at the right temperature - not scathing hot. Thoroughly recommend!

author: Lynn Greco
text:
Lovely old school Italian restaurant.
Super nice staff, very attentive.
Menu had great variety plus many specials of the night. Not sure why it was quiet on a Friday night - might be that it is summer ending in nyc and the Wall Street interns are gone. Branzino in Francese sauce (special) side of carbonara spaghetti for me - yum. Veal parm for hubby. Nice peppers and olives with bread (complimentary).
Def a solid choice for Italian in FiDi.

author: Omi T
text: Ate dinner here with some family last night and the whole experience was incredible. Luigi our server was top notch and so was the rest of the staff. The food was delicious in every way. The quality and freshness of the meal was something special. I go out to eat at many places and this is right up there with many of my favorite places on Arthur Ave in the Bronx. After you meal make sure you save room for dessert. Tried three of them; the panna cotta, the cr√®me br√ªl√©e, and the chocolate cake. All decadent and delicious.

author: Ahmed Farid
text: When I entered the restaurant, there was no one at the counter. Three workers were outside talking, and I had to call them in for assistance. They came in with a bit of reluctance, which didn‚Äôt feel very welcoming. I ordered the Pataka Fries with chicken ($12), which turned out to be delicious, topped with a sweet sauce and served in a generous portion, perfect for one person. I also tried the Beef Smash Burger ($9); although it was quite small in size, it had a good flavor. The ambiance was pleasant and comfortable for dining. Overall, it was a good experience, and I would recommend visiting.

author: Hatice B√º≈üra K√ºrk
text: We ordered nashville and tikkaville burgers. They were delicious, I did want my food to finish actually. The personnel was very kind and helpful as well. We ordered smash burger for the kids without spice, pickles etc. and they ate all of it, even though it was just cheese and meat and we ordered another. Pataka fries has a special sauce with garlic and spices, it was addictiveü•π I will tell my friends about this place and certainly come here again.

author: Vincent Li
text:
Chicken sandwich and fries both came out cold.

Also they charged us for an extra grilled cheese sandwich and when we brought it up they said it would get fixed before they charged it but it didn't.

Food looked good, but 100% not worth

author: Penguinrating
text: Excellent place, excellent atmosphere, good service. The sandwich was excellent. The waffle was very fresh. The chicken was fresh. All the ingredients were fresh, a little spicy for my taste, but everything was good. The bathroom was a little dirty. The entire place on the outside was very clean. I liked hearing the chefs singing in the kitchen. A little expensive. The chicken had a lot of flour. Speedy 6/10.

author: Fateema Akter
text: Namkeen is such a pretty restaurant and the staff are so sweet, especially Angie in the front :) We got the chicken and waffles, ‚Äúhot‚Äù is not for the weak.. and the waffles were so tasty!! Everything comes out fresh. Definitely a great place to go with friends.

author: Tareq Alshujaieh
text: I don‚Äôt know what kind of deal this pizza place made with the universe, but that sauce? Life-changing. I took one bite and briefly forgot all my problems. Student loans? Gone. Existential dread? Who? The pizza was so good I considered proposing to it. And the owner? He‚Äôs hands-down the nicest person I‚Äôve ever met. Like, weirdly nice. The kind of nice that makes you question your own personality. This pizza sauce must be made with magic (or some ancient Albanian secret),  Honestly, I came in for a slice and left emotionally healed. 11/10, someone give them a Michelin star and a hug.

author: Georgie Vargas
text: Dani‚Äôs House Of Pizza located in Kew Gardens, such a iconic pizza spot with great tasting pizza ! Best known for their signature pesto slices, would recommend adding pizza sauce on it for exquisite taste. Best to call ahead to place any catering orders or a pie itself.

author: Catalina Sears
text:
This is my non-negotiable stop every time I‚Äôm back in Kew Gardens, especially after a long train ride. The line? Worth it. The sweet tomato sauce? Iconic. The vibe? Late-night local magic.

Their classic cheese slice is always hot, perfectly cheesy, and nestled on a golden, crispy-but-soft crust that folds just right. This place is legendary for its sweet sauce, and once you try it, there‚Äôs no going back. If you really need the salt, get a pesto with bacon, omg!

I was helped quickly and kindly even with a full counter. The staff keeps things moving, and the energy is always just right‚Äîbusy but never too stressful.

‚ú® What I loved:
‚Ä¢	That unforgettable sweet sauce üçÖ
‚Ä¢	Cheesy, golden slices that actually fill you up
‚Ä¢	A perfect stop post-LIRR or late night out

Local gem. Total comfort. Slice heaven.

author: Eddie Peng
text: Since 1959. Best pizza in Queens? The sauce is on the sweeter side, but for someone like me who drinks black sugarless coffee, I find it surprisingly tasty. Lots of ppl ask for more sauce on the side  Absolute nostalgic. The cash register is looking 50 years old, and the usual music you will hear is Sinatra. The most recent visit was Moon River in the background. Expect a 10 min. line every night. NYC gem.

author: Hassan Hashi
text:
Dani‚Äôs House of Pizza in Kew Gardens just became my go-to spot in Queens. I tried their pesto pizza first, and it was incredible. The perfect mix of garlicky pesto, melty cheese, and a crispy crust. Then I had their classic cheese pizza, simple but packed with flavor. But the real surprise was the pesto pizza with red sauce on top. I didn‚Äôt even know that combination existed, but it was next level. The tangy red sauce mixed with the creamy pesto was something special.

Now whenever I‚Äôm in Queens and craving pizza, I know exactly where to go.

author: Big Marvel and Chicken
text: We had the fried chicken burrito, shrimp taco, barbacoa taco and the salsa and nachos. The food was flavored to perfection and the portion sizes were great. We also tried the churros for dessert and they were equally as amazing. Not too sweet and went perfectly with the Nutella dip. Also, 10/10 service, the servers were super attentive and so welcoming!!! I cannot recommend this place enough!ü©∑ü©∑

author: Hemakshi Pathak
text: Cute Lil spot with really good food. It was fresh and delicious. The server brought out a meat filled taco instead of black bean on accident and she threw in a side of fresh guac and chips for me to munch on. Very kind staff. Atmosphere was a very chill,  low key vibe with a nice bar area. The price was great also. Got a taco and a burrito bowl for the low

author: Fanise Cannon
text: Calexico is convenient, consistent and has become a go to for my friends and I. The food is quick and tasty, the staff is always so nice, and the portion size for the price is incredible. We love the queso dip, chips and salsa, burritos and burrito bowls. They also have a great brunch deal where you get 2 for 1 drink specials! We each got an entree, 2 brunch drinks, and 2 apps - split the bill evenly between 6 of us and the bill came out to around $32pp (pre tip) Love this place!

author: Ido Simyoni
text: The food at this spot was tasty overall. I especially enjoyed the fish taco and the chicken taco; both were delicious and quite filling. The rolled quesadilla was flavorful but a bit dense for my liking.

author: Nathan Yakuza
text: Loved the happy hour, 2for1 margaritas is always a Top tier, and the bloody Mary‚Äôs are so freaking good! Just missing the bacon!!! The shrimp taco is really good flavorful and enticing! (Pricey but worth it). Nachos were ok not great.

author: Jewelz TeeHe
text: The atmosphere is great for night time dining, and service is just about right. Only problem is miscommunication. Food wise, personally I got the chicken parm, the dish its self was good and nothing special, although I found it hard to cut into the chicken itself from the burnt cheese on top. The sauce was salty and left a lasting taste in my mouth.

author: Emmanuel Rodriguez
text:
Fumo is truly one of NYC's hidden gems! This is one of my favorite Italian restaurants in all over NYC. I truly love to come here and get favorite dishes or try something new.

The fried Mozzarella is a signature here. I get it every trip but I also love the Vegan pesto with grill chicken add on! Best of the best ! The pizza here is amazing as wells. The margarita pizza is another signature here.

I honestly never have complains coming here! If you haven't yet, go soon ! Also use @resy for reservations !

author: Takara SL
text: Great spot for meeting up with friends, a date or a family dinner. Met up with coworkers for afterwork drinks and food. The servers were wonderful. Food was piping hot and delicious.

author: J Ubiwa
text: I went to both this location and the location in Harlem. I would say that this location is better however I do not believe I will be returning as a customer. All of the food was mediocre. I did not have high expectations because the location in Harlem was very disappointing. I will say they are a smidge better but not enough for me to spend my money again.

author: B Lopez
text: Very generous portions. Spaghetti with Alfredo sauce and shrimp it‚Äôs a must have. The food was fresh and made to order very quick. Better with reservations but they were open to accommodate us. Great atmosphere, family friendly.

author: Michelle
text: Little bar/restaurant in a super convenient location. Great for drinks after work or a snack in the summer outdoors. Food and drinks are kinda exactly what you expect, nothing super stand out but does the job. Very expansive menu with a bunch of cuisine options too. Burger was actually pretty good! Would recommend for a casual vibe

author: Jay T Blondek
text: Went in for a great brunch yesterday.  The electrolyte brunch! The maracuj√° margarita was üî•üî•. So good. The burger and spicy fries were amazing as well. The oysters were good but got a few teeny ones.  They happens everywhere though.

author: Madhumita Sawant
text: Went for a brunch on a random Saturday afternoon. The place was pretty full but luckily I found a last minute reservation. We were seated outdoors. The food was great and the bottomless mimosas were pretty strong. They were out of peach for the Bellini‚Äôs which was slightly disappointing to us, but we had a good time overall.

author: Georgia G
text: Just had a fantastic meal at The Laurels in NYC! The smash burger was incredible‚Äîjuicy and perfectly cooked, with all the right toppings. And their lavender spritz? So refreshing! But the best part was our server, Ben. He was super attentive and made the whole experience even better. If you go, definitely ask for him!

author: Andres Aguirre
text: We hosted a birthday party at The Laurels and it was fantastic. The staff was attentive, the brunch menu was delicious, and the cocktails kept everyone happy. Five stars all the way

author: Barry Gragg
text:
The Grilled octopus salad appetizer was amazing delicious and portions generous. (I had eaten most of it before I thought to take a photo)
Many of the specials included in various types of fish.
Once again, the waiter was indifferent and bitchy. He brought the wrong bottle of wine and when I pointed that out he told me it was the one that I ordered and uncorked it and plopped it down on our table.

author: Aggie Waggie
text: We come here whenever we come to NYC because the food and ambiance are amazing! Just remember this place isn't open on Tuesdays. You really can't go wrong with anything on their menu but especially the tart with potatoes, beets, goat cheese and arugula is incredible, and the spaghetti alla chitarra is amazing. One time they had a beet ravioli as a special and that was fantastic too. And their burrata is also amazing. There's really nothing bad to say about this place; you won't be disappointed.

author: Matt Torres
text: I cant rave about this place enough, the food is delicious and comforting, i believe everything is made in house. They have a large menu and so much to choose from. The grilled calamari was tender and delicious and the oxtail ragu from their specialty menu was rich and flavorful

author: Jorge Melendez
text: I loved this place the food was amazing and the wine selection is always amazing.  I‚Äôve been coming here for years.  But this time I was very disappointed, I ordered my usual stake which is the best I‚Äôve had but this time was the worst I‚Äôve had.  The meat was tough and tasteless.  The pompano fish seemed to be made at a vapor and also tasteless.  The salad was the fig cheese and arugula was delish and so was my wine.  For the price I paid I was very disappointed.  Remember today to go out for a nice dinner is a luxury.  Restaurant need to serve better quality food.

author: Nyah Jones
text:
Such an amazing spot in NYC!
The food is absolutely incredible and everything is made in house. Everything was so fresh and the dishes were unique.
The staff is extremely friendly and attentive!
I highly recommend visiting Gennaro‚Äôs when in New York, definitely worth stopping by!

author: Berele
text:
Let‚Äôs start with the good part: the atmosphere is incredible. Red velvet, candlelight, and live jazz so close you can feel the bass through your glass. The cocktails are top-tier, and the food easily outperforms what most music venues even attempt. My crab cakes were crisp perfection, the salad was fresh, and the service stayed calm even with a packed house.

Now for the part that ruined the vibe. The mandatory entr√©e rule. I came for drinks and small plates, happily spent several times the cost of an entr√©e, and was still told I had to order one or leave it uneaten. It felt like a cheap money grab at a place that otherwise screams class. Nothing kills the mood faster than being told your perfectly good dinner order isn‚Äôt ‚Äúenough.‚Äù

I still respect the music and the kitchen, both are excellent, but that policy left a bad taste I can‚Äôt ignore.

Three stars. Great night, unnecessary greed.

author: Jacqueline Caserta
text: We went to Smoke Jazz & Supper Club last night and had an incredible time. The show was absolutely amazing, especially the Monk tribute, which was unbelievable. Both the food and the performance exceeded our expectations. We had the octopus, NY strip, and coq au vin, and everything was cooked perfectly. Such a great experience all around.

author: Andy Fairbairn
text: We had a great night at Smoke after a difficult start. Somehow I managed to confuse bookings and we turned up the day after our reservation - I guess the product of a busy few days. Obviously this was disappointing, however the team made sure we had a table in the late show at no cost. That was unexpected, as it was my mistake but says a lot about the place. Beyond that the food was delicious , bar and serving staff knowledgeable and friendly and the Joey Alexander set wonderful. What could have been a sad end to our trip was very memorable and we couldn't be happier. Thanks to everyone involved.

author: Elliot Hoare
text:
Took my partner for her birthday and it was superb!
The food was excellent, we shared the polpette and bread for starters, followed by steak frites for main and chicken parm for main course, this was served and eaten mostly before the jazz started.
Then once the music started the cocktails are excellent! Overall perfect spot for a special evening, we will be back!

author: Rochel deOliveira
text: Beautful glam club with wonderful artists. However... we have been coming here for 25 years and the other night was the worst experience ever. It was a cold night and the ACs were on high and we (and the folks at the neighboring table) were FREEZING. Had to wear coat throughout show and still cold. The ACs were blowing right on us and not only that - you could actually HEAR the air blowing which interfered with the experience of enjoying a solo piano concert. We mentioned it to the waiter and the manager and nothing was done. The room was only 1/3 full and it was cold out: why would they not take this into consideration and turn down the AC's? Given the high cost of their food and the tickets, plus requiring that you order 2 entrees (1 $68 steak +1 appetizer is not enough for them), we felt ripped off and upset and will probably not come back for a long time. Plus my partner's food came out lukewarm. With high prices like this they should be much more customer-oriented. It's too bad because we've had so many great musical experiences at Smoke.

author: Britny Rogers
text:
We absolutely loved this place.

We made reservations for Sunday night. The restaurant is spacious, not too loud and the vibe was perfect for an intimate dinner.

The food was amazing. Everything that came to the table was a solid 10/10. We ordered the arancini, meatballs, fettuccine ragu, cacio e pepe, espresso martinis, wine, a few other cocktails and tiramisu. All the ingredients were fresh and in house olive oil was spectacular. The portions were a good size and the vegetarian options were bountiful.

George, Rosie and Joyce were great. George could read our mind and made sure we were well taken care of. We will be back for sure.

author: Mario V. Rijo
text: Wow! We had an amazing Easter lunch at Felice Montague! The food was delicious and the service was excellent. We loved the lasagna and the conchiglie al salmone! The shareable gelato dessert was so good! Definitely coming back soon!

author: Adithya Raghuraman
text: Cool italian joint in the heart of Brooklyn heights. Cozy spot. Overall nice vibes! The arancini was spectacular

author: Kirsten C
text: The linguine fruitti di mare was delicious, the milanese was good too but they seemed to have forgotten to add salt to the chicken. Can be fixed by adding salt myself but thought it was a miss. A good selection of summer cocktails and outdoor seating was perfect on a nice, not extremely hot summer day.

author: Midori Grabowski
text:
Came in for lunch on a Saturday without a reservation. They were definitely fairly full, but my friend and I were still able to snag a table.
The outdoor area was very pleasant to sit at on a warm spring day.
I ordered a Bianco spritz and the shaved Brussels sprout salad. The spritz was delightful and the whipped goat cheese on the salad was so yummy.
We were very well taken care of by the servers. Overall a very pleasant experience!

author: Mkaurene
text: I came to Sushi Mike's because I had some business in Dobbs Ferry. There is paid parking all around and strip of spaces adjacent to the restaurant. I dined at around 4:15 pm on a Saturday; I was 1 of two parties dining and another party came in as I left. I only tried one roll and it was incredibly tasty. I did find the prices to be high for me, but I don't have anything else in the area to compare it too. I can say the dining area seemed clean and once the servers gave me the menu they were pretty attentive. I think if I was back in the area I would try it again. Either way, tasty good, clean restaurant, fine service.

author: Thaddeus Whitney Cochrane
text: The food was fantastic! Very unusual selection, delicious and obviously high quality, and it all arrived pretty quickly. We sat near the chefs and had a wonderful, relaxed dining experience. There were many other items we would love to try if we ever get here again (we live far upstate), but we loved everything we tried! The abalone sashimi was a real standout for us and well worth the cost!

author: Judith Pulicicchio
text: Very small restaurant with every bit of space utilized. Every table was taken in a Tuesday night. Service was in point. Food was delicious as this was my first time trying Sushi. Crispy Rice rolls are a must.

author: Lesly H145
text:
I arrived as a walk in and was greeted immediately. Once I said how many, I looked at the tables and saw that it was basically full and expected to have some wait time or get changed to outdoor seating. Instead I was happily surprised the server was just looking at the tables to see which ones they would be able to separate for me. I personally ordered a S&S roll and a bottle of ‚ÄòCHOKARA delicious and fruity‚Äô for the table. The drink and the sides were the first thing we received with our first round poured for us in soju cups.i don‚Äôt typically like the taste of alcohol but this one was easy to bear and we were able to finish the whole bottle with our meal leaving one last toast at the end. Though the service was friendly and attentive our final toast was a bit ruined for me as the server lightly tossed the check presenter at the table which caused my glass to spill. The server immediately walked away as their job was done but with no napkins left(as we only had one for each person) a little mess was unfortunately left.
I recommend anyone have my order but especially try the miso soup as it was very easy, deliciously simple and the perfect temperature that lasted our foods wait time.

author: Eda S
text:
I dont know how to feel about this. This place used to be amazing.... unfortunately now that they have the clientele they are cutting corners or worse....
I ordered soft crab, when the plate came there were 2 pieces of crab. Confused i asked if it was suppose to be the whole crab, the server decided to count the pieces. She must have thought i was blind, as she started counting fried yam and mushroom as the crab. I said that was incorrect and opened in half the yam and mushroom. She brought a new plate, when i requested for the crab not to be cut she said the chef had already diced it. Red flag number one. I also ordered chirashi. When asked what was the difference between it and the delux, i was told sea urchin and salmon fish. For about 5$ more i decided on the delux. Now about this plate, the fish looked sketchy and i decided to smell the uni, boy o boy! The smell alone would put someone in ER! i asked the server if she could smell the uni, she said thats how it was suppose to smell, however her face and nose betrayed her. As she walked to the chef, he said the whole box smelled the same ...red flag number two. He asked me if I wanted him to open a new box.This told me all i needed to hear. I am not here to tell you to have integrity on what you serve, but if you are willing to poison me i will take my money to an establishment that takes a bit more pride in what they serve. The last thing that shows they dont care about their patrons was the chipped glass. I could have cut my hand while drinking if i wasnt paying attention.

author: Fahahaha ha-Haa
text:
The pizza was excellent, the service was great, the portions were substantial, & the atmosphere was casually comfortable. We had a great time & sat for a long time after we finished eating without any pressure to hurry along by the staff.

We enjoyed our visit very much.

author: Amber Duke
text: Pizza, and steak Milanese were delish! The steak was huge and smothered with Milanese! Also tried the custard!

author: Joe Laskowski
text: I ordered takeout. I had the sausage Parmesan with pasta. The people were very friendly. The food was affordable. The only thing that threw me off was I got the pasta and the sausage in separate containers. I've never gotten that from other takeout places. Friends tell me a lot of people prefer it that way. It wasn't a downside just unusual for me.

author: Tim Hall
text: I am in Endicott for 3 months working at a local hospital. I am ashamed that it took 2 of those months before I found Joey‚Äôs. I tried their Large Quattro Carne pizza and it was delicious! I also tried the Joey‚Äôs sampler platter. With the sampler, the fried cheese ravioli was amazing. I admit I wasn‚Äôt a fan of the ponzarotti but that was a person preference. Everything else was great! Friendly service as I picked up. I look forwarded to trying their subs!

author: Kaci Le
text: Best custard ever! Both the cheesecake and espresso flavors were delicious.

author: A.
text:
Overall the quality and value here are incredible for most places in NYC. The fries are astounding. The burgers are always delicious and greasy quality.

A full meal can range from about $16-26 with taxes. if you get a shake you‚Äôll still be under any dinner at most places for the cost of an entree which will get you to around $30.

**** ALSO ORGANIC ü´∂ü§©
Staff is always nice and helpful. They are thoughtful about their servings and check at just enough time.
‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
Addressing the issue(s):
I‚Äôm not sure how it happens, but in NYC random renovations do cause things to occur.

Repeated issues do mean there‚Äôs issues in storage and cleaning, but I have to report that it doesn‚Äôt look like it‚Äôs still present.

author: Aminah Imani
text: We came here after floating. This food was just what we needed. It didn‚Äôt make us say moo but the milkshake made my body dance. The falafel burger was good. My friend inhaled the nachos. I would definitely come back here if Im in the area for sure! The service was friendly and super welcoming. Thank you!

author: Leo Gordon
text: Nice and cozy place and staff is very pleasant. The only drawback was that a $16 burger was very tiny.

author: Gwendolyn R Houston-Jack
text:
Found this spot on the walk back from a day at the Brooklyn Bridge park and I'm so happy we stopped. It was an early Sunday evening so not busy at all. The weather was nice so we chose to sit outside.

Our waiter was so cool and aware. He did a great job with all the customers sitting outside. I was impressed.

My hubs had a cheese burger and I opted for the hot dogs and fries. The dogs were good, but far too many onions and too much deli mustard for me. The fries were also hot and crispy.

The showstoppers were the root beer float and chocolate shake. We couldn't stop talking about them.

Next time I'm in Brooklyn, I'll be making another stop for sure.

author: Patrick Price
text:
The food was great aside from the ONION RINGS. Beer battered but they came out very oily and the batter was too thin for my liking.
The FRENCH FRIES were to die for loved them, even stole my daughter.
Ordered the LAMB BURGER and that was awesome.
My partner in crime ordered a CHEESE BURGER with FRIED EGG and AVOCADO and she freaking loved it. And theSWEET POTATO FRIES knocked us out

author: wadigzon Diaz-wong
text: Great ambience, great service good ok (omelettes Greek and veggie did not impress - had better ones at many other places), decent prices

author: Michelle Dooley
text:
If you're going to the natural History museum this is a great spot to eat with your family!

My family had a really delicious dinner here tonight! I have some very picky kids. It's rare that the adults and kids all loved their dishes! The smash burger was amazing, my husband loved the Ruben. There was a kids meal that included a drink which is rare and a nice treat. The staff was lovely, food came quickly. It was a perfect end to a museum trip.

author: Nelia Acosta
text: I ordered through postmates and my steak was made perfectly!! I will definitely be ordering from here again! The onion rings were delicious as well as my baked potato!! The way they packaged my food was great. Nothing spilled! Thank you Viand Diner!

author: Daniella Thompson
text:
Spending the weekend in NYC and looked for a place to have breakfast near Central Park and to our good fortune found Viand!! Solid reviews and really deserves more than a 4.3 rating..come on folks, hype up your favorite spots‚Ä¶ because this place a strong and steady flow of local New Yorkers for breakfast (especially families with young kids).
My breakfast sandwich, The Modern, was delicious! I was able to change the ciabatta bread to the brioche bun which was soft and sweet and the tomato bacon jam was out of this world, yummy. I‚Äôll definitely add bacon to this sandwich next time. My partner got the steak and eggs, good sized steak, well seasoned, cooked to the desired temperature and the eggs they use here are huge and hearty! We don‚Äôt usually like shredded hash browns ( prefer breakfast potatoes) but their hash browns are pretty good with onions and peppers and again, well seasoned.
Atmosphere is very nice, small but not cramped, clean, and the staff are wonderful; friendly and attentive without being overbearing and they seem to work well as a team to serve all customers. Overall this was a really great experience, slight dings for the fact that the coffee was pretty weak (and o don‚Äôt like strong coffee so that‚Äôs saying something), and the orange juice was a bit tart/bitter. But that aside we enjoyed it so much we ordered a salad and Cuban sandwich to-go for lunch later!
Awesome food, great service‚Ä¶ stop by!!

author: Anna Broadhurst
text: This is a diner with service and food like none other! Brunch is AMAZING! The weekend brunch and drink specials are perfect! Nikki, Valentina, and Lisa, and of course Victor are awesome and so on top of every table. No one is left wanting. We live in the neighborhood and know all the restaurants and if you want great food, great service, and delicious drinks you should eat at Viand! Oh and I believe the manager, Nick (?) has something to do with hiring the best of the best!

author: B Jung
text:
I was served by a terrific waiter from Morocco. He was very friendly and helped me decide on my order. His recommendations were great.
MUJADDARA CROQUETTE: Green lentil and rice croquette, makdous, caramelized onions, bechamel, feta - tenderly crisp outside, and warm and soft inside with a please and slightly tangy sauce.

MUSAKHAN: Sumac chicken, red onion, olive oil, almonds over flat bread - generous serving, red onions were just slightly cooked with still a bit of the good raw flavor, the sliced almonds adds a nice focus and but it's crunch, flatbread was good and kept it's consistency without getting soggy

Both were excellent, and I was full, so I ordered dessert takeout for later: Homemade Knafeh (also excellent)

Atmosphere was nice. Kinda chic-y, but noise level was a bit high.

author: Nicola
text: Hubby and I came here for brunch last week on a Sunday morning. The place was still empty and we had an outdoor table. Staff was friendly and attentive. Food was served fast. I liked the Shaksuka and Babaganoush. My husband found the french toast average. Overall good experience for an early Sunday brunch.

author: yousef dash
text: Love the menu and authenticity. Very skilled and professional star. Food was delightfully quick but still made well. Portions were relatively small but that just allowed us to order more. I just love how authentic and proud this place is all around. Chic chill setting on top of that. Wetriesd more than half a dozen dishes, the muhammara was shockingly tender grilled chicken. The octopus was the best I had it was unlike octopus I had anywhere else, and the fattoush salad with the pomegranate was certainly notably nice.

author: Chao Ji
text:
Great middle-east food with strong Palestinian influence. The chicken was juicy, and the rice with mutton was yummy and excellent!
The only minor issue here is the background music was on a louder end to me, making conversation quite exhausting. They might be short of staff on the evening I was there. Only one major waiter was servicing, taking the order and cleaning.

author: Shee Yan Chin
text: We love the food so much here. Food was amazing, staffs were super friendly and engaging, me and partner definitely enjoyed our time here and wish to come back again!

author: Susan Chen
text: Fantastic wine local wine shop with a great curated selection of natural wines. They are my local go to. Love their friendly service too.

author: Jonathan Hirshowitz
text:
My go-to liquor spot since they opened about 8 years ago.
A refreshing change from the typical bank-style liquor shops ‚Äî this place has character. The staff are always helpful and up for a good conversation. Great selection, weekly specials, free tastings, and convenient hours. It‚Äôs one of those local gems that sets Clinton Hill apart from all the other neighborhoods

author: Marlena Fauer
text: Great selection and wonderful friendly staff! Always discover new favorite bottles here!

author: Cory Long
text: Great selection and knowledgeable staff. They are always happy to provide a recommendation based on my preference.

author: Lauren King
text:
I always leave Tipsy with a great bottle of wine and a smile on my face! Excellent choices of wines, very knowledgeable and friendly staff. Friends from Manhattan who go with me always say they wish they had a Tipsy in their neighborhood!

EDIT DEC 2024: The wine selection is unrecognizable under new ownership/buyer. Gone are the small woman-owned wineries and thoughtful selections. Very disappointing as a loyal customer.

author: Katherine Czyzewski
text: My favorite dining spot in the neighborhood! The staff is always super kind and they treat you like you are their neighbor! I‚Äôve had breakfast, brunch, lunch, and dinner is here and every time it is always a hit. Great drink menu and great atmosphere!

author: Ana Popovic
text: LOVEEE this place! You can never go wrong coming to Taralluci UWS whether it‚Äôs for a brunch with friends, a quick stop for a cappuccino or spritz, or a phenomenal spread of apps and entrees for dinner. My favorites are definitely the orichetti and the lamb skewers that were just recently added to the menu, amazing! Oscar is truly incredible and makes the atmosphere very welcoming. He is so attentive and makes some of the best spritzes I‚Äôve had in the city!! Highly recommend this restaurant and will continue coming back :))

author: W E
text: Cute corner restaurant on the upper west side, reliable and good service. The food was pretty good but I nothing stood out as amazing from all the dishes my party had ordered. The service was good and they did a really nice job with the birthday candle and cake for my friend.

author: Ameya Bhakay
text:
Had made reservations for NYE which had a Prix Fixe menu with a decent split of vegetarian and meat selection across three courses. We went for the early seating and it was relatively quiet on a rainy last day of the year.

Alex, our server, was friendly and was kind enough to offer us a glass of wine on the house, after he felt bad having charged full price for our little one on the Prix Fixe menu.

Food overall was pretty decent. There was a Pappardelle pasta for our little one, and a few great options for meat lovers, including a Rib-eye steak which unfortunately lacked flavor, in spite of adding their rather heavy garlic and heavy cream sauce. The lobster tail was thoroughly enjoyed by the seafood lover on our table, and was enough to knock a person out on the table next to us, who possibly had a shell fish allergy. We were glad to see the person doing fine though, towards the end of the meal. Definitely not a nice way to end the year!

Noise levels were on the average end throughout our time there, and their menu and service were pretty good, definitely on the expensive end though. Will definitely visit again sometime in the near future!

author: Jenny Beth Stenquist
text: Italian transported to the UWS! Get the Rigatoni if it‚Äôs your first time here. Get the Cacio E Pepe if you appreciate peppery dishes. I loved the intentionality of the pepper‚Äîit was clearly the main flavor yet it didn‚Äôt overpower the whole dish. A+

author: Ko S.
text: Stopped by Batata Cafe and really enjoyed it. The chai tea was amazing, full of flavor and perfectly balanced. The service was friendly and quick, making it an easy and pleasant stop. I‚Äôll definitely be back.

author: Ariah H
text:
Ordered a hot honey chicken sandwich on a day I swore I was eating healthy, so I asked for it bun less on lettuce. They nailed it exactly how I ordered. My coworkers' meals looked just as good and were thoughtfully packed, so points for presentation.

The chicken itself? Crispy perfection. I'm extremely picky with chicken because I can't stand when it has that "chickeney" taste (you know exactly what I mean), but this was fresh, flavorful, and downright tasty.

Super happy they're around delicious food, great attention to detail, and honestly, I'm already planning my next

author: M K
text: Food is always top notch. Our go to spot when we are near Northport. The staff are always helpful and pleasant. The dining area is always clean and food is prepared fresh. Highly recommend this place.

author: David Green
text:
I literally work across the street from Batata Cafe in Northport, and have the great luck of being able to walk over anytime; a great thing indeed!

I am not a vegan, but like to vary my diet, especially when having lunch, which is usually on the fly and not always so healthy. Lol. Batata has a really great variety of options, from the Impossible Burger, Soups, Wraps and more. I have tried a wide variety of these options and they are all fresh and delicious! They have all been seasoned nicely, not too heavy a hand, as sometimes you get with Vegan meals.

Great food and great service. The menu is stacked with so many delicious options.

Moreover, the Staff are all friendly and greet with smiles and warm welcomes. They all seem to enjoy working at Batata and it shows. The restuarant is always clean and they take pride on their appearance with clean glass and nice decorations.

The store is conveniently located on a 25A/Ft Salonga Road with plenty of parking. If you choose to dine in you'll always have a seat as they offer indoor and outdoor dining options. They also offer wine in a can which is interesting. They offer various discounts so ask and you can accumulate points towards future meals if you order online with the Toast App.

Regardless of meal time or food preferences, Batata is always worth a visit - Go and enjoy a great meal experience!

*Bonus tip: In Batata's "Cold Case" you will find round containers with homemade "Bites". (see picture) There are 2 varieties, I only half-jokingly call these my "crack" ...:) Literally addicted...make sure to try these too!

author: Danielle Woods
text: If you, like me, stopped going to Batata for a time because their food and service seemed to decline a few years ago, I recommend you revisit soon‚Ä¶ food and service was excellent the last 3 times I ordered. I have been going to Batata since it opened many years ago and through all of its changes. A few years ago, it seemed that mostly some high school kids were working and always messed up our orders and had awful customer service skills.  I gave up on eating there for a time, but recently revisited to find everything excellent once again.

author: Cayden Chu (UMC)
text: It was a wonderful experience, one I‚Äôll never forget. The staff were extremely friendly, to say the least, and the food was out of this world. The mix of Asian and Japanese flavours will blow your tastebuds away to heaven. One of my favourite dishes of the night was the foie gras. The duck liver will melt in your mouth, flavours unstoppably seeping in. It was then combined with outstanding rice and bean curd skin, it fits perfectly. The fusion of taste don‚Äôt just add up to each other, they multiply each other and increase the already amazing tastiness. It was so good we had to order another plate. Next came the pork knuckles. We ordered both flavours, the vinegar and the garlic. Both were remarkable, but the garlic one was truly  magnificent. Considering I‚Äôm not a huge fan of cilantro, it fitted surprisingly well with the extraordinary texture. The dessert was also exceptional. The cheesecake was a mixture of New York style and Japanese style, a soft crumbly exterior and a gooey interior. It wasn‚Äôt too sweet, but hit the spot. This spot is a must try, truly ground breaking. I am amazed and do recommend it for everyone.

author: Aziza WONG
text: This a hidden gem (believe it or not in Chinatown) a Japanese restaurant found is by far THE BEST discovery after the pandemic.  The food is beautifully presented & dishes are delicious.  Price is more than reasonable compared to Soho, midtown, or uptown.  Service is also attentive, polite & prompt.  Can‚Äôt ask for more these days with the burden of food cost, sales taxes , & 20%+ service charge, eating out is no longer fun & affordable + frequently deal w/ nasty food.  I would like to give this new food establishment 6 STARS.

author: Glenn C
text:
Short review- order the goma, kani, wagyu, tonsoku. Nabe/hot pot is alright.

I went here a while with a group.

The first thing that arrived was probably my favorite bite of the night which was the Goma Hamachi for $20 with baby yellowtail with scallion, seaweed, and sesame sauce which is poured table side. The hamachi was excellent quality being buttery with a soft texture and the nutty sesame sauce (said goma) worked nicely with it. This was excellent and I would recommend it heavily.

Also very tasty was the Kani Harumaki for $14 with a blend of snow crab, pork, mushroom, and vegetables served with spring roll skin which came with a light soy based dipping sauce. There was a bit of sweetness, a bit of earthiness, and some richness and it all fit well with the crispy skin. This was very good as well and was decently portioned for the price point.

Also very tasty was the Wagyu Yakiniku Wrap for $18 with BBQ washu beef with lettuce, pickled vegetables, and mayo wrapped in a scallion pancake. This was perhaps a bit messy due to the mayo as well as the sweet sauce especially when paired with the slightly oily pancake but the flavor was excellent. The beef quality was high and it had some sweetness to it but not too much so and the pickled vegetables added a nice crunch.

The Tonsoku Ponzu for $13 with grilled pork feet with scallion and ponzu sauce is one of their signatures that you can't really find in many other Japanese spots. The dish of course has a lot of collagen so it's rich and fatty but the ponzu helps cut down the richness of the pork. There was also a Japanese hot sauce on the table which helped as well. This was also good though I would recommend more compared to other small plates to share.

The Kara Age for $9 consisting of Japanese fried chicken with mala mayo was pretty standard outside of the price point being relatively cheaper for the portion size compared to most other places. The chicken was pretty tender though I have had much crispier versions before but I can't complain with the light batter and the amount of chicken given. Though the color was different, the mayo also didn't exactly have any type of mala seasoning either but it still worked with the chicken.

The Koji Ebi Chili for $20 consisting of shrimp with sweet chili over egg omelette was pretty standard western Japanese/Yoshoku style comfort food. There was plenty of shrimp/ebi in there and the sweet chili was standard. I wish the egg was a bit fluffier but that is only a minor fault in an otherwise standard tasty dish.

Last was our large main to share which was the Tonton Hotpot (or nabe) which is $68 for the large or $38 for the small and we got the large one which was large and fine. This came with pork feet, chicken thigh, pork belly, dumplings, tofu, vegetables, and your choice of soup where we got the spicy miso tonsoku soup. The primary meat in there was the tonsoku/pork feet with there being some thigh and a little bit of dumplings and pork belly. Outside of the size which is easily big enough for four people as it should be for the price point, it's hard not to compare it unfavorably to some other nabe spots such as Kimura or even some other recent ones such the izakaya Toriya on the LES which both had much better broths, a little more variety in terms of vegetables, and was not focused on one meat in particular. Possibly the motsu/intestine pot is better here but I would recommend sticking with their other dishes instead.

This place is tasty with plenty of highlights and a worthy successor to the original excellent izakaya.

author: William Nobutomo Shinwo Kim
text:
The food was delicious. I ordered the small tonton pot and the portion was enough for two. The fried oysters were delicious and came with a delicious sauce (I think it was mentaiko egg mayo but not 100% sure). The pork in the hot pot was so soft and delicious, and the dessert was a perfect not-too-sweetness.

The service was also excellent. We had the pleasure of interacting with multiple staff members and they were all extremely friendly and welcoming.

author: Lee
text:
food is just as good as the old days. service is still exceptional. i love Tonton hotpot with Red Miso.
Good to know this place is still running.
been visiting this place since 10 years ago in West Village.

author: –ê–ª–µ–∫—Å–µ–π –®–µ–≤—á–µ–Ω–∫–æ
text: Lovely place, perfect for brunch. I ordered a dish from lunch menu (turkey club sandwiches). They were tasty, turkey meat was fresh and bacon was cooked well. Loved the vegetables inside too. Moreover, they serve french fries with sandwiches, pretty big portion. They have sauces for different dishes, used ketchup for my french fries. Also loved a little pickle. My wife ordered a breakfast item: Brie French Brioche, and it was massive and tasty too. Moreover, they also gave a cup of syrup, which was nice. I didn't have a drink, but she had a coffee and liked it. Definitely worth a visit.

author: Shay Teoli
text:
This was our first stop on our trip to Ithaca and it was the perfect start to our trip. From the atmosphere, to the friendly staff and the amazing food...5 stars across the board.
The atmosphere is a combination of 70s diner but with an add of updated sophisticated vibe with the rose gold lighting fixtures and the ceiling details. The food was absolutely amazing. The menu has a variety of options to choose from for anyone. The hostess was charming and quick to greet us at the door. And our server, she was an absolute delight. I would highly recommend this place to anyone visiting Ithaca.

author: Chaz Tuck
text: The food was amazing and reasonably priced. The service was incredible. From the second I walked in until I left I felt so comfortable and welcomed. The aesthetic is beautiful. Reminds me of a classic 40s dinner but still very stylish. I traveled from Rochester to try to baked apple pancake and I was not disappointed. Well worth the travels !! Will be returning again very soon

author: Taylor Karim
text: By far the best diner experience I have ever had in all my travels. We were transported back in time with the music and atmosphere topped with the beautiful and polite waitress by the name of Quin. She was very attentive to our needs providing a memorable service by which I will return again.

author: Erin Paik
text: Such a memorable, elevated Brunch and Breakfast area!! Milkstand offers a refreshing twist on American comfort classics, elevated through thoughtful presentation and creative flavor combinations. The Apple pancakes were so delicious offering such generous portions and strong cinnamon apple seasonings. I also savored the avocado toast, chicken and waffles and vegan chorizo skillet. Milkstand has such friendly interactions towards their dietary restrictions and is a standout gem in the Ithaca dining scene!!

author: Sy W
text: Very delicious dim sum. Served in an authentic way, with carts around. We got a bunch of small dishes to share and they‚Äôre absolutely delicious. Our favorite is the durian dessert ÂÜ∞ÁöÆÊ¶¥Ëé≤, so creamy and fresh. Apparently they make it fresh everyday so they didn‚Äôt have it when we first asked for it. The leek dumplings are so good! Lots of ingredients like shrimp, egg and lotus root. Beef tripe with turnip is so refreshing paired up with the chili spicy oil. The tofu wrap is so tasty. Porridge‚Äôs absolutely amazing. You can tell it‚Äôs freshly cooked and prepared with lots of time. When it comes to the sticky rice dishes, I prefer the pearl one more because it‚Äôs softer and with more kinds proteins. The other one is just so plain and rice is dry. Popular place and friendly service!

author: Steven Nhan Ngo
text:
My family and I was in NYC to visit from Philadelphia. We have dimsum in PA as well but the experience and the food here taste so much better!

Everything was steamed hot in the carts and every dishes was so savory and tasty. They have a wide variety of option and deserts. I definitely recomended the shumai, chicken feet, and the tofu skin rolls.

We had a great time here and we‚Äôll definitely come back if we‚Äôre in the city the next time!

author: Tan Tang
text: Been here when studying in East coast long while ago and thus want to revisit. Love the interior and spacious seating and of cause the food carts pushing around the tables for you to choose are much fun and missed, most dim sum restaurants not offer the food carts nowadays, even in Asian countries. Food are delicious generally, we enjoyed a lot on all dim sum dishes. We had brunch on a weekday and thus no wait time. However, the second want to revisit on a weekend lunch time, we had waited almost an hour downstairs outside the elevator and still so crowded. Had to change to another nearby dim sum restaurant after an hour wait. Recommend to go on weekdays or go earlier over weekends and prepare for long wait.

author: Emil Yao
text:
ABSOLUTELY the BEST Dim-Sum restaurant in the Northeast area!!
Fresh, tasty and very authentic Cantonese cuisine just like what you can find in Hong Kong.
Although the dining room could be a bit noisy, the service is actually quite fast/good.
Reservations are highly recommended. If you want to just walk-in, it‚Äôs better you show up before 11am on Saturday and Sunday. Otherwise you may have to wait up to one hour.
They also have a to-go only entrance on the ground floor.

author: diegobatt
text: My first DimSum experience, but definitely one that is going to be hard to beat. The place is extremely crowded, full of real Chinese people so you know it's good. Prices are ok for new York standards, 45usd including tax and 20% tip. For a Sunday, arriving at around noon, the wait is totally bearable, around 15/20 minutes for 4 people.

author: Leo Zou
text: No joke one of the best Thai places in the city. The massaman curry with beef is incredible. Not too spicy with plenty of flavor. The peanuts really provides a good crunchiness to the savory curry. Loved how the potato‚Äôs absorb the flavors. The pad Thai with shrimp also great, and I asked for a drink that‚Äôs not too sweet and the lemon Thai ice tea was just it. Really washes away the curry and refresh the palate for another round of flavor. The lunch special pricing is amazing, would be here on the regular and if not order delivery.

author: Mia ZHONG
text: Tried this Thai restaurant for the first time and was really impressed. Every dish had its own unique flavor and stood out in a different way. Nothing tasted generic or the same. The spices were well-balanced, the portions were good, and the overall meal felt thoughtful and authentic. Definitely worth a try if you‚Äôre looking for solid Thai food in the area!

author: Nicole ‚ÄúNikki‚Äù Sue Low Chee
text:
Excellent quality, authentic food at fair prices. Space has a neighborhood Thai place vibe but the food is better than your normal neighborhood Thai place, with the inclusion of a street food menu ‚ù§Ô∏è. Attentive, friendly service.

I ordered the crab fried rice and Chinese broccoli with crispy pork and was impressed by both. I was even impressed by the pork to broccoli ratio because it‚Äôs usually most broccoli. This is the first time I‚Äôve had the proportion reversed.

The lunch special is only $12 or $13 from memory. But I would go with the street food menu!

author: Dee Cam
text: The food at Myrtle Thai was delicious. The vegetables and berry rice was delicious. The pineapple rice was also very delicious. My favorite was the sticky rice with mango compote. It‚Äôs amazing how they make a delicious dessert out of rice. The service was great and the restaurant had nice music and a nice ambiance. I recommend this place for delicious and affordable Thai cuisine.

author: Margo Phillips
text: Came here on a recent trip to New York, and this was my favorite part of the trip! The staff is amazing! They were super friendly. The food here is also really good! The picture is their new mango sundae and the ‚ÄúSo High School‚Äù drink.

author: L.
text:
+ Get $25 off $50 using the link on my profile!

They have a nice happy hour till 6pm so make sure to catch it. The food and drinks were all decent, nothing spectacular but good and homey. The chicken was alright; I‚Äôd recommend the cavatelli more. One thing to note is that contrary to some reviews I‚Äôve seen, they don‚Äôt do anything for birthdays ‚Äî in case anyone comes expecting something based on those reviews and gets disappointed like we were.

author: Jasraj Singh
text:
All around wonderful restaurant, they also have a great happy hour with good priced cocktails and tasty beef tartar and kale salad.

The French onion soup was some of the best I have had in NYC, combined with sitting outside on a summer or fall evening it was just all around a perfect feeling.

The steak was extremely tender and the sauce was so good, they should consider serving extra sauce to dip your fries in it. The pasta was creamy and filling without being too heavy, the short rib in it was robust with flavor as well. Only thing could have been improved was a little more salt on the fries and fried mushroom, otherwise almost everything was perfect.

Service here was extremely accommodating and everyone was very nice.

author: Jennifer Fairholm
text: This place is an absolute gem. We came here for brunch and the atmosphere food and service are top-notch. We can really tell that there‚Äôs a lot of love that goes into each aspect of our dining experience. We would definitely recommend this to our family and friends and hope that you get a chance to try it as well.

author: Angel Torres
text: It is certainly worth experiencing. The French and modern cuisine is excellent. The service was top-notch and respectful. It is a wonderful place to celebrate an anniversary, a birthday, or simply to relax and enjoy delicious food.

author: Kevin Costa
text:
This place‚Äôs prices were offensively expensive. $20 for a French onion soup?! $36 for a bowl of mid pasta?! Absolutely not.
One cocktail and 2 bowls of pasta + tax and tip should not cost $112. INSANE and out of control. I‚Äôm fine with an expensive meal if the value and quality are there but this wasn‚Äôt it. Never again.

The food, drink, service, and atmosphere were fine‚Äînothing to call home about. Specifically, the truffle gnocchi was decent but the actual truffle shavings were dry‚Äîwould‚Äôve preferred less actual truffle for a more reasonably priced meal. The short rib cavatelli was disappointing, lacking depth and flavor.

author: Kevin Tenorio
text:
The best 5 course meal my wife and I have ever had thus far. Our hands down favorite, and rightfully so as sushi fanatics, was the hamachi. Talk about fresh on fresh on fresh on fresh. Fresh fish, fresh fruit, fresh sauce, fresh cream, fresh presentation‚Äîinsanely delicious and refreshing.

The tiger bread was some of the most exceptional bread we've ever had as well. The garlic was as buttery smooth to spread as the whipped butter itself, and was pleasantly flavorful without being overly potent.

My next course was the butternut squash rigatoni. The garnish on top was light and crisp and added that extra accent to the whole dish to round it off beautifully. My wife got the iberico pork, which was cooked to tender perfection. The broccoli mash concoction that came with it was reminiscent of broccoli rabe but basically in it's ultimate form anime-style. Crazy inventive.

The next course for me was the beer battered monkfish with risotto and was actually the best beer battered anything I've ever tasted. Superior crisp encasing that mouth melting fish. The risotto had crispy chunks in it as well and helped offset the heaviness of the fried fish like a wife offsets her husband's hard shell exterior and gives way to his heart of flesh. Speaking of, my wife got the lamb with risotto and it was yet again a perfectly tender cut of meat. It was smokey and carried a more intense flavor, which also was rounded out by the gentleness of the risotto, complimenting it on that marital level yet again.

Lastly, the desserts came in and ended the whole show the same way it began‚Äîwith favorite-level energy. It was the solid second favorite course for both of us. Mine was the panna cotta. Yo. It went crazy. It was like a salted caramel apple cheesecake, but after finding a way to dial in each ingredient to the max before artistically laying it all out on a plate without any of the cheesecake crust. I LOVE sweet/savory, and it encapsulated that in a dessert beautifully. My wife had the chocolate cake with ice cream, and like we don't even know how to properly describe how good that one was‚Äîbut here goes nothing. The cake was dark dark and rich rich from the sauce oozing on top to the moist pastry itself. The ice cream had a citrus undertone to it that balanced out the richness of the cake. Literally, yin and yang on a plate with the freshest chocolate drenched cherries on top. Good Lord, the Lord is good indeed.

The service was top notch, from the warm greetings, to the coat check in, to the menu break down, to the seamless water refilling and course transitions. We are big on omakase type meals as sushi heads, and this was up there while being a fraction of the price. There was a chill and comforting vibe to the whole restaurant as well. Take a trip here and let them take your palette on a trip it will sing praises on the whole way through. Bless.

author: Rachel Truong
text:
