The fries and sweet potato fries deserve a special mention too: perfectly crispy, piping hot, and honestly addictive. They‚Äôre the kind of sides you keep reaching for long after you‚Äôre full.

For mains, the lamb shawarma was excellent, with a distinctly gamey flavor that made it rich and satisfying without being overpowering. It felt authentic and hearty. But one of my favorite parts of the meal was the Israeli chopped salad on tahini. It was bright, refreshing, and balanced, with that creamy tahini base tying everything together beautifully. It was light yet flavorful, the kind of dish you could eat every day and never get tired of.

Everything about Shoo Shoo‚Äîfrom the fresh, flavorful food to the great ambiance and attentive service‚Äîmakes it a place I can‚Äôt wait to return to. It‚Äôs perfect whether you‚Äôre coming for a casual meal, a night out with friends, or just to enjoy really well-executed Mediterranean dishes in a space that feels good to be in.

author: Aparna Shankar
text: Excellent food and lots of vegetarian options. Loved the hummus, the eggplant dish, and the shakshuka. Cocktail was too sweet, would not recommend.

author: –î–∞—Ä–∏ –ë–∞–¥–º–∞–µ–≤–∞
text: I was with a friend a couple of weeks ago, I heard a lot of recommendations. The atmosphere, the service is very pleasant. We took tea with mint and schnitzel with french fries, as well as vegetables with zaatar. I expected more from the food, but in the end it was averagely good. The sauces were delicious, especially green, but the schnitzel itself is boring and the potatoes are not sluggish.

author: Marc Starvaggi
text: I've visited twice with my girlfried and I think this is one of my absolute favorite restaurants in the city. The chopped Osraeli salad is the best I have ever eaten. The schnitzel is as well. I have really enjoyed the shakshuka both times, especially the challah that comes with it. The knafeh is good too. Love the mint lemonade!

author: Maddy A
text: It‚Äôs fine - the food itself is quite good but we had a large party and were seated in the basement, which was giving cellar vibes. Did not like the ambience and would not come back here because of that. Service was good - servers were very friendly.

author: Megan Wilson
text: Wonderful food. The lamb manty had a very rich tasty filling that paired well with the fresh herbs and sour cream. The crispy fried eggplant was an unexpected delight. We opted for two of the most popular hand pulled noodle dishes, and both were excellent. I would recommend the lamb over the beef - but I am partial to lamb. The server was very friendly and helpful. Portions are huge, we had tons of leftovers to bring home!

author: David Asekoff
text:
Went to the 20th Avenue and 62nd street location of laghman express in Bensonhurst, Brooklyn nyc.

Written up by the ny times in 24 and 25 as one of the top nyc restaurants.

Central Asian cuisine: laghman, chechvera and compote. Phenomenal food. Indoor and outdoor seating. Great staff! 3% credit card fee

author: Junaid Ali
text: The food at this restaurant is nothing short of exceptional, boasting vibrant flavors and exquisite presentation. The service is equally impressive, with attentive staff who ensure a delightful dining experience. Additionally, the portions are generous, providing great value for reasonable prices. I truly have no complaints‚Äîthis place exceeds expectations in every way.

author: Fatema Poushi
text: Today we went there for dinner and the staff were really welcoming. They are really well behaved. And the food is soo good ! The portion is also very good. Definitely gonna visit again soon. No wonder why they have so many good reviews! Love love love. My 3 year old toddler loved their dumplings. ü§åüèª‚ù§Ô∏è

author: Janice C
text: I could eat this everyday, the fried manty are the ultimate comfort dish!! The dumplings were juicy and full of meat and the main courses were spiced to perfection. On top of the amazing food is the incredible staff and cozy environment. must try you won‚Äôt regret taking your friends here just to try out every appetizer.

author: Isabella White
text: We had such a wonderful dining experience at Cena Brooklyn! The food was absolutely delicious‚Äîevery dish was full of flavor and beautifully prepared. The atmosphere was warm and inviting, and the staff made sure we felt taken care of throughout the evening. A perfect spot for anyone looking for great food in Brooklyn. The music playing in the background was a welcomed addition.  We Highly recommend!

author: Juan Delacruz
text:
Arrived at 8pm, the waiter took our order at 830pm, we received food at 915pm on a lazy Wednesday evening with 4-5 couples seated in the restaurant. Wait staff was completely negligent. Couldn‚Äôt be bothered to do much. Food was bland, under seasoned and far from the quintessential flavors you come to expect from a Mexican restaurant, even if they‚Äôre going for a more modern take the flavors are just non existent. Add to this No salsa, no hot sauce, nothing of that nature to be found at a Mexican restaurant, just not good IMHO.
And I hate giving less than 5 star reviews, but you add the bad service on top of that and you just have a disappointing night out.

author: Chantelle Ray
text: Neighborhood gem! The sizzling fajitas were very fresh and tasty with a great portion size. We came here for brunch with my toddler and they were incredibly friendly and accommodating. Looking forward to coming back in the warmer months

author: Christine
text:
I really wanted to like this place, unfortunately found my dinner experience disappointing.

Service:
The service was incredibly slow and inattentive. They took forever to take our order and then brought out our entrees but forgot our drinks.

Food & drinks:
My $21 chicken quesadilla was a bit bland but greasy. My Paloma was good!

Atmosphere:
Tables were quite close together so it was hard to hear the person I was having dinner with. My clothes ended up smelling like food long after I left as well.

Overall, found it to be too expensive for what it was, especially for the area. $50 can get me a better experience elsewhere.

author: Paul
text: First of all, the food was not bad, but the service was atrocious.  We ordered two sodas and an appetizer and 20 minutes later the gal asked if we had ordered the appetizer‚Ä¶ we were the only party in the restaurant so who else ordered the appetizer and she never even brought our drinks.  Four people for breakfast with no alcohol was $130 before tip.  Like I said, the food was fine, not spectacular, but you could do better for half the price somewhere else.  And the female server definitely needs to find a new profession where personality is not a requirement.

author: Aixa Galarza
text:
‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
Absolutely amazing experience at Giovanni‚Äôs Brooklyn Eats!

From the moment we walked in, the atmosphere was warm and welcoming the perfect blend of cozy and classic Brooklyn charm. The service was exceptional; everyone was friendly, attentive, and made us feel right at home.

The food? Incredible. Every dish was beautifully presented and full of flavor from the lobster pasta with fresh mussels to the pistachio cream puffs that were out of this world. We paired it with a lovely Montepulciano d‚ÄôAbruzzo Riserva that complemented the meal perfectly.

If you‚Äôre looking for a true hidden gem in Brooklyn with amazing food, amazing service, and a genuinely inviting vibe, Giovanni‚Äôs is the place to go. Can‚Äôt wait to come back!

author: Anna H
text: There is true hospitality here. Dino the don and Giovanni is the dad and they do everything right here: the food is quality ingredients and I say this because you can taste it. My montipulchiano wine and Sardinian wine were top tier like when I go back to Italy to visit my cousins. The frito misto was amazing. Light and tasty. Good mix. Actually outstanding just like the table salad. Best I ever had. The fried zucchini flowers were so yummy like zeppoli almost. The vegetarian lasagna was the best I ever had in a restaurant. Seriously. The pasta was homemade and every layer was separate and well executed. Good pesto. The housemade squid ink pasta ravioli stuffed with lobster outstanding. Thh lobster was fresh. The lemon cello cake was the best dessert of my year. Live music. Friday and sat. We heard a great New Orleans band and got to hear Giovanni singing. What a treat. Packed out the door with people.

author: Ana Myles
text: Wonderful gem in the neighborhood. We have been dining here consistently for over a year now, both the brunch and dinner are excellent. We especially love coming Friday nights for live music. They recently had a fantastic porterhouse special, cooked and sliced perfectly with pasta and wine, as well as a unique clam gnocchi which was a favorite of our group. What makes this place even better is Giovanni himself, who is always so warm and welcoming, and made the night for my parents who were visiting from out of town. They already want to come back next time. You may even catch him singing a song on Friday!

author: Alexa D
text: The best chicken parm. The Tuesday special is one that I‚Äôd come back to Brooklyn for. Incredible ambiance, the staff was great especially the sous servers cleaning up our plates shoutout to them for being so on top of it. Loved everything about this experience. If I‚Äôm ever back in town I‚Äôd love to bring a bigger group.

author: Alyssa Kabel
text:
We came in 10 minutes before the kitchen closed as a group of 8, a restaurant‚Äôs nightmare, but the staff was accommodating & great.

The food was delicious. Some had seafood but most of us had pasta & everyone was thrilled.

As a vegan, there were many options. I had the spaghetti ortolano without pecorino & loved it.

Next time I will try to homemade limoncello!

author: Derek Lao
text:
Food was excellent. It feels like the food is organically cooked, with good attention to detail, making for a very good presentation and experience.

I got the beef blood sausage, and DjonDjon paella. Blood sausage was nicely juicy and flavored, the tomatoes and sauce paired very nicely, adding a nice touch of acidity and sweetness. The DjonDjon paella is nice and satisfying. It is not boldly flavored, which meant I could eat a lot of it in one sitting without feeling overwhelmed.

The atmosphere is nice, like casual fine dining. I highly recommend giving this place a try, I will certainly be back.

author: Ruthy M
text: I came here for a family gathering. They accommodated all 30 of us. I know it was probably a little hectic, however everyone was very attentive. My server Moe was amazing. The food was served family style since it was a large group. Everything was really good, but my favorite dish was diri blan sos pwa, and the goat. The goat was so tender, the sos pwa had so much flavor. My experience was 10/10 & I do recommend!

author: Minora Barthelemy
text: As someone who loves Haitian food coming from Miami, Florida, my experience at Djon Djon was underwhelming. The service was fine, but the food was disappointing. The diri djon djon (black rice) lacked all kinds of flavor. The sauce and banann was meh. The griot wasn‚Äôt bad, but I would‚Äôve enjoyed it a lot more if the pikliz alongside it had any flavor. I can say the salmon was good. Overall I was disappointed with the lack of authentic Haitian flavors and would not return. Definitely not worth the price. üëéüèΩüëéüèΩ

author: Amarachi
text: I had an amazing time at Djondjon. My friends and I went here for dinner and we were impressed. The food was absolutely delicious. Our waitress, Julissa O, was outstanding. She constantly checked up on us, offered great recommendations, and was overall a vibe. I highly recommend this spot for delicious Haitian food.

author: Raquel Stjuste
text: Traveled from Jersey to try this restaurant and I must say it did not disappoint. Comfy, cozy, and stylish restaurant. The staff and services were excellent. The food and drinks was absolutely delicious 5 stars. I will definitely return and drag some friends ands family to experience this lovely Haitian restaurant.

author: Raymund Gotiangco
text:
My partner Tracy and I got to finally to try this spot in the area and I must say the food was impressive. I got the mixed grill plate and everything was absolutely cooked perfectly. It was flavorful and not dry. The hummus and tahini were amazing. I believe the owner Yadin (I hope, I didnt butcher the spelling) also gave us home made hot sauce and it was great. You can tell he takes great passion in what comes out of that kitchen.

I will say if you expect a quick bite or a grab and go then this is not the place. The food was made to order with great flavors and ingredients. Patience is a virtue with this spot but definitely worth it. Would easily recommend and come back. Glad to know this is in the area.

author: Beth Dacquisto
text: An amazing neighborhood spot that has life-changing hummus that puts all other hummus to shame. Delivery has always been accurate and on time without issues. I love their falafel, but the sides are so fresh as well - it tastes like actual REAL food and you can tell it was made with care and love. You can‚Äôt go wrong here!!

author: Kaddy Feast
text: If you live in this neighborhood I don't need to tell you... a Hidden Gem with spectacular food! Stellar service, so friendly! Top 5 of my best falafel in the WORLD! Must eat!

author: Paul Vassar
text:
Walked in and thought we were at the wrong place.

It‚Äôs a super small shop with an open kitchen.

Food was excellent, everything tasted incredibly fresh and you could tell it was being made right then and there from the salads to the meat.

Mon-Thur they also had a 20% off for dine in.

10/10 would go back for meat platter and salad

author: Tony Leon
text: Everything I've ever tried is great but the falafel sandwich + fries is unbelievable! Possibly the best falafel, ever. Also, definitely get the skhug sauce on the side. It's v hot and v tasty.

author: Rachael Martin
text: came here for my last dinner on my nyc trip and was very impressed. we dined on a monday and the restaurant was still quite busy and had a great ambience. the wine list is extensive and their chilled red is honestly one of the best that i have tried. we ordered arancini, the grape salad, tagliatelle, and radiatori. all were incredible, i especially loved the radiatori. the pasta tasted very fresh and the service was attentive. we also tried the date cake for dessert which was delicious. i wish we had somewhere like this in australia but i will definitely be returning on my next nyc trip.

author: cl√©mentine huertas
text:
Great food! We had the Arugula and radicchio salad, which paired perfectly with the Calabrian pinsa. We also tried the Medaglioni pasta with the butternut squash. We paired the food with the chilled red Trollinger. Yummy!!
For dessert we chose the date cake - I loved the contrast between the sweetness of the cake and the saltiness of the ice cream.
The atmosphere was very cosy with the dim lights - staff was kind and efficient. I would definitely go back!

author: Melissa C
text:
This place is amazing. For starters, my server Madi and the bartender Manu were great company. Manu played great music, made delicious drinks, and was a fun conversationalist. Madi showed me a bunch of great wines from across the world with super detailed flavor profiles, truly a fun wine-tasting experience. From Italy, to Slovenia, I tasted notes of strawberries, chocolate, raspberry and more.

She also made impeccable food suggestions and I was blown away by the focaccia, ravioli and arracinhi. We topped it off with a tiramisu.
Focaccia- crispy on the outside, soft, warm and buttery on the inside. The garlic and chili pepper paste to dip was a nice contrast to the usual olive oil at most spots.
Arracinhi- also very crispy. The star of the show here was the tomato sauce. Sweet and savory. Just straight up some great tomatoes.
Ravioli- Wow. Just WOW. A very happy marriage between lemon and creaminess. You would never guess it‚Äôs vegan. While it only came with 3 pieces, it was pretty filling. It also had these juicy mushrooms and sweet grape tomatoes that really added to the deliciousness.
Tiramisu- Delicious. Not too sweet, surprisingly a bit chocolatey. Great way to end the meal.

I don‚Äôt eat a lot of vegan food but after this meal I‚Äôd like to add some vegan spots to my rotation. Even my boyfriend, who said he didn‚Äôt want to eat vegan food, will most definitely be coming back. I would be more than happy to try the rest of the food, cocktails, and wines at this spot. Soda Club is my newest obsession and go-to elevated date spot. The vibe is homey, romantic, and intimate, while also being funky and innovative with their menu.

author: Lynette Kamimura
text: Delicious vegan Italian in NYC.  Great craft cocktail menu, nice pasta.  My only critique is that the Tagliatelle was a bit bitter, perhaps they got some lemon pith in there, but the Gigli and our starters were very good!

author: Justin McClelland
text:
I received a gift card for Christmas to Soda Club and finally got around to using it at the end of June. I hadn‚Äôt heard of this place, but I‚Äôm so glad I went! Truly, the other reviews are spot on - this place is a diamond in the rough when it comes to treating yourself to a nice vegan meal.

I was celebrating an anniversary on the night of the meal and the entire staff could not have been more kind and attentive. The staff went above and beyond to make the evening feel special, which is a rare find nowadays. The service was just‚Ä¶well, outstanding.

The vegan ricotta appetizer with bread and fresh tomatoes was my favorite of the couple we tried. As for the pasta, for me I really enjoyed the ravioli. The pasta is freshly made and you can definitely tell. I would definitely go back and would recommend anyone wanting a good meal with great service to enjoy their evening at Soda Club!

author: Ameya Bhakay
text:
Made dinner reservations and we got an amazing family style table in this really amazing, rustic looking, happy vibes place! Noise levels were on the higher end and you had to speak loudly to hear the other person across the table!

Jos√© our server was friendly, attentive, and quick with his service. This is a very kid friendly place - so highly recommended for families with kids. At the same time, a great place for date night too.

An extremely well priced menu, with great options is how I'd describe their menu. Our order consisted of Crostini Misti ($10.50), Calamari ($18), Funghi di Prato ($12.50) - an excellent mushroom salad, for appetizers.

Mains included a very tasty (and slightly cheesy) Spinach Gnocchi ($18.50), Penne Arrabiata ($16), and Tagliatelle al Ragu ($18). Kids thoroughly enjoyed their butter pasta which they polished within a few mins!

Overall, we had a great time at this place, and I can clearly see Malatesta become our go-to Italian dinner place on weekdays or weekends. Great service, excellent quality food, and a very well priced menu! Can't ask for more.

author: Adrienne Costello
text: This was our second time visiting Malatesta and it is still exceptional! Food is gourmet and delicious, service is friendly and attentive, and prices are reasonable. Our first time here was in 2021 - we spontaneously chose it for dinner as we were visiting the west village and got hungry while exploring. We had such a memorable experience that we made it a priority to come again in 2025 with our whole family. Same quality and service! We showed up at 5:20 on a Sunday with a party of 5 and got seated right away.  I‚Äôm both gluten intolerant and egg intolerant and found plenty of options in the menu with the guidance of our waiter. Each dish came out hot and everyone loved the culinary experience! (The grilled calamari appetizer is amazing!) Highly recommend Malatesta and can‚Äôt wait to come back again when we visit NYC!

author: Jelica A.
text:
If I could give 10* for this Restaurant, it would be great!
Very cozy and nice ambient, the staf is great, really friendly and helpful, and the food - top of the tops!
Everything what we ate was super delicious!
We had a reservation, so we didn't wait at all.
Overall, this Restaurant is really worth visiting!

author: Dionne Chen
text: Great cozy Italian place. Food is pretty good, not the best in NYC but very fair. The star is definitely coziness. Really like the vibe and it‚Äôs nice to sit outside as well. The portions are a bit small I will say.

author: Susan DeAngelus
text: We had our 2nd visit on Saturday evening and oh my word, molto bene!!! The ragu is worth the effort to get to this lovely space in the West Village. Prices and portions are perfetto! Grazie mille!!!

author: Max Feliu
text:
Meal was very lackluster, especially for the price charged. The salad (with figs and gorgonzola) was very underwhelming in its flavors. The anchovy dish in particular was extremely disappointing: untoasted, cold slices of average bread, with unmelted butter and the anchovy on top is simply not a pleasant mouthfeel and it fails to bring out the flavors of each of the ingredients. The cocktails had a very syrupy mouthfeel and overly sweet flavor that masked any notes of the liquors used. Perhaps we "ordered wrong" but for the price it seems unacceptable that there would be wrong dishes to order.

We had one of each pici and they were good, but not enough to turn the evening around. The space is very nice. The waiter was very friendly.

author: Brian P
text:
After walking through the streets of Brooklyn I wanted some authentic Italian food. This place came heavily recommended and I tell you what it did not disappoint. We got their kind of late however that did not matter at all they stayed open until we finished eating.
The service was out of this world he was incredibly knowledgeable and friendly and definitely helped set the mood for the night.
The menu was expansive but wasn't overwhelming and the food was definitely a delight.  I would definitely visit this place again next time I'm in town..

author: Eric Ambel
text: Locanda is the finest restaurant in Clinton Hill, Brooklyn. Terrific food, fantastic wines and a great staff in a hundred year old building that used to be a pharmacy. House made gelato too.

author: Sarah Myers
text: I got the truffle tagliatelle. While I was greeted with a lot of truffle on my plate, the taste itself was not anything special and I only was willing to spend the $35 because of the truffle. I've had better tagliatelle. The Gelato, however was absolutely amazing! My favorite was the olive oil and bread crumb and the Italian cream. The serve staff was incredibly hospitable prompt, jovial, and so friendly! I would come here again just not for the food. The restaurant is in a really nice part of Brooklyn too.

author: Mikayla Agrella
text: I love this spot. First and foremost, excellent wine list (by the bottle) and cocktails (Negronis and Amari-forward). Service is top-notch, vibe is right, food delish.

author: OmeKa
text: Tbh, Taste Korea is a total win! The food was incredible, especially the kimchi fried rice , and the staff made me feel right at home. Such a cozy spot for a solo meal. Definitely earned its five stars! Would highly recommend.

author: Taehyun Nam
text:
A hidden gem in the Brooklyn neighborhood. The place has dim lighting that creates a warm, comfortable mood.

The food was great. The soondae was fresh and surprisingly good, the jjajangmyun was impressive, and the budae-jjigae was tasty‚Äîall served in generous portions.

The staff were kind and easygoing. They even let us in about ten minutes before opening, which was a nice touch. There‚Äôs also a small, charming bar that adds to the cozy vibe.

It‚Äôs not a fancy spot, but definitely good enough to become a regular go-to.

author: Patrick No
text:
Solid Korean food in Bed Stuy / Clinton Hill. Likely one of the only options here as well.

The Hot Stone Bibimbap was great, especially w/ the added bulgogi. I enjoyed the rice crunch. The Mandu Guk was also good too, a familiar dish for most Koreans. I liked it better than some places in Flushing, where other restaurants add a lot of black pepper. This broth was great on a cold day. The Topokki was standard, they all taste quite similar.

Prices are a bit on the higher side, but the portions are quite large. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend getting a starter, we couldn‚Äôt finish all our food because we were so full. Good food !

author: Rj D
text: Best place with the best server. He truly deserve all the appreciation. We had an amazing party (30s the best) and everything was perfect (he are so honest with recommending food) We loved it. We‚Äôll definitely be back üëãüòä

author: John Chen
text:
Way better than expected.

I'm a NY native and I've tried a lot of Korean food before. I have Cho Dang Gol almost once a month. I've tried Jungsik, Kisa, Tosokchon, Miss Korea, Kunjip, Olle, Her Name is Han etc...

I went to Korea 3 times this year, for a total of 3 months in Seoul, Daegu, Busan, Jeju, Gyeongju, so at this point I feel like I can say you can trust my opinion on Korean cuisine at least a little bit.

And what I think is, honestly, this may be the best Korean food in Brooklyn, and second best in the whole city only beaten by Chodanggol, which is saying a lot.

The food tastes nice and clean, showing that the cooking was done with care and good technique. The flavors actually reminded me of the same dishes from popular local restaurants in Seoul.

I would recommend the
- Hot Stone Bibimbap (Bulgogi)
- Sundubu Stew (Pork)

I also think eating in would be far better than takeout just so your food can be eaten at the ideal temperature and texture.

Definitely should give it a try!

author: James B
text:
Mike‚Äôs is our go-to breakfast whilst we‚Äôre staying near Fort Greene. You absolutely have to go here.

It‚Äôs a truly classic diner with great food Nd a really warm, buzzy atmosphere. To top it all off, the service is exceptional!

They were really helpful with allergens too. No dairy, no problem.

author: T. M
text: Loved this place so much. Super friendly, fast service, tasty food for a good price. Only visiting but came back twice in 2 days!

author: Tchanavia Bryant
text:
Great local diner! The staff was very friendly. I was in NYC for a few days and ate breakfast here twice. The portions were a good size and the food came out piping hot. I‚Äôm from the south so I wasn‚Äôt sure about how the grits would come out. Overall, not bad for NYC. They were a little watery for my taste, but again not bad.

They had counter seating if you are rolling solo. Space is a bit tight, but manageable. I went around 9am and had at most a 10 minute wait the first time and no wait the second time.

I would definitely go back again for breakfast.

author: Elijah Bader
text: Stopped by Mike‚Äôs Cafe on a Sunday morning and really enjoyed it. It‚Äôs a laid-back, classic New York spot with friendly service and a steady stream of regulars. I got two eggs, toast, bacon, and homefries, everything was really good, though the homefries could‚Äôve been a bit crispier. It was super busy, which makes sense for the weekend, and while we had to sit outside, I was glad we found a table. Would definitely go back.

author: arthur king
text: passed by this place a couple times decided to go in,and boy i wasn‚Äôt disappointed,service is great ,nice and comfortable and food is delicious

author: Isabella Ton
text: Vegan options! Loved this place, the staff is so friendly. We got the edamame, fried brussel sprouts, impossible bun and the spicy creamy yasai ramen which the broth and noodles were üî•. Got spicy for the ramen and it was so yummy. Definitely try this spot!

author: Zhiyu Wang
text: We took kids here for dinner after a long day out, and it was such a great experience! The host was incredibly kind and welcoming, which made us feel right at home. The kids especially loved the buns and edamame ‚Äî they couldn‚Äôt stop eating! The ramen was also fantastic ‚Äî rich, flavorful broth and perfectly cooked noodles. Definitely a spot we‚Äôll be coming back to!

author: Aleksei Samoilov
text: I‚Äôve been to Toyo Ramen several times now, and it‚Äôs consistently great. The service is always fast, the staff are friendly, and the food comes out hot and delicious every single time. The broth is rich, the toppings are super flavorful, and the whole place has a cozy, welcoming vibe. Definitely one of my favorite ramen spots in the neighborhood.

author: Maria Romanov
text: Tried this ramen spot for the first time and it was absolutely amazing! The broth was rich and flavorful, the noodles perfectly chewy, and every bite felt like comfort in a bowl. Our waiter was super patient with us while we decided what to order, which made the whole experience even better. Plus, they have this awesome deal ‚Äî write a Google review and get any drink of your choice on the house! Highly recommend!

author: Bernard Wiggins
text:
I‚Äôve just finished eating here today. I was in the neighborhood and had a want for ramen and was surprised I‚Äôve not been to this place as I‚Äôm familiar with some of the other Ramen shops in the area.

I have to say this was a pleasant experience at this particular ramen spot.

I will say the only downside isla that the pork was very few considering that some of the other places are a little more generous with pork for what you‚Äôre paying.

However, the atmosphere for the most part is very inviting and calm which is very different from other places that seem busy and super loud.

I also do appreciate that they do not give me the bums rush and they let me sit and relax after eating their good food and was even attentive to my want of water and refills.

I didn‚Äôt eat their good food brown shredded stuff that was in the ramen as it is my first time trying it and my stomach wasn‚Äôt comfortable with it (Google just showed me that this stuff is called Wood ear mushrooms. Definitely not for me. I‚Äôll ask them to leave it out next time).

I definitely recommend this place if you‚Äôre in town or just wanting a different atmosphere to relax and eat.

UPDATE: I am not a fan of bubble tea. However I tried this Milk Green Tea they shared with me and I have to say it‚Äôs quite delicious! I actually like it more without the bubbles! I know that sounds weird, but I‚Äôm very simplistic when it comes to food and sometimes simple is best! You should definitely try this drink!

author: ReedH
text: ‚Äôm from Texas, so I was curious to see how their chicken fried steak stacked up. And it‚Äôs legit. Crispy, well-seasoned, topped with great cream gravy, and served with a solid side of mashed potatoes‚Äîit‚Äôs a serious meal. I finished with the pecan pie. Not my favorite - the crust didn‚Äôt have much flakiness, but it was still decent. The overall vibe was great though, and the service was really friendly. I‚Äôll be back.

author: David Joseph
text:
For this review, I came here on a nice weather Sunday in late August for brunch. I‚Äôve been here many times before and I absolutely love the place. The atmosphere is so fun. I‚Äôm originally from Texas and even though I‚Äôve been gone from Texas for over a decade, it still gives me a lot of nostalgia vibes.

Most times I‚Äôve come here, I‚Äôve made a reservation but it usually seems like walk-ins are available. I don‚Äôt believe they take reservations online, but you can make one over the phone.

As far as food, the queso and chips are so great and feels like TexMex quality. This is not a TexMex restaurant, to be clear, but it seems like standard Texas restaurant that offers a combination of Tex Mex and southern cuisine. Think of it as quirkier Willie‚Äôs Ice House. I also love the frito pie and the quesadillas. The frozen margaritas are some of the best in the city because they have a margarita machine whereas many places try to make them in a blender.

Sometimes certain servers can be a little cold or aloof, but generally they always get you what you need. I look forward to coming to this restaurant all the time and recommend it frequently, especially for groups.

author: Amanda Reagan
text: We loved it here. The vibe was so great and the decor was quirky and fun. Awesome bartenders and the drinks were delicious!

author: V Morton
text:
The service and Atmosphere was welcoming and Grand. It was Halloween and the decorations were up and exciting. Our waitress was very polite and had great recommendations. I really wish I went with the country fried streak, mashed potatoes and gravy.  It looked good from across the room!!!

Thanks for having us!

author: Allison L.
text: This is such a fun, southwestern-themed restaurant! I loved the style and flair in every direction and the food was fantastic too! There are great soul food options, lots of vegetarian and classics. I loved the catfish which comes either grilled, blackened or fried. Lots of people got the chili and ribs, also great cornbread! Would recommend the prickly pear margarita which you can also get frozen! This is great for a post-work outing or night out, highly recommend!

author: Ankush Thakur
text:
We started with the pretzel with the beer cheese. Personally not much of a fan of it but it wasn't bad.
Rib were pretty good when you had it with the mustard. Without the mustard they were alright.
Hungarian schnitzel - the pork was crispy and tasty. We did not like the pasta thing it came with however.
Warm apply strudel with Ice cream was good.
Service, vibe and cleanliness was ok point.

author: Lee Stat
text: The service was great. Very welcoming. Go for a burger and beer alone or with friends and it won‚Äôt disappoint. Food was good too. The pretzel was good but it was cooked twice because it got really hard too fast.

author: Mo Chai
text: Pretzel was top tier. Would say everything else was just okay. Ginger ale tasted off

author: Carina G
text: I have nothing but good things to say about the food, staff, and owner here at Manner. I have been coming here since I can remember and have always had the best of times. I've had so many meals here, from my communion to graduation parties to even just Friday meals with my family. Nothing but love for the Manor Community! If you are in the area, I totally recommend checking it out. My go-to recommendations are always the wings and bacon for appetizers.

author: K VC
text:
My large group was seated in a separate area, though not very private, and was tight bec not enough space for the number of people reserved for.
Found the meat dry in the schnitzels and pork chop dishes. Didn't really like the pork chop flavor. Apps and sides were just ok.

author: Charoy Thurston
text: This place felt like we were dining in a museum. The atmosphere was beautiful, like a modern-ancient rendition of an Asian art house. We dined over the lobster tacos, the "Out of Control" roll, Sweetheart roll, Smoked salmon sushi (amazing!), the Kani and Tuna hand rolls, and shrimp dumplings.  We will definitely be back!

author: Ann Su√°rez
text:
Second time at MoCa and it's always a pleasure. Our server was very nice and suggested great dishes.
Went with a party of 4 for a birthday and even got free shots.
The food was amazing, we ordered multiple appetizers and 1 entree that was shared which was the crispy duck, definitely good, just wish it was more fulfilling.
Definitely check out the bar appetizers even if you're not at the bar, they are worth it.
I personally love the atmosphere and the semiprivate booths, wonderful for a small party of 4-5 people.
It's definitely a bit expensive, some dishes and drinks are above the average price so keep that in mind, but for special occasions it might be the best Asian fusion option in forest hills.

author: shineden
text: The overall experience at was very pleasant and wonderful. The staff was nice and the food I had was delicious. The sangria duck is the best I ever had. The sake paired nicely with my meal. I had a lovely time and it's worth going back.

author: Craig Pelletier
text: Took my mother here for her first experience. She was positively raving about the shrimp dumplings. My wife and I have always enjoyed dining here. It's upscale. You should dress accordingly (optional, of course, but in my opinion, helps set the mood for you).  Well worth the trip down Austin st. (Or one of their other locations)

author: Bald-kugo
text: Very wonderful experience! Ordering was very easy and there were so many great options to choose from. We had a pescatarian dining with us at the time and our server helped pick out good tasting fish options and even substituted other things in the bento boxes for them. Speaking of the bento boxes, the presentation of the 4 ordered were so well done, and it was pleasing to both the eyes and the stomach. So delicious! Even the miso soup was great. We ordered something for takeout as well and it came nicely packed and very quick. The place itself is very comfortable to be in with a little chill now and then from the door but lights and even the cupboards looks very stylish. Everything was so clean and put together, and even the way they handled the plates made me feel safer about eating raw fish since it seemed so tidy. The only issue I had was that the ginger ale seemed to be watered down which was a bit strange, but it might have just been the ice

author: Yolanda M
text: I have passed this place a few times and actually planned for this visit with a group from work for lunch. The waiter was excellent. He was patient when taking orders for a table of 7 with three checks. We ordered from the $20 lunch menu which was a pretty good value with a starter and meal. Portion was good for lunch. I actually had enough to take for later. The only thing none of us liked was the steak on the menu was an additional $10 which we felt shouldn't be an option if not in the $20 price point for the options. I had the chicken pasta with pesto sauce which was tasty. We sat outside and the water assisted us with the table placement so we could all sit together. The chairs weren't all that comfortable but it was nice being outside. I would return if in the area again.

author: Barbara Milano
text: The food was excellent.  Very fresh. The veggie frittata had a unique variety of fresh vegetables and was cooked to perfection. The waiter was very attentive and we never had to wait for anything. We were so lucky because it was a perfect day so we got to enjoy our meal outside.  It was truly delightful dining experience!‚ù§Ô∏è

author: alexandra levdar
text:
I placed an order today and unfortunately received completely wrong items. I ordered pesto pasta with shrimp, burrata, Greek salad, and steak tips, but got pasta with beef and other dish I never requested.
When I called the restaurant to let them know, the person who said he was the manager insisted with strong attitude everything was correct, refused to look at a photo, hung up on me multiple times, and wouldn‚Äôt give his name.
The lack of professionalism and customer service was very disappointing. For the sake of your nerves, I wouldn‚Äôt recommend ordering from here.

author: Michael Grieco
text: Came here for dinner with a friend on their recommendation.   All food we ordered was good, I personally thought the burrata appetizer was delicious.   The crab cake was tasty, and it is mostly crab (which was excellent), but I felt for the price of $24 it was a bit small for that price.  Both my friend and I ordered steaks, her's was a touch over cooked as she wanted rare, mine was well cooked as I asked for medium-rare.  I really enjoyed the overall ambiance of the restaurant.  We opted for the outdoor seating as it was a gorgeous, cool summer evening.  I'd recommend this as a solid place to take a date as the establishment was great for having conversation, wasn't too loud at all.

author: Blake Tyler
text: The service was really good and atmosphere is great. Place is beautiful and plenty of space. We had the tuna tartar and calamari. Both were great especially the calamari with the spicy kick. For dinner my wife had the half chicken that she says was really good. I had the ribeye, I did not like the steak. Meats was meh and char wasn't good. More medium than medium rare and extra fatty.

author: Stephanie Jenson
text:
I hadn‚Äôt been in New York in 10 plus years but this neighborhood restaurant on election night made me feel like a real New Yorker. This is clearly a local favorite from the conversations we had with our neighboring tables but this was all destination dining for me and my best friend, Linette.

Linette and I celebrated 35 plus years of friendship and are both originally from D.C.
I live in New Zealand now and booked a hotel in Brooklyn specifically near Gertrude‚Äôs as I follow the chef Eli Sussman @gertrudesnyc - Partner/Exec Chef @talkininthewalkin on social media and was keen to try Gertrude‚Äôs with high expectations.

This election night  was magical  with the city feeling upbeat and positively giddy. I had told Gertrude‚Äôs it was our Frienniversery of 35 years and Allie the bartender greeted us with vodka beet juice shots that got the party started! Great introduction to Gertrude‚Äôs! Scott was our server with Lisa the floor manager stepping in at times to serve or check on us. Jacob and Reni were other servers that night on the floor.

The service was impeccable. Professional, of the highest standards, while warm and intimate. It‚Äôs an absolute pleasure when the service matches the excellence of the meal.

Gertrude‚Äôs was  outstanding Jewish Soul food, elevated comfort food to gladden the heart. We started with Challah Park rolls,Latkes with Cr√®me Fra√Æche & Trout Roe and Beef Tongue Tartine. We were treated to Whitefiish & chips and housemade Spaetzle,  complimented from Gertrude‚Äôs. Everything was presented well: correct temperature, lovely plating. and delicious flavors. Ingredients balanced and complemented each other.

Linette & I both had the 10oz Bavette Steak with sherry bordelaise, pickled shallot medium rare ( the best way!). The meat was beautifully marbled and perfect cooked. There was a choice of fries or salad greens. We chose fries.
Wonderful curated wine list to match and excellent recommendations from Lisa!

To finish, we had the Black & White ‚ÄòSeven Layer Cake‚Äô. My mom use to make us a chocolate layered cake with Sarah Lee pound cake (when guests over!) and it reminded me of being around the kitchen table with family and friends.
A truly memorable dining out experience and evening that puts us in a New York State of Mind! A must experience in Brooklyn, New York.

author: Mariya Proyss
text: Gertrude‚Äôs is the kind of place that quietly wins you over from the moment you walk in, it‚Äôs cozy, elegant, and effortlessly welcoming. The space has that signature Brooklyn charm: lively but relaxed, with a sense of care in every detail. The menu strikes a beautiful balance between comfort and sophistication, fresh, seasonal dishes that feel both homey and refined. Service is warm without being overbearing, making the visit feel personal. Gertrude‚Äôs is where you go when you want a meal that feels special, but never pretentious, a true neighborhood gem. Travelled all the way from LES!

author: Adam
text: Came here Friday night with a bunch of friends and it was really great. We got oysters and a whole platter of different smoked fish and all sorts of stuff and it was just really an amazing way to spend happy hour right before dinner. The food was great. The service was great. The drinks were awesome and I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for some great drinks and great bites in Brooklyn.

author: Dilan A
text: We had one of the best dinners ever at this restaurant, thanks to the exceptional bartenders Allie and Karla. Their recommendations for both food and drinks were spot-on. I can‚Äôt wait to return and explore more of their drinks and food! (The layer cake was INSANE)

author: Ryan Tammaro
text: Great spot in Prospect Heights with a cozy atmosphere! The burger was juicy, and the latkes were crisp. I also enjoyed the Black & White Seven layer cake which was rich without being too heavy.

author: Ari Grabova
text: We had an amazing dining experience at Ortomare Ristorante Pizzeria. When me made the reservation over the phone, the service was exceptional, with friendly and attentive staff making us feel welcome. The atmosphere was warm and inviting, creating the perfect setting for a relaxed evening. As for the food, it was absolutely delicious. Each dish was beautifully prepared and full of flavor. Overall, it was a fantastic experience, and we will definitely be returning!

author: Jairo Melara
text:
Food was great. Got the tortelloni, rigatoni, and the baked eggplant. Delicious.
The vibe was romantic, dim, and action packed if you sit next to the pizza maker.
The service was lackluster. The server seemed like he didn‚Äôt want to seat us because we were dressed too casual. We waited 20 minutes for menus and then just pulled it up from Google photos. Once he noticed we were looking at the menu online, he rushed over with paper menus and rushed us to order. The server had also just smoked a terrible cigarette so you imagine the smell.

author: Jay A.
text: Visiting from Texas and WOW, what a find. I was craving a ribeye and this was the best I have ever had. Octopus was grilled to perfection, calamari and marinara was spot on. Atmosphere was cozy and romantic. Staff was very polite. We even got a limoncello on the house. New go to when we come back to NYC. Best news, they are expanding to Austin. Highly recommend and regret we didn't take pictures.

author: A.L. Harris
text: Still my favorite family owned Italian restaurant.  Good is excellent here.  Wood fire pizza and delicious classic Italian dishes.  Meatballs are just like nonna makes.  Great attentive service. Gets crowded so make sure you have a reservation.  It‚Äôs worth the trip uptown for some great food.

author: Rhona Kummerer
text: The staff are super nice and I felt really welcomed, the price for food is a little expensive, but it was yum!

author: Kahshanna Evans
text: We thoroughly enjoyed delicious catering from Miss Mamie's Spoonbread Too for a the launch of a new perfume. Little did we know we were in for such a surprise to actually meet the iconic former fashion model Norma Jean Darden, known for her role in "The Battle of Versailles" battle between French and American fashion designers, and subsequent documentary and book prior to founding her restaurant, Miss Mamie‚Äôs Spoonbread Too, which catered our event. What really helped our team was the helpful thoughtful discussion we had prior to the event, to be sure our selection would delight guests. The catfish bites, jerk wingettes, deviled eggs, fruit kebobs, and brownies were perfect and delivered with care.

author: Mikael Mihranian
text: This place just tastes like a home away from home. Mamas love in every bite. I suggest the sampler for a unique flavor profile of all flavors you can get. Audible sounds of flavor from my friends as we ate. A special place with romantic New York charm

author: Edward Kroll
text:
I truly enjoyed the experience I had at Spoonbread! The ice tea was delicious (per the menu!). I was in love with the cornbread hash and candid yams, a surprise treat and flavor that was new and exciting. I had the platter to sample a few sides and the shrimp, ribs and chicken (üôåüôå - pictured below).

The waiter was helpful and appreciate their willingness to let us stay a little late to get a few sides and dessert to go!  Also, I thought it was very cute that the staff sang happy birthday to some other guests that were having dinner next to our table.

author: Judith Vasquez
text: I discovered a gem here and will become a frequent customer. The workers all displayed friendly attitudes. The meal options, affordable costs and excellent service create a positive experience. The food had just-made quality and excellent flavor. People speak truth about Miss Mamie's Spoonbread Too - it's genuinely excellent.

author: Amanda *****
text:
The experience was super good, and the food was super taste.  The owner was so sweet to greet our table and check in on us.  Thank you for such an awesome experience.

Miss Mamie's Spoonbread Sampler with three veggies (spinach, cabbage, and potatoe salad).  Fish sandwich with French fries.  Peach cobbler with vanilla ice cream.

author: Natalie Veronica
text: If you‚Äôre from Indonesia, this place will feel pretty ordinary, nothing special. Honestly, it‚Äôs not worth joining the day tour; it‚Äôs a waste of time and money. We booked it through Klook. The vibe feels just like back home in Indonesia, and there‚Äôs really nothing much to see, just a small river. The kayak trip only takes about 15 minutes before you turn back.

author: Sreejesh Nataraj
text: Journeying through the narrow Mekong waterways provides a unique and genuine window into a rich riverine culture moulded  by natural elements, time-honored customs, and close-knit community ties.

author: Su Su
text: Mekong River at Luang Prabang. Stunning at sunset. There is a lot of rubbish on the riverbank though unfortunately

author: Shatz13 S
text: knock it out of the park#  the best expericed in 2 days and. 1. Night# gaining insight into the daily lives of the people along the river# simple life. #must. Try

author: Siddhartha Agrawal
text: Mekong Delta tour was one of the most captivating tour of my Vietnam trip. The boat trip was awesome. We also went to a village where we tried local honey and tea. It was very tasty and we end up buying Honey. Local food was also good and there was live Vietnamese music too. We also saw the coconut candy making process. The tour ended with an awesome boat ride in the delta along the mangrove trees.

author: Caleb Ju
text: This might be one of my favorite Chinese restaurants. Reservations at 6:30 on a Sunday, although plenty of seating thanks to massive space. Food was great. Our selection was on the spicier end (mung bean noodle with chili sauce, dry pot), but the chefs did an excellent job balancing spice with texture with other flavors. Service was one of the best (cleaned out oily plates, asked when we want our food to come out). And ambience is also elegant. Will come again!

author: Julie Wiggers
text:
This was recommended by a security guard outside the Metropolitan Museum of Art who said it‚Äôs the best in the city.

We ordered spicy garlic sauce chicken and braised beef noodle soup. This was faster than fast food!! It was hot and delicious with tender-crisp veggies, perfect noodles and meats.

Great value, attentive wait staff, excellent food.

author: liat amano
text:
The atmosphere was nice, we walked in and immediately got a table, the service was very quick and nice.
We got iced tap water and a tea pot for the table which was very nice and all of the dishes came very quickly
Me and my roommate got the dumplings in chili oil, the Dan Dan noodles and for entrees the garlic sauce style with pressed tofu
The only complaint is that the Dan Dan noodles weren‚Äôt as spicy as we expected (actually the entree was more spicy and it was supposed to be the opposite)
We also got two cocktails that were very tasty
The total was 81$ without a tip and with a lot of leftovers to take home
Overall a great experience!

author: Bleesy Dy
text: We love this spot! Ain‚Äôt go wrong with Chinese food! We went on a weekday so it was not that crowded but we had early dinner, and the restaurant wasn‚Äôt that crowded but as soon 6pm hits, the place got packed. We had reservation. But no need if you are planning to visit not on a rush hour. I love how generous the servings were! Cumin Fries is a must try, not the usual fries you would usually have. We ordered fried dumplings too. General Tso‚Äôs chicken was good too! And eggplant stir fried would always be the best. When the place started to get packed, the servers were not enough to cover all tables. Good ambiance too.

author: A.L. Harris
text: I always love the food here.  Take-out is always good and when you eat in it‚Äôs such nice experience.  Service is always good, whether you come for the lunch special  Monday - Friday from 11-3, or Happy Hour at the bar from 4-7, or sit down in the beautiful main dining room. Won ton soup is excellent and the Garlic style chicken has such an amazing flavor.  What ever you order you can‚Äôt go wrong.

author: Ana Turkienicz
text: We came to celebrate my birthday. From the moment we came in, we were greeted with a gracious smile and happy birthday wishes. Our table was waiting for us, and we started with great cocktails, the eggplant and Haloumi salad , which were both delicious. Our party of four shared the lamb kebab and the shish kabab, also to die for. We were surprised to learn that the restaurant didn‚Äôt charge us for our dessert, the vanilla- kadaif (also delicious)- as a treat for my birthday- which was of course truly appreciated. This is our second time celebrating at Miriam UWS and we will certainly come back soon!

author: Tiaranad Gerjarusak
text: I went in without the reservation on Saturday lunch. They managed to sit me at the counter bar. The brunch menu looks really good unfortunately I already had breakfast. So my husband ordered Chicken schnitzel which came with mash potatoes, beets sauce, chop cucumbers, onion, avocado and tomatoes. The chicken was don perfectly, crispy and moist. I had Kofta Kebab which is meatballs with humus, vegetable, and pita bread. There are still a lot of things on menu that I want to try. The service at the bar was pretty good, the bartender was very pleasant. The ambiance is airy with interesting art pieces displayed.

author: Zhenya Globazh
text:
Extremely Disappointed ‚Äì Served Raw Chicken and No Real Apology!

We‚Äôve been to this restaurant several times before and always enjoyed it ‚Äî great food, atmosphere, and friendly staff. Unfortunately, our last visit completely changed our impression.

I was served raw chicken, which is not just unappetizing but a serious health risk. Our waiter agreed it was unacceptable and offered to replace the dish, which we appreciated. However, when the bill arrived, the replacement meal was still charged, and nobody apologized or made any gesture to acknowledge how serious the situation was.

Serving undercooked chicken is a major food safety issue, and the complete lack of accountability was shocking. I genuinely hope the management takes this seriously ‚Äî this kind of incident simply shouldn‚Äôt happen in any restaurant.

author: Donovan Moffre
text:
Without a doubt the greatest brunch I‚Äôve ever had. Menu items were simple but incredibly flavorful, the sauces that were served alongside them were the stars of the show.

We LOVED the pickles, too!

We will absolutely be returning.

author: Jacqueline Kloos
text:
ADDENDUM: The general manager at Miriam reached out in response to our feedback, apologized, and offered to replace the ruined clothing. We are truly grateful for her customer service! Will be increasing our rating from 1 to 3 stars to average our initial experience and the steps taken to rectify it.

Original review below:

We dined at Miriam this evening. The food was good, the patio atmosphere was pleasant. Unfortunately at the end of the meal, the staff member cleaning the dishes off the table accidentally toppled the dishes onto my partner, spilling on his shirt and pants. Both are ruined. Initially, we were told his meal would be comped. I expressed some dissatisfaction with this (his shirt and pants cost more than a burger) and they then agreed to comp the whole bill (there were three of us dining). This was a step in the right direction, but it took about 15 minutes for this to be offered after the incident. No manager ever came to speak with us/apologize. I think the proper way for the restaurant to handle the situation would have been for the manager to come out immediately and ask (and then cover) the price of the outfit. While I appreciate the offer to cover the table‚Äôs bill, the outfit still costs much more than our total, and it was naturally a major inconvenience. While I don‚Äôt blame the staff member for the accident - things happen! - I do think the restaurant should have handled the aftermath better.

author: Ari Perkins
text: Was surprised how good the food is here. Had the whole dorade and just as good as anywhere in Greece. The trio of dips and hamachi was excellent as well. Service and atmosphere matched. Will repeat

author: Christopher Yandell
text: Very elegant vibes at this place. We got three spreads, the almond-garlic was my favorite, and the pepper-feta was good as well. The moussaka was delicious ‚Äî very rich and the portions were generous.

author: Andrew Hazelrigg
text: This restaurant is so delicious. The feta red chili pepper spread was our favorite. Also the lamb chops were great along with the cucumber chips. The only dessert we liked was the chocolate mouse thing. The cheesecake is too light. The baklava was too dry.

author: Ameya Bhakay
text:
Absolute fab experience. Reservations recommended on weekends, plenty of seating outdoors and indoors with a spacious basement perfect for family seating.

Vegetarians also have plenty of options which was surprising!

What to order: Tasting of 5 Spreads ($32) - Skordalia stands out, Grilled Halloumi ($18), Gigantes ($16), Asparagus ($12) - all cooked to perfection!

Non Vegetarians won't go wrong with Lamb Chops ($55) or Grilled Shrimp ($25).

Service was absolutely fantastic but our server Arthur was friendly and attentive. Very welcoming and friendly staff.

We will be visiting again with friends and family!

author: Carlos Hernandez De Pena
text: Thank you guys! You made our wedding the happiest day of our lives. Everything was flawless. Andrew was integral in creating this special day, and the staff were so efficient at helping everyone with all of their needs. The food was perfect, the celebration was perfect, everything went perfect.

author: H J
text: I went there on a Friday night and was able to snag a last-minute reservation for early dinner. As always, their pizza didn‚Äôt disappoint. The classic Margherita is my favorite. I also tried the octopus salad, which was good, but I‚Äôm not sure it‚Äôs worth the price.

author: Rus
text:
I‚Äôve been a loyal customer of Motorino Pizza in the East Village for years. I used to love their clam pizza and always brought friends here. But after my recent experience, I won‚Äôt be coming back.

While eating the clam pizza, I bit into several hard, sharp pieces of clam shell baked right into the slice. It was painful and dangerous ‚Äî I nearly cracked a tooth. For a place that prides itself on quality, this was completely unacceptable.

What made it worse was how the situation was handled. I called a few days later to report the issue, hoping they‚Äôd show some concern or offer to make things right. Instead, I was met with complete indifference. No apology, no offer to help, nothing.

It‚Äôs really disappointing to be treated this way after years of being a loyal customer. I can‚Äôt recommend this place anymore ‚Äî and I definitely won‚Äôt be returning.

author: Kate Lee
text:
The best pizza in NYC, I guarantee it. I've tried more than 15 pizza places in Manhattan and Brooklyn.

I ordered an extra spicy soppressata pizza with grilled peppers on top, and it was mind-blowing. The dough was very chewy and puffy. My husband ordered a sausage pizza with mushroom toppings, and both were really good.

author: Nathalie Ramirez Rodriguez
text: Food was delicious! Service spectacular! Our waiter Axel was super kind and helpful. Definitely recommend this place!

author: Mark LoGiurato
text: It's disappointing when the salads are better than the pizza!  The pizza was served room temperature - almost cool. The crust could also use more salt and olive oil to enhance the flavor.  However, the ingredients are very good and the wood-fired oven makes up for what they lack elsewhere.

author: Harry Ballas
text:
Absolutely loved this place, from the second we walked in amazing service and the vibes from the energy from the place was excellent. I wish I remember our waitress name but she was fantastic! The focaccia was amazing! My octopus was 10/10 and my daughter pasta was full of flavors I was lucky enough to finish it. Plus let‚Äôs not forget the salad with artichokes in it , that itself was 6 stars !
They have other places and you have to try it

author: Emily Chao
text:
The food was so fresh and light. There was a touch of lemon zest in many dishes that gave it an extra layer and made it very summery. Was slightly disappointed that the grilled octopus appetizer was mostly salad with only some octopus bits on it‚Äî we expected the more octopus but it was still good.

The chocolate torta was the best I‚Äôve had at Italian restaurants in nyc so far‚Äî the light whipped cream and tangy lemon zest brought out the creaminess and thickness of the chocolate even more.

author: Emily McNally
text: Although I have been to Rosemarys many times before (all locations - even Miami!) this review is to highlight a private event we held with them. From the moment we reached out to gather information, to the actual event itself, everyone was beyond helpful, organized, and easy to work with. We planned a welcome dinner for our wedding in the Gallery space and it was absolutely perfect and beautiful. The room was set up so nicely, the staff were attentive and helpful, and the food was phenomenal. Our guests were so happy with the evening and the dinner. They even accommodated very specific dietary restrictions with no issue. I would highly recommend using Rosemary‚Äôs for an event and hope that we can have another event there in the future!

author: JAY BLESSED
text: Had a beautiful lunch here. The atmosphere was fun and light, yet I left focused and full‚Ä¶of delicious food. T‚Äôwas a sensory delight that surpassed gustatory and olfactory amazement. Rosemary‚Äôs Midtown is all consuming; in a let-me-invite-you-to-my-family-home-and-prepare-the-pull-out-sofa-for-your-post-meal-rest. Kudos to the amazing service and kitchen teams for delivering exceptional service. Thank you Ashley.

author: Peter Mathys
text: We really liked this place! It was near our hotel, and it was easy to make a reservation. The atmosphere was pleasant, albeit a bit dark (which we didn‚Äôt mind). The service was great and fairly fast, despite it being busy. The appetizer we had - Ricotta e Tartufo Nero - was a very pleasant combination of bread, whipped ricotta, honey, and truffle. The pastas we had, Rigatoni and Pappardelle Verde, were delicious and fresh. We are glad we tried this place out!

author: Lorelein Gonzalez-Joseph
text:
We first discovered this catering at my father-in-law‚Äôs birthday, and I instantly fell in love with the food. When it came time to plan our wedding, choosing them was one of the easiest and best decisions we made.

Their online menu made everything simple to choose from, the prices were exceptional, and the service was so thoughtful every step of the way. What made it even more special is that we were able to honor my husband ‚Äôs Greek heritage through the menu, and then we paired it with Venezuelan desserts‚Äîit was the perfect blend of our families and cultures.

The food was absolutely delicious and our guests are still talking about how much they enjoyed it.

We are so grateful for their role in making our celebration unforgettable and would recommend them wholeheartedly!

author: Lauren Sachs
text: King David's catered my wedding and they did a fantastic job! My guests all said this was some of the better wedding food they've had, and we loved it! They have something for everyone,  gluten free, vegan, dairy free, etc. They accommodated a wide range of allergies and dietary restrictions and everyone had plenty of delicious options! They are so easy to work with,  very organized and knowledgeable, and they are a family owned business which is another plus! Definitely recommend.

author: Diana Sponsler
text: I always love their food, the grape leaves are a special treat! They accommodate special requests when possible, and the Baklava with Turkish Coffee highlights any moment and can brighten my mood from any despair I‚Äôve had thus far. Merely thinking about it makes me anticipate my next visit eagerly!

author: N N
text: I've been enjoying King David's Mediterranean food since the mid-70's. The original restaurant on Marshall Street was established by the father of the current owners who worked for their dad as young men. When the father retired, the business was divided, with one son opening a new restaurant in Fayetteville and the other taking over the Marshall Street location, but moving to a smaller upstairs space. Having eaten at both restaurants, it is my opinion that the larger Fayetteville restaurant serves the best food. The chicken pesto pizza is an excellent starter for 2-4 to share. The platform is a 12" piece of crispy pita bread topped with delicious cheese, chicken, black olives, tomatoes, and pesto sauce. For your main course, try the babagnouge ala carte platter which includes salad, pita bread, and a falafel patty, or order the chicken shish kabob over rice which comes with salad, falafel, pita bread, and hummus. Other items on the menu that we love include the beef chawarma sandwich, the Greek salad with chicken, and when it's available, the mushroom soup. For something different, try the apricot nectar as a beverage. I think it pairs well with the food, particularly if you make liberal use of the hot sauce. At the far end of the dining room, there's a door leading to a skylight-lit patio that's pleasant in the summer. For lunch, you place your order at the register as you enter and it's delivered to your table. At dinner, you are seated and the waitstaff takes your order and brings your food. Service is excellent and the environment is relaxed and comfortable. UPDATE-1: It seems that the pita bread may be thinner than it once was. The beef shawarma sandwich falls apart pretty easily. Delicious with added Frank's Red Hot, but a little messy. UPDATE-2: I was up for a light lunch and chose a Greek salad without chicken. It served the purpose perfectly and tasted great. UPDATE-3: Even though the fattoush salad is no longer on the menu, the staff kindly prepared it for me. It was very good, but I do prefer the Greek salad.

author: Shew nay Way
text: I went there today with my boyfriend, I ordered the chicken platter combo and was VERY disappointed‚Ä¶ I was serve a plate of white uncle Ben‚Äôs rice with what seems like boiled chicken! There was no garlic sauce and the lady taking our ordered even offered salt and pepper because she too knew how bland and flavorless it was! I couldn‚Äôt even finish my meal! Left there STILL starving!!! NOT REAL MEDITERRANEAN FOOD

author: Joe Martin (EvilSkull093)
text:
A.W Wander
145 E Seneca St
Manlius, NY  13104

Good music, amazing staff, great to bring the kids to have fun family time together. Great food choices to choose from. I recommend the supreme pizza. If you don‚Äôt like all those toppings, I would also suggest the pepperoni. The pizza had an excellent tasty sauce, all the the toppings were spot on, and wood burning taste of the smoke just gave it the extra flavor like it should have. For their drinks they have different kinds of soda and alcoholic beverages. Also during spring and summer you can enjoy your food outside.

author: LDLTV Live
text: Spectacular place. Born and raised in FM Schools K-12 and now a 35 year Florida resident,  I came to town with my client for a Movie Event next door at the Manlius Cinema.  I'm wondering why someone in Manlius didn't dream up a place like this 42 years ago when I was in high school. The Pizza is insane. As good as any place, anywhere I've been including NYC and Italy. I had some special pizza that had like everything I love..cabbage roasted pork and some kinda cooky, delicious hipster sauce drizzled over it and the first bite was heavenly as was the last. Wood fired, crunchy and savory all at the same time. The staff is and was fantastic the two nights I was there. They are on top of everything and polite (a lost art form). Everyone is  happy to be working there and super helpful with picking out the beverage and pizza of your choice.  The atmoshphere is just as cool as the name of the business. It's a bustling and super hip joint thats both modern age and old school for us old people with authentic decor true to the year it was built (which I love). It checks every box for a 10 outta 10 establishment. The owners hosted a movie showing  last weekend and took care of the movie guests really well so that was just amazing too. Great work Dan and Joe you hit a grand slam. Can't wait to get back there to M town.. Cudos to the Mayor too!

author: Mark Myers
text: Great food. My favorite is the BBQ chicken bacon ranch pizza. Great flavor. Amazing atmosphere and great craft beer and wine.

author: Bill Meidenbauer
text: My girlfriend had been here before but I hadn't . Food was outstanding. Staff was absolutely awesome. The one manager noticed I was in a sling and didn't everything he could to make my visit much more comfortable and accommodating . Although that wasn't necessary it was greatly appreciated. People don't care how much you know till they know how much you care . And these people care. Was overall an outstanding experience and we will be back.

author: Teresa Corrigan
text: This is the best pizza place in America! The monthly special is always excellent.  I don't bother looking at the ingredients anymore. I just order it. The beer selection is phenomenal.  The smells are great and their set up is perfect. Works like a well greased wheel.

author: Angelo Garcia
text: I have visited Ithaca several times and every time I am in town I eat here!!! Prices are modest and the food is delicious!!! Service is friendly and courteous!! Facilities are kept clean and orderly! Plenty parking and plenty to choose from!!! Bring your friends, family and colleagues you will love it!!!

author: Amanda Gorges
text: Palento fries were lacking flavor and I was expecting way more from them. The sacchetti pasta and ravioli were good but the lobster ravioli was on the sweeter side wheras the sacchetti was very rich with cheese. Portion sizes for both were on the smaller side.

author: Erin Karpich
text: It's an okay experience. If I wasn't vegan I'm sure it would be better. I did enjoy the Bruschetta. The dish I ordered for my entr√©e was just okay, the gnocchi.

author: Streaming Iraq War Veteran
text: $20 for 4 lobster ravioli. Thats $5 each. In this economy that is just ridiculous. Not to mention the water they force on you is disgusting. Im not happy with the price and the staff was ok but a bit slow. I cant really recommend this place. If you do go I would definitely ask how many your getting of something before ordering

author: Lbyor
text:
Found Ciao on Trip Advisor under ‚Äúbest gluten-free restaurants in Ithaca.‚Äù Lived up to the hype. Love the stylish yet casual environment. It was busy when we arrived but it still took less than 5 minutes to sit. The host gave us a booth with a view of the wood-fired pizza oven, which was greatly appreciated. I‚Äôm glad my girlfriend was in the mood for gluten-free Italian, which is what prompted my search in the first place. We wanted to try something new in the Ithaca area.

Service was excellent from start to finish. Our waitress was great. She was very attentive without coming across as overbearing. She did a great job of staying one step ahead at every opportunity.

The house bread dipped in the garlic-infused, seasoned oil was amazing. It set the right tone for our taste buds. Our entrees arrived before our appetizer. Although we didn‚Äôt mind, management apologized and didn‚Äôt hesitate to deduct the appetizer from the bill. They proceeded to serve the appetizer a few minutes after that. This made quite the impression on us because they did not have to do that. And I love a business that acts in good faith.

The meatball appetizer is highly recommended. I had a pasta dish that was similar to Utica‚Äôs chicken riggies. Every dish we had that involved red sauce tasted amazing.

My only constructive criticism is regarding the pear and gorgonzola pizza. I think this pizza could use more pear slices to help balance the dominant flavor of the gorgonzola. The tastiest bites included the pear. And perhaps this pizza could benefit from a drizzle (the aforementioned garlic oil, pesto, or balsamic would be perfect). I should have asked about adding a drizzle, given that this pizza was a bit on the dry side. It still tasted great and we were super happy with our food.

We wanted to try dessert and we opted for the chocolate mousse. It was the perfect dessert because you don‚Äôt need much room to eat it. And the chocolate mousse had a rich flavor without being too sweet.

Overall, Ciao left a great impression on us. I would highly recommend this place. And next time I‚Äôm in the Ithaca area, I can‚Äôt wait to return to Ciao.

author: Catherine Gray
text: This is one of my go to places. There‚Äôs never a wait. The interior is decorated in a very fun way and I love the outdoor seating in the summer. The outdoor seating is dog friendly too! The food is the best part. It‚Äôs unbelievably good with a beautiful presentation and unbeatable drinks! The staff is always friendly and attentive as well. Can‚Äôt recommend this place enough!

author: Maria Martha
text:
A really cute Mexican restaurant. The staff was very friendly and attentive.
We came for lunch and enjoyed our fajitas.
They have all types of yummy drinks.
My steak fajitas needed a bit more seasoning but my friend enjoyed hers. I wish they would‚Äôve served us some complimentary chips and salsa.

author: Rose Daraz
text: My husband and I randomly stopped by and ended up loving it! We got the shrimp fajitas and fish tacos‚Äîso good. The staff was really friendly and we loved sitting outside.

author: Thomas Murtagh
text: Easily a top 3 margarita that I have ever had. Great service, cheap drinks with a great happy hour deal. Food was amazing as well. Only negative was that chips aren‚Äôt free but that‚Äôs typical for NYC mexican

author: Christina LeMoine
text:
This place has grown on me as I've continued to go back. The wait staff are mostly warm and authentic accommodate requests.

I love that there's vegan options for almost every section of the menu. The food is yummy, especially with the fresh elements, such as, special cilantro, lime, radishes and flavorful salsas.

Haab is a good neighborhood casual dining option for dinner, brunch or lunch (with specials).

author: Anthony
text:
Oiji Mi

Food:
The chili oil lobster ramyum is the move. Rich, savory broth with just enough heat, perfectly chewy noodles, and tender lobster. It‚Äôs the kind of dish you think about the next day and consider going back for. The rest of the menu is beautifully plated and thoughtful. Portions lean upscale (not huge), but the flavor more than makes up for it.

Service:
Friendly, polished, and just attentive enough without hovering. Our server gave great recommendations and didn‚Äôt make us feel rushed, even on a busy night.

Ambiance:
This place is sleek. Dark wood, soft lighting, cool touches everywhere. The bathroom was a standout. It‚Äôs one of those places where you walk in and go, ‚ÄúOh‚Ä¶ this is nice.‚Äù Great for a date night or a special occasion dinner that‚Äôs not stuffy.

Overall:
Oiji Mi nails that upscale-but-still-fun balance. Come hungry, get the lobster ramyum, and maybe take a bathroom selfie while you‚Äôre at it. Definitely worth a visit.

author: KEVIN
text:
Our dining experience at Oiji Mi was a study in contrasts, showcasing moments of genuine quality alongside significant operational flaws. Considering the substantial bill of $1,119.26 for four people (excluding service) in a casual setting, the disparity between expectations and reality was notable.

Cuisine Identity and Execution:
While positioned as 'Korean fusion,' many courses across the menu felt confused in their identity. The utilization of certain spices and vegetables did not clearly anchor the dishes within a distinct Korean gastronomic framework, leaving the fusion border ambiguous. However, specific dishes excelled:
‚Ä¢ The Main Galbi (Short Rib): Perfectly cooked and served with a beautifully balanced soy-based sauce that offered deep satisfaction.
‚Ä¢ Black Sugar Bingsu: A sophisticated and impeccably executed dessert that served as a fantastic conclusion to the meal.

Beverages:
We selected two bottles of wine, including a Dr. B√ºrklin-Wolf (Pfaltz) white and the Littorai (Anderson Valley) red. The Other Half Brewery Green City DDH Hazy IPA was also ordered and impressed with its rich aromatic profile. The quality of the beverages themselves was not in question.

The Critical Failure: Service and Management:
The service was the most disappointing factor, falling far short of the standard one expects from a Michelin-starred establishment.
‚Ä¢ Staff Engagement: Waiters and front staff displayed a noticeable lack of focus and enthusiasm for guest interaction, exhibiting an indifferent, minimal-effort approach more aligned with a casual eatery.

‚Ä¢ Sommelier's Conduct: The sommelier was overtly promotional, intentionally topping up partially full wine glasses to empty the bottle quickly and pressure an additional purchase. This felt like aggressive salesmanship rather than professional beverage service.

‚Ä¢ Operational Oversight: Staff members were frequently observed engaging in personal conversation, distracting them from attending to dining guests. This highlighted a serious lack of focus and suggests an amateurish approach to floor management.

While flashes of excellent flavor were present, the experience was ultimately overshadowed by the restaurant's ambiguous culinary direction and the indefensibly poor quality of service that did not justify the high price point. Given the wealth of more refined and consistently executed Korean fine dining options in New York City, a return visit is highly unlikely. Oiji Mi urgently needs to address staff training and management oversight to align its hospitality standards with its Michelin accolade.

author: Zoe
text:
My husband surprised me with a birthday dinner at Oiji Mi, and while I knew we were going somewhere special, I didn‚Äôt realize just how special it would turn out to be.

He had reserved a table facing the open kitchen ‚Äî essentially a chef‚Äôs table ‚Äî and it was such an unexpected treat. The setting was beautifully designed: the round table felt intimate and romantic, giving us a perfect view of the chefs at work, adding a layer of magic to the whole evening.

Every dish was a visual delight ‚Äî absolutely stunning plating that I‚Äôve never seen before in Korean cuisine. Each course was refined, flavorful, and full of personality. From seafood to meat to elevated takes on traditional Korean flavors, we were blown away by the creativity and depth of the menu.

The cocktail is exceptional !The staff were warm, super professional, attentive, and so thoughtful, absolutely top service! They even surprised me with a beautifully presented birthday dessert, which made the night feel extra personal.

Chef Brian Kim‚Äôs vision is remarkable ‚Äî elegant, modern, yet deeply rooted in Korean tradition.
