The location is great, the vibe is sophisticated yet cozy, and we just found out there‚Äôs another concept by the chef right inside the same space. We‚Äôre already planning to return and explore more of his brilliant work.

A truly unforgettable evening ‚Äî one of the best dining experiences we‚Äôve ever had in New York!

author: Cecilia Lee
text:
Overall 4.25/5
Food 4/5
Service 5/5
Ambiance 5/5
Value 4/5

We celebrated my hubby's birthday here and the side dishes felt more memorable than the main course! Our fave part of the entire meal was actually the desserts.

For a $150 pre-fixe 5-course meal, it felt like decent value, but when considering both taste and overall value, I still lean towards JUA.

Scallop 4.75/5: Cooked to perfection with beautifully balanced flavors.

Trout 4.25/5: Very refreshing and delicious.

Lobster Ramen 4.5/5: A delightful cold ramen with chili sesame oil, and the lobster was nice and meaty.

Jook 4.5/5: The black cod paired really well with the jook; the flavors were just right.

Dry Aged Duck 3.5/5: This was a bit disappointing, not as tender as I would have liked.

Seabass 4/5: The clams were very meaty, but the sauce was a tad on the saltier side.

Shaved Ice 5/5: The tapioca was a perfect match for the brown sugar shaved ice.

Doughnut 5/5: Loved, loved, loved the mochi doughnut with the ice cream! Couldn't get enough of this!

author: Emma Chang
text: Spent my birthday here! Every dish was delicious. We ordered the Bossam for two, which was the perfect choice, and I was glad I went with the Oiji Bowl, it was so fresh. The staff were very welcoming, and the chocolate birthday cupcake was also tasty. Had a wonderful night here!

author: Bob Cummins
text: Excellent Food! Upscale Bar! Perfectly fitting to be the USC Trojan Alumni hangout on College Football üèà game days! ‚úåüèΩGet the Pork chop! The best that I have ever had! Wait staff wonder & kind.

author: David Peragallo
text:
Perfect solo brunch spot

Had a fantastic solo brunch at Pennsylvania 6. Sat at the bar and enjoyed the bottomless Bloody Marys ‚Äî the mix is house-made, rich, and perfectly spiced. Service was smooth, and drinks kept flowing at just the right pace.

Started with oysters, which were fresh and served with a freshly ground relish ‚Äî a standout.

Also tried the wings ‚Äî not bad, but I‚Äôd skip them next time. The rest of the menu felt more refined.

The vibe is upscale but relaxed, and ideal for solo diners. Big thanks to Mackenna, who was friendly, attentive, and made the experience feel genuinely welcoming.

Definitely coming back.

author: Andrew Murfett
text: Great place to watch NFL and college games. Excellent beer selection, wings were very solid and great game day happy hour specials. Awesome vibe from fans watching. Will be back.

author: John F
text:
First time for me being away for a Bills game. Looked for a Bills Backer Bar and it was perfect. Felt like I was watching playoff football in a WNY bar back at home !  Awesome vibe, great service from attentive bartenders, wings were great.

I‚Äôll definitely return on my next trip to try out their full menu as it looks excellent.

They do get a small line before the game so if you have t. Made reservations be prepared to stand and wait.

author: Becky Silverberg
text: Super Bills backers!! ‚ù§Ô∏èüíôGreat experience. I sat at the bar and Emily  waited on me. I had literally the very best small side salad Caesar salad ever. So rich and flavorful. I‚Äôm picky about salad haha And Pancetta pizza. Great food. Great service. Fun vibe.

author: Bleu Parks
text: Their food is delicious. Their manager is sweaty and rude. There was a misunderstanding regarding my pickup order and instead of listening and understanding, the manager escalated the situation to where I had to physically back up to create space. Once the guy finally understood what was going on, he ran into the kitchen never to be seen again and without an apology. Don‚Äôt eat here for service and the food doesn‚Äôt make it worth it.

author: michael rabiner
text:
I ate here recently with my mother. It‚Äôs a charming restaurant on the corner of 18th street and 2nd Avenue.

The food was delicious. My Lamb Saag was the perfect level of medium spicy that I requested. My mother loved her dish of mild buttered chicken. The Somosa was delicious and the spicy food was cooled by the Mango Lhassi.

Of you‚Äôre in this neighborhood and looking for a delicious and reasonably priced restaurant I‚Äôd recommend eating here.

author: Shahid Iqbal
text:
Dal Makhni is India‚Äôs signature dish ‚Äî but what arrived here was nothing short of a culinary crime scene. A baffling mix of yellow and black lentils with random Rajma thrown in, cooked in a ‚Äúunique‚Äù way that defies human understanding. Let me be clear: by no standards on this planet is this Dal Makhni.

I asked for HOT spice level and got‚Ä¶ dessert?? A bizarrely sweet dal that left me wondering if they confused ‚Äúspicy‚Äù with ‚Äúsugary.‚Äù

The rice? Weapon-grade hard. I nearly broke a tooth trying to crack them ‚Äî clearly designed for people with titanium jaws and cast-iron stomachs. And the naan? Good luck. It was like chewing through a piece of hardened leather; I‚Äôm pretty sure medieval shields were softer.

Honestly, this feels slightly less than a conspiracy against Indian food ‚Äî more like a full-blown attack. What a shocking waste of time, money, and calories.

If they want to keep serving ‚ÄúIndian food,‚Äù someone on their team urgently needs to get on a plane to India and take notes. Completely, utterly disappointed.

author: Sunny Ma (Sunny)
text:
Decent indian restaurant!
I ordered Chicken Takka Massala (?)

I liked it!! But the chicken was quite so dry for me...except for the chicken, the curry was good. I chose medium spiciness for my curry.

Also, I got Mango Lassi,too.
I think Lassi taste is depending on restaurant s. This Mango Lassi was more sweet than sour flavor.

But it was good!!

I got here during lunch special time.
I thought I had to choose either rice or Nan, the bread. But those two will come when you order!

author: Omer Hayun
text: Great Indian restaurant! Usually I don't order the vindaloo because it's too spicy, but here it was just perfectly spicy. The saag paneer was really good and so was the chicken tikka masala. Very recommended!

author: Jeff
text:
Food was not great. The Caprese salad was not salted, so it was difficult to appreciate umami flavor of the tomatoes. The buffalo milk mozzarella had a sour taste, and I suspect it has gone bad, though our server explained it is supposed to have a tang. The basil leaves were added on top as a decorative bunch and not torn, so there was no basil flavor in the salad. Arugula seemed out of place in a Caprese.

The octopus in tomato sauce with capers and olives was flavorful, though it had a fishy smell and may not be the most fresh.

The two pizzas had large black burnt areas  that were bitter.

The fancy-looking olive oil on the table smells like paint thinner.

author: Maria Pia Arevalo Silva
text: My third time here and always had the same great experience! Thank you Adelaide for your service!. This dinner was so especial for me because it was the first time for my dad in this spot (who is visiting me from Peru) and the first time of my best friend from Germany too and everything was fantastic, the service, the atmosphere, the food! Thank you so much guys!! We‚Äôll come back definitely! ü©∑ü©∑ü©∑‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®

author: Francisco Gonzalez Rey
text:
One of the best pizzas we‚Äôve ever had ‚Äî if not the best.
The dough had the perfect thickness, and the cheese was absolutely delicious ‚Äî truly unmatched.

We tried the Margherita and the truffle pizza. The truffle one was next-level ‚Äî simply outstanding.

The service was exceptional. They even offered us complimentary Aperol Spritz, which was a lovely touch.
The whole place has a great vibe ‚Äî it genuinely feels like a little slice of Italy

author: Max NoName
text: I tried Song‚Äô E Napule in Manhattan, an authentic Neapolitan pizzeria. The pizza was tasty, juicy, and beautifully packed with nice presentation. However, I felt the price was a little on the high side. The sauce had a slightly sour note and the dough was a bit plain, so for me it didn‚Äôt reach a perfect 5 out of 5. Overall, I‚Äôd give it a solid 4+, though personally I still prefer SIMO‚Äô Pizza for now.

author: Andi Shahu
text: Fun Italian place in West Village. Main focus is neopolitan pizzas which were delicious (the dough was fantastic). The atmosphere is fun and lively and the staff was very nice. We also had some great meatballs.

author: Joe T
text: The food and staff are excellent here. Came here last minute with my daughter who is in a wheelchair and they got us seated right away. The pizza looked and tasted amazing. In fact, I watched other as their pizza came and every single person of took pictures of their food because of how good it looked. We also had the arancini and it was the best I‚Äôve ever had.

author: Gabriella Braga
text:
Absolutely amazing food, service and atmosphere, which definitely looks like a little Italian restaurant from the inside!

The pizzas are absolutely delicious and the pastas as well. I would strongly recommend the Busiate al pesto and the gnocchi!

Definitely will be coming back next time i come to nyc.

author: Cher A
text: Super delish meals and awesome gluten free pizza. Lots of flavor with everything we had . Loved the regular bread . Gluten free pizza was super good . Great service - didn‚Äôt wait long for our meals to arrive. Loved this place

author: cecilia cordova
text: Norma in Hell‚Äôs Kitchen has a charming, intimate atmosphere ‚Äî the space is a bit tight, but the food more than makes up for it. The dishes are full of rich Italian flavors and feel thoughtfully prepared. The staff is welcoming and attentive, adding to the cozy vibe. A great spot if you're looking for delicious Italian food in a warm, inviting setting at reasonable prices after a Broadway show.

author: Dave Zatorski
text: Sat outside on a beautiful summer NYC day to enjoy a classic Sicilian-Italian lunch. We ordered the Buffalo Ricotta with orange honey, meat stuffed rice ball, and Norma pizza with tomato, mozzarella, basil, eggplant, and ricotta. The Buffalo ricotta tasted sweet and could have been served as a dessert. The pizza dough had a flaky crust and the eggplant melted in your mouth which I really enjoyed. The rice ball was stuffed with meat and tasted savory but not too salty. Great restaurant to try before seeing a Broadway show.

author: Nestor Camarillo
text:
Cabana in Forest Hills is hands down one of the best Latin restaurants in Queens! The food is absolutely delicious ‚Äî everything comes out fresh, full of flavor, and beautifully presented. The fried calamari was crispy and perfectly seasoned, and every dish had that homemade Latin touch that makes you want to come back for more.

Service was excellent, the ambience is perfect, and the music adds a fun and lively vibe without being too loud. You can really feel the welcoming atmosphere from the moment you walk in.

Compliments to the chef for the amazing food and flavors ‚Äî truly a standout dining experience. Highly recommend Cabana to anyone looking for authentic Latin cuisine and great service!

author: Mike Reviewed It!
text:
We got there at 10:20. I was concerned that they closed at 11 and had the waiter sure us we had enough time to not be rushed.
Turns out we had plenty of time and we were welcomed.
We went with the calamari appetizer
The Ropa Vieja and Arroz Con Pollo.
Simply delicious   They give you a choice of dark meat or white meat for the arroz con pollo.  We went with a mix. That‚Äôs the first time I was ever asked what type of meat for this dish. It came oven hot in a cast iron grill. Stayed hot the whole meal.
The tops vieja was very filling and equally as tastey if not even more.

author: Kevin Zeng
text:
Great food.  I was so full. Service is friendly. Atmosphere is well decorated.

I was chatting with the bar tender and he suggested their famous mojito. He‚Äôs not wrong.

We ordered paella and some mor dishes. They are all well cooked and delicious.

Thanks for the wonderful birthday celebration.

author: M G
text:
The yellow rice and red beans alone - so goood. I had the steak and sweet
plantain. Very tasty. The mojito!!! Yum!! Will be back. Thank you to Oscar for the wonderful service.

author: Sean Blair
text: Good Cuban food (hard to find in NYC and especially this part of Queens), GREAT TOP NOTCH service, especially from Marco. Friendly staff all around and a good lively vibe, feels like a mix of an upscale Cuban restaurant and good old friendly neighborhood spot. Sunday lunch kind of place. üôè

author: Tatiana Hoover
text:
We stopped in for lunch before a show at a theatre nearby.  The location is great.  The diner is small and a bit cramped.  If there‚Äôs a line, people are huddled together waiting for an open table.  It‚Äôs a mixture of tourists and locals.
The servers are nice, but hurried.  Food is served fast, our fries could have used more time in the fryer‚Ä¶ however the cheeseburger was delicious!! Perfectly made but needed addition of salt and pepper.  Large menu‚Ä¶ Pricey.

author: Aleen K
text: This is a quick stop spot. I‚Äôm not sure I‚Äôd enjoy coming back, but it seems to have a-lot of foot traffic. The menu is pricier than I expected. The location is great, that‚Äôs a win.

author: Hilary P
text: Fast food like your brother can cook served in the atmosphere of a traditional diner. Pricey, but hey, its New York near the park, what di you exoect!

author: Iun Chen
text:
Quick and easy if you are nearby and need to get in and out, but other than that it‚Äôs expensive for what it is and probably not worth the visit.

I can see a nostalgic factor to the seniors who frequent here but if you‚Äôre looking for a good diner with lots of options and bang for your buck, this one‚Äôs not it. We got two fairly small, standard dishes (egg and ham sandwich + BLT) and it was over $50 incl. tax/tip.

On top of that, this place is very small and even walking in the aisles was hard‚Ä¶ and I‚Äôm a relatively tiny person. The setup isn‚Äôt good for lounging and with the prices high, food quality pretty OK, safe to say we won‚Äôt be coming back.

author: Cee Andsee
text: Decent but $70 for 2 for breakfast. My coffee was half done and realized my mug had lipstick on it, I wasn‚Äôt wearing any, so that‚Äôs cool. The food tasted good if I‚Äôm honest but not $70 good. That B grade was missed by me though. Yikes. Try to stick with A‚Äôs. Had pancakes eggs and bacon x2 and 2 drinks and it was $70.

author: Indy Life with Lexus
text:
This restaurant was so big with 2 levels and busy . They open until 5 AM early morning.
They have  so many side dishes and I love Kimchi & Fish tofu,Staffs were fast services, nice and helpful, decent food, and reasonable prices.
Tofu soup is so good , but need to be careful die to they served with the hot pot it was full of the flavor.
We love LA Galbi combo , Spicy raw crab combo , Spicy stir fired squid were so good and delicious.
For the drink , I was recommended draft makgeolli , good together with Korean food. Confirmed.

I was recommended this place and I would come again by soon.

author: Guy Eichler
text: Nice casual Korean spot in K town. This is a good place for walkins we were two and we got a table in less than 10 min. The food is good. They don‚Äôt really specialize in classic Korean bbq so don‚Äôt expect that. You order the dishes and they come to your table. I really love their spicy tofu soup. Galbi was okay too but I think their bulgogi is better.

author: Julia H
text:
Almost like a standard Korean restaurant. ‚ú®Many side dishes, fast services, decent food, and reasonable prices. Tofu soup is definitely a must and worth the price.

Intestine tofu soup was intense since the soup will be full of the flavor. It came with an egg and rice, you can be full after this meal.

Spicy sauce crab was a raw and cold dish. Super Korean thing which I loved it. But the taste was pretty heavy and spicy.

author: Naveen Kumar
text:
Went out for dinner with friends and had to wait over 40 minutes for a table of six. This place seems better suited for smaller groups (2‚Äì4 people)‚Äîotherwise, expect a long wait.

That said, the food was excellent! They offered a few complimentary snacks, which was a nice touch and gave us a preview of the menu. The standout dish was definitely the Seafood Tofu Soup‚Äîrich, flavorful, and perfectly balanced.

If you‚Äôre not in a rush and enjoy good food, it‚Äôs worth the visit. Just plan ahead if you‚Äôre coming with a bigger group.

author: Emely Romo
text: Food is great for lunch, I usually always come here for lunch with coworkers or by myself. But I honestly was left really disappointed this time and won‚Äôt be coming back. I always get the spicy squid and ask for very little spice. It‚Äôs never been a problem until now. It wasn‚Äôt just the mistake, but the fact they tried to convince me that this was the least spicy possible. This isn‚Äôt even the mild version, this is extra. You can see the clear difference in the two pictures. The less ‚Äúspicy‚Äù one is visibly different. Honestly, they wont treat you very good if you‚Äôre a solo dinner. If you‚Äôre gonna go, go with a group or go somewhere else.

author: Lisa Myers
text: Went here for brunch as I was craving shakshouka but I have to say that I was a little disappointed. Serving was generous but the sauce was minimal and not overly tasty. I also didn‚Äôt like the pita served with it and would have preferred toast. We also had a share plate of dips and falafel. The falafel was very tasty. The service was satisfactory and I liked being able to sit outdoors. I would recommend it, but I‚Äôm not sure I would go again - unless perhaps to try some other dishes , as the food coming out for lunch looked good.

author: Harvey Messing
text: One day I had their baked meatballs ($18.00), which were satisfactory. On a different day I tried their meze combination platter ($26), which I expected a lot better of. They offer a pleasant sidewalk dining area. On a Sunday I ordered their hummus topped with lamb. The menu did not state that the chopped lamb topping was spicy, which it was. I did not enjoy it because of the spicy lamb topping. I followed that with the lamb burger, it was not spicy because it had virtually no flavor, and was dry. Although the hamburger was about an eighth of an inch thick, it was not cooked the way i ordered it, medium.

author: N.C Harri
text:
On a beautiful spring day, I visited Meme Mediterranean with a friend, and we were not disappointed! We were seated at a nice table, and our server was friendly and attentive.

The food was delicious‚Äîour appetizers were seasoned perfectly, and we thoroughly enjoyed them. The main course arrived promptly and was delightful.

I liked the flourless chocolate cake, but I wish the kitchen had put more effort into the presentation.

Overall, we had a fantastic time at this charming little restaurant and will definitely return!

author: Jamaica Aali
text:
Delicious!  The table to our left complimented the chef and the table to our right ordered the same appetizer twice because the first one was so delicious (a beet dish).

We started with an incredible hummus and perfectly fresh falafel. I ordered the salmon with risotto, which I highly recommend. My husband had the scallop risotto and ate every bite. Dessert was a bread pudding with a fresh whipped cream that was heavenly.

We‚Äôll return. The lamb looked amazing as did the spicy margarita.

Recommend opting for an early dinner if you don‚Äôt like a weekend crowd. It was fairly quiet at 5:30 but to the brim an hour later.

author: Joseph NewYork
text: Basically a fast choice and we ended up at this small local Mediterranean spot for dinner. They have a friendly staff, but they're very busy, especially when it's full.   I would like to have given them a higher overall rating but the main plates were uninspired. The food looked fresh and appetizing but was kind of bland. Apparently, the cook likes red pepper flakes, but that is only one spice. The mains were hot temperatures but the sides weren't. The staff were busy and never asked if we wanted drink refills or dessert. A $30 appetizer platter was good but only came with what looked like one cut pita for four to share... Then they charged $2 when we requested one more. They are in a very busy neighborhood full of very good restaurants. Please up your game.

author: Eli Haboosh
text:
I gave 4 stars for food just because of the deserts.
The Meath part was awesome. Great and tasty cuts kept flowing to our tables. We didn‚Äôt have to ask for something and it just came. There are parts we just tried to stop the waiters from keep coming with meat.
It‚Äôs was very tasty and plenty of it.
The salad bar was ok. Seen better but we didn‚Äôt come for the salad bar. It has plenty of option but it just didn‚Äôt talk to us.
We ordered deserts. You can leave without deserts. It was ok but not great.
I would stick with the meat. Unless you just have to finish with something sweet.
Overall it was a good experience. A bit pricey but compared to what you get and compared to NY prices it was reasonable

author: David Lorenzini
text: Employee's totally awesome. It's a must go. all u can eat meat was unbelievable. Food outstanding salad bar was one of the best I seen very fresh.

author: Arthur Merk
text:
As a Brazilian, I was so incredibly happy with the experience we had at Churrascaria Plataforma. My family and I had previously gone to the Fogo de Chao in NYC and we were utterly disappointed in all aspects. For my birthday, we decided to give this a try having heard good things online, and boy were they right!

The food is fantastic. Good quality, comes out fast, well seasoned. The salad bar, the meat, and the deserts! It met the expectations we had of an authentic Churrascaria. The Passion Fruit Mousse and Fried Polenta in particular was to die for.

Maybe even more impressive than the food was the service. Everyone was very warm and attentive, and with a pace in their step. You can tell that they have the Brazilian work ethic of BEING A TEAM, everyone helps each other with everything. You never feel like you need to find "your waiter". Again, it was my birthday, and they made it special with a cheesecake and everything.

A special thank you to Angel, Marcondes, and Portoncello for taking care of us and providing us with warm service.

We finally found a good Churrascaria in NYC! Will be back!!

author: mike dutch
text: Stopped here yesterday after a Mets game. It's a beautiful place. It's Brazilian style meat with a good salad bar. We had all kinds of steak ,pork and lamb then hit the salad bar. I had a bunch of different stuff from the salad bar my favorite being the potato salad. My gf loved the sushi and other fish from the salad bar. We got back to the table and record our appetizers which just keep coming I choose cheese balls and she picked fries. The whole experience was very good. They also brought us out a piece of cake after for our anniversary. We left very happy and very full. Just be ready to pay, it is not cheap  but definitely worth a try üôÇ

author: RyWill
text:
Yes, I got the meat sweats. No, I wasn‚Äôt mad about it.

We went for restaurant week and man, this place is WILD. There‚Äôs a full on buffet in the middle with everything from salad to tortellini  to sushi. I thought that part was crazy until the PARADE OF ALL YOU CAN MEAT STARTED. I‚Äôve never had so much meat in one sitting. It was all quite tasty but included chicken, sausage, steak, steak, lamb, parm crusted pork, garlic steak. And we had sides as well.

My server was an older man who was actually quite hilarious. He took great care of us.

author: Chrissy Monroe
text: I love this place. It is such a classic atmosphere with exceptional service. Every bite was delicious. The caviar was perfection. I love their Bellini‚Äòs and lemon cake. I had the spaghetti with Seabass and cherry tomatoes. It was so good. Everything here is so fresh and you never know who you‚Äôre going to see sitting next to you such a fabulous New York experience. .

author: Ryan Mark
text: Harry Cipriani unfortunately did not meet expectations. The food was decent, but the experience felt far more pretentious than the Beverly Hills location I‚Äôve dined at. The atmosphere had an almost luxury designer store vibe - polished and exclusive, but not at all welcoming. There‚Äôs also virtually no privacy; you‚Äôre seated barely a foot away from other diners, which makes the whole experience feel cramped and uncomfortable. The dishes themselves could‚Äôve used more seasoning, especially for the price. Beware - an automatic 20% gratuity may or may not be added to your bill, even when your party doesn‚Äôt exceed 6 diners indicated on the menu (we only had two and it was added to our bill). Overall, it clearly caters to a very specific crowd, and the visit left me more disappointed than impressed.

author: Margaret Delbridge
text:
Our meal was  outstanding! We were able to be seated around 5:00 PM without a reservation.
Weren‚Äôt we lucky! We dined early before going to see Wicked.   Will definitely return to try the desserts.  Thank you for the excellent service and meal!

author: Anastasija Tasevska
text:
We had the most incredible experience at Cipriani today, thanks in large part to our outstanding server, Ricardo. From the moment we sat down, Ricardo made us feel so welcomed and cared for ‚Äî his warmth, professionalism, and attention to detail were truly top-tier.

My family and I were celebrating a special day, and Ricardo went above and beyond to make it feel memorable. He was attentive without being intrusive, made fantastic menu recommendations, and ensured that everything came out perfectly timed and beautifully presented. His genuine kindness and charm added such a personal touch to our meal ‚Äî we honestly couldn't have asked for better service.

Thank you, Ricardo, for making our day so enjoyable. Cipriani is lucky to have you, and we‚Äôll absolutely be back soon ‚Äî hopefully to be seated in your section again!

author: Emely Lopez
text: THE BEST SERVICE EVER!!! I was walking by Central Park and randomly decided to walk in just to check it off the bucket list. From the beginning the man who opened the door for me was so respectful. The staff were all so friendly, shook my hand and even conversated with me. The manager Miriam and my waiter Fernando were both so lovely. As scary as a bunch of high end restaurants are, Cipriani‚Äôs wasn‚Äôt at all! I will be coming back here ‚ù§Ô∏è I was just a random table for 1 but they made me feel like royalty :)

author: Jodilynn DiPiazza
text:
Went here for Lunch with CoWorkers.. Service was great.. Food was very delicious really surprised me..
My coworkers had the Mexican Street Corn and Loved it.
THE guacamole although very tasty was not the best I've had..
The restaurant is dimly lit and cool vibe, decorated very authentic and cute..
Definitely would go back

author: Divya D Nayak
text:
I went to the midtown Mad Dog for a girls night dinner recently and was kind of disappointed. I remember going to the other location in downtown and having an amazing time, especially the food, drinks and the vibe! This location didn‚Äôt quite measure up.

The spicy guacamole lacked real heat and was more mild. The shrimp tacos were just okayish‚Äîit missed that fresh, vibrant flavor I was hoping for.

We ordered a guava margarita pitcher and it was a letdown as well! Tasted more like a syrupy cocktail mix than a refreshing drink.

What did stand out for me though was the friendly and attentive host. She made the experience more pleasant for us.

While nothing was particularly bad, but nothing really impressed us either. It‚Äôs a good spot for a casual meal, but it doesn‚Äôt deliver the same quality or flavors as the other location.

author: Tristen Gabourel
text: went there last night with my friend we got seated almost immediately on a friday night and it was full inside. everything we ordered came out very quickly as well. Thank you to John he was very kind and he found my friends card and my sunglassesüôèüôèüôèüôè

author: Joel
text: After being here a few times it's time for a review. I underestimated this place. The food is way better than I expected especially since they are continuing to experiment and try new flavors. I was just served the most amazing wings with custom hot sauce. It was incredible. Perfect flavor and spicy level. That being said every time I've been here the food has been good and the service at the bar especially has been exceptional. It's truly an underrated place in midtown for quality service and very tasty food.

author: Carlos Soler
text:
The sign on 5th Ave  caught me to go there.  The best guacamole and margaritas. Effectively it was 100% true.
Loved the freshly  just smashed guacamole, generous portion and crispy chips ü§§ü§§ü§§.
Staff was very kind from manager to servers. 100% recommend. I asked for fajitas and they were so tasty. My wife and I had great experience in this place.

author: Katherine
text:
Fantastic Thai restaurant in midtown east. The interior is so cozy and aesthetic and service was attentive. We had a great meal here and would absolutely come back!

Crying Tiger: Grilled NY strip that was flavorful and tender. Also loved the sauce that it came with. I personally prefer my steak a bit more rare, but the flavors delivered

Keaw Tod: Crispy fried wontons with a delicious chicken and shrimp filling. Super snackable and great to share

Short Rib Massaman: Rich and comforting with tender short rib. Loved the roti to dip into the curry too!

Larb Salmon: From the winter seasonal menu. Fresh, citrusy, and tangy in the best way. Definitely balanced out the other dishes

Mango Parfait: I didn‚Äôt know what to expect but loved this. Think mango sticky rice meets ice cream parfait

Drinks:
My Summer (mango mocktail): Super refreshing!
Melon Lar (melon mocktail): More syrupy than I expected, but still tasty if you like sweeter drinks

author: Pauline Cheng
text:
If you are down for a good time, good vibe and especially great food? Say less, come over to Yezo Thai!
Drinks- fantastic!
Food- fabulous!
And for my first drunken noodle, it was delicious!!!!
I would look nowhere else!

And look for May because She will be the LIFE OF THE PARTY!!!!!

author: –ö–∞—Ç—è –ë–µ–ª–æ–≤–∞
text:
Just had an amazing experience at Yezo Thai Isankaya! ‚ú® The cozy vibe and welcoming atmosphere immediately made me feel at home. The flavors are authentic and full of character ‚Äî every bite was delicious üòçüç¥.

If you‚Äôre looking for real Thai food in New York, this place is a must-visit! üíõ

author: Jill Warner
text: Dinner was delicious and portion sizes were great! We were seated quickly on a Saturday night and the happy hour was every day until 7 pm.  Highly recommend their version of the Druken noodles if you like a bit of spice!

author: Steffanie Godoy
text:
Tried the Pad Thai and Thai Fried Rice and both totally delivered! The Pad Thai had tender shrimp, a slightly sweet tamarind sauce, and great texture though I would've loved a bit more tang. The Fried Rice was comforting and flavorful, with perfectly cooked chicken and just the right amount of wok char.

The food was so good I completely forgot to take a photo and that says a lot!

The ambiance is warm and modern, with soft lighting and a clean, minimalist vibe that makes it ideal for a chill dinner or date night. Service was kind and attentive without being pushy.

Will definitely be back to explore more of the menu!

author: Tiffany
text:
this place was so delicious and the service was fantastic!

we had 4 appetizers (spiced cucumber, tofu pockets, pork gyoza and fried octopus) and they were all so tasty and fresh. as a main, I had the beef udon noodles and my boyfriend had the fried udon with steak. we both loved everything and our waitress was so friendly and helpful! definitely a spot to come back to

author: Millie Shi
text:
Not to sound harsh but I think the other reviews are a bit too generous to this place. The food is just fine - we got the ebi ten udon (order a classic to judge a place) and the yakiniku udon, and a shio saba for appetizer. The saba was seasoned nicely although a bit tough, but the udons were disappointing. The noodles were overcooked and much too soft, they tasted like any mass produced packaged udon you could get at a grocery store. The shrimp tempura weren‚Äôt bad though, nice crisp.

Service is really nice though, and the ambience is perfectly homey and as good of a Japan-in-America vibe as you could hope for!

author: Siwaree Amornsupparat
text: Went there for dinner with friends. The place is cozy and homey. The foods were delish. I really like spicy cucumber. It‚Äôs tasty and refreshing. Service was awesome. The servers are very attentive. I definitely come back to try others menu.

author: Jennifer Lee
text:
Def worth a try if you want to try good udon. The udon was perfectly soft yet chewy enough. The Yakiniku udon was my fav as the stir fried made the noodles very flavorful (sweet and savory taste). The steak was cooked well - crispy on outside, soft on inside.
The servers were very nice. Checked in on us multiple times and made sure our water was always full.
Inside was a bit small but cozy enough.

author: Amy Lu
text: Loved the ebi niku udon! The soup was very flavorful. I came with a friend at around 5:30pm for dinner. Just be mindful that the place may get booked for parties during certain hours but the staff will post a sign stating so at the door. Also they'll give you stickers if you ask!

author: Luz Marie Mercado
text: I stopped in just planning to have a mimosa and ended up having such a wonderful experience. The owner was so kind and welcoming, and you can really feel how much care and pride goes into everything here. The peach Bellini was absolutely amazing! Perfectly refreshing and made with attention to detail. Everyone was so warm and genuine, and the whole atmosphere felt special. I‚Äôll definitely be coming back soon! Thank you for everything!

author: S Hwang
text: Food here was amazing and service was even better. Our server Austin was the best and made us feel so welcome at the restaurant. We got bruschetta, codfish, and the Tonnarelli Cacio e Pepe which was so good. Would definitely recommend!!

author: Ganling Zhou
text: The service is warming. We keep coming back and they recognize us since the second time. The food is truly amazing. It always feels home cooked and everything is so fresh. Specially mention for the post-meal limoncello.

author: Stephanie Cheng
text: Everything here was delicious. Amazing soft focaccia, marinara sauce was delicious and I don‚Äôt even like marinara. Squid ink pasta is my go to dish.

author: Ahmet Fitch
text: Had a fantastic pre-marathon dinner at L‚ÄôAngeletto! The owner was incredibly warm and hospitable, treating us to limoncello and biscotti, both absolutely delicious. I had the lobster ravioli special of the day, and it was perfection. We were a party of 10, and everyone raved about their meals. The atmosphere was cozy, the service exceptional, and the food authentically Italian. Highly recommend for a memorable dining experience!

author: Richard
text: Fantastic quality and unforgettable flavors! The wagyu was buttery, rich, and grilled perfectly over charcoal. Everything was fresh and beautifully presented. A bit pricier, but absolutely worth it for the quality. Will definitely come back!

author: Dolly H
text:
This beef tongue was an absolute standout ‚Äî beautifully marbled, tender, and full of flavor. Each slice was perfectly cut, giving that ideal balance of chew and melt-in-your-mouth texture once grilled. The presentation was elegant, served on a golden plate with a vibrant orchid and a wedge of lemon that added a refreshing brightness. The accompanying sauce had just the right amount of kick to complement the rich umami of the meat.

If you‚Äôre a fan of yakiniku or want to try something unique and luxurious, this beef tongue is a must-order. It‚Äôs as photogenic as it is delicious!

author: Lisa Wong
text:
We had a great experience at Japanese BBQ Toraji. The service was attentive and friendly throughout our meal. We ordered a la carte and everything we tried was delicious.

We order everything with salt and not the sauce.
The kalbi was tender and flavorful definitely a highlight. The Toraji Salad was refreshing and had a nice balance of textures. We also got the signature Toraji Cut, which was rich and juicy, perfect for grilling tableside.

Overall, a solid spot for Japanese BBQ with high-quality meat and great service. We‚Äôll definitely be back to try more!

author: Eva
text: The environment is very comfortable ‚Äî clean, cozy, and with a relaxed atmosphere that makes it perfect for chatting and enjoying good food. The meat was fresh and tender.

author: Jamie L
text: I absolutely love this place! I booked it on a whim since it's close to my job, and it turned out to be an incredible find. We grabbed seats at the bar, and the menu, while simple, offers a few course options alongside √† la carte selections. Totally worth it! The A5 Wagyu was exceptional--so tender, with perfect marbling, it practically melted in my mouth. It was both filling and deeply satisfying. Overall, an outstanding experience, and I highly recommend giving this spot a try!

author: Julie Alvarez
text: In an area where options for Thai food are not hard to find, Udom stands out with its impressive menu and reasonable prices. The service was warm and friendly, and the inside of the restaurant was very cozy. Other customers seemed to be regulars, and the staff know them, which I found very charming. And after tasting the food, I can definitely see why people keep coming back! Everything we tried was delicious, and the portion sizes were very generous. I enjoyed the variety of both more standard Thai fare as well as creative and modern twists on the old favorites. The Tom Yum Fried Rice was something I had seen home cooks make online, but I don't think I've ever seen it on a restaurant menu before (and I've been to a lot of Thai places!). I knew I had to try it and it did not disappoint! Of course everything was delicious but that really stood out. It's obvious why Udom is a neighborhood staple that has stood here for many years: with a friendly and warm atmosphere and delicious food served with fresh ingredients, no matter where you come from it makes it feel a little bit like home.

author: Deidre Matthews
text:
Q strikes again! üí•

She whipped up a pistachio martini for me tonight and WOW‚Äîcreamy, dreamy, nutty perfection! üå∞üíö The flavor was spot on, like pistachio got a glow-up. Q seriously never misses. If you haven‚Äôt tried her creations yet‚Ä¶ what are you even doing?!

A Taste of Thailand Right Here!

I‚Äôve been searching for an authentic taste of Thailand for the longest time, and let me tell you‚ÄîUdom Thai delivers! The flavors are spot on, and the crab fried rice is an absolute must-try. It‚Äôs easily one of the best dishes I‚Äôve had in a while.

The atmosphere is warm and welcoming, and the service makes the experience even better. July is incredible‚Äîshe‚Äôs so courteous, always smiling, and truly goes above and beyond to make you feel at home.

I love it here and will definitely be back soon. Highly recommend!

author: JiaXin YU
text:
‚ú® Hidden Thai Garden in Brooklyn üå∏
Who knew you could find such a cozy little garden spot in the middle of NYC? ü™¥
Outdoor garden, greenhouse vibes & hearty Thai dishes ‚Äî and guess what? Almost everything is under $20 üî•

ü•¢ Volcano Shrimp ‚Äì crispy & tangy perfection
ü•¢ Hawaiian Fried Rice ‚Äì sweet pineapple & chicken combo
ü•¢ Roasted Honey Ribs ‚Äì fall-off-the-bone, huge portion for just $18 üëÄ
ü•¢ Fried Wontons ‚Äì crunchy bites with sweet & sour dip
ü•¢ Rock and Roll Duck ‚Äì tender, flavorful & comforting

author: Kat Reed
text: I had the soft shelled crab and it was absolutely delicious. The place was very cute with so many options would definitely go back

author: Karen Stephanie Monsalve Reyes
text: We came here for the first time just looking for a good fried rice but what we found was a menu full of options, it has plenty of variety, and the portions are generous enough, and the prices are the best part, cuz you don‚Äôt have to overpay for a really good meal and people is very kind, they also bring a bottle water with cucumber inside and it tastes delicious, and a plus is that they close late in the night so is lifesaving, we will definitely without a doubt come back soon and try more of the dishes

author: Pasha Javadi
text: For an airport restaurant, this place really stands out! The food was fresh, tasty, and served surprisingly fast‚Äîperfect when you‚Äôre on the go. The staff were friendly and welcoming, making the quick stop even more pleasant. Definitely one of the better airport dining experiences I‚Äôve had!

author: Alan Mizell
text:
The worst chips and salsa I‚Äôve ever had in my life. The chips are very hard. What is supposed to be salsa is really just some sort of marinara sauce with a bunch of pepper in it.

Add a $4.55 Coca-Cola and The meal becomes a $15 snack. And people just say, it‚Äôs airport prices, as if that excuses it.

And if you don‚Äôt leave a tip for a $4.55 Coca-Cola, the clerk‚Äôs smile fades and the service becomes slow.

Do not recommend but you are a hostage here so you‚Äôll probably buy it.

author: LL
text: I had a decent experience overall, but the food itself left much to be desired. While the service was absolutely a 10 out of 10‚Äîattentive, professional, and friendly‚Äîthe food didn‚Äôt quite live up to the rest of the experience. Everything was clean and well-maintained, and the ambiance was pleasant, but unfortunately, the food quality was not the greatest. Some dishes lacked flavor, and the portions didn‚Äôt justify the price. It felt highly overpriced for what was served. I expected more considering the cost. It‚Äôs a shame because everything else‚Äîfrom the cleanliness to the staff‚Äîwas truly impressive. If the kitchen stepped up the quality and flavor of the food, this place could easily be a top recommendation. For now, I‚Äôd come back for the drinks or atmosphere, but not necessarily for the food.

author: Lena T
text: I had the most wonderful experience at LaChula‚Äôs waiting for my flight. The bar tender Millie was so friendly and provided excellent service. She even told me stories about her grandchildren. It was such a nice experience until this man started causing trouble out of nowhere. He was loud and obnoxious, accusing her of being rude, when all shs did was ask him if he needed anything else. I was worried this man might assault her, I don't understand why he was upset, I saw the entire interaction. Why did management allow him to behave that nasty with the staff? Otherwise 5 stars and anytime I fly at laguardia that's my spot!

author: Skylar Warren (Sky Kennedyy)
text:
This was one of the worst airport dining experiences I‚Äôve had. There was no seating available, which made it uncomfortable from the start. They also didn‚Äôt have water available, which is ridiculous considering it‚Äôs a basic necessity, especially in an airport. The menu was extremely limited, and when the food finally came, the portion size was tiny for the price. I understand airport food usually costs more, but in this case the quality didn‚Äôt even come close to matching the cost.
On top of that, the service was terrible‚Äîunhelpful and inattentive. Overall, a complete waste of money. I would strongly recommend avoiding this spot and finding a better option elsewhere in the terminal.

author: Rashad Chowdhury
text:
Torishin is worth it. Incredible experience - great execution.

You‚Äôll get to experience a great yakitori course paired with fantastic banter from Jacky, the chef cooking our skewers.

Each skewer was delicious and perfectly seasoned. Should you wish, you can add the sancho pepper or the shichimi which are available at your counter.

I loved the chicken heart. Soft, steak like and juicy. It really is the best piece. You‚Äôll also have the option of adding additional skewers - do this.

Really wish I got the pudding instead of the shiso gremolata/ice dessert. The pudding is phenomenal. Sweer, rich, and decadent. Perfect ending that I sadly did not get through my own idiocy.

author: Lauren S
text: Wow, I went here tonight and it was the perfect meal. It‚Äôs the perfect place to go to before or after a Broadway show it‚Äôs a few steps away from all the Broadway shows!! I love how chic the restaurant is. you walk in and you‚Äôre totally transported to a whole different world which I absolutely love the food was so good. It was so freshly yakitori was the best I ever had. It‚Äôs Michelin rated and the service was excellent. The yakitori chefs really listened to what my preferences were so I really enjoyed every bite. The prefix Omakase meals totally worth it. It‚Äôs so much food. Totally worth it!!!

author: Elena Ho
text: Yakitori Torishin is America‚Äôs first Michelin-starred yakitori restaurant in tucked in Midtown West. They offer a full yakitori omakase experience for $148pp which takes you on a full journey through the art of Japanese yakitori. Each skewer is grilled over binchotan charcoal bringing out a smoky aroma and juicy, layered flavors that are absolutely mouthwatering. Seasonal selections keep the experience fresh and surprising, and pairing everything with different sake makes it even more memorable. Torishin staffs are warm, attentive, and genuinely passionate about what they‚Äôre serving. They take time to explain each skewer, offer thoughtful recommendations, and strike the perfect balance between professionalism and making you feel completely at home. If you‚Äôre looking for authentic yakitori elevated to the highest level, this is the place to go!

author: ReedH
text:
I miss yakitori from my time living in Asia, so I decided to give Torishin a try last weekend. It‚Äôs definitely more upscale than the spots I used to frequent, but I was excited to see what they‚Äôd do.

I went with the omakase, though I liked that they also offer individual skewers a la carte. Sitting counter side was a lot of fun‚Äîthe team clearly knows their craft, and it was great to watch everything being cooked right over the charcoal. Every bite was excellent‚Äîtender, flavorful, and full of smoky charcoal depth. My favorite of the night was the chicken oyster. If you like chicken, it really doesn‚Äôt get better than that. Service was outstanding and made the evening even more enjoyable. Overall, a wonderful experience. I‚Äôll definitely be back.

author: Kira Bernhard
text:
I visited Torishin in April 2025 and had such a memorable experience! From the moment I stepped inside, the staff made me feel so welcomed and at ease - I instantly knew I was going to have a good time. I chose the Omakase option, which was a perfect way to try a range of dishes even though I'm not the most adventurous eater. The staff were incredibly thoughtful, checking in with my friend and me ahead of our meal to see if we preferred certain cuts of meat so they could tailor the experience to our individual tastes.

Throughout the meal, our server was attentive and knowledgeable, always nearby to answer questions and make sure we were comfortable and enjoying everything. Watching the chef prepare each course right in front of us made the atmosphere even more special and added to the night!

As for the food itself - it was absolutely incredible. My favorite dishes were their popular chicken "scallops," which were so juicy and flavorful, and the gindara fish, which was perfectly flaky and delicious.

Between the warm service, the amazing food, and the lively, welcoming atmosphere, Torishin truly gave me a night to remember. I can't wait to come back!

author: Erika Baker
text:
Surf and turf was out of this world!

If you were looking for a classic iconic steakhouse in your Times Square to enjoy a nice meal with your family, I would highly recommend this establishment .

You get what you pay for so do not sacrifice your time and resources on anything less than your best.

author: zeracohw
text: This centrally located NYC steakhouse delivers a solid dining experience. We had the veal and lobster ricotta ravioli, which was flavourful and well-prepared. The service, however, was the real standout‚Äîattentive, friendly, and perhaps better than the food. The atmosphere is classic New York, with walls covered in vintage movie posters and black-and-white photos that give it an old-school charm. It‚Äôs definitely on the pricey side, but that‚Äôs expected for the area. Note: a 20% tip is already included in the bill, so keep that in mind when settling up.

author: Keisuke Hirata
text:
Staff is kind and humorous. Had short conversion about meal, male staff gave me good information and suggestion.
Ordered the T-bone steak, and it was so tasty and temperature was perfect.
They also have pork chop and lamp chop so you can chose many selections.
Thank you!
I had no booking but could take a counter seat. Coz it was lunch time of weekend.
If you wanna get the table, should you make a bookingin advance, especially on weekend.

author: Raymond Zhao
text: Service is great. Waiters are very attentive. Waiter saw my knife was broken and immediate gave me a new one without having to ask. Unfortunately the food is subpar, USDA Prime steak was very tough and chewy. Did not taste like usda prime at all. On top of that, the Hash Brown Potatoes were completely butchered. Ambiance and decor was nice, but I would not dine here again.

author: Novi Beerens
text: We went for dinner after searching for a good old steakhouse nearby our hotel on 10th Ave. this restaurant has another location on 37st. We made reservations, and were greeted attentively by the host and she also got both of our coats store at the coat room. We got a nice booth table in the main dining room area. It was a busy time for them, however service was really great. We got watermelon spritz to start (refreshing!). We started with bread service and we shared tenderloin, sea bass, potato au gratin, mushroom and onion and finished with tiramisu. Simply one of the best meal we had in NYC.

author: PhilYouIn
text: Terrific choice for dinner. Beautiful restaurant with delicious food and excellent service. Our server, Diego, was very engaging and pleasant and knowledgeable. The cocktails were perfect, as was the food. The place is noisy with happy patrons, but not too noisy to have a conversation. Very relaxing, enjoyable dinner. ‚ôøÔ∏è

author: Harvey Messing
text: They have a very sophisticated and attractive decor here. While some OTHER Italian restaurants will be closed at 10 p.m., THIS restaurant still has a lot of people dining in it. A complimentary bread basket comes with a small dish of lentils, bread, and bread sticks which are delicious. I tried their salmon with mustard sauce ($39.50), ordered medium. It was served that way, it was moist and I enjoyed it. On another visit there I had their Chicken Paesano. The chicken pieces were not tender. On another visit there I tried their rabbit that came with mashed potatoes and Brussels sprouts. The rabbit ($49.50) had lost a lot of its flavor due to its preparation. The mashed potatoes were very enjoyable, the Brussels sprouts were good. A thin electric candle ads a nice touch to each table. They serve the same menu for lunch and dinner.

author: Rebecca Clark (Becca)
text: Outstanding experience! Huge, beautiful venue with excellent service. The Rockettes were even better than I imagined. Friendly, professional staff and a phenomenal show to enjoy with family and friends. Of course it‚Äôs really crowded!

author: Ulyana
text: Not sure how this place has such high rating - one of the worst meals we‚Äôve had in the past few months. Absolute waste of money. The worst calamari we‚Äôve ever had. So soggy and soft. My pasta was okay. Asked about mocktails. All our server could offer virgin mojito at an Italian restaurant?? Thank you, no. Over $180 for a terrible dinner with a terrible service. Server never checked on us or how the food was. Would never go back here.

author: camelia motoc
text:
La Masserie is truly a gem. From the moment you walk in, the warm atmosphere makes you feel like you‚Äôve stepped into an authentic Italian countryside farmhouse. The service is attentive and welcoming without ever feeling rushed, which makes the dining experience even more special.

The food is exceptional ‚Äî fresh ingredients, beautifully presented, and full of flavor. The pasta is perfectly cooked, the seafood is fresh, and the sauces are rich and balanced. Every dish feels like it was made with care. The wine list is also impressive, with options that pair wonderfully with the menu.

For dessert, I highly recommend trying the tiramisu ‚Äî light, creamy, and just the right amount of sweetness.

Whether you‚Äôre coming for a romantic dinner, a family celebration, or a night out with friends, La Masserie delivers an unforgettable experience. It‚Äôs the kind of place you‚Äôll want to return to again and again.

author: Matthew Frankowski
text:
Some of the best udon in NYC! While the wait can definitely be long during peak hours(1hr 30min on a Sunday evening), Raku SoHo is a cozy spot that delivers authentic noodles and thoughtful dishes once you‚Äôre seated.

For an appetizer you must try the chicken tatsuta-age which is wonderfully fried and seasoned. We loved the dipping sauce which perfectly compliments the chicken. We tried two hot udons, the tantan and the nabeyaki.

The tantan offered a rich and flavorful broth while not being too overwhelming. My only complaint would be that most of the pork and other components were under the noodles so I didn‚Äôt discover them until I was almost finished. The nabeyaki was a nice light soup with the same perfect noodles. It offered a lot of protein and a nicely balanced fishy flavor. The stand out of this dish was the shrimp tempura which was fried to perfection.

My only complaints would be of the tight seating arrangement. You will be practically sharing a table with the people around you if you are seated near the front. Overall, I cannot wait to come again and try more of their udon!

author: Amenita T
text: The restaurant not too big, cozy, but pack, rsvp totally recommended if coming in rush hours. 90 mins to complete your meals since they are very busy so other customers can have an opportunity to dine in as well. Their steam eggs surprisingly so tasty and it took at least 20 to 25 mins wait for that dish. Their spinach and mushroom very simple yet very tasty as well. Udon was also good, overall I loved this place and I was glad that my hubby discovered it lol. We walked there since we were there on a vacation. There‚Äôs no way we would drive around NY. Too crazy and parking sucks. Good for kids, family as well. Serves beers and wines. Of course there is parking along the streets. But not easy to find one sometime. We either walk or uber when we come to NY.

author: Wesley Gan
text:
Raku is known for its udon, but that will be a separate review for me. This time I was craving Katsudon which I decided to order. The flavor was good, I wish that the pieces of meat were a little larger and most crispy, however everything mixed together really well. It came with a small soup which was delicious. And the pickles were solid as well, I wish there was more.

I did have a big group, but I felt like the service was not as good as I expected. It was busy but also clear that the group next to us was getting more attention and care than mine - when it came to ordering, getting the attention of the waiter, drinks, etc. they also sat down after us‚Ä¶

author: J Sun
text:
The good: The udon noodles are excellent and perfectly chewy.

The bad:
- bathroom sinks are insanely small. I don‚Äôt know who looked at that and thought it was a good idea
- they ran out of fried appetizers ‚Äî three hours into service. That‚Äôs unacceptable, you‚Äôre open for another 6 hours!
- you get very little protein for the amount of money you pay
- we got zero service, nobody came to ever check up on us and it was extremely hard to flag someone down.
- found a piece of black plastic in my food. I‚Äôm assuming it‚Äôs a piece of black nitrile glove??
- we opted to not tip because of these reasons, and the server thought it would be appropriate to ‚Äúremind‚Äù us that tips aren‚Äôt included in the bill. When we said we knew, he asked if we were tipping in cash.

Overall, for the price Raku is charging, this level of unprofessionalism doesn‚Äôt make sense. I would not recommend or return.

author: C A
text: Delicious udon with a large menu where everyone can find something they enjoy. I was very impressed with the quality of the food. The noodles tasted freshly made and the broth was comforting. The restaurant was clean and the service was prompt. The bowl of udon was large and you‚Äôll definitely leave satisfied!

author: Augusto Paulino
text: The lunch specials ($17 each for the Panang curry and the Tom Yum fried rice) were decent-sized portions with a good amount of spice. The meal includes an appetizer and a drink. A soft drink may be a better option than the Thai iced tea. Service is super friendly and fast. The space, though, is elbow-to-elbow cramped.

author: Jalisa James
text: This cute, cozy Thai spot is such a gem! The food is absolutely delicious, and the atmosphere makes it feel really special. If you‚Äôre looking for a place with amazing food and a warm vibe, this one‚Äôs definitely worth checking out.

author: Raksina Winaitammakul
text:
Lenox Thai is a true gem for anyone seeking authentic Thai food. As a Thai person myself, I can confidently say the dishes here are incredibly delicious and taste just like a home-cooked meal in Thailand. The flavors are spot on and the ingredients are fresh.
Beyond the fantastic food, the staff is exceptionally friendly, and the cozy atmosphere makes you feel right at home. Whether you're a Thai food connoisseur or just looking for a wonderful dining experience, Lenox Thai is a must-visit.

author: Vanh Saeng
text:
Wow this place surprised me. I was looking for a Thai restaurant to eat at with my family and this spot blew me away.

It is a small cozy little joint located at the bottom of the upper east side. Due to the size it is limited seating. Can possibly fit around 12 people or so. There's a nice little mural that someone painted. The menus on the TV are bright with clear pictures.

I noticed they get plenty of door dash/Uber eats, etc.

Our hostess was super sweet and caring. She attended to our needs and was very helpful. I had a question about what one of the dishes was and she looked it up on her phone to show me what it was.

The food definitely blew me away. It was surprisingly good. We had the crispy spring rolls, classic fried rice(Chicken), pad Thai (chicken), and a mango avocado salad. The fried rice was amazing. I've always prefer Thai fried rice compared to other Asian fried rices. It didn't taste super greasy and it had the right amount of eggs and chicken and vegetables. The salad was perfectly riped. A great combo of mango and avocado with onions/cashews and an Asian sauce. Very fresh and delicious. The crispy spring rolls came in a set of 4. They tasted great are also a nice size, not too small. It was paired with a sweet chili sauce for dipping.The pad Thai was delicious ü§§ not too dry and just the right amount of oil. The noodles were cooked perfectly. The portion was a great size. I ended up taking the fried rice and pad Thai in a to go container. She was nice enough to box up the food for us.

We also ordered Thai tea. It was the final piece of the puzzle to balance out the spicy meals.

We definitely recommend this place. Everyone please try it. Would definitely try again if we're in the area.

author: Anish Sinha
text: Lenox Thai is a cozy, small cafe-style spot with seating for about 12 people. We tried the green curry, and it was full of flavor‚Äîrich, aromatic, and satisfying. The menu offers a good variety of both vegetarian and non-vegetarian options, making it a great choice for mixed groups. Perfect for a casual meal with authentic Thai flavors in a relaxed setting. Would definitely come back!

author: Maria Russo
text: Great food and service. Authentic thai cuisine with great flavors. Was very busy upon arrival but got a table fairly quickly. Cozy spot for food and great atmosphere on the UES. Even had warm/heated bathroom and was super clean. Mameiw was super attentive and conscious about any allergies and was very knowledgeable about the menu. She noticed we had not given our order yet and came right over to assist. Hardworking and super helpful!

author: Praveen solanki
text:
Thep Thai truly stands out, not just for its vibrant atmosphere, but for the exceptional quality and flavor depth found across its entire menu, especially in its vegetarian and chicken offerings.

For those seeking plant-based dishes, Thep is a revelation. The menu is clearly labeled with excellent vegan options, and the kitchen handles substitutions perfectly. The Vegan Pad See Ew with tofu is arguably the best I‚Äôve ever had‚Äîrich, smoky, and perfectly textured. Don't skip the Avocado Massaman Curry (available vegetarian/vegan), which is wonderfully creamy, savory, and loaded with tender sweet potato. The commitment to flavorful, authentic vegan food here is top-tier.

On the non-vegetarian side, the chicken dishes are equally impressive. The Chicken Pad Thai is a classic for a reason, hitting that perfect balance of sweet and tangy tamarind flavor. However, the real showstopper is the Chicken Khao Soi (Northern Thai Egg Noodles)‚Äîthe creamy coconut curry broth is incredibly deep and comforting, and the chicken (often bone-in, which adds to the authenticity) is cooked to perfection. It's an absolute must-try.

Whether you're visiting for a comforting chicken classic or looking for sophisticated, flavorful vegan Thai, Thep delivers consistently high quality and is highly recommended.

Minnie was awesome to help us with our order. A big thanks to her and entire staff for making our lunch good

author: Kristen Darby
text:
I love THEP Thai. I‚Äôve been here so many times and I was last here for my friends birthday dinner.  It‚Äôs my favorite Thai food on the UES. We were a group of 10+ and we had called to get a reservation earlier in the week for a Friday night and they were able to accommodate.

I got a Thai iced tea and the khao soi. I love the food here (have tried most of the menu items).

The service was super quick and friendly - we had a nice lady named Four as our host/server.

Love this place and will be back!

author: Brooke Waller
text: Thep was absolutely delicious! We got the chicken pad Thai, chicken pad see ew, and spring rolls and all were delicious and I can‚Äôt wait to go back. Definitely get a Thai iced tea as well‚Äîsuper tasty and an all time fav. Thank you to our sweet waitress Kade for great service and recommendations! üòã

author: michael vilcapoma
text:
Had the pleasure of having outdoor seating in the fall of the UES. Tables and area was clean and lights were romantic.

Our server Mameiw was knowledgeable and helped zero in on what to choose on the menu and the Spicy Udon noodles did not disappoint!

Overall a nice corner spot and you can tell why there is a short wait time during weekend dinner rushes (~20mins for table of two).

author: Kiu Siu
text: Upper East Side neighborhood Turkish restaurant serving good food at a reasonable price. We were a party of two and went to A La Turka on a Saturday night. It was lively and crowded. Our waitress was friendly and efficient. We ordered the A La Turka salad and Falafel for appetizers. And for the main we had the Lamb Shank and the grilled whole Branzino. The portions were generous and the food was good. Overall we enjoyed our dinner at this restaurant.

author: Dawn Nargi
text: We loved our late lunch, early dinner.  After spending the afternoon admiring Halloween decorations, we worked up an appetite.  (I love wandering around my NYC like a tourist even though i lived here 30 years)  Too hungry and tired, we asked our waiter, Ali to recommend his favorites.  He created a spectacular meal for us.  All delicious and the end to a perfect day.@widowshelpingwidows #stoopandthecity

author: Jeffrey Liss
text: This is one of our new favorite restaurants!! The ambience is unique - great design and colors. The energy is high.  The food and service are wonderful! The manager/host is highly attentive to EVERY customer's needs, as are that of the wait staff. We have sat at the bar for drinks and snacks and also sat at a table for a full dinner. I highly recommend the Hummus. Their breads are amazing!!

author: Rita Asso
text:
The best Turkish restaurant in NYC!
Everything was absolutely delicious ‚Äî so fresh and full of flavor. The presentation is beautiful, and you can really taste the quality in every bite.

The owner is amazing and makes you feel right at home. You can tell he truly cares about the food and the guests.

Highly recommend to anyone looking for an authentic and unforgettable Turkish dining experience in New York!

author: Anna Yegorova
text: Came here for brunch and was blown away by the excellent service, beautiful ambiance (even from choice of cups and tablecloth combos) and a delicious unique breakfast! That pastrami bureka was the most delicious lightly fried rolls of deliciousness with a generous helping of eggs on the side. Can‚Äôt recommend this place enough for actual good food that both looks and tastes good!

author: rebecca
text:
LUNCH SPECIAL, you will always be my favorite.

Such a chill spot to grab lunch at. My bestie and I went for the lunch special and it was so much food for such a reasonable price. The staff was kind and the bathroom was clean. Thank you for having us, Spice Thai! :)

author: Christine George
text: Amazing food, great service. You won‚Äôt be disappointed by the menu and their consistency. Atmosphere and quaint and comfortable. I didn‚Äôt wait long to be served. They accommodated my cake someone surprised me with and did everything to ensure you were satisfied. Great food, great price!

author: The Foodie Architect
text: Good decent Thai food. The waiter is very attentive!

author: Victoria Leon
text: Great food at good price. I ordered Massaman curry with seafood mix and jasmine tea. The curry was rich and flavorful. I didn‚Äôt enjoy getting shell pieces between my teeth a few times, but the food itself was delicious. I also loved the interior, cozy with lovely fresco at the back and beautiful tiles. The staff were very nice.

author: Miranda A. Walker
text: A Lovely, quaint authentic Thai cuisine that‚Äôs delightful and delicious. I ordered the appetizer sampler since I was going to a show after work. The variations were good and filling. The drinks are awesome too! Go during happy hour! (Location 1479 1st Avenue @77th Street$

author: Victorandmanuela
text:
I highly recommend this restaurant.

I took the menu Maki 2.
It was very generous and good for $22.
The fish was fresh.

For me the place is very great in terms of quality and quantity for the price.

I will definitely go back

author: Linsey mackey
text: Came with a friend for an early dinner. It was good. My favorite rolls were the Sweet potato tempura. The other rolls were good too. Had the Yuzu white peach to drink and the Dragons egg for dessert. We got all 3 flavors.

author: Le Coucou
text: This is a good spot for a quick lunch! I placed a takeout order that was supposed to be ready in 15 minutes, but came out in just 10. Apin, who runs the place solo during lunch, was very friendly and even offered me a glass of water while I waited. The chicken katsu was decent, and I plan to order from them again.

author: Fiona Camm
text: Sushi was incredible! The fish melted in my mouth & they were very generous & lovely. Couldn‚Äôt recommend more. Also such great value.

author: Korie Carr
text: The best sushi in the neighborhood especially at this price point. Has been my go to pick up food for over a year. The owner and staff are always extremely friendly when I pick up and the food is amazing! I ate inside for the first time and ordered a glass of wine while I waited for my Togo food and the owner came over and gave me a glass on the house! Highly recommend!

author: Celeste
text: My husband and I celebrated our birthdays recently at the restaurant. Every dish we ordered was impeccable.  The creamed spinach and crispy onion string sides were amazing! The steak and halibut with beet risotto were unbelievable too!  Very attentive waiter and  classy atmosphere.

author: vincent xue
text:
This place is just about what you'd expect from a steakhouse. Good service, decent atmosphere, decently portioned sides, and a nicely cooked steak with optional accompaniments. In my opinion, the sauces were too weak to really enhance the entree. However it came in a medium sized pot with a handle, making it easy to use and share.

The only thing that stood out to me was the creamed spinach. Every bite was quite rich but wasn't too dense.

Did I have a good time with my meal? Yes.
Did the flavors blow my mind? No.
Would I come back? Probably no. But I don't regret coming here.

author: Bradley C
text:
I came here by myself tonight. I ordered a raspberry sidecar to start my dinner. The drink was very nice. Very balanced. It was smooth and beautiful.

I ordered lobster bisque, a NY strip cooked medium rare, and a side of toasted wild mushrooms.

The bread was quite nice. They gave me one nice looking one and a one that was kinda ugly. Turned out, the look did matter. The nice looking one was way softer than the ugly one.

The lobster bisque was nice. Very pungent and thick. It also had a generous amount of lobster claws meat chunks. However, some of them were a bit overcooked and some were perfectly tender.

The NY strip came out pretty well. The meat was pink and tender. Very flavorful. It came with roasted garlic. The garlic was smooth like mashed potatoes, and it was fragrant but not stinky.

The side of roasted wild mushrooms was very nice, too. Usually, they can be a bit oily and greasy, but here, they were cooked to almost perfectly. Almost, because they were a bit bland, and they were a bit too dry.

Overall, it was a nice restaurant with a good atmosphere. Even though, I still wish they could pick up the speed a bit. Between the time I finished my lobster bisque and my NY strip was served, I waited for 35 minutes. They can probably do that for the party of 2 or more, but for a person who was eating by himself, I‚Äôd like to just finish and leave.

author: george grinnell
text: Great looking place ,cool vibe , nice decor but it‚Äôs basically a step above pub food. Hardly a Steak house however informal it‚Äôs described on google. Service is slow and non attentive at best. Steak was bland , sides were same and the bacon barely cooked even when sent back and asked for it well done came back out the same . Waiter was robotic no personality , not what you expect from a ‚Äústeakhouse‚Äù waiter . Overall aside from a drink and maybe a quick app at bar this place really should do better or change the name . Sub par across the board minus the atmosphere.

author: Olga Tymshan
text:
I recently discovered this establishment on the UES and it‚Äôs become one of my favorite spots on Friday nights! It was easy to make a reservation through Google maps, the table was ready right away, the staff is very courteous and accommodating.
We came primarily for drinks üçπ and were not disappointed: all three tequila cocktails were unique and delicious. Our server was also very knowledgeable about their origin and the making. The buratta salad is at the top of my salad list now! It‚Äôs like a meal by itself to my European standards and the concoction of tastes makes it truly unforgettable and wanting me to return there for just this one dish üôÉ

author: John Gonsalves
text: Lexington Candy Shop is one of those true New York classics that still keeps its charm after all these years. It has that old-school diner feel with counter seating and friendly staff who actually remember regulars. They still make their Coca-Cola the traditional way from syrup mixed right in front of you which gives it a flavor you can‚Äôt find anywhere else. The coconut cake is a must-try, super moist with that perfect balance of sweetness. They also serve all the classic diner favorites like omelets, egg sandwiches, and pancakes, all made fresh and served hot. It‚Äôs a simple spot, but that‚Äôs part of what makes it so good  just classic comfort food in a nostalgic setting. Definitely worth a visit if you want a taste of old New York.

author: Food Soul
text: It was a long waiting line but totally worth it! We got babana split and cherry coke float. They all were amazing! Perfect sweet. We got the bar seats and I like to watch them making the Cola, adding the syrup and soda. The atmosphere was so warm welcoming, cozy and unique. We got good service, they all have smile on the face. Also, I enjoying watching the coke bottles in the front of the shop.

author: Chiara Rizza
text:
The Lexington Candy Shop is an absolute gem, an original spot where you can enjoy Coca-Cola served the old-fashioned way. The atmosphere is wonderfully vintage, full of charm and character, but never feels outdated or worn. It‚Äôs like stepping into a piece of New York history that‚Äôs still very much alive. The staff is fantastic: friendly, down-to-earth, and genuinely welcoming. Their warmth makes the whole experience even better. Everything we tried was excellent, and the overall vibe of the place is unforgettable.
A must try if you‚Äôre looking for something authentic, nostalgic, and delicious!

author: Walenska Florencio
text: The staff is very kindly and the food is very good. The cheeseburguer was better than The one that I tried on Times Square. There was a line but we are 4 and around 30 minutes our table was ready.

author: Hishaam Bin Masood
text:
I was curious to visit this establishment as it was pretty popular on Instagram but somehow the Google rating was not promising so I decided I need to go and see it for myself.

The review on Google was right. This is just hyped up to be a tourist trap.

But don‚Äôt get me wrong, the vibes and ambience is spot on! Typical American diner but the rude behavior of staff and the prices are exorbitant like grilled cheese is $10 and it‚Äôs not even on sourdough bread.

The only reason we went to try was the Coca Cola float as they seem to be making the Coca Cola the old school way.

So in short, the ambience 10/10 as it has a pretty decent history around the upper east side, the food not so much.

author: Gaby Ortiz
text: Definitely not our favorite place‚Ä¶ the Food took 20 minutes to arrive and the place was empty. The salmon omelette was the best of everything we ordered. The portions are huge!

author: Olivia
text:
Went for Sunday brunch - group of 4. Reserved table beforehand, no wait. Brunch comes with a drink - Bellini, mimosa, orange juice, or coffee. OJ tasted fresh, pulp which I like. We spent about $35 pp. Felt on the pricier side especially waffles, pancakes for $25-27 which we did not opt for. Still, would return as a special outing with friends for good food at a convenient location with good ambiance.
Pictured: crab cake burger, omelettes, eggs Benedict.

author: Stinson Parks III
text:
Stopped in after an evening at the Guggenheim not too far away and were automatically greeted by such a warm and welcoming host.

We were promptly served our pitcher of red sangria by our attentive server as he guided us through our selections of delicious bites including the Bocado fries, sea scallops, and flatbread with prosciutto.

author: Ana Sanabria
text: After work dinner and drinkns. Service is incredible.  The food..so tasty. I had the fried fish sandwich with mango salsa. Sooo yummy....I would definitely come back

author: janae metz
text: Oh my god, the food was so good here!! The service was def not the best, as we had to ask for bread, and had to ask for check after quite a bit, and then still wait a bit more. But I will most def be returning as my meal was heavenly!! Portions are big too!

author: Emre Aslan
text: The pancakes were absolutely incredible. Fluffy, flavorful and perfectly cooked. The atmosphere was just an amazing and welcoming with a great vibe that makes you want to stay longer. Also Dayan is my fav server. She was fantastic thank you for the excellent service‚ù§Ô∏è. Definitely a place I‚Äôll be coming back to !!!

author: Nigiar Zanger
text: Such a lovely and clean spot in West New York! I‚Äôve been there several times and everything is always delicious. Their food and desserts are really tasty, and the fresh smoothies and juices are always made right in front of you. It‚Äôs cozy, the quality is great - I honestly don‚Äôt understand why the rating is so low. This place definitely deserves more appreciation!

author: Hanan A
text: I had Turkish coffee and falafel! Both were fantastic. The owner is working there too so you‚Äôre so everything feels just right. The vibe is pretty cozy. I liked the seatings. It‚Äôs the kind of spot that makes you want to come back again for sure.

author: Gerard Smith
text: I was visiting my grandson and had breakfast at the caf√© every morning... They had a very nice view of the midtown skyline and park... The service was excellent...  I had excellent Lavazza coffee (black) and my grandson had fresh made orange juice... We both had omelets the first day and then croissant sandwiches the remaining mornings... They croissants were crisp and fluffy with good cheese, eggs, and bacon...  I'll be back in December and will definitely be back to the Park Caf√©...

author: Jose Vasquez
text: Found this place by coincidence, we were vacationing and stayed at an Airbnb in Jersey, this place became our ‚Äúgo to ‚Äú spot for breakfast. The food here is made fresh to order with quality ingredients. Everything we ordered was so good, the owners and workers were very friendly and welcoming. I highly recommend this cafe and will definitely come back when in town.

author: Holly
text: Went to Salumeria Rosi with my handicapped Grandma. The owner/manager was super helpful and accommodating. He did a lot to make sure that my Grandma was comfortable. All of the food was outstanding, with the exception of the lamb chops which were nearly impossible to eat. It‚Äôs a typical New York City restaurant so not very spacious and I would definitely recommend making a reservation to ensure that you get a table. I would definitely come back here, I want to try everything on the menu!

author: IndyKevin317
text: We‚Äôve been searching for an authentic Italian experience outside of Italy and Salumeria Rosi fits the bill.  This place was recommended to us by complete strangers and we were not disappointed.  Really enjoyed dining outside on the patio on a beautiful day.  Great food, great vibe, and great staff.  We are not locals, but will definitely be back on our next trip to NYC.

author: u.g. Lodwig
text:
Food is good although portion size is quite small.
