Spaghetti with clams had tiny clams and the flavor was quite ordinary‚ÄîI‚Äôve had this dish at many Italian restaurants in the United States and in various towns in Italy. This dish here is only ordinary. The pasta is not al dente, and the olive oil didn‚Äôt taste like high-quality Italian olive oil, and the clams are just too small, and perhaps it‚Äôs lacking some garlic flavor (in Italy this dish is usually cooked with garlic and the olive oil and parsley flavors should stand out as well as the vongole). For the price they charge, I expect better. Appetizer was very good though, still portion size is quite small compared to other Italian restaurants in UWS. The puttanesca is good though a bit salty.

They have both indoor seating and sidewalk seating. Sidewalk seating is on a busy main street so you might get some strange reactions from passersby.

author: Meredith Moore
text: Best spot in the UWS hands down. Always excellent service and you can taste the love put into every authentic bite. The blue cheese martini's are a must. The pastas are fresh and appetizers are so unexpected and delicious. We have never had a bad meal. A must try-you will keep coming back!

author: Kathy D
text: Tiny cute restaurant with nice service and good food.  The ricotta and peaches was delicious.  The peaches were sweet and the cheese was creamy and rich.  Adding some mint and nuts made for the perfect bite.  Meat and cheese platter was also very good, the meats was sliced very thin which was great, but I would have appreciated if they told us the types of cheeses we were eating (the meats were obvious). Also would have like to have known what the garnish was as I couldn‚Äôt place it, it didn‚Äôt taste strong enough to be candied ginger but it may have been.    I did ask what all of these were and was told someone would come and explain but they never did. Bread basket was a combination of toasted and fresh bread served with tasty olive oil.    When you first walk in there is a counter where they sell their meats, cheeses and salads, all looked delicious and while we were they the counter was very busy. Overall liked this restaurant and would recommend.

author: Mohammed Alanazi
text: Delicious Indian food with authentic flavors! The curries were rich, the naan was fresh, and the portions were generous. Friendly staff and a warm atmosphere

author: S S
text: Excellent service, beautiful ambience, incredible food‚Ä¶ only have good things to say. The garlic naan was exactly what you could hope for!! Delicious

author: ry
text: Absolutely delicious food and amazing service. We were given the lunch special despite it being the weekend (when the special isn‚Äôt usually available). Our server was incredibly accommodating and kind. We couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better experience. Definitely coming back, would recommend to anyone

author: Anthony Lord
text: I recently ate at this lovely little treat of a restaurant on Amsterdam Ave, Upper West Side, NYC for my birthday. The food was cooked to a very good standard and had a great atmosphere in the restaurant itself. We liked it's location and would go back anytime in the future, if the opportunity presented itself. Great flavours combined with fresh ingredients made for a great bithday evening meal out for myself and my family!

author: Ari T
text: The food was excellent, came out quickly, and everything was so flavorful. The servers were incredibly nice and accommodating, making the whole experience even better. It‚Äôs also a great place for big groups ‚Äî highly recommend! Gluten free options too.

author: Courtnie Clemens
text: Delicious food all around! The aj√≠ de gallina was fantastic, creamy, flavorful, and perfectly seasoned. The maduros were absolute perfection, caramelized just right. Service was friendly and attentive, and they were so accommodating, even adding an extra person to our table last minute without any issue. A great spot for comforting Peruvian dishes and a relaxed, welcoming vibe.

author: Fabiola Rojas
text: I found this restaurant because I was looking for Peruvian Chicken and boy did this place exceed my expectations. This is a Chinese/Peruvian fusion so their menu is quite extensive. My family of 5 loved everything they ordered, service was friendly and timely. Would definitely come again!

author: Susana L
text: I absolutely love the food at Flor de Mayo restaurant. The service was great and we received it fast. The food tasted fresh and was hot. They have a wide selection of food, and all the dishes I have tasted are delicious.   It‚Äôs hard to locate parking, but I highly recommend it when in the area. It‚Äôs a must try üòÄ

author: John ‚ÄúChance‚Äù Acevedo
text: Florida De Mayo has been a staple of the community. It's one of the few still standing. It's been there more than 20+ years serving the community their Chinese Latin food. Part Peruvian and Chinese this location has something for everyone.  Regardless of your preference you can not go wrong at this location or their sister location.

author: Lori Lam
text: i usually go to the location on 86th street but this location is just as great! the food, the drinks, and the people were all so good and lovely. menu highlights were: broiled pork chops, the shrimp soup (my all time favorite), squid fried rice, and can never go wrong with some pi√±a coladas.

author: shirley ‚Äúshirlz‚Äù f
text:
Cute, quaint spot. The customer service was great.
What we initially came in to try wasn‚Äôt available but I was not disappointed with my visit. The food was absolutely delicious. My sister who dislikes ham thoroughly enjoyed her quiche Lorraine. I enjoyed the croque madame. I do wish the side salads had dressing. The caramel macchiatos were some of the best coffee I‚Äôve had in a long time. The crepe was perfect balance of tart and sweet.

author: Walker J
text:
I was looking for a quiet place to have a nice glass of wine and a bite to eat. After a beautiful concert at the Cathedral of St. John the Divine. After trying a few different places that were way too loud, I found Cafe du Soleil.
The host tonight was Miguel. He was so gracious and welcoming. Even though I just wanted a little something, he showed me to a beautiful little table outside that is inside a plastic bubble! Very cozy and private. It was the perfect quiet experience to have a glass of wine and some delicious escargot on Broadway in New York City! I will be back, for sure. Very grateful to Miguel for the welcome.

author: Vladislava Kursheva
text:
What an amazing discovery.  Great atmosphere, wide menu selection, welcoming and professional service.
Every dish we tried left us curving to return for more.  My personal surprise was a blood sausage.  I tried plenty of them cooked Slavic style, but one we had in Cafe du Soleil - best of the best!!!

author: Amanda Vasquez
text:
Absolutely wonderful!!! Tried snails for the first time and I have to be honest I was skeptical..but they were absolutely delicious!! Especially when paired up with the delicious bread they give you! Had steak and eggs with fries, omg!! The best steak and eggs I‚Äôve ever had in my life! The bartenders were amazing and very communicative and comforting. Definitely coming here again!! 10/5!!!

Sorry I didn‚Äôt take pictures of the steak and eggs, I very much inhaled that food lol oh and the fries were spectacular too! Perfect amount of crunchy, crispy and flavorful!

author: Nicole Arsenault
text: Ordered on uber eats October 4 around 4 in the afternoon. Missing a drink, fries were old and cold, bottom of bag fell out as soon as l lifted it from the counter. Burger bacon was raw. No toppings as described (Lettuce tomato pickles etc). Mousse was warm. Onion Soup was tasteless.

author: Bry T
text:
Saiguette is one of those hidden gems in NYC that consistently delivers when it comes to Vietnamese comfort food, especially for takeout. I‚Äôve tried a good amount of Vietnamese spots in the city, and while Saiguette doesn‚Äôt offer a dine in experience (it‚Äôs strictly takeout), they make up for it with flavor, portion size, and speed.

The banh mi here is definitely the standout. Unlike some places that skimp on the fillings, Saiguette really loads it up. The bread is fresh with the perfect balance of crunch on the outside and softness inside, and the fillings are generous you don‚Äôt feel like you‚Äôre paying just for bread. I also appreciated that the balance of meat, pickled vegetables, and fresh herbs is done right, giving it that satisfying bite every time. Portion wise, it‚Äôs more than fair for the price, especially considering NYC standards where you often pay more for less.

Pho and other noodle dishes also come packed with flavor. The broth is rich, and the portions again don‚Äôt leave you hungry. For a takeout-only spot, the packaging is practical and sturdy it travels well, and you can enjoy it at home without everything spilling or getting soggy.

The one downside for me was more about the ownership and authenticity. When I asked if the restaurant was Vietnamese owned, one of the workers told me yes. Later on, I found out that the owner is not Vietnamese, which was a bit disappointing, especially after I tried speaking Vietnamese to him and realized it wasn‚Äôt the case. It doesn‚Äôt take away from the taste of the food, but as someone who values authenticity and cultural roots, it felt misleading.

Overall, though, Saiguette is worth trying if you‚Äôre in NYC and craving Vietnamese food. The quality, portion size, and fair pricing make it a solid choice, especially for banh mi lovers. While I wish the ownership had been upfront about the background, I can‚Äôt deny that the food itself is good and consistent.

author: Kate Mao
text: Saiguette has a really excellent Banh Mi. The lemongrass pork shoulder is my absolute favorite, the spicy creamy sauce is delicious and the pork is juicy. The veggies inside are generously portioned and the bread is crispy and soft. I probably eat it once a week and its genuinely almost a perfect sandwich.

author: Pippa Harding
text: Incredible pork shoulder lemongrass Banh Mi! Best I have ever had. The fresh bread is delicious, perfect flavour balance. Can't recommend enough.

author: Anthony Huang
text: Worth every moment. Their Grilled Juicy Boneless Chicken Thigh and the Grilled Lemon Grass Pork Shoulder banh mi was a whole new experience worth trying! One of my top choices!!

author: Emily Francisco
text: i went during lunch time so it was 10% off the Vietnamese iced coffee was strong and sweet. The pork sandwich was delish and so filling. The place doesn't have any indoor seating. however, its 2 blocks from central park

author: Robert Kachroo
text:
A typical bar with a restaurant vibe. A few TVs with sports, friendly staff, a few good draft beers on tap.

Amazing happy hour. $5 margaritas are tasty and they don't skimp on the alcohol. My favorite food are the wings and truffle fries.

Outdoor seating too. It can get busy and very loud. But at the same time lively.

It's classic sports bar style is familiar, has great food, friendly staff, a bargain happy hour. What's not to like. Stop by here if nearby.

author: Ji Seok Lee
text: One incompetent action after another. I ordered pick up it took 85 minutes. I should charge them for waiting my time. They told me they lost my order after 55 minutes and that a menu order was unavailable for take out after 80 minutes. I think i was too polite and accommodating for service this poor. I was forced to stand around for half an hour and they did absolutely nothing to make it up to me or try to kake things right. Not even an apology. The food is fine, but not worth this. Maybe if the food was even great but it's just good. Dishes are hit or miss. Some are really bland. I was not my decision to eat here and definitely won't ever be again.

author: Steve Bundy
text: Staff friendly and professional. Atmosphere/decor a bit dated but in a familiar way not worn out. It's a pub feel that you would want to visit often with your closest friend group. Chicken was dry. All greens fresh and tasty in salad. I think the pretzel was frozen and prepackaged then heated up or microwaved. Beer was great!

author: Doc Golden
text: We hosted a private party here for 50 people. The space was great and the staff was excellent! Bart, Max & James took care of absolutely everything we needed, were available whenever we needed anything and they were all delightful to work with.

author: Guy Eichler
text: An above average sports bar close to Columbia university. Good variety of food around $18 for a burger and fries which is not bad nowadays. Big variety of drinks and they always show main sports events on their many screens. You can watch a game from any table except for outdoors. It‚Äôs a big place but can get crowded sometimes. They have a standing area close to the bar.

author: Angela Rodriguez
text: I was looking for some Cuchifrito and stopped by La Isla. Over all it's is Puerto Rican food and tastes like it too. The service was ok but the staff had somewhat of an attitude (but who in NYC doesn't have one?). Not bad overall.

author: Terixo Smitix
text: They've proven their worth through reliable quality. The meals here truly impress. The food amount exceeds expectations at costs that work. The moment they saw us, every employee showed exceptional warmth. I plan to return and tell my friends to visit.

author: Elsa Bennett
text: I appreciated the thought put into how this place feels. The food satisfies consistently and the location saves me time. The meal preparation and worker care exceeded expectations. The food quality went past merely great. This spot is EXCELLENT!

author: Judith Vasquez
text: La Isla presents a challenge in knowing what to highlight first. Their meals taste fresh and come beautifully arranged. This spot fulfilled my expectations completely. Good food. Truly excellent staff. I appreciated the consistent quality.

author: Jilliann Thomas
text:
Overpriced and Rude Service

I've been here before, but after today, I will never return. I ordered a small soup, which used to be $6, and was shocked to see the price jump to $8.50. When I asked why, I was completely ignored. On top of that, the older lady at the register showed zero interest in serving me. She pinched the money from my hand like she didn‚Äôt even want to take it. The combination of ridiculous price hikes and rude service makes this place a hard pass for me. Definitely not worth it!

author: Idrees Khan
text:
Because of Safari, Somali food has now become one of my favorite cuisines ever! We ordered the Beef Suqaar, Mango Curry Chicken, and Hilib Ari. Literally everything was absolutely delicious!
The owner was extremely hospitable and I honestly cannot wait to go again. Make sure to ask for bananas to enhance the experience with your rice!

author: Tracy Wu (Yu-Lun)
text:
The food is good, but I suggest not going without a reservation.
We came in on a Friday night around 7 p.m. There was a huge group and a few other tables. Sadly, we were unable to get our starter until 8:30 p.m. and our entree at around 9 p.m. We were very frustrated to see that the staff was busy serving other tables and ignored us.
However, the food is delicious and authentic. If we can revisit this restaurant, we will definitely make a reservation.

author: InTheName OfFashion
text:
We stopped into Safari in Harlem for lunch, and at first, the completely empty dining room made us question our choice‚Äîbut I‚Äôm so glad we stayed!
Service-wise, our waiter wasn‚Äôt the friendliest or most attentive, but honestly, the food was so good it didn‚Äôt even matter.

We started with the Chicken Sambuca‚Äîperfectly thin, flaky dough wrapped around juicy, flavorful meat. Light, tasty, and a fantastic appetizer. For mains, we had the Goat (Hilib Ari) and the Lamb Shoulder. The lamb was a little on the dry side, but the goat was absolutely sublime‚Äîso tender it melted in your mouth, with amazing flavors and seasoning. The accompanying rice was aromatic and beautifully spiced, pairing perfectly with the meats.

Next time I‚Äôm in NYC, I‚Äôll definitely be coming back!

author: Gabriella Nicole
text: I was skeptical at first. I heard good things about this restaurant, but it was empty when I came in. Don‚Äôt be fooled by that though, the food is AMAZING. My friends and I barely spoke while we were eating. Just silence and the occasional joyful giggles because our bodies were in heaven. Please come in and make sure you try the chai, hibiscus juice and mango lassi. Also come with friends so you can get the full experience.

author: Betty Chen
text: The seating in the back is really traditional and cozy. Server was so nice and keep our chai tea warm all the time plus we got extra chai on the house. Food is well seasoned. The sauce was super delicious.

author: Irina Gu
text: I ordered the lunch special. The spicy tuna was very strange in color (yellow to gray), had no taste, and was not spicy. I would not recommend it. The eel avocado roll looked like a skin-ell avocado roll. :) The phyladelfia roll was okay. The food deserves 3 stars.

author: Locale Monkey
text: Sapps is the best for Japanese food. Good environment, good price and a lot of space! Specially if you wanna do birthday party or celebrating something special for your special moment and with special person.

author: tessa Lennox
text: Food was great! I enjoyed the tempura and takoyaki. The servers are very nice and the bathroom has a ton of anime and manga references :)

author: Steven Miller
text: My favorite neighborhood spot in LIC. Staff remember you, your order and are great people. Food-wise - I don‚Äôt know better sushi at this price point in the city. Is it omakase counter level? No. But, for a causal spot, this place is excellent.

author: Charlotte Cockburn
text: Honestly AMAZING meal! Food, service, atmosphere were all 10/10!! The teriyaki tofu was unreal and the sushi was delish!

author: Ori ‚ÄúLora‚Äù
text: Today had a horrific experience at this restaurant El Nuevo caridad  . I ordered baked chicken with beans and a salad, but when I started eating, I was disgusted to find a bug in my food. I immediately called the restaurant and asked to speak to a supervisor. He apologized and offered to send me a new order, but I was too sick to my stomach after seeing the bug. I asked for a refund instead, which he provided. I returned the remaining food, bug and all. Needless to say, I do not recommend this restaurant‚Ä¶ No compren comida aqu√≠ es asqueroso encontr√© una mosca, cucaracha en mi orden que asco!!!

author: Dess R
text: Most of the workers barley know English which is why I‚Äôm rating a 3. Very hard to explain what you want if you do not have or see someone who speaks both languages (English and Spanish) but I  came for the lunch special . Great price and great food . The rice and the chicken were very good .

author: Stacy P
text:
Food was okay, but the bill was totally different than the printed menu prices. The menu said sides were included but when the bill came we were charged separately. Total scam, the waitress didn‚Äôt say anything about sides being charged separately even though we asked when we ordered. The food was definitely not worth the overpriced cost.

Do not trust this restaurant to be honest. Stay away.

author: Sha J
text: I placed an order on uber eats. The restaurant called to say that they didnt have the food that I wanted. I told them that I would cancel on my end on uber eats and while I'm on the chat with customer service to get my full refund back, they canceled my order and I got charged for food I didn't receive. I will never patronize this restaurant ever again

author: Shanni L
text: Please please be careful me and my fiance do not feel good after eating from heregiving you guys another chance our stomach's hurt it was a whole chicken rice beans and mojito will not be ordering I remember years ago before covid 19 you guys actually cared were very clean never any issues with food but never again we will not order again no more chances

author: Violetta S
text: A wonderful place for lunch with a warm and cozy atmosphere. Every dish is thoughtfully prepared and full of flavor ‚Äî you can truly taste the love in every bite. The service was exceptional, and the staff were friendly, attentive, and welcoming. Huge thanks to the team for making the experience so special. Keep up the great work ‚Äî I‚Äôll definitely be coming back soon!

author: Karuth Williams
text: The aesthetic was super cute‚Äîdefinitely a cozy, stylish spot. We started with the Crispy Feta Cigars and the Beef & Pork Dumplings with caramelized onions, and both were absolutely mouthwatering. For the main, I had the Steak Frites (petite tender), which was incredibly satisfying‚Äîespecially paired with those perfectly crisp truffle fries.  We had a fantastic server‚Äîwarm, attentive, and really added to the experience. And the cocktails? Total hits. Definitely looking forward to coming back! Also The music selection was very cutesy very mindful. ü§ç

author: Diego C.
text: The food here is absolutely fantastic! The atmosphere is also really lovely; it's the perfect place to relax and enjoy a good meal. And the best part is, you usually don't have to wait for a table. I can't understand why this restaurant isn't as popular as it should be ‚Äì it's a real gem! I highly recommend giving it a try.

author: Kimberly Dugan
text:
The food was good. Let me start with that. It wasn't anything spectacular. The menu was fixed, but the variety was pretty good. I don't personally think it was worth the price. Now the details.

The beet salad was delicious. It was one of the appetizers. The oysters were good, however, one of the oysters had a pea crab in it. That really put us off.

The lamb was the best part of the meal. It was cooked perfectly, and the brussel sprouts they sat on were so flavorful.

The lobster ravioli were rather underwhelming. And again, for the cost, the quantity and presentation were both lacking.

Overall a good meal. We most likely will not be back

author: Jimmy Davis
text: I love this place. It‚Äôs so casual and comfortable and the food is sooooo good. Feels like one of those neighborhood gems. With unpretentious atmosphere and homey vibes. Everything I‚Äôve eaten has tasted great, like authentic home cooking. Borscht with meat, beef stroganoff, kale salad. All yum.

author: Ladii E
text: I was looking for a spot to grab lunch and walked by this place. Did a quick google search and the reviews were good so I decided to give it a try. I ordered 2 lunch specials and paid about $30 total. It was around 2 pm on a Friday and there were just 2 people dining in. The decor is probably the best thing about this place. It makes you feel like you‚Äôve stepped outta Brooklyn, right into Thailand. The dumplings were yummy but that‚Äôs about it. Food was basic and bland. The presentation was there at all (they could‚Äôve done better even for take out). The crispy fried chicken that‚Äôs supposed to go with one of the rice looked like a damn joke. The girl behind the bar seemed annoyed that I asked for a menu like ma‚Äôam. Let‚Äôs be so forreal ! She also had an attitude with the couple who were drinking because their meal was incorrect. I would NOT recommend !!

author: Veronika Parchevska
text:
During my recent visit to Rua Thai in Brooklyn, I was impressed by the perfect combination of a cozy atmosphere and attentive service. The restaurant's interior, designed in Thai style, exudes warmth, making it a welcoming space suitable for both casual dining and special events.
From the appetizer menu, we tried the Shrimp Donuts, which were wonderfully creamy, accompanied by a sauce that was truly delicious, along with the most exquisite Cheesy Crab Rangoon. For the main course, the Kai Tod Had Yai special was beautifully prepared, flaky, and seasoned to perfection. They even adjusted the spice level of the Rua Volcano to be milder just for us, and it was delightful.
The team at Rua Thai demonstrated remarkable attentiveness. Our server offered valuable suggestions, quickly refilled our drinks, and made certain that our dining experience was pleasant.
I highly recommend Rua Thai Restaurant.

author: Xintong Huang
text: Amazing Thai spot in Brooklyn! The Tomyum grilled river prawns were flavorful and beautifully presented, and the teriyaki fried rice with steak and egg came sizzling hot and perfectly seasoned. Great Thai tea too ‚Äî rich and creamy. Cozy vibe and super friendly staff. Definitely coming back! üáπüá≠‚ú®

author: Jimmy Zhao
text:
RUA Thai is a cozy Thai restaurant in Brooklyn with a warm and relaxed atmosphere. The staff is friendly and the service is smooth.

The Grab Curry (soft shell crab curry) is the highlight ‚Äî rich flavor, real Thai spice, and very delicious with rice. The Thai Iced Tea is creamy and helps balance the heat.

The cocktail Chili & The Moon is fun and unique. It‚Äôs made with mezcal and mango puree, and it comes with sweet crispy fish snacks on the side ‚Äî surprisingly tasty.

The Steak & Egg Teriyaki Fried Rice is also very good. The steak is tender and the egg on top makes the rice extra flavorful.

For dessert, the Mango Coconut Sticky Rice is fresh and sweet, with strong coconut flavor.

Overall, great food, real Thai taste, and a nice place to relax. Definitely worth trying!

author: Yongyi Li
text:
Really great Thai spot in Brooklyn! The food was full of flavor and everything tasted super fresh.
We tried the Mala Wings, Tom Yum Soup, Drunken Noodles, and the Teriyaki Steak ‚Äî all amazing!
The staff were really friendly and the atmosphere was cozy but stylish. Perfect for a casual dinner or date night üçúüíõ
Highly recommend if you‚Äôre around Smith Street!

author: Lindsay Alexander
text: Great pancakes and cute atmosphere. We didn‚Äôt have to wait to long even with no reservation. Bacon was crispy. I want to come back sometime for dinner! CASH ONLY

author: Princess Williams
text: I've been here about 6 times. I haven't been disappointed AT ALL! Which is why my husband and I keep coming back. I've had the tacos, salmon, pancakes, and today my husband had the French toast. The food is awesome. The service is great. The atmosphere is cool. They even have a cute, quiet, little corner to eat if you're dining alone which I've done and read my book. They also have an outside area in the back. I plan on becoming a regular here. 10 out of 10 HIGHLY recommend!

author: Jeff Tsang
text: I‚Äôve ordered delivery from here quite frequently and it‚Äôs normally good, but I ordered a medium rare salmon today and got something that was ice cold and mealy in the center, something like 80% raw past the surface. I‚Äôm guessing they might have cooked the filet straight from the fridge??? Either way it‚Äôs not medium rare.

author: Liz Cong
text:
Tasty Brunch Spot, fluffy pancakes and mimosas
üòãü•ûüçæ

Came here back in November and just now getting around to this review‚Ä¶but it was memorable enough for me to remember this Sunday morning with my sister and hubby.

Wait wasn‚Äôt too long but there is a queue‚Ä¶earlier is better.

Menu has standard breakfast, brunch and lunch fare.

I ordered the salmon salad and was pleasantly surprised with the generous portion of salmon, avocado and crisp fresh veggies. Salmon was cooked perfectly.

Pancakes were so good. Crisp edges and fluffy goodness. Hard to share this.

Eggs Benedict - good, potatoes could have been a tad more seasoned but they were cooked nicely. Love that you can order just one portion.

Mimosas were a good accompaniment to a great brunch.
Service was fast and attentive.

Nice, lively neighborhood eatery.

author: Kyana Ifill
text: So crazy thing but I must say, worst thing here is the pancake. I know it gets all the hype and the other reviews are true, crispy edges and fluffy inside but that‚Äôs literally it. The actual pancake has no flavor and needs syrup. I am a fan of specialty pancakes with the fruit in flavor baked/cooked in. If you want a classic pancake that requires copious syrup, here you go! Otherwise skip that. Otherwise the food was shockingly good. We got a couple sunny side eggs and sausage (delicious of course), the open faced grilled chicken sandwich and chips and guacamole‚Ä¶.that might have been the best chips and guacamole I‚Äôve ever had. And based on the comments about the chilaquiles I think the sleeper here is the Mexican food. The grilled chicken sandwich was good, great sauce and stuffed once you tried to close it. The sourdough was delicious and toasty. I saw another table order chips and guacamole and clearly got more chips than us so they aren‚Äôt standardized with that unfortunately. Our service was also incredibly slow. I saw people who sat after us get food, drink, and get order taken before us. We waited about 20 min to get our orders taken and the food took long to come out. Unfortunately sandwich is not pictured. The Shirley temple was quite good per my bf but I gave up soda for lent so didn‚Äôt try. But it was so good he ordered two. I got apple juice and I‚Äôm not sure why I got a smaller cup, that‚Äôs always a pet peeve of mine, different size cups for juice vs soda or tea. Anyways I would definitely come back for Tex mex night or something else. Menu was extensive and a lot of things (salad, sandwich, pasta) looked good. Once again MUST DROP A STAR IF YOU‚ÄôRE CASH ONLY IN 2025.

author: Michael ‚ÄúMarion‚Äù Pena
text: Had brunch with a good friend, we both had meal sets with happy hour drinks and dessert! Came out to about $48 each, and the sake cup with the panda design is free to take back home! This is the best, authentic izakaya-style Japanese restaurant in Washington Heights. Music wasn‚Äôt too loud but still contributed to the good vibes. Shout out to our server Peter!

author: Francelys Abreu (Curlyceliss)
text: My partner and I love this place for it‚Äôs authenticity. The food is very fresh and ridiculously delicious. I love they included a new combo of a mini ramen bowl. Our recommendation will be that the place should upgrade to a bigger spot because it feels very overwhelming when its full and there are other people waiting inside for a spots to be available.

author: Darren Thompson
text:
Its a small location, but its got a vibe! The staff were nice. The floor is a bit uneven, bur thats typical of hole in the wall NYac restaurants. Not complaining, though.

Several vegetarian/vegan options.

Loved it

author: Kevin hernandez
text: There‚Äôs a ton of ramen spots in NYC. But this one is FIREüî•everything from the appetizer to the entrees and their home made ginger ale goes well with a spicy bowl of ramen ! I got the spiciest ramen I think it had dragon in its name and my girl got the spicy miso ramen‚Ä¶definitely recommend! Try their fried chicken and pan seared pork and veggie dumplings too! This spot was a solid 10 for me üò≠

author: Claire
text: The mini-sized ramen set was satisfying and well put together. I wanted more dumplings, so I ordered another one. I think I‚Äôll be craving that ale beer again, too.

author: Abedallah darwish
text: My first 5/5! I truly enjoyed my meal here. The service was good but the star of the show was the atmosphere and of course the food. would come again anytime i‚Äôm back in NY.

author: Aatiq Antique
text:
I recently visited Saggio, a Sicilian restaurant, and found the experience mixed.

The interior was inviting, with a warm and cozy atmosphere that made for a pleasant dining environment.

As for the food, the fried calamari was decent‚Äîcrispy and tender, but it lacked the standout flavor I was hoping for. The chicken was okay as well; it was well-cooked but didn't have the depth of seasoning I expected.

Overall, while Saggio has a nice ambiance, the food could use some improvement to truly shine.

author: Kilgore Trout
text:
Saggio is a far and away a main staple of the neighborhood and has been for years. I've been here many times and have never left unsatisfied.

Is it the best Italian you've ever had, especially in a city like New York? Probably not. But they're insanely consistent and the service is warm and friendly--especially their bar staff. They have a lot of employees that have been there for years and very much care for the clientele they serve and they make an effort to actually remember you.

I'm a fan of their frequent rotating dinner specials that change from season-to-season. They rarely miss. I've also never had something off of their main menu that I've ever disliked, and I love to try new things, so it's nice to have a wide spread to let you adventure out, but you can always find the regular go-tos as well.

It's a relief to have somewhere that you can trust like them in Hudson Heights.

The wife and I are a big fan of their bottomless brunch on the weekends. Their back patio is a gorgeous little cozy nook in the middle of the city that blocks out all of the noise from the busy street in front of it.

Since they changed out the old tables to booths, the ambiance has felt very cozy. Vibes are on-point.

If you come back frequently, you'll see a lot of regulars at the bar during happy hour, and people aren't afraid to engage in conversation, which is abnormal (and welcome) in recent times. I've randomly met some pretty cool people.

author: jana moubarak
text: This restaurant is a hidden gem. It is the perfect ambience for a date, but also for a chill hang out with a group of friends. The waiters were professional and it was a very quick service. I had the penne pomodoro pasta, which I highly recommend. It was very flavorful and delicious. I also had tiramisu for dessert, which is the best tiramissu I have ever had. The prices are also very affordable for such a beautiful place.

author: Nathan Useche
text: I was out with my family when we came in out of nowhere. With no reservation, we entered to be welcomed by a great ambience and aroma. The service was exceptional and my black pasta was amazing. My family greatly enjoyed their meal too. Everything was fresh and I couldn‚Äôt be happier. The Ricotta Cheesecake for dessert was very nice and unique, not too sweet but of great flavor. I will for sure be back in the future!

author: Blair Boyer
text:
GREAT food! The Pizza is real New York and the sandwiches are amazing. I have the Meatball Parm or Eggplant Parm Panini...both very filling and tastes. They also have great salads. My favorite is the Kale & Fig Salad. Also try the Garlic Knots!
Prices are very affordable. The staff is super friendly.

author: Crash Gregg
text: A great place in the Washington Heights neighborhood for a slice of good homemade pie, pasta, panini, or even a salad. Friendly folks clean tables, and good customer service. Try the Margherita, the Sicilian, or any of their great specialty pies.

author: Andre Schoolman
text:
A local pizza place, with specialty pies beyond your basic cheese, pepperoni, etc. not tons of seating, very crowded on Fridays and weekends, but always a good vibe.

The one problem I have with this local establishment is the prices; $6 before tax for a speciality slice (basically anything not cheese) is shooting way over the average city price, especially because you can go a few blocks away and get a reasonably priced slice of slightly lesser quality.

Restaurants are not immune to inflation, but this place seems to be taking it to a new level, and disregarding the actual value of their product. Because of the prices, I am a less frequent customer.

author: me4tisbivayutsya
text:
I usually like this place, but there is one FEMALE CASHIER who makes the whole experience terrible. She is extremely rude, disrespectful, and talks to customers in a very unprofessional way. Yesterday she even overcharged me for two slices ‚Äî almost $14‚Äî and I only noticed when I got home. I paid with a credit card, so I didn‚Äôt see the total right away.
Her attitude is unacceptable. I hope the management pays attention to this, because customers shouldn‚Äôt be treated like this.

UPG: Please listen to me for a moment. I completely understand that you are a family-run business, and maybe this cashier is your relative ‚Äî your sister, daughter, or someone close. But that does not give her the right to speak to customers in a raised voice, be disrespectful, rude, or make personal comments.

To be honest, I really like your pizza. I like the place, the atmosphere, everything. But I will never come back again ‚Äî not because of your food or prices, but because of this one cashier. And as long as she continues to work there, I personally will not return.

I have also spoken with several neighbors in our area, and everyone says the same thing ‚Äî her rudeness is not only toward customers, but also toward delivery workers and even other staff. It creates a very unpleasant experience.

Please don‚Äôt reply with a standard template message. Just take this seriously and pay attention to the situation.

author: Kilgore Trout
text:
Fresco's is a reliable, no frills neighborhood pizza joint that you can rely on.

They're consistent, but full disclosure, they're going to charge you out the wazoo for just about everything. Even a basic slice is as pricey as you'd pay down on Bleecker Street, so don't expect any uptown discount. But their Vodka Slice worth every damn penny. The wife and I prefer to come in and get various slices between the two of us, because a whole pie can set you back over $30 at times.

Pro Tip: Pay in cash. Pay a little less.

As with most other spots in the 'hood, you'll be left supplementing your own salt and seasoning, because the aging demographic has a stranglehold on every restaurant in the area in regards to sodium content. The white-haired rabble generally want the bare minimum. And they complain about. A lot. I guess they're salty enough.

Fresco's also has a nice spread of different slices--especially white pies--which is pretty unique to most other spots in the city, who only offer red pies. They're absolutely a class above most other pizza joints in the neighborhood.

It's a family run shop, so you'll see the same people behind the counter time after time. Most of the time they're pretty friendly, especially the dudes baking your slices, they go the extra mile to keep you returning and will make small talk if they're not overwhelmed. Good fellas.

If you haven't been inside and only walked by outside, you've assuredly dodged the swath of bikes and delivery guys outside that make it look like a post-apocalyptic bicycle gang occupies their space, but it just turns out they're one of the most delivered pizza joints in the entire US, so I can only assume they know what they're doing to keep people happy. I sure am.

author: Cecilia Perez
text:
Omg this place was amazing!! Everything was super freaking delicious where we were happy to spend the money. I do have one small complaint that we opted to order the LARGE Henny Colada cocktails but were not warned that they were $60 each!! Luckily,we could afford it but I know that it could be a problem for some people. The drinks were tasty, strong and had 3 small Hennessy bottles as floaters do they were totally worth the $ but still, a little warning would've been nice.

Every single dish had soooo much flavor!!

author: Nery Espinal
text: This restaurant exceeded all my expectations. The food was delicious, and the service was outstanding. I will return and bring family members to enjoy the excellent Honduran cuisine.

author: Pinero QGTM
text: Restaurante catracho todo estuvo delicioso. Las baleadas and pupusas were delicious . Will be coming back for the fried chicken

author: Michael Ruggieri
text: This has become my new favorite place to eat‚Ä¶ I highly recommend it!! Food is so good and if you want to drink this is the place‚Ä¶ask for a large drink, I dare you‚Ä¶incredible‚Ä¶so good!!!

author: Dionne Grinage
text: I had am amazing time at Seis Vecinos. Shelley was my waitress. She was amazing. The food was fantastic as well. I ordered the Seafood Paella. It was perfectly seasoned and came with a salad . They sung Happy Birthday to me and made me feel so special.  I will definitely be back. I'm so lucky to have this gem of a restaurant so close in my neighborhood. You don't need to go to Manhattan for excellent service.

author: Dieter Ferreira
text:
Solid 4.5 here. When are they going to allow half-points?
Excellent cocktails variety. Indulge if you must.
First time here at the UrbanCoveSociety (is this related to the Guernsey Literary & Potato Peel Pie Society?), drawn by the promise of good branzino and real tablecloths üôÑ, part of the 33 Seaport Hotel.
Quietish early on a Sat evening. The decor could use a hand, me thinks, but great low-key music.

The branzino (European seabass) came fileted (not whole per pictures) and did not disappoint! Was so impressed I forgot photo... maybe it was the cognac... Intriguing lemon chili dressing, supported graciously by oodles of garlic in my spinach side order. Recommended.
Last but not least, the banana bread pudding was a bit firmer than my dessert fork grip expected, but matched well by excellent caramel ice cream so overall very good.

author: Lisa Hall
text:
So we bought a travel zoo voucher and went for brunch on a Sunday. When we arrived there was no one in the front. We waited about 4 mins before we actually saw someone.

We were seated and offered some water.  No one introduced themselves through the whole process. The restaurant was cool, and the atmosphere was chill. It was not a busy afternoon at all. There were only 4 groups in total in the whole place.

We waited about 10 minutes before a young lady came over and we showed her our voucher and told her what we wanted. THEY HAD NO CHICKEN AND NO STEAK! It was not okay because my friend only eats chicken. Anyway we adjusted and I got a burger and she got French toast.

We waited 45 mins for our food....did I mention it was not busy. The pastry basket was very sad, and no one checked on us after we got the mimosas. A gentle man came over to say sorry there was no chicken 2 mins before the food came out. The burger was salty, I ate it because I was hungry. My friend said her French toast was good.

We waited long in general for everything, the food, the bill, the service. Really had to rethink the tipping but she did leave a tip anyway.

author: Alizabeth
text:
This restaurant was an incredible find! I used a Groupon for a three-course dinner for two, and everything went perfectly ‚Äî no issues at all. The food was outstanding, especially the mashed potatoes (seriously, don‚Äôt skip them!). The cocktails were not only gorgeous but also tasted amazing.
The staff were warm, attentive, and made us feel right at home. The ambiance was calm and elegant, with great music that set the perfect mood. Honestly, I‚Äôd give this place more than 10/10 if I could ‚Äî I‚Äôm already looking forward to my next visit!

author: Kaliana Martinez
text: This place is absolutely amazing!!! I had a groupon for a 3 course dinner for 2 and no complications at all. All of the food was phenomenal especially their mashed potatoes (must try!!) Their cocktails were beautiful and so great. The staff were very attentive and super sweet and welcoming. The place was very quiet with a gorgeous atmosphere and a plus for great music too. 100/10 and I hope to come back soon!

author: josh hill
text: The shellfish platter was outstanding, featuring fresh head-on prawns, chilled lobster tail, and locally sourced oysters. Everything was incredibly fresh and cooked to perfection. The specialty bourbon cocktail recommended by our server paired beautifully with the meal. I can‚Äôt wait to return!

author: Joel Hernandez
text: Wow, the wait to get in was long! Was it worth it? Well the favor was different from the Chinese food I‚Äôm accustomed too. Not offensive but definitely different. Egg rolls were amazing! Service was top notch we got along with our server, an instant rapport was created! He was witty, sarcastic, funny and genuine. They can cook to your dietary needs.

author: Mona Posti
text:
Do not go here!!

Family dinner. We ordered two kinds of vegetable low mein. Our usual chinese favorite. But in this restaurant the noodles tasted like burned grease. Neither of us was able to eat the noodles. The vegetables were ok. Our child had chicken fried rice. He could not eat his food either. I told two members of the staff that we could not eat the food and definitely we did not want to take it with us. They did not care.
As soon as we paid, they started emptying the table although we still had our drinks. While I used the bathroom, they actually took my daughter's drink from her and asked her and the child to leave the table.
Advice: do not pay before you are definitely ready to leave immediately. Staff is extremely rude.
Only one unisex bathroom available :(

author: Eliesabeth Gasser
text: Delicious and absolutely classic NY restaurant. The service here is direct and fast paced, as is common in Chinatown. I celebrated my birthday here with a party of 10!! They set up a table just for us, despite not taking reservations. We had a FEAST of food, for less than 25$ per person, including beers. Come here with friends and eat up! Make sure to order the duck fried rice, a Lo mein, and the snow peas with bean sprouts. They do all of the Cantonese-American classics well, so really order anything. Everyone was so fun and kind. We were cracking jokes all night and they even gave me a free Wo Hop t-shirt for my birthday! Love these guysssss.

author: David Cabanzo
text: What a classic nyc Chinese restaurant! Very cool atmosphere. The service is quick and servers are super nice. The fried rice was incredible and the veggies but the pineapple duck wasn‚Äôt good! It was super sweet and the pink sauce definitely doesn‚Äôt help. Maybe next time will get classic dishes not some sort of specials.

author: Marie Fetzer
text:
The place was super busy, but surprisingly there was a table for me. I enjoyed the fried fish. It was delicious. I wish my friends were with me because I wanted to try more food but didn't want to be wasteful. I have already planned my trip back to try more.

It's a really cool and unique place serving authentic Chinese cuisine. The price was so reasonable. My meal was under $20. I left feeling happy and full. The service was great.

The place is in a basement and it is a bit cramped. Lots of orders going out the door for takeout.

I did not wait to be seated.

This place has unique decor and vibe.

author: deepan prabhu
text:
Mapo tofu rocks,

Usually all chinese places give a liquid like water with tofu, but here it‚Äôs so savory, flavor filled, spicy and up for grabs!

The cedar fried rice tastes awesome, usually has a motor oil/wok taste to it - but thats what  I bought it for.

Tasty chow fun, mild, flavor rich and yummy.

Beef coriander soup was okish.

Don‚Äôt get the dumplings, they seem fresh but just have a bland doughy taste.

author: Adnan Jehan
text: We got the gluten free beef chow mein and it was a very underwhelming dish. They straight up brought exactly that and nothing else. No vegetables in the dish, no soy sauce and no chili sauce. For the cost, a little crazy. We had to channel the vegetables previously cooked in the same wok through the noodles to pretend to enjoy it. A little effort in dish would have gone a long way. When you order ask what else is in your dishes before trusting the menu. I get simplicity but for $20 bucks that was under simple.

author: Isabella Furrick
text: For an appetizer, we got the jellyfish. It was so bouncy. The daikon and carrot slaw cut the saltiness nicely. For an entree, we got the chef‚Äôs special and asked for it very spicy. It did not disappoint!! We also got the lamb and mixed vegetables in garlic sauce. The lamb texture was on point, and the dish was very flavorful. Would absolutely recommend if you have dietary restrictions, they‚Äôre very accommodating!!

author: Robert Vilches
text: This place is the real deal. Great food. Great portion sizes. Always end up ordering too much, but always end up finishing everything because the food is great. Super clean restaurant. Cool staff. Dinner menu is awesome, but the Dim Sum menu is where it‚Äôs at. Shark fin dumplings, mushroom rice rolls, sticky rice lotus leaf are favorites of mine but you can‚Äôt go wrong with anything.

author: Bradley C
text:
This is my favorite vegetarian Chinese restaurant. We ordered pan fried dumplings, tofu skin with cedar sauce, mixed sea food with cedar sauce in taro bowl, eggplant in spicy laksa sauce, Buddha‚Äôs delight pan fried noodles, and Fujian fried rice.

Everything was so delicious. I love their cedar sauce. It goes so well with everything, and it‚Äôs so fragrant and savory.

My favorite dish was the mixed seafood with cedar sauce in taro bowl. It has been my no. 1 for a long time. I have to get it whenever I‚Äôm here. I also love the Buddha‚Äôs delight pan fried noodles. The crunchy noodles with slightly gluey sauce were just perfect. Especially when the noodles were mixed with the sauce and got a bit saggy, it was the most delightful texture. The braised tofu skin with cedar sauce was also very good. I especially love the cabbage they put in the bottom of the plate. It absorbs the flavor and with the sweetness of its own.

It was my first time trying their Fujian fried rice. The idea was very similar to the Buddha‚Äôs delight pan fried noodles, but replaced the noodles with fried rice. I love the bits of the ham in the sauce.

Everything was simply delicious, but just like almost all Chinese food, it‚Äôs a bit greasy. Good thing was they had some tea to go with it. The servers were also pretty pleasant and friendly.

author: Sam
text:
The food tasted and looked as though it was the free offering on a continental economy flight. The steak was so bad we questioned whether it was steak at all. Absolute robbery at the price they charge.

The service was friendly and attentive and they accommodated a large group. Granted the restaurant was empty, which after eating the food, was understandable.

It reminded me a bit of food one would find at a gas station in regards to its freshness.

It is scraping an extra star on account of the service alone. Which wasn‚Äôt breaking any records but was nonetheless inoffensive.

Will gladly not return to ‚ÄúEastwood NY‚Äù

author: rich caplan
text: I love this place! The food is perfect.  Perfectly presented with attentive and friendly service within a space that has vinyl spun tunes and great beer. I‚Äôm going very soon.

author: Brendan A. MacWade
text: A really nice restaurant that is very committed to outdoor and ventilated dining. The menu is a little eccentric! It's American-European-Israeli. Like Oliver Bar nearby, it can only serve spritzes, beer, and wine (no cocktails). But their spritzes are inspired. It's a cool place. Service is super friendly. The bar is excellent, and it spins music on vinyl. I can't wait to go back!

author: Rebecca Emilia Malley
text: This is a neighborhood hang. The food is bar food but that doesn‚Äôt mean it isn‚Äôt tasty just is solid food that‚Äôs simple and gets the job done when hungry, plus the drinks, location and the amazing staff take all this up to a 5. It‚Äôs a place you want to come back because it has a heart and soul - theirs are regulars, working folk, meetups that are occurring for business or friends that haven‚Äôt seen each other in sometime. One of those unique and beautiful community waterholes.

author: Matty Lee
text:
A beautiful, casual but intimate bar/restaurant. Great for those private days when you want to read a book during lunch or bring friends in the evening.

Beautiful wine selection, their falafel, French fries, cauliflower pita sandwhich, hummus dishes are tasty.

Would recommend.

author: Kiril Kuzmin
text: This places serves real Spanish food, which does not happen too often in the United States, unfortunately. Lovely. The only thing that I would change is that majority of tables are in the open area, I would prefer a bit more intimate atmosphere.

author: C B (CB)
text: Much√≠simas gracias por todos los a√±os de excelente servicio y deliciosa comida! Y por celebrar conmigo un a√±o mas! I work in the area and I have been a loyal customer for almost 15 years and although many things have changed food quality and excellent service haven‚Äôt! Staff is attentive and knowledgeable, I always feel welcomed there! Whether you want a solo lunch at the bar or come with a happy group of friends for yheir delicious sangria and paella you won‚Äôt be disappointed!! Lunch specials are great, so is the paella, solomillo, bacalao and pollo al ajillo.  Desserts are delicious! tres leches flan was a chef‚Äôs kiss! Come for the sangria stay for the service!! Thank you guys for all the years of service and good memories!

author: Patrick Lopez
text: I have been going to El Pote since I was a baby and while I don‚Äôt remember those early visits I remember the recent ones with fondness. The staff is excellent. They have always been friendly and accommodating, but beyond that they are remarkably good at their job. The food has always been delicious and the portions are usually more than my family and I can handle, leading to the arguments of who gets to eat the leftovers. The red sangria is a staple for my family followed by some combination of paella and most recently the fideua. El Pote is an establishment of New York and should be revered amongst New Yorkers who enjoy quality.

author: Zorica "Zora" Poljak, eXp Realty
text: The food at El Pote Espa√±ol was absolutely delicious! The staff was friendly, welcoming, and made the experience feel warm and personal.

author: Mike Miguel
text: El Pote Espa√±ol offers a delightful dining experience with a cozy, intimate atmosphere. The service was attentive and knowledgeable about the menu, making for a pleasant evening. We had a great time! Staff is very friendly and the food is exquisite! Highly recommended! Thank you!

author: Amandip Kaur
text: I came here for my birthday brunch with friends and had the best experience ! Staff was very kind and service was excellent. All the dishes were very tasty and you could tell the ingredients were fresh and very good quality (they use seasonal produce from their farm). I took the biscuit & poached eggs and French toast: each dish was flavorful and well balanced. They also had freshly squeezed orange juice so 10 / 10 for me. Thank you for the hospitality; will be back for dinner soon :)

author: Jeniree Candurin
text: This is the best place I've been. They did an excellent job at every single step. First of all, the service was top notch, everyone seemed to come out of a happy movie, always kind, sweet and more. Then it came the food, OMG, I ate my place with my eyes closed just savoring every bite, and my husband's burger was not far behind, the flavor of the meat was amazing. Finally, I truly enjoyed that the environment allowed conversations without loud music blasting my ears. Overall, a great place to have a wine and relax.

author: L.
text:
Get $25 off your bill through the link on my profile!

The restaurant is located in a lovely neighborhood in Williamsburg, perfect for walking around in the summer. Aware that they used to have a Michelin star, I went in with somewhat heightened hopes but also not too expectant ‚Äî then was surprised with an incredible meal start to finish.

The whisky cocktail was really well balanced, clean and on point, crafted better than most bars. The octopus chorizo and spiced duck breast were even more delicious; from the first mouthwatering wafts when the dishes are placed on the table to the wonderful blend of flavors, everything delivered perfectly. When you ask for the bill, it comes with a small coconut dessert that‚Äôs warm and chewy. I savored every bite of it and still think about it now.

Beginning to end everything delivered! Even the leftovers I brought home and shared apparently tasted very good. Would strongly recommend this place to anyone who is considering going.

author: vfernandez515
text: Had a great time with my girlfriends. Everything from the cappuccino, to the green fried tomatoes, the huevos rancheros, the chorizo omelette and mimosa tray were amazing. Great ambience and service. Definitely coming back with the love of my life. The doughnuts were not my fave though.

author: Ken Wong
text: Meadowsweet exceeds expectations with its expertly prepared dishes in a chic restaurant near the Williamsburg Bridge. Roasted chicken with gnocchi stole the show for us. Great service too!

author: Pamelaj Payne
text: I stopped by Win Son for brunch. The line was long, but it moved pretty quickly. I ordered the fried chicken box and it was really good! Well-seasoned, crispy and juicy. I would recommend this place located in the hip neighborhood of Bushwick on Graham Ave. Outdoor seating is also available.

author: Sammy Q
text:
A modern and innovative bakery with strong potential to keep growing.

Order: Scallion pancake cheese and egg, mochi donut, fan taun, nian ago sesame fig, jasmine lavender milk tea, latte = $53~

The scallion pancake and mochi donut I've seen meet viral status on social media, for the amount of hype it's received Id say it's more the innovation behind it that's appealing than the taste. Nothing extraordinarily groundbreaking but it's an interesting refreshing twist to try. Same goes to the humble fan taun. What my friend and I mutually agreed is absolutely delicious is the seasonal nian gao fig pastry. Nian gao batter, layered with creamy custard, fig jam and topped with smooth mascoropone cream and figs - WOW. You don't have to be a sweet tooth to enjoy this, you just need to love yourself enough to treat yourself with this. Kudos to the pastry chef.

The drinks itself was fine but I felt the food does the storytelling here. I'd revisit to give the menu another shot out of curiosity. This place is for those who want to broaden their taste palette.

author: Annie Robertson
text:
Incredible Taiwanese-American Bakery. Mochi donut is to die for, unlike any other place. The scallion pancake wrapped sandwiches are also killer. My go to is the Juicai package and add bacon and of course, the BEC is yum as well. Lately I tried the shrimp milk bun (available after 3:30) and that was amazing as well. Top tier spot!

It is definitely fusion so I wouldn‚Äôt go in with expectations for it to be authentic Taiwanese food because that‚Äôs just not what it is. Lines are long on the weekends but it does move fast. It‚Äôs in my neighborhood so I like to go weekday afternoons after work ‚Äî if you‚Äôre in the area on a weekday it‚Äôs perfect and there should be plenty of spots to sit outside.

author: Sheila
text:
This review is about sustainability! ‚ò∫Ô∏è

By 2050, there will be more plastic in the ocean than fish. Which is why I so appreciate, that in this waterfront city, you choose to offer your customers the dignity of real silverware, ceramic mugs, and glasses for water.

I love to support businesses that are mindful of our impact on the environment, locally and globally.

So thank you for setting an example of how a caf√© can operate sustainably. I hope more local spots follow suit!

And of course, delicious food and a perfect cappuccino.

author: Jason Masong
text:
So fun and tasty I came here twice during my short 3 day stay in Brooklyn.

Playful Chinese-fusion bakery treats. Get the pancake wraps.

Other overlooked items are the soymilk (with dough sticks to dip in) and asian salads

Trrated myself with a red rice donut too.

author: Indy Life with Lexus
text:
Good atmosphere and very nice decoration.
I got lunch spacial eggplant basil with mock duck. They served with soup and salad(I love it)  , Quck & crunch was very good and yummy. Staffs have provided good service , nice and helpful.
Recommend this restaurant and I will come back for sure.

author: Thanapol Engel
text:
We had such an amazing experience at Forever Thai! Their Fall Special Menu truly impressed us, every dish was beautifully presented and full of bold Thai flavors. The Aquatic Duck Dance was tender and rich with red curry and fruit, while the Velvet Egg Octopus was perfectly cooked with a hint of sweetness. The Quick & Crunch duck salad was refreshing with a great balance of tangy and spicy flavors.

The cocktails were just as good, we tried the Lychee Martini, Mai Tai, and their Buy 2 Get 1 Free mystery drink, all delicious and fun for fall evenings.

The restaurant itself is cozy and elegant with great lighting and a welcoming vibe. Service was attentive and friendly throughout. Definitely one of the best Thai spots in Bushwick, we‚Äôll be back soon!

author: Curtis Bernadeau-Pierre
text: Forever Thai is an absolute delight! The food is fresh, flavorful, and beautifully balanced ‚Äî every dish felt like it was their specialty. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, perfect for a cozy dinner or casual night out. What truly made our experience special, though, was our server, Toey. He was, attentive, and took his time to explain the menu. Made us feel completely at home. It‚Äôs rare to find service this thoughtful. We‚Äôll definitely be coming back!

author: Fatima Hashem
text: My friend and I came here because we were craving thai food, and honestly this is probably one of the best places for thai we have ever tried! We loved the Thai Iced Tea and we both praised how perfectly sweet it was. I got the Basil Fried Rice and it was stunning. My friend got the Drunken Noodles and she said she loved how saucy they were, and were a good warming spice. Overall, highly recommend coming here for good food and a good atmosphere!

author: Ruben
text:
Forever Thai was truly delicious and amazing quality all around üôå I came for the $15 lunch special and also got a beer ($8 for Chang or Sinha and they brought it with a chilled glass üíúüç∫). Total after tax was 24.99 (before tipü§û). In my opinion it‚Äôs one of the best deals in the neighborhood and it lasts until 4pm

Pineapple fried rice was great and tasted fresh with a good amount of veggies, the chicken in it was solid too

They also offered me an extra Thai tea drink they had made and it was super tasty üôè disclaimer that free drinks aren‚Äôt guaranteed lol but this does show that they care about customer satisfaction and don‚Äôt want to waste food ü§ò

author: CL G
text: I loved this place. I was treated well. I walked in and ordered a latte and paisano hero. The cashier told me that it was the same price for a roll, hero or white bread. I just got it how it normally comes and told them spicy. It tasted great. The latte was legit, excellent tasting. The female working there made it for me. The place is out of my way plus I have to feed the meter, so I know I won't be coming that often. It is definitely worth a try, though. I like that they sell many different types of ravioli in the back in the freezer (among them crab and lobster).

author: Isaiah Hyman
text: After seeing this place for months on my IG feed, I decided to pop in while I was in Brooklyn to try the Matt & Steve 2.0 and The Paisano. Both sandwiches did not disappoint. The service was quick and and they also have a lot of pre-made dessert options as well. There's a couple of picnic tables outside on the side of the building but other than that, there's not much else regarding seating.

author: Adam Arciola
text: Had this place on my bucket list for a long time. Happy I finally got here, and what an awesome experience.  I got a bunch of sandwiches for myself and my family.  They were awesome!!! My wife got the FDNY, I got my mother the Anthony & Daughter and added beaded eggplant, I took home the Soza and split the Almost Perfect with my friend!!!! Everyone loved what they ate. Sampled some their's and let them try mine. The Almost Perfect was actually PERFECT!! It was such a unique sandwich that was on an amazing  semolina hero. Can't wait to go backüíØüíØüíØ!!!!!

author: Emmanuel Rodriguez
text: Just stopped in this spot for some lunch, thank goodness I did. The Tuscan delight sub was amazing, literally hit the spot just with half. I'm super glad I walked into this spot. I'll definitely come back if I'm the area.

author: Will M
text: Got the FDNY, the vodka sauce chicken cutlet sandwich with mozzarella. It was good but felt a bit dry, had to pay for an extra vodka sauce which feels a bit much considering the sandwich is already $20. Either way it was good sandwich which could last 2 meals.

author: John Gonsalves
text:
Birds of a Feather is a beautiful spot tucked away in Williamsburg that really stands out for its atmosphere and design. The space has this perfect balance of industrial and modern d√©cor exposed brick, soft lighting, and elegant touches that make it feel both stylish and welcoming. It‚Äôs one of those restaurants where you notice the details right away, from the furniture to the way the dishes are plated.
I stopped in for their lunch special, which I thought was a great deal. The prices are fairly affordable considering the quality and the portions the servings are actually quite large, so you definitely won‚Äôt leave hungry. I ordered the chili fish, and it was excellent flavorful, fresh, and just the right level of spice. The food came out quickly, which I really appreciated during lunch hours.
I also tried the egg and scallion stuffed pancake, which ended up being one of my favorite parts of the meal. It‚Äôs crispy, savory, and full of flavor the kind of dish that makes you want to come back just for that. Overall, Birds of a Feather is a great place for a relaxed but elevated meal in Williamsburg. Highly recommend checking it out, especially for lunch.

author: Andreas Kaiser
text:
‚ÄúIn‚Äù-people go to Brooklyn, not to Manhattan anymore. Many excellent restaurants are found in that corner of the dense metropole. Among them birds of a feather, a Chinese-inspired cuisine of highest quality. The interior is cool with multiple individual tables and a major communal table in the center. The atmosphere is hectic but the staff remain calm and friendly. The food was outstanding with too many choices untested and requiring us to return in the future.

(Originally posted by me on Yelp)

author: valeri bolkvadze
text:
5-Star Review for Birds of a Feather (Williamsburg, Brooklyn)
Birds of a Feather ‚Äì A True Gem for Foodies and Friend Hangouts!
If you're looking for that perfect spot where incredible food meets unbeatable vibes, Birds of a Feather in Williamsburg is your answer. This Sichuan-inspired Chinese restaurant, born from the genius minds behind Michelin-starred Cafe China, nails the balance of authentic flavors and chill atmosphere every time.
I've made it a ritual to come here with my crew ‚Äì it's hands-down my top go-to place for group hangs. The space feels warm and inviting, with those subtle nods to Chengdu's laid-back greenery that make you forget you're in the heart of Brooklyn. Whether we're splitting plates after a long week or celebrating a birthday, the energy just flows ‚Äì spacious tables, dim lighting, and that effortless cool factor that keeps conversations going all night.
But let's talk food, because oh man, it's on another level. Top-tier doesn't even cover it ‚Äì every dish is a flavor explosion. The Dan Dan noodles? Silky, spicy, and nutty perfection that had us all fighting for the last bite. We couldn't resist the cumin lamb skewers (smoky, tender, and addictive) or the mapo tofu, which brings just the right heat without overwhelming. Portions are generous for sharing, and the cocktails (shoutout to the yuzu margarita) cut through the spice like a dream. Service is spot-on too ‚Äì attentive but not hovering, which lets you focus on the good times.
Price-wise, it's a steal for the quality ‚Äì expect around $50-70 per person with drinks, and you'll leave stuffed and smiling. If you love bold, authentic eats in a spot that's as fun for friends as it is delicious, do yourself a favor and book a table. Birds of a Feather isn't just a meal; it's a vibe. Can't wait to go back! üå∂Ô∏èüçú 5/5 stars.

author: Felix
text:
Really delicious Sichuan dishes. The menu isn‚Äôt overwhelmingly large but has a good variety.
Twice cooked pork belly and chongqing chicken were both really great.
Soup dumplings and duck fried rice were pretty standard but solid and the food comes out really quick even though the place was full.
Worked out to about $50pp with only tea for drinks and before tip.

author: Linh Pham
text:
This is my favorite Chinese restaurant in New York. The space is nicely decorated, comes with outdoor seatings. Service is fast.
The food is the star of the show. The portions are large at this restaurant. The quality doesn't miss no matter if I dine in or order delivery.
Chungking chicken comes with crunchy small chicken bites, loaded with chillies, packed with flavors and that mouth numbing spiciness. Kung pao chicken is tender, velvety texture. Spicy fish filled is my favorite dish; it's comes with small fried fish fillers, crunchy, perfect moisture level with that signature spiciness of szechuan chilies. Mapo tofu is also one of the must try dish, hot tofu on a bed of spicy ground pork sauce. It's perfect for any dinner meal. Spicy cumin lamb is absolutely the most tender and flavorful lamb I have had in a long time. Tea smoked duck offers juicy smoked duck slices, pairs well with buns and sauce.
The restaurant can get really crowded during dinner time. It is suggested to get a reservation ahead of time or to stop by at odd hours to avoid waiting in line.
Overall, I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who loves to enjoy Chinese cuisine or just loves to incorporate chilies in their meals.

author: Caylea
text: Charming and quiet spot in Wburg! HH deal is great for the oysters and drinks! The chicken and the octopus were standout dishes. The grilled hake fillet was just okay, a bit rubbery. Although we didn‚Äôt get the fries, they looked great!

author: Beyza Akk
text: We spent around $100 for 2 people and totally worth the experience. Everything was so delicious and stuff were kind enough to make us feel happy. They kept asking how‚Äôs the food and if there‚Äôs anything we need etc I‚Äôd highly recommend Burger, fava dip, and octopus. The sourdough bread they use is also AMAZINGLY delicious. I feel so bad that I didn‚Äôt ask where they got the bread:(

author: Jan Ezer Dominguez
text:
Came here for a light dinner date with my partner, and we ended up mainly ordering the seafood.

The grilled octopus was amazing! Not a big portion, but very tasty.

The mussells were perfectly cooked as well. Couldn't get enough of that sauce!

author: Elle
text: Caf√© Colette is such a gem. They have a great oyster special during the week that‚Äôs definitely worth it, and the staff was super friendly and welcoming. The vibe is cozy and stylish, which makes it a perfect spot to unwind after work or catch up with friends.

author: melody wilson
text:
My friend and I went here the other day for some brunch. The waitress was nice but not super attentive.

The food was definitely not worth the cost‚Äî it was overpriced for one slice of toast per person.

I got the eggs and hash and it was not worth $17. There was too much random presentation and not enough actually filling food. My friend says it‚Äôs the same for her food‚Äî she got an avocado toast with an egg.

I also ordered a frozen coffee which was tasty.

The vibes of the place are nice.

author: Ava Johns
text: Came here with my friend for a nice girls night! We got a reservation at 9 pm and it was crazy packed when we walked in. A bunch of people waiting. Took a bit to get our table but seemed like it was just people staying too long that caused backup. The place was sooo cute and cool and the bathroom was like a mini club which I loved. Music was perfect, playing all my favorites. Waitress was AWESOME and super helpful. We got espresso martinis which came out quick and green beans and wontons to start. Green beans turned out to be our fav fish and were delicious with some fried bread on top. Great flavor. Wontons were good too and had a curry/Indian flavor. I thought they could have been hotter (temp and spice level), but we enjoyed them. we also got the noodles. I personally don't like the rolled noodles and I thought the flavor was weird. But my friend loved them.  Overall really thought this was a cool place and enjoyed our experience but didn't wow me like other spots in NYC. I'm also really tired of cocktails being $20, but I guess that's just what the reality is these days.

author: C J
text:
Made the ‚Äútrek‚Äù to Brooklyn and was excited to try Bonnie‚Äôs. Service was good- the server was knowledgeable about the menu and very pleasant. Had heard ravings about the MSG martini which we tried, and also tried the sour cherry Negroni - neither were spectacular and the martini had a strange aftertaste.

For food, we ordered the chrysanthemum salad (Don Angie‚Äôs is so much better) - which was a large portion but mostly cabbage (?), the long beans were too mushy for my liking (liked the fried crullers but they were overly salty), the fuyu cacio e pepe mein which was just ok, and the sundae for dessert which was not that interesting (I liked the fried condensed milk). We also had the shrimp with walnuts and broccoli which was pretty basic. Overall, the food was pretty disappointing and I would not go back‚Ä¶

author: asmaa odeh
text: OK, so I came here tonight and I have never heard of this place before. Everything was pretty good nothing was amazing and nothing was terrible. I will say that the shrimp with the candied walnuts were really good and the long beans were also pretty good. I ordered the mussels with the shoestring fries and when it came out, it had pieces of what looked like some kind of pork on top so I asked the server is that pork? and they said yes and I said oh no I can‚Äôt eat that so they brought it back and gave me the menu to pick something else, and I asked if I could have the same thing but with no pork and they said they couldn‚Äôt do that because it was in the broth so when I looked at the menu again, I realized it mentioned nowhere that there was pork in there, which is kind of annoying because if it wasn‚Äôt directly on top, I would‚Äôve never known it was in the broth. I heard this place is extremely popular and I don‚Äôt know I‚Äôve had much better food for lower prices and just better food in general. I also was not a fan of the flounder at all. It tasted like it had pi√±a colada sauce on it, but my partner liked it so..

author: Rachel Michelson
text:
The mussels were good, the broth was extremely flavorful and creamy, but way too salty. The fries also ended up a bit soggy, and we needed more fries for the broth, if that was the intention. We ended up with a bunch of leftover broth that was too salty to drink on its own. Some bread would have been nice for this.

The chow feung was pretty good, but really small and underwhelming for the price. I also thought this was too salty. The texture of the rice noodles was nice though, and i really liked the flavor of the dried shrimp.

The bkrib.. It was good. I really liked the fluffinesses and the flavor of the bread, the sauce on the meat, and it was cooked okay. Maybe a bit overcooked. The onions and pickles provided a nice contrast. Not show stopping though. This was also too salty.

The half chicken was pretty good as well. The broth was my favorite part. The flavor and cook on the chicken was good, but the rice didn‚Äôt really make any sense. It was yummy, but it felt as though the rice and the chicken were two completely separate dishes. The chicken was also too salty.

I would say the food is pretty good, maybe not worth the price, and my  main issue is the overall saltiness of the dishes. I typically eat saltier foods than my peers, but even after drinking 3 full glasses of water during this meal, my mouth is left with a tingling feeling and I need more water.

author: Christian Ramirez
text: THE PANZANELLA. I haven‚Äôt stopped thinking about the PANZANELLA since I last went 2 months ago. Best bite in Brooklyn??? We ordered 2 for a group of 6 and we probably should have just ordered 6. Everything is good‚Ä¶ the noodles are awesome.. the green beans are divine‚Ä¶ and the outdoor patio tables are super uncomfortable

author: Vicki
text:
I usually hear people going before they open to get a table, and was so excited that I was able to reserve online!

The staff were nice and helpful with deciding our orders, and we were glad that we did not skip on the focaccia!

I was way too full afterwards, so I think the 2 of us could‚Äôve just gotten one pasta instead of 2 (or just one appetizer)!

author: Bianca R
text: Lilia is an outstanding modern italian restaurant. I would rate it 4.5 stars, and rounding up to 5 this time because we ordered one of the dishes a second time. The agnolotti is to die for. Perfectly balanced and very rich and complex. We also enjoyed the focaccia and the little gem salad as appetizers. The prosciutto was okay, and the arancini were also only okay. Mafaldini pasta was good. The italian job dessert was good but we expected better from all the hype. Would come back, lovely place, and great setting.

author: Katie Infelice
text: i love coming to lilia!!! the food is literally always so stellar (highlights: focaccia, clams, spaghetti, italian job) and the hospitality is unmatched (shoutout britt and elle). i try to come back whenever i can. such a special place :)

author: Gaetano DiNardi
text: The Rigatoni was solid. But the Mafaldini lacked flavor. The Agnolotti was the star of the show. The fettucini rag√π was flavorful but it was a lot of noodles and not enough sauce. We also ordered a rib eye steak that came out cold and rare, which had to be sent back. Overall this place is average, but overhyped. It‚Äôs a 3/5 stars and that‚Äôs an honest review. And I‚Äôve eaten at hundreds of Italian restaurants.

author: Kathy D
text: Great food and service in a very casual but eclectic setting.  There were a couple misses for us but overall absolutely delicious fresh food and we will definitely return.  Mozz and bread is a large portion but absolutely worth trying. Cheese was soft and flavorful and bread was thick and crusty.   Little gem salad as pretty to look at as it was to eat.   Grilled artichoke, I probably could have eaten 5.  Perfectly cooked and seasoned. Bagna Cauda was a miss for us. The anchovy dip was overpowering and I think I just didn‚Äôt understand the dish.  We tried the agnolotti based on our server‚Äôs recommendation and so glad we did.  Soft creamy pillows of deliciousness. Spaghetti also delicious, pasta was al dente with texture from the nuts.   Escarole was another recommended dish and it was very good and a nice side. The lamb steak was our other miss. It was cooked well but if I didn‚Äôt know I was eating lamb I would have thought it was a bland steak.  It had no gamey lamb flavor.  We didn‚Äôt know but will try next time that there is an off the menu steak and potato dish you can order. It looked and smelled amazing.  This restaurant serves unpretentious delicious food, can‚Äôt wait to return and try more options.

author: Susie Su
text:
Burger and focaccia were delicious, the burger especially stood out.

A side of focaccia is perfectly sized for 2 people actually - and cheaper than the dish.

Coffee with orange blossom cream was interesting, would recommend to try at least once.
