Chicken and pancake was way too buttery and the chicken ended up tasting dry. Next time would skip that. It had good intentions though, just maybe excited slightly poorly.

author: Heidi Mayer
text: This is my kind of place! A fabulous wine list, a limited menu, excellent food. The crispy chicken is amazing. Clearly I forgot to take the pictures before we started eating. It was so good.

author: Kathleen Zhou
text: really lovely little gem in Greenpoint: a classic American restaurant with seasonal dishes that are executed very well. we‚Äôll be back to sample the wine menu & desserts!

author: Kaitlyn Murdock
text: We LOVE this cozy neighborhood spot!! After 5 visits, we‚Äôve tasted most of their menu and not a single dish has missed. Excellent cocktails and wines. Incredible value. I love that we can always get a last minute seat - but am always shocked that they aren‚Äôt busier. You must go!

author: Bl√°thnaid Conroy
text: Gator is a standout restaurant. Definitely in the running for best brunch in Greenpoint. I‚Äôm absolutely shocked that this place isn‚Äôt full to the brim every weekend. Every item on their menu is carefully devised, unique, and created to a very high standard. Their green eggs and ham are OUT OF THIS WORLD. Full of flavor, perfectly cooked. The flatbread?? Incredible. Great service too, everyone is always welcoming and friendly. I hope they‚Äôre around for a long time to come!

author: Ghayas Salem
text: Had a business lunch here. Everything we ordered was tasty. Also good drinks. Tons of TV's to watch any game you like. The place was buzzing, even midweek at 3:00 PM. Reservations are recommended.

author: tomasz j
text: nice old school style pub and restaurant in maspeth. with a big bar in the center. definitely for sports fans. if you want to eat something, have a beer and watch a game this is the perfect place! the staff is nice and helpful, the food is good. if you order a steak be sure to ask for their own sauce - it's great! i recommend the swordfish and the steak! the desserts are also delicious. i recommend and enjoy your meal

author: alice hsieh
text: I had a baby shower for my daughter here. I was totally impressed. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The room was set-up elegantly with white tablecloths and cloth napkins. The food was delicious. And the cost was very reasonable. I highly recommend O'Neill's Maspeth for your next party.

author: Lisa S
text:
I came here for the first time recently because of an event that I attended. This place is truly exceptional with its hospitality and service as the staff was fantastic.

This restaurant is a well-known institution in Queens and has been in business since 1933, and I could see why they have been around for so long.

I really didn't get a chance to try anything from their food menu, but the drinks I ordered were really good, and the bartenders are super nice. This place has a great sportsbar vibe, and it is a great place for hosting events since this restaurant is quite large.

I noticed other reviewers complaining about the parking situation in this area, but since I came quite early, I didn't have any issues finding street parking near the restaurant.

Based on my first impression of this place, I will definitely stop by again in the near future to grab a bite and a few drinks.

author: Teresa Marie
text: Attentive staff. I had a really awesome young lady who waited on us. She checked on us and even answered my daughters questions on a specific drink.  We had a wonderful time.

author: Rodney Champaco
text:
I‚Äôve been ordering delivery from Tito Rad‚Äôs for years (ever since I moved to Forest Hills four years ago) and it‚Äôs hands down the closest thing to homemade Filipino food I‚Äôve ever had. I‚Äôve been around Filipinos all my life, and Tito Rad's dishes always bring that authentic, comforting flavor that feels like it came straight from an auntie's kitchen.

I‚Äôve only had the chance to dine in once when I happened to be running an errand right across the street. The food fresh from the kitchen was even better... hot, perfectly seasoned, and clearly made with care.

Yesterday, for Filipino American History Month, my office facilities coordinator (based in San Francisco) provided our NYC team with lunch from Tito Rad‚Äôs... delivered to our Manhattan office near Bryant Park. I had no idea they delivered that far! If I‚Äôd known, I would‚Äôve been ordering for my coworkers years ago.

Everything was a hit... Pritong Lumpia, Pancit Bihon, Adobo Fried Rice, Beef Steak, Chicken BBQ Skewers, Lechon Kawali, and Turon. Every dish disappeared fast and now my coworkers want to make Tito Rad‚Äôs one of our go-to team lunches.

To top it off, someone from the restaurant even called afterward to check in and make sure everything went well (sorry I missed the call). That thoughtful touch really says a lot about how much they care about their customers.

If you‚Äôre looking for authentic, delicious Filipino food, Tito Rad‚Äôs is the place to go. And if you need catering or delivery (even to Manhattan), that‚Äôs just the cherry on top!

author: R Ho
text: Passing by to stop at Renee‚Äôs Kitchenette and noticed Tito Rad‚Äôs. Never been so I decided to try a new spot. I should‚Äôve went with more people so I could order more food, but we went with ‚Äúbasics‚Äù - tapsilog, tocilog, and longsilog. I didn‚Äôt even get to order lechon! Anyway, I got ukoy to try as an appetizer, and ginataang langka (never tried this before but I know I like jack fruit) and ginataang calabasa. I like the calabasa. I ordered it with garlic fried rice to eat. The ginataang langka was ‚Ä¶ different. I‚Äôll stick to it being a fruit that belongs in dessert or turon. The tapa was sweet, which I wasn‚Äôt a fan of but really, it‚Äôs your preference. Everything else was good. The hot calamansi was so warm in my stomach. It felt nice. The halo halo was good too. Big portion in a big bowl so I‚Äôm not struggling to eat it from a drinking cup. The ukoy was different for me too. I don‚Äôt like bean sprouts but this was fried and it wasn‚Äôt bad. Bonus: the waitress told me their ube ice cream is home made. Overall, I would revisit with a larger group. I would advise calling to make a reservation. I waited an hour to be seated. The staff was extremely kind though. They did check on us from time to time while waiting and updated us when our table would be ready. Very family-oriented.

author: judy
text: Ordered the grilled tuna collar, baboy sinigang, and ginataang kalabasa/okra. The tuna collar was grilled perfectly, and comes with a vinegar dip (I thought it would be a sweeter dish). The sinigang was a bit sour, could definitely taste the tamarind! Although I wish it was pork ribs with bone in. The ginitaang kalabasa was not too coconut milky. There was a party being set up and a huge lechon prepared! The aunties working there were very nice, and looked so fun with karaoke already starting.

author: marina dee
text: The food was so good, hit the spot. The back.room is great for big dinners or parties.

author: Christina Yung
text: I was sick and Tito Rad‚Äôs delivery came through with pork sinigang, garlic rice, lumpia, and chicken adobo. Delicious! Healed my soul, was exactly what I needed.

author: Jay M.
text:
Went to the place on the way home from Queens Center.

It was a little hole in the wall. There was only outdoor seating. The service was good. It was a wait for the food because they were busy and the food was fresh.

We got a series of dishes that were good! They definitely were more of a modern style of Bolivian food.

Everything had good flavors and they give you a lot of food!

author: Karla Ruiz
text: Bolivian Llama Party üáßüá¥ü¶ô‚ù§Ô∏è So many things to say about this place‚Ä¶ to start, service is always great, people at the counter, and the owners, that sometimes take care of you, are always kind, nice and extremely helpful! Then the food, OMG, best truffle fries you can try in NY, Salte√±as are always a good to go (chicken is my favorite!!), all the bowls are delicious, their chicken sandwiches, veggie choices, everything is amazing there, I am not even vegetarian but I love their jackfruit sandwiches! One of the best places in Sunnyside for sure, I highly recommend trying BLP, they never disappoint! ‚ò∫Ô∏è

author: Akimohai
text: Customer service here is absolutely awesome ‚Äî full of passion, and you can tell they truly love their food. The food itself is amazing. It was my first time trying Bolivian cuisine and I instantly fell in love with it. The way they cook the chicken is just perfect: crispy on the outside, tender and juicy on the inside. Damn good! Highly recommend this spot!

author: Beejay-Grace J
text: The beef empanada, trancapecho, and cilantro fries are all delicious. Everything is full of flavor and perfectly cooked. Highly recommend this place if you‚Äôre looking for authentic and tasty Bolivian food!

author: Ryan Tammaro
text: Beef Salte√±a‚Äòs are delicious, like a soupy empanada with a chewy, slightly sweet dough. Seating is outside only so these are better for on the go or quick stop dining

author: Nicole Cruz
text: Everything was great, the food was excellent and the service was incredible. Our server Jane made us feel very welcome and elevated the whole experience! Highly recommended!

author: Raymond Wong
text: All you can eat Korean bbq. Many cuts of meat to choose from. Sides were delicious as well. Staff is friendly and always asks if we need anything or if everything‚Äôs ok

author: avirut lerddirekrat
text: I had an good experience at this restaurant, largely thanks to our exceptional server, Karry. She was incredibly attentive and well taken care of us throughout our visit. The food was delicious, and I especially loved the wide variety of options available on the menu. Karry's outstanding service, combined with the great food selection, makes this place a must-visit. I can't wait to come back and try more of their delectable dishes!

author: Dan Oyan
text: All-you-can-eat Korean BBQ for $46 super affordable! We got the premium meat and it did not disappoint. The ribeye and brisket were my favorites. really good quality! Our server Eric was so nice and easy to talk to, very accommodating with all our requests lol. Definitely coming back again!

author: L Ramos
text: We decided to go here as a central meeting point for folks coming from Jersey and Long Island. I had been to a Japanese BBQ place where you cook your own food, this was a little different. The place is spacious and brightly lit as the sitting areas need to be spaced out(cooking areas and smoke hoods), you sat on stools that you can store your items in. You chose the type of meat selection from 3 choices. The whole table must choose the same menu course. You are on a timer but we weren't affected. There are many selections, so make sure to try all of them at least once. The tray can cook 2 portions at a time and once it gets cooking 4-5 adults will having trouble keeping up, but we have it our all. The food was delicious, they cook it all for you. Pork, beef was best we didn't try the chicken. The Soju was awesome; pomegranate, lychee and blueberry... All very tasty. Make sure to get lettuce and rice. The salad was also very tasty. Just be careful and observant; when the server pulled back from placing meat on the cooking tray, some of the meat juice fell on the salad. We set that salad aside immediately. I definitely want to come back the seats were ok, but I dunno how long we can sit on those seats. Price was reasonable. Definitely go here and check it out.

author: Kristina Zhegunova
text: We love this place ‚Äî we‚Äôve been here more than 10 times, and every time it‚Äôs a hit! Our friends enjoyed it too! We love everyone who works there! Bahut bahut dhanyavaad! üáÆüá≥üíõ

author: H M
text:
My favorite Indian in the neighborhood, the food is always fresh, hot, and delicious. I love hoe crispy the naan is when you dine in.

This time we got the garlic naan, chicken caldeen, cardamom mix grill, lemon and garlic shrimp, and lamb potato croquettes.

author: Kab Ra
text:
NVM just got food poisoning after my meal
‚Äî
Very good. Wish the malai kofta had more than 4 dumplings. The entrees are a little pricey ($20+ per dish) but the service was excellent. I love that you can add tofu to any curry.

author: Andrea Luper
text: This cozy neighborhood spot happens to be not only some of the best Indian fare in the area, but in the greater New York area. Never disappoints. The naan is perfection. The curries are perfectly balanced, and the saag is so thick and luxurious. Can‚Äôt wait for my next visit.

author: Ticia Tialetagi
text: The best Indian food in town, recommend it! You‚Äôll not disappointed! Cosy place

author: Faed Ahmed Arnob
text:
Really nice place with a cozy vibe! Kinda gives off that Himalayan caf√© feel ‚Äî if you‚Äôve been to Nepal, you‚Äôll totally get what I mean with the big glass windows and the warm lighting. The staff seemed super authentic Nepali too, both in how they talked and acted, which was a nice touch.

Food was good! I‚Äôd say go for the beef (yes they are halal) options if you‚Äôre into meat ‚Äî the chicken momos were okay but had more veggies than chicken. Loved the Thai Soup Momo (gave off a bit of a butter chicken vibe) and of course, the Chilli Momos are always a win.

Bonus points for the super clean washrooms ‚Äî seriously, top-notch. Overall, I‚Äôd give it an 8.5/10. Great spot, just a little pricey for students.

author: Tanvi Desai
text: These momos are out of this world! My absolute favorites are the Chicken Tandoori Momos and the Chicken Chilly Momos ‚Äî but the real showstopper is the Chaat Momos. Truly unbeatable!

author: Arth Shah
text:
We were craving some Momo's. Looked around for some places, and Momo crave came up. Decided to give it a try. The momo's were delicious. Most of the time, at other places, the momo are overloaded with ginger. Momo craved, momo tasted delicious. We got tandoori mom which had good smokiness. We also got chili momo, which was good and spicy.
They have plenty of vegetarian options. We would visit again to try different momo.

author: N Nuha
text: I come here very often and for a few years now. All the momos here are packed with flavor. They're all good. The spicy sauces can give a kick. My favorite is the chili momo. They added a new soup- the Thai soup momo and it's Thai coconut with the steamed momo. Tased very good as well. The artwork around the shop is fun and creative. Definitely look around. I felt like the portions have gotten smaller since it took more Momos to make me full and the flavor has been adjusted somewhat. Hope it doesn't stray too far from what made this place great

author: Tanoy Dutta
text: A gem of a place to satiate the momo cravings. In fact, all the dishes are outstanding to say the least.

author: Shawn Shawn (Shawn)
text:
So I made my way from Manhattan over to Queens to try out SVL in Astoria for a midweek lunch meal.
Was super excited to try this spot as all of the reviews have been pretty popular and it's on my "Saved List of Eats".
The spot is right off the Triborough bridge to the right train, or the 1st stop off the M60 bus coming across the Triborough from Manhattan.  The restaurant was very clean and the staff was pretty attentive as it was midweek and it wasn't too busy.
I ordered the Lunch Special Chicken Yeero pita sandwich with a Mesculan salad and some of their famous SVL sauce.
The chicken was perfectly seasoned,  super moist, and plentiful.  It was layered with french fries, tomatoes, and fresh red onions all on a fresh off the grill pita bread.
The mesclun "side salad" was also super fresh and well proportioned with red and yellow peppers, petite cucumbers and balsamic vinegar
Overall I had a great experience at SVL and will definitely come back as I want to try the chicken sticks and rice next.
Also this french fries were seriously seriously good and well seasoned.
Can't wait to visit again.

author: Joselin Menocal
text: Incredible food! my friend and I were both pretty hungry and we ordered the mixed platter for 2- and we could NOT finish it- although we REALLY wanted to! every bite was fantastic and we thoroughly enjoyed it, would most definitely come here again :)

author: ben zander
text: A charming spot conveniently located by the subway. Delicious food good atmosphere nice portion sizes. We got the haloumi fries.

author: Vasilis Dux
text: One of the best experiences in gyro plates outside of Greece.. big portions, fresh ingredients..unbelievable hand-cut fries..our compliments to the chef

author: vale
text: This place is awesome-possum! It is very clean and put-together, great system. Kind and polite customer service. The food is perfect here. It contains many flavors and great seasoning. Cooked to perfection! Thank you so much!

author: Chris Escala
text:
This is the top place not only to eat food from Spain but also to enjoy a great time as it truly makes you feel at Spain. The food is vast, diverse, and superbly delicious.
From the paella to the tapas and the sangria. It's a great spot to reminisce Spain üá™üá∏  you'll definitely feel at Iberia. Ole! üíÉ

author: Lexi
text: We ran into the nicest old Spanish guy on the street. He doesn‚Äôt speak too much English, but he was so warm and really tried to tell us to try this place. It turns out to be amazing!!

author: Vivianne Barretto
text: This place was recommended to us and I'm very happy that we followed up on the recommendation.  The food was üòã.  I had the Madrid Strew (Chickpeas and Tripe with Chorizo), my Mom had Mussels, Scampi style and our friend had Fried Calamari.  We were all very happy with our appetizers.  Then for our entr√©es, we all had Merluza which in English is Hake.  We each had it in a different preparation.  There was grilled, stewed and breaded.  Mine was Grilled and it came with vegetables and a choice of a side.  I chose Boiled Potatoes.  My Mom chose to have it in Stew which is served in sauce and with Potatoes and our friend chose the Breaded version with a choice of a side.  She had the French Fries.  We were all happy with the preparation we chose.  The servings were large.  We all took food home.  We all had Flan for dessert and it was very good.  My Mom had Wine, our friend had Sangria and I had Estrella, a beer from Spain.  The prices are very good here.  The service is excellent. We came in the afternoon but in the evenings they have entertainment.  I don't know if it's every evening or only on certain evenings.  I have to look into that.  The space reminds me of a small scale Supper Club.  There is also a area off to the side with a Bar, t.v.'s and seats.  We will definitely go back, maybe when they have a show.  I also have to say,  we've been to Spain on several occasions and the food here is as good and even better than in some Restaurants in Spain.  Forgot to mention that we each got a Bailey's, on the house.  It's very rare for restaurants to do that nowadays.

author: Karilu Ruiz-duran
text: The restaurant is beautiful.  The staff is very attentive.  The steaks and sangria were very good.  The seafood paella was okay. My only complain is that they have a stage and they didn't do any show for mothers day weekend.  They talk about doing events on the second floor last week. If they had a flamenco üï∫üíÉ dance show on the stage, I can assure you the restaurant would be packed.

author: Armando I
text:
Hidden gem off of Broadway and Steinway Street.
Food is always prepared with love and everything on the menu is a must have!
I recommend the sangria with any paella option.
Check the site for shows and dances. I‚Äôm sure they will have a special for New Year‚Äôs Eve!

author: Hailey Richards
text: I am not the type of person to leave reviews on anything whether it‚Äôs a positive review or a negative but this place truly deserves it. Yesterday was my 4th time coming to eat at Calibun and I must say their food is 10/10 and the customer service was amazing as well. You can tell that this place cares about their customers because when I walked in, I was greeted by the cashier with a big smile and positive attitude. I couldn‚Äôt decide if I want a heavy meal or something light like wings but then the person at the front helped me out saying I should try their mini classic combo. I took his advice and tried it and when I tell you this burger was really amazing I truly mean it. Also it took less than 15 min for my food to be ready and they make everything fresh. Tables were clean too. My experience was 10/10 if you‚Äôre looking for a place to eat around your area or if you‚Äôre a foodie in general I would highly recommend you going there. Will come again!!

author: LongIslandHalal
text:
Calibun is an HMS-certified restaurant in Astoria, Queens. Calibun, in my opinion, has one of the better fast-food beef burgers in New York.

The cheeseburger is unlike any other halal fast-food beef burger spots. You can tell that they dont use completely frozen meats and really care about the quality of food they serve. The beef is extremely tender and it melts in your mouth. Definitely going back to try out all the other burgers.

author: Mereann F
text: Place was really clean and cute. Had a lot of seating. Ordered the Lava Burger with bacon and fries. The fries were not fresh at all and the burger was mediocre at best. It wasn‚Äôt nasty per say but the flavor wasn‚Äôt there. If the fries were fresh they might have tasted better. Overall I was very disappointed.

author: Ahmad Karim
text: Amazing Burgers, they know how to make your burgers special! Zabiha Halal üçîüçîüçüüçüüçüüçî üçóüçóüêî still a fan! I hope they keep it up! Keeping it fresh and quality over all!

author: Jade
text: Just ordered a turkey burger from CaliBun and it was by far the worst turkey burger I‚Äôve had in my entire life. A thin inedible, old, freezer burned patty that broke down like stale bread in your mouth. The most upsetting aspect of this is that the patties are clearly not being stored properly but it‚Äôs obvious they don‚Äôt care enough about what the customers eat to provide better quality food. If turkey patties are unpopular, take them off the menu rather than give your customers stale items that could potentially cause food poisoning!!!!!!!!!!

author: Kelly Leung
text:
Very Authentic Cantonese Food,
Glad to have found a spot that tastes like food back home (HK). I ordered the Wonton and Braised Beef noodles, Pork Ribs Claypot rice, and Choy Sum(Vegetables). Wonton was big with shrimp and pork in it, you can taste that it's the freshly made and not frozen ones. Braised Beef was tender and there were many pieces in it. Noodles are just like the wonton noodles in Hong Kong, cooked great, a bit chewy. The clay pot rice was made to order and came burning hot after cooking it over the fire. Can‚Äôt wait to come back and try more dishes.

author: Nerdy Macropus
text: This Cantonese restaurant stands out as the best I‚Äôve discovered so far. The prices are reasonable, the portions are generous, and most importantly, the flavors are simply incredible (Âπ≥ Èùö Ê≠£). I highly recommend trying the chicken, siew mai, and the claypot rice.

author: Ashley Liu
text: As a devoted dim sum lover, this is my favorite spot in Manhattan. The food is incredibly fresh and authentically made, but what truly moved me was tasting a real Hong Kong-style herbal soup in New York. It‚Äôs the kind of soup that takes at least 12 hours of slow simmering to extract the very best essence of the ingredientsÔºÅ

author: Christine C.
text:
Long overdue review. I discovered Moon Kee soon after they opened 2 yrs ago.  My  BFF lives on 103rd so it's just 2 blocks away. I can't believe there is an **authentic** Canto restaurant up here!  I grew up in LA, lived in NY for 6 yrs and now in No CA.  Yes I'm an ABC, but my husband was born in HK and I know good authentic Chinese food. They even have BBQ meat hanging in the windows and people yelling in Cantonese to each other, haha.  Sign of authenticity in a dim sum place.  The only "non-authentic" thing? It's very very clean, no food stains on the chairs or tables but I haven't seen the bathrooms  (I know I'm risking offending some ppl on here...it's a *joke*).  There are always lots of Chinese ppl in here too.

I was hungry after flying in from CA and why spend $7 on a ham and cheese croissant heated in a microwave when you can have 3 gao choi gao (shrimp and chive dumpling) cooked fresh for the same price? Look at the size of the shrimp!  And you can sit in a clean booth with a/c (it's 90 deg outside). They're really nice and weren't upset that I just ordered $7 worth of food.  Very good service.

I've been here ~7 times and everything has been excellent. The big test for me in any dim sum place is the wu gok (taro dumpling). Many reputable places have other excellent dishes but their wu gok tastes of ammonia meaning old taro.  Or they're really oily.  NOT here - they're crisp, made of fresh taro, and not oily at all.  The dan tats (egg tarts) are perfect- flaky crisp dough. They just told me they are hand made here and the chef has over 30 yrs experience making dim sum.

I told my friend about this place and now her family gets food from here all the time.

Someone mentioned the prices- ummm look at where they are.  And it's not more than what we spend in SF and some places in NY Chinatown.

author: C.A. Young
text: Best Chinese food on the UWS. A quick delicious lunch with soup for $15 is a treat... with leftovers! Generous portions. True test is the old crowd favorite of crunchy steamed broccoli and tender orange beef. Perfect. But you will find there are lots of Asian patrons who order their favorite dishes here no doubt because it tastes authentic. Am so glad to be back home in NYC to eat here, try new flavors of dumplings, roast duck and a wonderful array of other dishes from this welcoming place.

author: Maisha Rahman
text: I bought from Al-Aqsa last night. I‚Äôm not a local but I heard reviews from some locals and they suggested that I should try it out. At first glance I didn‚Äôt like any of the food. They all looked like it was either cooked the day before or in the morning. Everything looked dry and not so appetizing. Anyhow I still wanted to give it a try. This Tehri is tasteless, super bland, what‚Äôs even more disappointing is that it has almost no meat and all of it is just rice. I got tehri from Khalil biriyani house as well just to compare. Although it wasn‚Äôt that great either but it was way better. It was flavorful and had meat in every bite. Bhai taka diye kine ebhabe manush ke dhoka dewar kono mane ami dekhi na. Eke toh mangsho kete kete small turka banai tar upor aitao dai na. It‚Äôs very disappointing.

author: Tasfia Islam
text: I was really looking forward to enjoying some good biryani, but this was a huge disappointment. The rice was dry and clearly stale‚Äîit tasted like it had been sitting out for a day or two. The flavors were completely off, and the meat was tough and chewy. Honestly, it felt like I was eating leftovers that had been reheated without any care. Not only that but the guys that work there are very rude and full of attitude. Would not recommend this place.

author: Tawhidur Rahaman
text:
‚ÄúThis post reflects my personal experience as a paying customer in a public-facing restaurant setting, supported by receipts and photos, it is intended to let the owners know about their service/employee only, not to attack anyone personally.‚Äù

This review is directed to the owner or management of Bronx Al Aqsa Restaurant. If you cannot manage your online orders properly, then please stop taking them. Your two employees outright denied my order. Even after I stood inside the restaurant, they did not respond. When I asked if they were busy, they said ‚Äúwe‚Äôre not free‚Äù while they were just sitting and chatting.

My pickup time was 9:30 pm, yet they claimed they never received my order. I reminded them that I had placed the order nearly 1 to 1.5 hours earlier and asked why my food was still not ready. At this point, the employee wearing a cap, instead of speaking politely, became extremely rude. He said, ‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt know about online order issues, call the owner.‚Äù I asked him to call the supervisor, but he repeated, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs your need, not mine, so I won‚Äôt call.‚Äù

If your restaurant hires people without training them in customer service, this is the result. If you cannot manage online orders or do not have skilled staff for it, you should not be advertising online orders on Facebook.

I have been a regular customer of your grocery and restaurant for the past four years. Starting today, I will boycott your business. I know my leaving alone won‚Äôt harm your business, but I am writing this so you are aware of how your employees behave. If you think keeping my $22 makes you wealthy, then so be it. I often give to the homeless; today I‚Äôll consider you as one of them. May GOD bring you in front of me on the Day of Judgment‚Äîthat is my prayer.

Edit: This guy had the audacity to reach me on my social media from a fake profile and asked me to remove his photo or else he'll file a lawsuit. My guy thinks that he can't be filmed or photographed while he's working at a publicly open restaurant, he should learn the law. First of all he's rude and their owner is also encouraging these kind of money grabbing things and then they have this much courage of playing a victim card while he's treating me like that.

author: Karan Chaudhary
text: Their fish curries are very delicious. Chicken seekh kebab was very good but half chicken was dry and bland. Their chilly chicken is good too.

author: Md Surman Ahmed
text: I ordered 4 fresh paratha with other dishes and they gave me cold, hard and overburned three days old paratha. I came home opened the foil and was so disappointed. I called multiple times and the line is purposely on busy mode not going through. After paying $50 takeout and not being able to eat peacefully is unacceptable. WHY IS THE FOOD QUALITY GOING DOWN? Can owner take a look at why this is happening.

author: Sheikh Ahmad Shah
text: I previously went to the Hillside avenue branch, where I liked the food. Here, I don't how know many days ago the biriyani was prepared. They heat up the food in oven, but that heating goes away very soon, and food feels cold within a few minutes. But I am mostly disappointed with their restroom. The hand dispenser was blocked by a mop. I don't know how much they care to make this restaurant successful. Unfortunate. And also, as a biriyani house, they were out of Borhani. That was disappointing too. I guess hillside avenue branch is better. Never will come to this branch. And the food felt expensive.

author: Tasmia Hoque
text: We called early to reserve our table for Iftar but when we got there our table was not ready. We had to wait 10 minutes for them to set up our table. They seemed disorganized with the reservations.They did not have most of the items from the menu so we had to get a iftar box, Kacchi biriyani, Tanduri chicken. They gave us complementary dates and juice to break our fast. The juice was really tasty. Kacchi biriyani and Tanduri chicken were tasty too. The servers were nice and friendly. The management should manage the reservations properly to make sure the tables are ready when the guests arrive or use reserved sign for the tables. I will take out but not dine in again.

author: MH Rahman
text: Khalil Biryani foods not good such as salty,reek,bad smell & uncooked Biryani rice and also too much bad service.That‚Äôs why I don‚Äôt like it Khalil Biryani House foods.

author: Gobbi ‚ÄúGobbiGames‚Äù
text: Nearly empty all the time. Service is somewhat slow, food isn't fresh but is made on the same day from what I can tell. I don't really like the biryani, the noodles are much better in my opinion. The chapli kabob is very tasty, meaty, a little spicy, and a little grease never hurt anyone, right? I didn't get it this time but I highly recommend the chili chicken if you get the noodles. It's an immaculate combo! I went with my mom and my sibling. They always give some green chilies, some lettuce, and a quarter of a lemon. Maybe some onions and carrots. The restaurant has little to no decor. They have campfire sounds playing on the speakers. There's also a sink near the entrance so you can wash your hands. I like it here! It's a bit pricey for this area, feels like Manhattan.

author: MD.Mamunor Rashid
text: We came from Dallas to taste the kacchi which turned out one of our bad decision during our trip. The food was worst than their service. Let‚Äôs talk about the service first, we asked for extra plates because we have ordered 3 kacchi, 2 beef beiden, 2 tehari, 2 vortas, 2 daals and vaat, so that we can try each of the item together. But the waitress brought just one plate, as usual we have asked for couple more plates then she brought four plates. Okay!!  We asked for extra cups so that we can try their borhani which usually comes in a bottle, then she literally brought 6 cups for 12 people. None of the waiters has any idea of the service and their food.  Okay now let‚Äôs talk about their food, The pictures of Salad will talk for me, I will not even try to explain. Kacchi was like goat, oil and rice mix. Beef Biden was like beef, oil and rice mix, tehari was so so, borhani has more water than yogurt no taste at all, daal was like a swimming pool of turmeric powder but no taste.

author: Ann Powers
text: Lovely neighborhood spot. Excellent coq au vin and ratatouille. Don‚Äôt come for the steak frites, but this place does the other classics well. Cozy atmosphere, non-fussy, great for a night with friends. A touch understaffed on the bar (Melissa is amazing), but drinks great and food came out fast. Charles was our waiter, he was endlessly patient and friendly.

author: Rumpelstiltskin
text: Great hang! The crepe menu here is really interesting and you can create your own crepes. The eggs benny were standard and coffee was nice. The ambiance is really what makes this place special tho. Super nice and warm vibes.

author: Jeff Melvin
text:
Had a fun little date night here. The whole place felt really homey, and I loved the decor. Service was super friendly, and made sure they could accommodate my peanut and cashew allergy.

I tried ratatouille for the first time, and I loved it. Perfectly cooked salmon as well. Will be back!

author: matea prljevic
text:
Love the backyard in a summer time!
Food is amazing! Oysters are must have!
And pasta fruit del mare is my favorite!! And mussels were amazing! (Photo of the finished mussel dish üòÅ)
I am glad I live near by so I will be coming back!

author: NESLY
text:
The location of the restaurant is definitely in a very good place. The atmosphere is really great. I sat in the garden and it was very comfortable. Chill.. You are in a quiet garden in the center of the city. I ordered a hamburger. It was the worst hamburger I have ever eaten in New York. I mean, a hamburger you eat at McDonald's is probably much better. I had a bad experience in this regard as well. But it is definitely a place where you can come with your friends, have a drink and sit. The bar looks very strong but I haven't tried anything. I only had a bad experience with the food. But still
Thanx ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçüî•ü§òüèª

author: Y T
text: My first time ordering and found a strange hair in it. Not sure if it hair on the head or not? Didn‚Äôt even bother finishing it. Was expecting phenomenal food.

author: paul gnu
text: I really liked this place, i have ordered from them numerous times this order was different since it was going to be a delivery. They have a system where you pay Zelle and then you pick up your food close to old school as you‚Äôre going to get you can place the order over the phone everything was very convenient. Not sure what happened tonight to the woman taking the order, but she was rude and condescending after I called for update on when the delivery was coming.  I didn‚Äôt appreciate that since I have spent over it $180 at this place over the past few months not to mention, I had my Job used them for a large lunch that we had for concert that we were producing In Flushing meadows Park I was shocked lost my appetite for my dinner. I sent My Son to go pick it up instead of me going there in person because I‚Äôm pretty sure I would‚Äôve told her exactly what I‚Äôm writing here today in this review of Pekin Empire. her out, I was disappointed in her behavior as a business owner. That‚Äôs not how you talk to customers if you‚Äôre busy to say hey I apologize we‚Äôre busy but to tell your customer that you‚Äôre not the only customer rudely unacceptable, especially since we live in Flushing and there‚Äôs so many choices of food to choose from they just lost a customer

author: SH Yoon (NYster)
text: Typical of many Americanized Chinese menu & price, but a bit better than most, as per a lot of Asian population & competition. Once in a L~ONG while, I feel like these things. Greasy & just plain. I would not recommended to cynical real Chinese cuisine aficionados, but if u grew up in suburbs & had this sometimes then eh~

author: Tahmina Hoque
text: Worst Chinese food I ever had in my life. I ordered Mongolian beef with fried rice. 70% of my food was onions! They literally cut up an entire onion and served it with my food. I had to take out all the onion because I could barely taste my food. All I could bite on were onions and rice! The fried rice was literally white rice fried with soy sauce. No eggs, peas, carrots etc. I also got an order of fried chicken which was soo salty. How can you go wrong with fried chicken? Never again.

author: Mikaela
text: Tried this place out due to the good reviews I have been reading. However I think it is overrated and will continue to go elsewhere. One, the person over the phone was rude and I was practically screaming over the phone because he couldn‚Äôt hear me. Second, the food took about 45mins to deliver despite only ordering two items. And finally the food was awfully bland (I got general tso) no spice or saltiness. Only reason why Im giving 2 stars instead of 1 is bc the delivery guy was very friendly.

author: Amy Coopersmith
text:
We had a fantastic dining experience at Patsy's of Queens! The food was absolutely delicious‚Äîevery dish we tried was a hit. The Fried Calamari was crispy and perfectly seasoned, the Traditional Pizza had a wonderfully balanced flavor, and both the Fettuccine Alfredo and Baked Ziti were rich, creamy, and comforting. The Chicken Parmesan was also outstanding‚Äîcrispy on the outside and tender inside with just the right amount of sauce and cheese. Dessert was fun and delicious... S'mores Pizza!

Our servers, Dean and Cynthia, were attentive, friendly, and made us feel right at home. The ambiance was charming and cozy, creating the perfect setting for a relaxed meal. The location is great, and to top it off, parking was easy and convenient. Highly recommend for anyone looking for great Italian food and warm hospitality!

author: Raymond Lian
text:
After ordering our food, we were served with complementary garlic bread that was really really tasty!! It is essentially cut up flatbread with their garlicky flavor and I couldn't stop eating it!! We got our food after a fairly long wait but the food was solid. However, there are definitely places that would have better food for a similar price. After getting the bill, I saw that I was charged extra for the side of pasta that comes with their entree. I was not informed prior to ordering that there was an extra charge for certain sides given that the menu states "All entrees come with a side pasta, vegetable or potato croquettes." The word "come" means it is complementary and therefore not an additional charge. The menu should be more clear with the costs. Since the charge wasn't too much I wasn't too mad.

Patsy has a really good pizza deal which is two 16" traditional pizza for $20!! This is ONLY for takeout orders and on Tuesday to Thursdays. There pizzas are one of the BESTT I've ever had!! It is thin and crispy and they have the perfect balance between the sauce and the cheese so that neither is too overpowering. I also love their brick oven gives the pizza an uneven char on the cheese and the crust. You should definitely come to Patsy's to get this deal!

Overall Rating is a 4.3/5

author: Ivan Perez
text:
I've been to patsys all over NYC.  The food at this location was just as good.

My chicken parmigiana with spaghetti was perfect.  The drinks weren't too bad as well.  The lights were a little too dim, my only knock but would 100% go back.

author: Mario A
text: I‚Äôve been going here for years. Staff is friendly. Cruz, Cindy, and everyone are always great. Food is very good. It can get busy on weekends.

author: Sunny Dronawat
text: The best pizza in Queens. The cook/pizza artist was amazing. The place has a great selection of Italian dishes. Everyone was friendly. The location is perfect with plenty of parking.  The pizzas I tried were simply out of this world, especially the NY style Margharita Pizza.

author: –ù–∞–¥–µ–∂–¥–∞ –î–∂—É–º–∞–µ–≤–∞
text:
Stopped by for lunch and was pleasantly surprised. I ordered a main dish that included a potato pancake, a large cabbage roll in tomato sauce, and a side of sweet braised cabbage. Everything was delicious and well-balanced. The potato pancakes were finely grated, giving them that perfect classic flavor ‚Äî especially good with the sour cream sauce. The cabbage roll was juicy, and the cabbage itself was tender and slightly sweet ‚Äî cooked to perfection.

Before the meal, they served two slices of bread with butter ‚Äî the butter was rich and flavorful. For dessert, I had three cheese-filled crepes (nalysnyky) ‚Äî huge, creamy, and served with a refreshing lemon sauce. I could only finish one and took the rest to go.

The service was quick and attentive, the food was fresh, and presentation neat. The total bill came to $34 ‚Äî a great value for such quality. I‚Äôll definitely be back!

author: Jennifer D.L. Smith
text: We had a great meal, everything was hot and fresh. I LOVED the fresh kielbasa! The sauerkraut was divine! Wish I could go back to Polish Villa daily!! It was that good! There were 5 adults in our party and we all raved about the great food and 2 of the 5 grew up with their mom's authentic Polish food!

author: Patrick Wilson
text:
We were in Buffalo for the weekend and knew we had to get Polish food, and the Polish Villa turned out to be the perfect place to do so!
We went for lunch on Saturday and there was plenty of seating.
We ordered a pierogi plate and a breaded pork chop plate.
The re are three pierogi options: cheese, sauerkraut, and meat for an additional $0.35 charge  We got the sauerkraut pierogi, which was tangy and tasty, but the meat pierogi was truly the star of that dish. It was served with a mushroom sauce that complimented the comfortable savory flavor of the meat filling.
The breaded pork chop was almost fork-tender and had a pleasant savory flavor.
Both plates came with a vegetable and potato option. We opted for the potato pancakes.
I wholeheartedly recommend getting the sweet and sour cabbage as your vegetable option, since it goes well with everything!

We didn't quite have room for dessert üòÖ

author: David Baker
text: Best Polish food ever. Just like grandma used to make! Polish Villa is good as or better than some restaurants I went to in Krakow Poland. I usually come in with my service dog üêï‚Äçü¶∫ and have never had any issues. Staff is very friendly and helpful. I drive 1 hour to eat here. It's definitely worth the drive.

author: Keith Carey
text:
Traditional Polish Comfort Food with Great Service

Review:
On a business trip in Buffalo, I was looking for something unique and stumbled upon Polish Villa, a traditional Polish mom-and-pop spot. The restaurant isn‚Äôt flashy, but it was bustling with locals even on a Thursday night, which felt like a good sign.

The server was friendly and helpful, offering suggestions for a first-timer like me. I went with her recommendation, the Polish platter, which included a hearty spread: one golabek, one kielbasa with onions and sauerkraut, two pierogi, a potato pancake, and a bowl of soup. The soup was a nice surprise‚Äîdifferent but delicious. The meal came out simply plated, not fancy, but everything tasted fresh and comforting. The pierogi were my favorite, and the kielbasa was flavorful. The golabek was good, though I wasn‚Äôt a huge fan of their sauce.

Overall, it was a solid, authentic Polish meal with attentive service. A good spot to try traditional dishes, though I probably wouldn‚Äôt go back again.

author: Sophia S
text:
Libbi is honestly one of the most creative spots I‚Äôve been to. The flavors are amazing, everything tastes super fresh, and you can tell there‚Äôs real thought behind every dish.

The staff is warm and on top of everything, and Chef David and his wife deserve a shoutout - their dedication really shows in the food. You can feel how much he cares.

Overall, just a great vibe and even better food.

author: Rachel Kahen
text: Let me tell you, the ues NEEDED a place like this. The gals and I hit it for a lovely Sunday brunch and every single bite nourished our souls. The food was fresh, the ambiance was delightful, and the service impeccable. I must say it's a tad pricier than other brunch spots but they aren't kidding when they say "fluffy" pancakes. Every bite was phenomenal.

author: Elirom Kalatizadeh
text: You can truly taste the love and care they put into every dish. From start to finish, everything was exceptional, the service, the atmosphere, and of course, the food. We especially loved the Halibut and their homemade Gelato! We can‚Äôt wait to come back soon.

author: Angeline Godeux
text: Beautiful place and delicious food! The whole team was so kind and very accommodating. The food was tasty and well presented. Loved Libbi! Highly recommend!

author: Jung Eun Lee
text:
It was our first time at a kosher restaurant, even though we‚Äôre Asian.
We loved all the little details, and the food was absolutely delicious.
Even the honey that came with the tea felt so refined, and the sugar served with the coffee was adorable and elegant.
When things are beautifully presented, they just taste better, don‚Äôt they?
The pancake we ordered was fluffy and perfectly suited to my taste.
The service was great, too.
And if you come here, you must try the desserts ‚Äî they were incredible.
I loved them so much that I couldn‚Äôt help but ask for four to-go, and we enjoyed them at home later.
I‚Äôm so glad a restaurant like this opened on the Upper East Side.

author: perle75nyc
text: There used to be many late-night spots in Manhattan, but post COVID, many places with high foot traffic started closing earlier. This restaurant is a great exception ‚Äî it opens late and offers a wide variety of delicious food. It‚Äôs the perfect spot for a late bite after a show nearby or for a nice date night. The staff are always friendly, and the food is consistently excellent!

author: Andrew Byrne
text: Absolutely delicious, authentic Japanese cuisine. A great place to have a quiet bar-table meal, or enjoy a night out. Highly recommend the Pork or Chicken Katsu curry- I‚Äôve had it a dozen times and it never disappoints.

author: Di Lu
text:
The salmon don has a miserable amount of salmon on a big bed of rice (see picture).
The eel set was really nice, comes with tea for chazuke and seasoning too.
Friendly staff although understaffed for the large space.
Nice little dinner spot.

author: Matthew Ho
text:
I‚Äôve been here a handful of times - it‚Äôs deliciously well-priced authentic Japanese food (with a very nice izakaya vibe), and the space is large enough that I have never had to wait for a table.

The menu is pretty long (can be a bit difficult √† la decision paralysis) and they have a (cute handwritten) menu of specials, so I must admit I haven‚Äôt tried most of their dishes (nor any of their drinks). But what I have gotten has consistently been fantastic - some highlights include:

- Oroshi tonkatsu set:¬†the katsu is so yummy with a wonderful texture (fried to a good balance of not being too oily or soggy). The whole set comes with a generous amount of food (soup, salad as well), and specifically I just love the taste of oroshi in the light dashi broth. I‚Äôve also had the curry katsu before - the curry itself was pretty good, nothing too notable to point out, and the katsu was similarly delicious.

- Sukiyaki donburi was a particular favourite. The sweet flavour went with the tender sliced beef so nicely, and it came with a good assortment of tofu, veggies, and egg for a very well balanced dish. Yakiniku don was yummy too - not too salty, beef savoury and well-cooked, and the rice/sauce combo complemented everything nicely.

I‚Äôve had the chicken karaage as an appetiser a few times before, and it was a bit inconsistent each time (sometimes a bit soggy breading / not tender meat). I feel like it‚Äôs not really worth the price (especially compared to the cost most of the main dishes on the menu).

Indeed, overall the price point is very solid here - esp for the neighbourhood. Even though I read some reviews suggesting that they are a no-tip restaurant, I fear this may no longer be the case, sigh. Would love to come back again soon!

author: KP
text:
This place is a hidden gem in the city. I have been to Japan a few times and I can confirm the food here is very authentic.

The staff are very friendly and accommodating. I would definitely return!

author: Carl Harris
text: Great Service, Great Food, good value. I usually get the Italian Mixed Sub, always a good choice. The Pizza is very good as well, buy it by the slice or a whole pie.

author: Joshua Sykes
text: I ordered a 12 cut pizza half mushroom and half sausage pepperoni and onions! When I got there they made me a 8 cut half mushroom half sausage pepperoni and onions! The only reason I ordered a 12 cut is because we prefer thicker pizza and the only 12 cut they make is Sicilian thick style pizza! So I do not understand how the communication got mixed up! I kept the 8 cut but ordered a 12 cut cheese because I wanted the thicker pizza! The pizzas were both really good just wish the mix up never happened!

author: Richard Ferrari
text: Excellent pizza. I thought the sauce and spices were done just right. An excellent treat for a family visiting Lake George for the week. I also liked the garlic knots. The prices were quite reasonable. I‚Äôd definitely come back.

author: Alana
text: Great pizza, clean bathrooms, friendly staff, and fast service!

author: Ryan Mazierski
text:
The pizza here is pretty good. I really liked the buffalo wings. Generous portions in the meals that I have had there. Good number of options and choices on the menu. Convenient
location. Friendly service. Orders are completed on time. The restaurant is a good pick up or delivery spot to order from. They have only a few tables inside. Worth a try if in the area!

author: Becca
text: Great calamari, great martinis! Loved the Christmas decor. The place felt very much like 'home' in a sense that it was far less crowded than many other bars in NYC! Would definitely go back.

author: Julie Icardi
text: We loved it... food great service great and it was warm & a safe &  friendly place especially out of the cold weather. Sorry we missed you Matt. Trish said Hi take care cheers Julie & Russell

author: DIY Dan
text: Good food, excellent service. The reason for 4 stars? The online menu isn't accurate as it lists items that aren't available and there are not many choices if you are vegetarian.

author: Ansar M.
text:
Found this lovely bar while walking around the city with my better half.   The original plan was one and done and to keep bar hoping., but they were playing excellent tunes and it was such a good vibe in there.

I decided to switch from beer to a proper drink (an old fashion) and our bar tender Josh S. was not only incredibly friendly but he convinced me to try Rye instead of Bourbon and it was the best Old Fashion drink I ever had!  It was Soo good I ordered 2 more and it was a great way to finish our day.

Shout out to Bar Tender Josh S.! Thank you for the excellent service and friendly conversation.  Cheers!

author: Shama Aziz
text: Delicious Australian food (kangaroo pie, minced meat pie) cozy atmosphere. Friendly staff. Sports on but not loud. Highly recommend for an afternoon break or an evening hang out in midtown Manhattan

author: Phylicia M
text: I had a blast. The food was amazingly fulfilling. The atmosphere was sweet. Elias Meister And his band played; awesome music. The food, the atmosphere, the employees.. simply amazing. I highly recommend!

author: Cukie The Foodie
text: This place is purely good vibes. Good music, tasty food, good drinks,and they even play a drinking contest. this is the perfect spot to celebrate Oktoberfest but I believe they keep the theme alive year-round

author: Marcus Hilka
text: Oktoberfest all year round! üç∫ The Bierhaus NYC offers a great selection of German beer and hearty food in a lively, authentic atmosphere. The outside seating with a view of Third Avenue makes it an especially nice spot in good weather. Inside, the vibe feels like a piece of Bavaria right in Midtown ‚Äì long wooden tables, festive d√©cor, and a welcoming staff that adds to the experience. A great place to enjoy a beer, some classic German dishes, and to dive into Germany for a short moment while in New York.

author: Shelley Biemans
text: This is going to be controversial! The Hofbr√§u Dunkel Weizen was tasty, but not particularly well poured. The K√§sesp√§tzle with bacon was very authentic...BUT I could hardly to find the noodles! A bit less cream and cheese would make this more of a traditional sp√§tzle dish. The caramelized onions and crispy bacon were nicely prepared and I loved the mild cheese and velvety cream sauce. (Consider I was contemplating sp√§tzle with a J√§ger sauce and a side of red cabbage.) I loved stopping in and hearing about a fifth of the place speaking German or having a touch of German accent. I would recommend others coming and return for future afternoon happy hours!

author: Andra Leeke
text: So fun. Highly recommend for a cute and fun German vibe. Great beers, great music and great service. Good location too.

author: John Camire
text: One of my favorite Japanese Restaurants, wish they were open later but the selection of Izakaya Yakitori and Sushi & Sashimi Japanese home style cooking is top notch ! Sake selection on point. Must have All Yakitori, Tako Taro Salad, Hama Kama, Hamachi + Maki Rolls as well as Hot Pots + Ramen. Prices are reasonably and affordable doesn't break the bank. Must have list! Arigato !

author: Woo Young Kim
text: Love the izakaya vibe and the yakitori were pretty good! My one gripe was they had some super spicy pepper out of nowhere that made my evening very painful. Service is so so. We would want to come back again for the yakitori, and doding the peppers so i can keep my tatse buds.

author: GrAcIE W
text:
Me and my friends went to a nearby restaurant and the food (appetizers) wasn‚Äôt good, so we left without order entrees. We hopped in to this joint on the same block and thankfully, also glad that they had a table available for us.
Good vibe, friendly staffs and good Yakitori. We couldn‚Äôt be happier after the 1st place. We didn‚Äôt order much here since we ate a little before, but would definitely come back for a full meal experience.
Thank you Izakaya Nomad for saving our night :)

author: Ali Bakhsh
text: Izakaya NoMad‚Äôs menu manages to stand out  in a city with many different Japanese restaurants. Overall, we both really enjoyed our dinner here and the diverse menu

author: Mia Huynh
text:
I came here for dinner with friends and we all enjoyed it! The interior of the restaurant is cozy and we got a booth seating. Service was fairly quick, and staff was friendly.

We ordered a variety of dishes: the cucumbers, kaisendons (the mini and uni ones), the squid, the chicken and meat assortments, chicken karaage, and okonomiyaki. Everything was delicious. My friends loved their cucumbers and mini kaisendon, while I loved their squid and uni kaisendon. The skewers were delicious and juicy, and I highly recommend trying their assortments. Definitely one of my favorite izakayas in the city, so far.

author: Amari hines
text:
Yesterday I was about to grab some fast food but decided I needed real comfort food instead ‚Äî and I‚Äôm so glad I did. I stopped by Sticky Rice, and from start to finish, it was such a cozy experience (especially on a rainy day).

I originally planned to just get the calamari, but let me tell you‚Ä¶ it was the best calamari I‚Äôve had in a long time ‚Äî perfectly crunchy, flavorful, and cooked just right. My server was super kind and convinced me to try the basil fried rice with shrimp, and I was not disappointed. Every bite was amazing.

The staff was so warm and welcoming, and the whole atmosphere just made me want to stay a little longer. Sticky Rice will definitely be seeing me again‚Ä¶ and again‚Ä¶ and again. üíï

author: S S
text: The food is absolutely delicious. The service was amazing. I appreciated the recommendations by the waitress. I loved everything that we got. The calamari was delicious and flavorful. This is such a cute spot good vibes. My new go to for Thai food.

author: Briana W
text: I come here every time I‚Äôm in nyc. The food is the best Thai food I‚Äôve had yet and the service is always great! The drinks are delicious also, highly recommend

author: Harsha Jayakody
text: Had a delicious Thai rice and dumplings at Sticky Rice ‚Äî both were full of flavor and absolutely satisfying. Great spot for tasty comfort food!

author: Giulia Turano
text: Great service and great food! Amazing lunch spot for something quick and delicious. Very comfortable environment. The green curry and pad thai are phenomenal:)

author: Pedro Giovanni
text:
I just sat there for a juice and a mocktail on a dead-breeze summer evening. They have caf√© tables outside if you only want drinks, and regular tables if you want to eat something.
The place inside is nice, and outside is just outside ‚Äî but it‚Äôs a good spot if you enjoy people-watching
The service is 4 stars because the menu was super dirty and the waitress couldn't hide her frustration when we ordered mocktails.

author: Javier Kohen
text: I really liked the food, especially the tuna tostada for its complex flavor, and the mole was a close second with its intense flavor. I found the shrimp taco's flavor too mild in comparison, but not bad. I really wanted to like the place, it looks nice and the staff is friendly, however the food took forever to come out and the space indoors is extremely loud.

author: Chris P
text:
Cute Mexican restaurant with great drinks and friendly staff.

We stop in for margaritas and chips and salsa a few times per year and always have a nice time.

author: Lisa Bilinski
text: If you're looking for a charming spot to enjoy a delicious meal, this place is a must-visit! We recently dined here and loved it. The chicken enchiladas were amazing, and the steak tacos were so flavorful! The atmosphere is so quaint and cozy, making it the perfect setting for a relaxed dinner. The service was fantastic, and we couldn‚Äôt get enough of the margaritas‚Äîdefinitely some of the best we've ever had. Overall, the food was a solid 5 stars! We can't recommend this place highly enough!

author: Caitlin Begg
text: Adina made our experience here great! Went for my husband‚Äôs birthday dinner and she was an incredible server. Food was tasty (recommend trying a bunch of the tacos, liked the shrimp and steak), drinks very good, and a cozy and intimate atmosphere. Highly recommend for a date night or small group!

author: Lena K.
text: My friends hyped this place up to me so I went with high hopes. The sound of a cocktail lounge with small bites is really good but they were playing the most random songs that did not add to the ambiance at all. If i am going to eat and drink on a crammed table the ambiance can make up for it but it was not the case. The only food item worth the money is probably the Short Rib Sliders. Pass on the croquettes and pigs in a blanket, they only come with a couple of them and leave you wanting more. Lastly the cocktails. They sounds really interesting and tasteful but when you drink it, its very lacklustre. The sweet ones are too sweet and the savoury ones are not savoury enough. I really was disappointed unfortunately. The waiters tried their best to recommend drinks i would like but the menu did not allow me to be satisfied at all.

author: Taylor
text:
A friend and I stopped by for happy hour after work. The food was honestly just okay ‚Äî not terrible, but definitely not memorable. You can find better bites elsewhere, so I wouldn‚Äôt come here specifically for a meal. That said, the drinks were fantastic! This feels much more like a ‚Äúlet‚Äôs grab a drink‚Äù spot rather than a sit-down dinner destination.

The staff was friendly, and I loved the free popcorn they give out ‚Äî such a fun touch. Their happy hour is solid, with $1 oysters and a pretty good menu overall. What really stood out to me, though, was the atmosphere. The vibe makes it a perfect place to grab a couple of drinks before heading out for the night.

author: Elsa Olivier
text:
Bar Belly is a cocktail lover‚Äôs paradise! Hugo is an absolute artist behind the bar ‚Äî every drink he makes is crafted with skill and style. The Pineapple Express was my personal favorite ‚Äî bright, refreshing, and perfectly balanced. And the Pink Pony frozen cocktail? To die for! Sweet, fun, and dangerously delicious.

The vibe is cozy yet lively, making it the perfect spot for a night out. Between the incredible drinks, the welcoming atmosphere, and Hugo‚Äôs top-notch service, Bar Belly has officially become one of my go-to NYC bars.

author: Alice Rodrigo
text: Was given a warm welcome. The high tables with stools were wobbly but that's okay. Our waitress was attentive. The food was DELICIOUS! The drinks were yummy. However, there was a lady who approached me and asked me to surrender my water bottle that wasn't opened. I don't know her name, but I can say she looks like a distressed Margot Kidder. She told me when I left. I can ask for my water bottle back and I told her I may forget. But she was persistent and insisted on the water bottle until my fianc√© took the water bottle, opened it and poured it into his cup of water. I don't know what the problem was, but she totally ruined my entire experience at this restaurant and that's what prompted me to close out my visit. If a customer is sitting at a table with a closed bottled water, they shouldn't have to be pestered to surrender it.

author: Mikayla N.
text: Amazing $1 happy hour oysters served with complimentary truffle popcorn. The drinks are phenomenal as well. I got the Casanova and it‚Äôs my fave!

author: Juan Marcano
text: Nice casual setting. Many dishes to choose from. We mostly chose appetizers. The ribs, fried shrimp, spring roll, fried banana cheesecake were excellent. The soup was not to my liking, the vegan pad see ew was ok, the fried calamari was rubbery & the pi√±a colada was so so. Overall I would say as long as you know what to order you'll be in good shape. I admit the service was really excellent

author: Diana Kenkolaukis
text:
Everything was so tasty ‚Äì highly recommended!

The mango salad was absolutely delicious ‚Äî super fresh and flavorful. But honestly, it‚Äôs just as good as the appetizers! The fried tofu and the calamari with that sweet and spicy sauce were amazing. So tasty!

It‚Äôs a bit of a shame they don‚Äôt offer bubble tea anymore, since that used to be a nice bonus. Still, this place is definitely worth visiting, and I‚Äôll be coming back many more times!

author: Sou Corley
text: This is a very welcoming Thai restaurant. Great ambiance and attentive staff. After stumbling in here after a show from the city. I had the best drunken noodles I ever had in a while. My friend had a similar dish Shrimp Pad See Ew. Even the Tamarind Hibiscus Tea was refreshing. My friend is vegan and trued their tofu dumplings. Calamari was also fresh.  I was very satisfied and would return again to try more on their menu. üòçüëèüèºüëèüèºüëèüèºüôèüèº‚ù§love it.

author: Kristina Kovalyova
text: I really liked this cafe. Nice atmosphere, very clean, the interior is comfortable and cozy. The Thai tom yum soup and noodles were so delicious. I want to try all their menu). The staff is friendly and serves very quickly. I saw a lot of delivery guys coming for orders, which means the food here is really delicious. I highly recommend visiting.

author: nico h.
text: Went in completely randomly on a Saturday afternoon. It wasn‚Äôt crowded. The waitstaff is very friendly and attentive. Ordered the Lay rolls, which was the only dish that was not satisfactory. They were dry and had what I believed to be insufficient filling. The brief taste of the filling was quite good however. Ordered the wings for an appetizer. They were crispy, cooked perfectly and the saucy was sweet and delicious. We had the red snapper for an entree and it was also perfect. The fish was whole cooked and perfectly fresh. Snapper is my favorite and this was soooo delicious. It was enough for two to share. We ordered a plate of rice - the pineapple which was equally delicious and paired wonderfully with the fish. I would definitely return. I live in the area and this a great local spot!!! Yummy üòã

author: Jimmy Si
text:
This place is amazing for Thai food. We started off with the papaya salad which was refreshing. The Khao Tom Haeng was excellent, the mixture of all meats (pork belly, Chinese sausage, minced pork & shrimp) were all delicious. The Gaeng Hung Lay Nuar was super tender and flavorful. The stewed beef in curry was so soft and was excellent when paired with the rice. The last dish, Pla Tod Samun Prai which is a fried branzino with lots of herbs and spices. It was super soft and flaky and the herbs, onions and garlic and other items went so well with it. Probably one of our favorite dishes of the night.

The staff was super nice and very attentive. The table we had was small but it managed to fit everything! There's seating inside and a canopy for outside seating. You can make reservations ahead of time. The atmosphere is great and lively and a very busy come popular dining times.

author: Sharon Chan
text:
This ambiance is so cute & the food presentation is amazing. Tony was a great server!

The Hor Mok is nothing like I‚Äôve ever had before & it was incredible. The thai tea & papaya salad were also tasty!

Kang Pu (Crab curry) & Pad Pong Ka-ree were punchy, spicy & paired perfectly with the fluffy white rice.

author: Alison Ryu
text: My favorite Thai restaurant in NYC! The fried branzino is amazing, and they have the best papaya salad. We also tried their winter menu, and the Lhon Pu appetizer was unreal. Would definitely recommend any of their crab dishes, they use high quality ingredients and you can‚Äôt go wrong with anything on their menu. So many Thai restaurants in NYC but if you go to one, you must try Sukh!

author: Foodie Elite
text:
NYC‚Äôs traincar-themed Thai restaurant is your ticket to a beautiful dining experience. @sukh.nyc combines rich flavors with stunning ambiance ‚Äî think vintage railcar interiors and thoughtfully plated dishes that feel like a journey through Thailand.

Unique presentation is a big part of the experience here‚Äîjust like the Hor Mok ‚Äî a steamed branzino curry custard topped with jumbo lump crab meat.  Their presentation and refinement took it to another level ‚Äî both visually and flavor-wise. Another must-try is the fried branzino ‚Äî perfectly crisp on the outside, tender and flaky inside.

Whether you‚Äôre a longtime Thai food lover or just looking to try something new, this Brooklyn gem is worth the ride.

Follow me @foodie.elite on IG and Tiktok for more!

author: Pat B Boon
text: Then you will not be disappointed. For the food, the food that tastes delicious and flawlessly delicious. It is the original taste of Thai food, including the model. The raw materials used are specially of high quality. It is definitely suitable for the price you have paid. The staff is smiling and paying attention to details. And you will be amazed with the special food that the restaurant offers in every season. Of course, I will come back to eat here and it is another restaurant in Brooklyn and in New York that is the top that will not disappoint you for sure.

author: Esfira Shakh
text:
Dining at Aquavit was a refreshing and inspiring culinary experience that fully lived up to its prestigious two Michelin stars. From the moment I stepped through its modern, chic entrance, I knew I was in for something special. The attention to detail, both in the ambiance and the service, was pristine and thoughtful.

We were warmly welcomed by Catherine, our server for the evening, whose grace and professionalism, along with the attentive support of the entire team, made the night flow effortlessly. Each course was served with impeccable timing, and dishes were changed seamlessly between courses, every gesture contributing to the seamless dining experience.

I opted for the Chef‚Äôs Tasting Menu, a seven-course exploration that was nothing short of extraordinary. The kitchen kindly and impressively accommodated my dietary restrictions (no dairy or shellfish), without compromising on creativity or flavor. Every plate was a work of art, visually stunning and masterfully composed with bold, yet balanced Nordic flavors.

The starters included a delicate fluke with cucumber, a beautifully presented cod with white asparagus, caviar, and apple, each dish showcasing refreshing elements with a rich complexity of flavor.

The entrees featured a vibrant salmon with Meyer lemon, a perfectly cooked Chilean sea bass with turnip, and a standout lamb with morel mushrooms. The fish was impeccably fresh and cooked to perfection, highlighting the natural taste of the sea, while the lamb served medium, was tender, herbaceous, and deeply satisfying.

Dessert was a lovely finale: a luscious chocolate mousse paired with strawberry, a sweet and elegant ending to an evening of pure culinary delight.

Aquavit is not only a restaurant, it‚Äôs an experience. A beautifully orchestrated blend of Nordic innovation, seasonal freshness, and flawless execution, it absolutely deserves every accolade and star it has received. A must-visit for any gourmand seeking something unique and memorable in New York City.

author: Ian Pilgreen
text:
Aquavit was my first 2 Michelin Star dining experience. Having had the privilege of dining at a handful of 1 Star restaurants before for lunch and dinner (like Le Pavillon, one of Daniel Boulud's restaurants in NY), I wanted to see what, if any, discernible difference there was between the two.

The thing I truly appreciate about Aquavit is its lack of pretentiousness and inviting model. I snagged a day-of 5:30pm reservation for 1 person in the bar area (a la carte menu only) at a gorgeous 2 Michelin Star fine dining restaurant and spent *under $100* for a 3-course meal WITH an aquavit flight. Incredible! They even take walk-ins at the bar if you're feeling the itch for excellent Scandinavian cuisine one night.

As soon as I walked in, I was greeted and my coat was checked by the woman at the front of house. To my surprise, she guided me to a booth table in the bar room (I was assuming I'd just be relegated to a high chair at the bar, but those are just for walk-ins).

My waiter quickly introduced himself, and there was a brief awkward moment when he put a second menu down and asked if I'd like to wait for my guest. I made a reservation for one and was dining alone, so I had to tell him it was just myself üòÇ Not a huge deal at all, but a more sensitive guest might not have appreciated the assumption.

He then asked for my water preference (still and sparkling are both complimentary) and a second waiter quickly filled my glass from behind once I indicated my preference. I ordered the Nordic Breads (sourdough & Danish rye), a flight of 3 aquavits (Fig & Cardamom, Br√§nneri, and H√∏vding) and the Swedish Meatballs.

The surprise stars of these was the Danish rye and the Fig and H√∏vding aquavits. The rye was arguably the best bread I've ever had (and I'm not a lover of hard seeded loafs), and the complex depth of flavor present in the drinks was a pleasure to experience.

The meatballs were nothing to sniff at, though. They certainly will go down as the best meatballs I've ever had, and the dish as a whole was beautifully balanced. The meatballs' texture was perfect, the pommes puree was luscious, the lingonberry provided a bright sweetness, and the house-made shaved cucumber pickles added a much-needed crunch and acidity.

After much deliberation and a recommendation from my waiter, I opted for the Apple Vacherin dessert as my final course. When it came out, it was accompanied by a small birthday Princess Cake, as I was having this dinner as a birthday celebration. It was a very cute moment, as the diners next to me, seeing I was alone at the table with my small birthday cake, all wished me a happy birthday üòä

Both desserts were excellent, but the Apple Vacherin was truly sublime. Each element gave way to a depth of flavor I wasn't expecting. The apples were tart and crisp which contrasted beautifully with the light vanilla creme fraiche. It was followed on the palate by the crunch of the tarragon-infused meringue, and the toasted sunflower seeds at the bottom laid dormant in your mouth until the very end when they gave a gorgeous kettle corn note to round out the meal.

Truly excellent experience from start to finish. I look forward to coming back in the dining room and trying out the tasting menu, especially the famous bird's nest dish which was not present on the a la carte menu.

author: Victor Borowski
text: First time dining at a Michelin star establishment. Incredible experience. Walking into the restaurant introduces you to a pleasant, relaxing aroma, as well as kind staff ready to help. The ambient music established a super serene atmosphere, and I was looking forward to dining. The dining experience itself was phenomenal. The staff was incredibly polite and accommodating for dietary restrictions of any kind. The food was incredibly creative. Some dishes were innovative, while some were meant to be cozy and nostalgic. Every dish performed how it was meant to. We were each given a gift: a complimentary container of the restaurant‚Äôs smoked sea salt along with the day‚Äôs menu. I‚Äôm excited to use this sea salt in my own dishes, and I hope to return soon.

author: Desmond
text:
Honestly, I've dined at Aquavit over 5 times now, having making the trek from Eastern Long Island to Manhattan just to come here.

This place is world class. From the relaxing ambiance, the vibe, the serenity, and the friendliness of all the staff. The food is simply divine.

Everything about the dishes presented as careful thought and execution. And it shows. I've had the Chef's tasting menu on my first visit, and enjoy the Bar menu consistently there-after.

Last night I had a remarkable Steak Tartare, Chilled Corn soup, and my date had the pancake shrimp skagen. As usual, world class food. For the seconds, we enjoyed the Atlantic cod and Kroppkakor. Again, everything outstanding.

The steak tartare should remain on the offering all year round, in my opinion!

Dessert I had the Swedish Pancake Huckleberry with the heavenly vanilla whipped cream. On previous visits, I had a wonderful Chilean Sea bass burger.

Aquavit is a place that feels like home and I hope they never change it. For the price point, its insane value and this cannot be denied. I'm shocked they do not have a 3rd Michelin Star.

I've attached photos from my multiple meals here, most recent from last night. My compliments to the entire Aquavit team for making this such a fantastic experience, every time.

Desmond Bhimull, MD

author: The Chef's Table
text: An unforgettable dining experience shared with my favorite dining companion. Beautiful technique was executed in each and every dish, with depth of flavor throughout. We started the meal with an Amuse of Elk Tartare which definitely amused the palate and got us ready for the whole experience. We shared a bottle of Timorasso which was perfect with many of the light dishes we enjoyed in the Chef's Tasting. The kitchen is in full sight with a glass wall and we enjoyed seeing them at work. We opted to add the Caviar supplement which was a nice touch. Service was top notch. Highly recommend.

author: Jennifer
text: I got the 2-roll lunch special for about $15. I‚Äôve definitely had better sushi‚Äîthe shrimp and shrimp tempura weren‚Äôt crispy, and both rolls lacked flavor overall. The taste just didn‚Äôt come together for me. The space is small but the service was quick.

author: Rolling Mutton
text:
Be careful if you are taking out. They play sneaky game not telling you the size.
$42 dollars in total. Just this much. I understand the fried oysters are written on the menu to be 4 pieces. But your specialty roll is not even 6 of them for 16 dollars! I ve seen pictures in the comments. Others got specialty rolls and it was way more than what I got.

author: Amelia Smith
text: really cute cozy place. i had a great service experience, the servers are direct but take good care of you. fish is fresh and well seasoned (i had spicy tuna roll) would definitely recommend but its small so come early to make sure you get seats. they also have take out available! (also they give really big mugs of hot green tea usually it's smaller at other places) if we lived here we'd be regulars!

author: Jacqueline Marks
text: I eat sushi all the time on the west coast, but in NYC I‚Äôve struggled to find a place with truly high quality fish for an affordable cost. Earlier this year, I found this place on doordash and now I order from them all the time. Not once have I been disappointed. The prices are amazingly low and the fish is consistently high quality, plus they are very generous with the size of their nigiri. Also‚Äî you can never go wrong with their ‚Äúyellowtail boy.‚Äù

author: Andrea Segarra
text: The sushi is decently good. I recommend ordering the lunch special, which includes soup, salad, and rolls. The place is small, and don‚Äôt expect much from the service‚Äîthe waiters are not very friendly.

author: Meghan Ng
text: First time eating here and Zara didn‚Äôt steer me wrong! She recommended the chicken schnitzel with the sides of mash pur√©e and broccolini and it was sooo good! I took the rest home because I couldn‚Äôt finish it all but I couldn‚Äôt wait to eat it the next day!üòã‚ù§Ô∏è

author: Hannah Kittrell
text:
Food was on the pricey side for brunch (not shocking for Nolita), but delicious.
All made worth it by my amazing waiter CHRIS. Hilarious server who absolutely lit up the restaurant on a slower Tuesday afternoon. He was very attentive and helpful with menu selections. Come over and cross your fingers that Chris greets you.

author: Faye Zhong
text: I absolutely love this place! Especially the friendly host Chris, he had me at hello!!! Will be coming back frequently! Oh, and the food is amazing!üíôüòç
