text: Every single dish was amazing! Too many courses that I lost count. I wish it was proper to ask for a whole 8" plate of their tiny portions, but that would be weird and waaay out of our budget. Cocktails are perfect. Left full & satisfied. Service is as-expected for the type of establishment. Interior and decor are a bit dated and dark. It is well-maintained and clean which is what matters most.  Overall, we would love to visit again.

author: Matt Bishop
text:
Le Bernardin continues to justify its legendary status as one of New York City‚Äôs finest dining establishments. Our recent prix fixe lunch experience reaffirmed why this restaurant has maintained its position at the pinnacle of seafood cuisine for decades.

From the moment we were seated the service struck the perfect balance between attentive and unobtrusive. Every member of the staff demonstrated genuine warmth and deep knowledge of the menu. Our sommelier deserves special recognition and his wine recommendations were impeccably matched to our dish selections, elevating each course and creating harmonious pairings throughout the meal.

The culinary journey itself was extraordinary. The opening amuse-bouches set an elegant tone with refined, delicate flavors that showcased the kitchen‚Äôs precision. The caviar service was presented with theatrical flair, accompanied by perfectly executed blinis and traditional accompaniments. The raw fish course demonstrated the restaurant‚Äôs mastery of preservation techniques‚Äîsilky, perfectly seasoned, and visually stunning.

The main course was a masterclass in technique: impeccably cooked fish adorned with toasted almonds, vibrant vegetables, and a sauce that brought everything together without overwhelming the star ingredient. Each element on the plate had purpose and demonstrated the kitchen‚Äôs respect for premium ingredients.

Le Bernardin‚Äôs continued excellence isn‚Äôt just about maintaining standards ‚Äî it‚Äôs about evolution while honoring tradition. Chef Eric Ripert‚Äôs vision remains as relevant and inspiring today as ever. This is destination dining at its finest, and our lunch was worth every moment. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a world-class seafood experience in New York City.‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã

author: Joanie Metivier
text:
We had such a lovely time at The Lounge at Le Bernardin. We couldn't get a table at the main restaurant as this was a last minute trip to New York unfortunately.  The food at the lounge was still outstanding ‚Äî the skate dish in particular was absolutely perfect, delicate and full of flavor, showcasing the precision and finesse the restaurant is known for.

What truly stood out, though, was the kindness of the team. Even though our son‚Äôs birthday is still a month away, they went out of their way to celebrate him and make him feel special. That thoughtful gesture meant the world to us and turned a wonderful meal into a beautiful family memory.

Thank you to everyone at Le Bernardin for such a warm and memorable experience ‚Äî we‚Äôll treasure it and can‚Äôt wait to return! We'll make sur to make a reservation ahead next time to try the main restaurant.

author: Julia Brown
text: I feel truly honoured to have had the pleasure of dining at this fine establishment. From the moment we walked in, we were greeted with hospitality and were sat immediately (no wait at the door). Every little detail of this place was special. The delicious food, the impeccable wine pairings and world-class service makes this place an absolute stand out. I have been fortunate enough to dine at many Michelin star restaurants all over the world, but this place will always have a special place in my heart. It truly does deserve its 3 Michelin star rating! We left happily full from our meal, and they even packaged our dessert course for us to enjoy later at home. Thank you so much for the incredible experience and for making myself and my guest feel so welcomed. 10/10 highly recommend.

author: Kristina Zhegunova
text:
We celebrated a birthday at Per Se two years ago and absolutely loved the experience. For some reason, I never wrote a review until now ‚Äî but it truly deserves one. The techniques were impressive, and the ingredients were of the highest quality. The finale with the dessert table was unforgettable!

That said, the restaurant itself could use a renovation ‚Äî the carpets and overall d√©cor feel a bit outdated and don‚Äôt quite match the level of a modern fine dining restaurant. Still, the food remains absolutely fantastic.

Thank you to the team for such a memorable evening! Highly recommend.

author: Lauren
text:
Per Se is an all around experience. We celebrated our engagement here and it was truly an unforgettable all around evening.

Per Se has been a bucket list item for me for over a decade. The experience did not disappoint - the food, I will say, not every dish was amazing. It is my first 3 star experience so I don‚Äôt have a good comparison, but at the price point I expect EVERY dish to blow me away.

They also had the largest wine list I have ever seen, they give you a whole iPad to look through!

The meal started off so strong with the classic oysters and pearls dish. Seriously this set the bar so high and left me feeling like I will never be the same after this meal lol. It‚Äôs been several months since we dined here and looking through my photos, the rest was fairly forgettable. I will note that every dish is truly a work of art, and some were prepped in a way that you couldn‚Äôt even imagine food being prepped that way. But again, nothing blew us away in terms of taste. The main meat dishes were nothing special.

The dessert was plentiful and very ‚Äúclassic‚Äù. Nothing out of the box or super imaginative.  We were actually so full by dessert we had a few of them boxed for us to take home.

The service is top tier. The staff really made us feel special and everyone was congratulating us on our engagement and it felt truly genuine.

The interior and overall vibe feel classic. I read a review it feels dated but it feels so classic NY to me.

Overall, it was a special night and a bucket list item crossed off the list. Unforgettable experience for sure but our expectations were set so high that not every dish hit the mark. Thank you to the team at Per Se for a memorable evening!

author: Alpay Ozbay
text:
Dining at Per Se was an unmatchable experience‚Äîone of those nights that reminds you why great restaurants matter. My wife and I went for dinner and enjoyed two incredible bottles of wine, a Barolo and a St. Georges Nuits, both perfectly paired with the flow of the tasting menu.

What really sets Per Se apart is how every single element on the plate has its own voice. Each bite delivers a completely unique taste identity‚Äînothing blends into the background, nothing feels repeated. It‚Äôs precision, creativity, and balance at the highest level.

Yes, it‚Äôs a splurge, but this was time and money exceptionally well spent. Between the service, the atmosphere, the wines, and those unforgettable flavors, Per Se delivers an evening you‚Äôll carry with you for a long time.

author: Anastasia M
text:
Phenomenal experience dining at Per Se. While it is a tasting menu, there were options to accommodate to our preferences and desires. My husband and I are not fans of tasting menus as a whole, but I have to stay every dish was out of this world.
The highlight of our experience were the staff. While extremely professional and adhered to the highest quality of serving standards, they adapted to our style of conversation and pace of eating. They were engaging and made our night that much better!

author: Karen Donovan
text: I came first to this restaurant upon the signing of my lease here at one of the high rises in the area. What will you find here? First off, a great cocktail. Secondly, excellent service. Thirdly, very good food. There is a reason why they have been in business as long as they have been. The place is now decked out for Christmas‚Äî my favorite holiday. Have a look‚Ä¶

author: Thomas
text:
Excellent food and service. The ambiance is very nice. Baked Ziti was perfection .

Just only one note. Do the tip manually on your own. The tips they suggest on the bill is including Tax. Tax is not part of the service so you will over trip if you use the suggestions on the bill.

author: akeera ramjohn
text: Some very tasty dishes! Lobster ravioli was especially delicious.  Had some other diners who were rude. Mussels in the appetizer was a bit overcooked.

author: Jordan Battiste
text: The food was excellent and the portions were generous. The drinks were really tasty and the wait staff was on point. It's a good spot for a business meeting, or a nice little date.

author: Elvis Jimenez
text:
Modern Restaurant & Lounge at 310 Huguenot Street is an absolute must-visit for anyone in New Rochelle looking for a superb dining and social experience. The moment you step inside, the beautiful, modern atmosphere sets a stylish and welcoming tone.
‚ÄãThe spacious layout expertly blends an inviting restaurant area with a lively bar. It‚Äôs a perfect spot to unwind, whether you‚Äôre enjoying a casual meal or catching a game, thanks to the convenient two televisions dedicated to sports.
‚ÄãBeyond the aesthetics, the food and fun are what truly make Modern shine. The menu boasts delicious, homestyle Italian classics and modern twists, all expertly prepared. From appetizers to entrees, every dish is a treat.
‚ÄãFor events, their private rooms are a fantastic amenity, making it an ideal choice for parties and celebrations. With a full bar, professional service, and a truly comfortable setting, Modern delivers an experience that is both sophisticated and deeply enjoyable. We thoroughly enjoyed the fun and the food‚Äîit's a staple for a reason!
‚ÄãWord Count: 152 words.
‚ÄãWould you like me to adjust the tone of the review, or perhaps focus on a specific dish or feature you enjoyed most?

author: Darran Smith
text: Mary's is marvelous. great staff and great food. there were so many tempting sweets but I decided to keep it savory on my visit and picked up a spinach pie, chili roasted sweet potatoes and a cheddar scallion scone. the spinach pie was delicious - great flavor and perfect texture. the sweet potatoes were amazing - just the right amount of chili to balance the natural sweetness of the yams. the scone was also tasty. I wish it had been a bit more cheddar-y, but the flavor was still good and the texture was perfect. if I lived here, I'd visit frequently (i.e. daily LOL!)

author: Pranav Khurana
text:
What an hidden gem this place is! Well ok, not that hidden :)

Great coffee, awesome blueberry muffin, spicy chicken sandwich and the best falafel roll I have ever had ( have had a few believe me) !

Also, they can teach some other local joints a thing or two about polite, friendly and respectful service.

Great job to its employees and whosoever is running the place!
Probably unlikely to be back in East Hampton soon but if we are then will definitely come back again!

author: Martin Kelly
text: Great food. Great coffee. Yes, it takes longer to prepare and cook food to order rather than nuke a prepackaged load of colored goop pumped with stabilizers and crap you can't pronounce.  Everything is fresh and made to order.  I now go there regularly instead of Starbucks.

author: Paula Seefeldt
text: Great coffee and delicious baked goods and prepared foods. The gluten free options are just as good as the regular choices and there is a  nice selection of savory foods, including a muffin shaped frittata. When in East Hampton, I like to go early, get a cup dark roast and then walk the beach. Great start to the day!

author: Shipra Jasoria
text: Wow!!  What a bakery. Ordered a cold chicken sandwhich and a falafel wrap to go with coffee and muffins and i am so glad i did as it made my morning. The service was great with owner/manager being the politest man ever. Will deff retuen to this bakery on my next trip to Hamptons.

author: Anna Li
text: Classic NY diner food in the area. Reasonable prices for near grand central. Solid cheeseburger! Fried calamari was very stale and hard though. Service was great.

author: Grace Kassimis
text:
Best breakfast I ever had.
Food was delicious

author: Rosenberg Bello
text: The atmosphere and service was great. The food on the other hand was subpar. Got the salad and it was drenched in dressing that I gained weight in eating the salad. The nachos that I shared with my family was very salty. The calamari however was good. If you come here, get the breakfast meals as they look appetizing. I regretted my decision and wish I got a breakfast meal instead

author: Gordon Watson
text:
A pretty good neighborhood diner.

I visited in the morning for brunch, the diner was a good level of busy with what felt like locals, always a good sign if construction workers are using a diner.

French toast was great, staff were attentive and helpful (even adding a side of peanut butter).

Coffee wasn't up to my incredibly high diner coffee standards,  but that aside all good.

Toilets however are down a flight of stairs, so not great for wheelchair users or anyone who's got limited mobility.

author: Lola Lopez
text:
Greeted as soon as I walk in. Being that it wasn't extremely busy I was able to pick my booth .
First time here and I enjoyed myself! Food was fresh & delicious.
It was about 12:30pm it was a nice space not to busy when I went but a continuous flow of people in and out.
Everyone that works there was nice & attentive to what I wanted. Side note( To my my bigger people the booths are kinda tight) I'm not sure if they have chair seating.

I also bought some sweets for home to share.Plain cheese cake it was good not overly sweet & A strawberry shortcake light & fluffy . Both good.

author: Victoria Yegorova
text:
Very affordable and delicious sushi gem! üíó
Me and my friend went here as well as my family afterwards, thai tea is my favorite! For the food I recommend the Kosan Pizza, Soho roll, Bagel roll and shrimp tempura, rock shrimp for the most part. The rest werent that bad but the other ones were my favorite. We also ordered kani salad as our first dish and it is definitely recommended to order that before the food! üç±

author: Deanna Lee
text:
Restaurant looks nice and clean, atmosphere is welcoming. The service was decent since we were the only customers there at lunch on a Wednesday at noon. The sushi tasted fresh and good. Will try again and order some other dishes for a broader review .
update 5/9 ordered delivery and unfortunately both orders were incorrect and not good. So sad that the food isn‚Äôt consistent.

author: Alex T
text:
Kosan Asian Fusion in Sheepshead Bay is a true hidden gem! The sushi here is fresh, beautifully presented, and absolutely delicious. Every roll we tried was bursting with flavor, and their creative menu offers a fantastic mix of classic and unique options.

Beyond sushi, their Asian fusion dishes are equally amazing, with rich flavors and perfect portions. The ambiance is cozy, and the staff is warm and attentive, making you feel welcome from the moment you walk in. It‚Äôs the perfect spot for a casual dinner or a special night out. I can‚Äôt recommend Kosan enough for anyone who loves great sushi and Asian cuisine!

author: Ignace Manoury
text: My server provided quality attention despite reports. The service quality alone validates this establishment. This restaurant offers affordable quality. The quality is top-notch! Visit this spot without hesitation!

author: Farooq Siraj
text:
Saturday evening drop by. This space is on my list for a while and didn‚Äôt disappoint a bit.

This restaurant has open view so one can see throughout. They have special seating for group of 6 to 8 for private, secluded dinner with your guests.

The space itself is nice and clean yet simple. The service is fast, prompt and more importantly attentive.

The food I ordered was two rolls (California and spicy tuna roll) both equally delicious and tasted fresh. Also ordered entree Japanese rice that came with salad.

All in all great experience, nice open space, excellent service, delicious fusion food.

author: Nacho Gonzalez Iglesias
text:
We had a fantastic experience at The Waverly Inn in West Village. The atmosphere is completely in character ‚Äî elegant yet relaxed ‚Äî creating the perfect backdrop for a memorable meal.
We ordered the eggs Benedict, the chicken sandwich and the burger which was absolutely spectacular‚Äîclearly a standout. The onion rings we had as a side were also must-order: crispy, flavorful, and just the right accompaniment.
The whole visit exceeded expectations. I‚Äôll definitely be back whenever I get the chance.

author: Julia W
text:
Made a reservation here for a Saturday evening dinner (resy opens 2 weeks in advanced), for my partners birthday. I did note this in my booking but it was not acknowledged by staff at all.
The dining room has a great, old feel to it, however tables are very close together. We were lucky to dine at 6pm, before the room was full.
We had the trout salad as appetiser which was better than expected and easy to share between two. For our mains, we had the chicken pot pie (very hearty) and roast chicken. Both were cooked perfectly.
For the price, I would only recommend for special occasions.

author: Nick C
text:
Celebrities may dine here and it may be on an abundance of NY must eat lists but if you are into food and know good restaurants then don‚Äôt bother.

Sadly this was the most disappointing meal I‚Äôve ever had in NYC. The pasta was below average and lacked creativity and flavour. The steak was small and under seasoned, the pot pie was dry and sloppy.

The highlights were small but the vibe inside is high. A beautiful building that has been well maintained. The completely biscuits were very tasty as was the wedge salad (but light on blue cheese and dressing). The dirty martini‚Äôs on the other hand were amazing. Some of the best I‚Äôve ever had. Also our waiter was perfect. Genuine and smiling with great chat.

All in all. Go for a drink and a snack during the day maybe. Don‚Äôt expect a memorable meal in terms of food more a fun vibe.

author: Alex Rademaker
text: My family of three had dinner here last night. We were very happy with our food and we tried a lot. Dining room has a nice feel. Service was incredible! James was our waiter and I think we‚Äôd all agree we‚Äôd go back just to have him again. You know when a waiter or waitress just makes the whole experience so nice you almost could care less about the food? This was our experience with James. We will definitely dine here again.

author: jade
text:
Such a good meal. Just tasty all around. Love the baby kale salad so much. Salmon is good but nothing you haven't had from a salmon entree before. Chicken is great, the real star is the castelfranco... holy wow. I don't know what they did with that dressing but it's absolutely insane. It honestly blew my mind I can't explain it. Mixed with the sauce of the chicken. Amazing. Need to come back from dessert but I was so full
And those biscuits!!!! So freaking good ugh i need them by the dozen.

Also the ambiance inside is a vibe.
I wouldn't sit outside in the front, it's noisy and buggy. But the back outside garden is nice.

author: Anna
text:
It‚Äôs my first time trying omakase and Sushi Blossoms was amazing! I went with my boyfriend for our anniversary and we chose the 17 course for $128 pp. Our experience was 9/10. The food was spectacular, staffs were so friendly and warm. They treat everyone with respect. The chefs were professional and explained the different pieces that were delivered to our plate.

Every piece of fish was delicately cut and prepped. Every piece was soft and tender. The soup and dessert left me speechless. They were sooooo good that I‚Äôm still thinking about it now.

Overall, I highly recommend Sushi Blossoms for anyone that likes sushi or omakase. I‚Äôd also recommend to book a reservation early and sit by the bar for the best chef experience.

author: Nina Anita
text:
It‚Äôs not great for solo dining.
Don‚Äôt bother coming early they seat you later especially if solo.
Once you‚Äôve had $185 Omakase in Barracks Row, this pales in comparison.
Yes the sushi was good but not omg I can‚Äôt wait to come back good like it is at Omakase in Barracks Row (that‚Äôs a whole experience) here it‚Äôs just a sushi bar. I was going to splurge on their premium omakase at Sushi Blossoms but it didn‚Äôt seem like it was worth it based off the service.
Overall it‚Äôs good.

author: J P (Delryn)
text:
If you like sushi, this is the perfect date night or celebration spot for a birthday or a big promotion. We have had Omakase at 4 different locations at various price ranges. This place ties with a Boston location for the top spot.

We've been here at least 4 times, sometimes with friends, usually on our own. Everytime the menu is different, and always delicious. The staff are friendly and attentive, the chefs are well-skilled and also hilarious. The ambience is superb with LoFi music, beautiful decoration, and mood lighting that is bright enough to see your food, but dim enough to not hurt the eyes.

We recommend this place to anyone visiting The City.

You don't have to, but I recommend you dress nicely. This restaurant deserves the best customers for providing the best food and service.

author: Aida Zheng
text: Took my mom and her friends here for their first omakase and I now understand why it is a local favorite. We got the $85 course, which despite being in Manhattan was surprisingly affordable, and the fish was just so fresh and melts straight into your mouth. The staff were very friendly especially the chefs, and the interior was super cozy. This place is definitely a must try for anyone having their first omakase experience! (Note that you might want to make a reservation beforehand, as they are busy most of the time).

author: Jody
text: The best omakase you will ever have! Everytime you go they change the menu based on what is in season. Their menu is always so creative and they have the best dishes. When I first tried their bird‚Äôs nest, I was laughing at how comical the dish was but it was so unique and delicious I ordered it again! I would recommend trying the sake as well, they have the best options. My favorite part about the resturant is they have the cutest collection of chopstick stands and everytime you go you don‚Äôt know which one you get! I got a chinese cat last time. Definitely a unique spot that everyone should go to once in their life. I always come here for my birthdays or special occasions. Can‚Äôt recommend this place enough.

author: Rachael Martin
text: delicious vegan sushi! i have been here on a previous trip to nyc and was keen to return. we booked online however we realised the booking system is for the other location, so be aware of this if you are using resy. they still fit us in and service was pretty good. food was great and prices are reasonable - the spicy salmon was a standout! definitely recommend this place!

author: Hannah King
text: A must visit vegan restaurant!! I come to Beyond Sushi every time I'm in town and the experience is top tier. Service is excellent. Food comes out quickly and looks and tastes delicious. Finally ordered an appropriate amount of food to have room for dessert and the ube cheesecake is to die for. üòçüò©ü§© I want to order seven more pieces as I'm typing this review.

author: A-Z Vegan
text:
Most likely the best spot in NYC for vegan sushi, full stop. As with all of the City Roots Hospitality Group, the meat (well, fish in this case) alternatives are mind-blowing and the flavour combos are well thought out and delicious. We went for:

-Philadelphia Maki
-Salmon Avocado
-Tuna Nigiri

And we were impressed by the presentation and taste of everything (although the Philadelphia roll was a ‚Äúwow‚Äù level highlight).

Service was prompt and very friendly. We will absolutely be coming back if we visit NYC again to try more of the menu!

author: Kristen
text:
Really great sushi! The Oshizuki Spicy Salmon was my favorite, the flavors were so delicious. The dumplings were also SO GOOD and seasoned very well.

We brought some family who are not vegan and they were really impressed and thought everything was super fantastic! Highly recommend!

author: Quendolen
text:
I stopped in for lunch on a Saturday afternoon and was immediately able to get a table for 1. The server who greeted me was super friendly and double-checked that I knew everything was plant-based and asked if I had allergies.

I ordered 2 different sushi rolls: the mighty mushroom and the spicy tuna. If you‚Äôre a fan of mushrooms, you‚Äôll love the mighty mushroom roll and I quite enjoyed the spicy tuna roll too.

Overall, I would say that Beyond Sushi had great service and quality food, and I definitely want to come back and try some of their other options too!

author: Barbara Gulten
text: Best late night snack! And this is a great spot for it. I admit that I was skeptical and didn‚Äôt think I would eat a whole slice. Ended up eating a slice and a half. We could have eaten a whole pizza. Great crust!! toppings simple and tasty. Long lines but it moves fast. Lot of people grab and go. They are making the pizzas fresh. Very tasty, very NYC, pop in and get two or 3 slices!

author: Paula
text:
We went on Saturday night and we queued twice for around 5-10‚Äô. Not too bad.

The best pizza was the champions üçÑ‚Äçüü´ one although a bit too much cheese.

The classic pizza was good but the sauce a bit too sweet for us.

The pepperoni square pizza was not fully cooked. The dough didn‚Äôt feel fully cooked. We should have returned it as we didn‚Äôt finish it/enjoy it.

We would have preferred if instead of a ricotta, there would have been a pizza with a blue cheese like Gorgonzola for example.

The staff was super kind and the atmosphere inside/outside is very friendly.

Prices aren‚Äôt too expensive and there‚Äôs the option of buying slices, which we loved.

Best part? How thin and crunchy the dough was.

author: Mike
text:
In my Summer 2025 Pizza Top 5 list, Bleecker Street Pizza comes in third place.

Bleecker St. Pizza is hyped by several NYC bloggers. I can understand the hype. The slices are very tasty. I had a Margerita (Cheese) a Peperoni with Jelapenos. The crust is a bit too crispy for me and the Mozzarella dominates the slices. The tomato sauce is great. OMG, the jelapenos blew me away - I thought I was used to hot food. I looove the level of spiciness! The ice-cold Coke saved me. The bit too much fat on the pizza can easily be wiped off with napkins. Overall it is a typical NYC pizza with pretty good quality and definitely worth trying.

The shop has two seating areas inside and one outside on the busy 7th Avenue. It's not exactly charming; there are TV screens everywhere and the rooms are very spartanly furnished. Overall, the shop fits in very well with the neighborhood, on the border of East and West Village, where five of New York's top pizzerias are located.

I guess I was very lucky because on my visit there was no waiting line at all!

I recommend Bleecker St. Pizza.

author: J M
text:
Always stop in once a year on a Friday to start our New York weekend trip (coming from VA). Greg is always very welcoming and he's always there when we (fam of 5) stop in. Never been disappointed in anything we order and we've tried every pizza on the menu. This place fills up fast and always so busy but worth it. We always make sure to have left overs to eat at the end of the night (after cruising NY).

Would have posted more photos but the kids already started eating.

author: Ash N. Smith
text: Solid pizza slice shop down in the village. It‚Äôs gonna be your go to place if you‚Äôre hitting in the bars in the area. They have plenty of seating for an nyc pizza shop and a good selection of pies. I actually grabbed one of their ready to go Greek salads and it was really good! üòä def gonna stop by here again in the future.  They will always be there!

author: Sara Soltan
text:
So tasty and generous amout
The fries so crispy and delicious
And their generosity to give free falafel before even start to order
They sell falafel packs to cook buly yourself, I can't wait to try it

author: Natalie Hernandez
text: If you‚Äôre pro pali, coming here is such a treat! Great food. Touching artwork. This is a must visit!! üòã I tried the king appetizer and chicken platter! So delicious

author: Jackie M
text:
Food was delicious!! Big portions! Pita was fluffy and flavorful! Love the decor and love how friendly this environment is from
the employees, to the owner, to the patrons. I will be back!

author: Giovanni Correa-Quinones
text: Everything from the place is phenomenal. From the entrance to the falafel to all the stickers and signs out there. I totally understand why the falafel is the best one ever. I would legit come back here every week if not every month. Food was mind blowing

author: Elif Akar
text: A proud Palestinian owned business and they have the best falafel I‚Äôve ever had the pleasure of having in my entire life and I‚Äôm not exaggerating at all. It‚Äôs shaped like kibbeh rather than the traditional round shape, they start frying them as soon as you walk in and offer you a piece as you wait in line to place your order and it‚Äôs the best starter before your meal. That is if you can fight the urge to get more and order something else instead which I personally failed at and proudly had one too many pieces that day, no regrets. Oh and the meat shawarma was also delicious.

author: Adam Giladi
text: Unbelievable Italian dinner and hard to believe it is gluten free! Loved exploring their risotto menu. Enjoyed the duck breast ragu dish with the penne. Don‚Äôt skip dessert here either

author: Russell Zagado
text: This has to be, the absolute best place for risotto. I‚Äôve had many risottos, even cooked them myself, and the lobster risotto special I‚Äôve had, was incredible. The place is nice and humble, and the owner or manager was extremely kind and attentive. All three of us got the lobster risotto. The lobster risotto was this nice risotto where the lobster was incorporated into every bite, along with other components-they all made sense in the dish. The grana padano was an incredibly tasty cheese that I put on my spinach. We also got a few appetizers like the calamari and the prosciutto and they were refreshing. It is not recommended to put cheese on seafood, as the cheese overpowers the seafood. This is my second time going to this place, and yet again, I wasn‚Äôt disappointed.

author: Morgan Watkins
text:
Wow. What a fantastic experience. We're only in the city a couple times a year so it's rare that we eat at the same place twice. This will be somewhere we return.

Carpaccio was on special. Just the right amount of shaved truffle was a highlight.

Both of us had risotto from the regular menu, we're still raving.

One server (Nicole?) was plenty for the small space and she was fantastic.

author: DBradshaw25
text: Even if you're not gluten free, I really recommend you check out this place! Everything was really excellent! We had the Fritto misto (calamari) appetizer and the Caesar salad to start - the salad was amazing quite honestly! The gluten free croutons were the best (I usually am never able to get croutons with salad!). For the main meal we had the pollo bacon risotto and the spinaci asiago pasta. The risotto - fantastic! The pasta was good but please allow the server to add cheese to it! I asked them to skimp on the cheese and I needed to add salt to it which was my mistake. When the server came back I asked them to put the normal amount of cheese on it and that fixed it. For dessert we had the special which was the raspberry chocolate tart.... OMG.... Phenomenal!!! Service was excellent and everything was fantastic. I will be back!!

author: Hannah Tori
text: We had dinner at Risotteria Melotti after our wedding ceremony a couple weeks ago. We have 3 celiac family members who all RAVED about the food here and felt safe because the entire restaurant is gluten free. They accommodated all of the needs of our party (kids who are picky eaters, someone who doesn‚Äôt eat shellfish, vegetarians). Kind servers, delicious food, excellent hospitality! Can‚Äôt say enough good things about this place, and it will always be one of our favorite restaurants.

author: Steven Kagen
text: Their website does not show a delivery charge until after you pay. I was going to buy a $38 pizza pie, added a 15% tip for a driver, and after I made a payment got a receipt with $15 previously hidden delivery charge. I totally can understand a delivery charge, but it should be disclosed before the payment, not after.

author: Shneur
text: Great pizza shop with fair prices. Salads, sandwiches.. most fresh salads and pasta plates are $10! Limited indoor and outdoor seating. Close to public transportation.

author: Ben GG
text:
The pizza here is good compared to their sister pizza location on nostrand.
BUT the fish n chips. Were horrendous..
Please just please take a look at how real fish n chips are supposed to be. Your fries are alright but the FISH bro those frozen fish sticks. HORRENDOUS.

author: K. A. Butt
text: I bought a whole pizza pie but it was over priced so I won‚Äôt go back there

author: Dave Kineret
text: Very good pizza. There were literally 20 orders and it took 5 minutes and there was a Karen acting like it's McDonald's because they don't wrap it enough they literally only have one working come on Karen but otherwise the food was insane!

author: Pnina Bar Zaltzman
text: We visited the restaurant three times, the first time about two years ago in the bar was simply unforgettable, excellent dishes. It left us with a wonderful taste. The second time in the restaurant was an extraordinary experience, everything was delicious and special. Today at the bar, what a disappointment, we left the food on the plate, the service is excellent, the food is so disappointing. The starters are not tasty, boring. The main course, lobster ravioli, smelled bad, the fried chicken felt like fast food, the only dish we really liked was the Mont Blanc, the dessert was excellent, just a waste of money and time, a big disappointment

author: k chen
text:
This was truly the best five-star dining experience we‚Äôve ever had! Even though there was a small mistake with one dish, the staff handled it with such grace and professionalism. They not only offered us a discount, but also surprised us with five complimentary desserts and a birthday cake.

The desserts were absolutely stunning‚Äîeach one a masterpiece that completely blew us away. What impressed us most was the way the restaurant turned a tiny imperfection into the most perfect and memorable service.

It ended up being the most delightful birthday celebration we could have asked for‚Äîfull of surprises, warmth, and genuine care. Highly recommended!

author: Tarek Farahat
text: Loved it ..Great place for lunch. The food is delicious, service is quick and the bar area is nicely spacious. Great for business lunch as it offers good space between tables to allow for conversations. We had a delicious hot dog with caviar (yes with caviar) and tasted amazing. Main course were salmon (always great there) and pasta with lobster. Dessert was caramelized banana with ice cream. Portions are relatively small but each dish had its own strong taste.

author: Jayson Tomasulo
text: Went for a late lunch with the family after an adventure at the met. Overall it was stellar. Started with some tomato bread that was perfectly seasoned. The salmon was cooked well and a sauce added some interesting notes. Finished it off with a delightfully chocolate dessert. Food was excellent and service was tight. Highly recommend

author: Emma Chiu
text:
Came here for a really special celebration with a few friends and honestly was very disappointed by our experience.

We got the restaurant week menu and the food was phenomenal -- highlights were the steak tartare, heirloom tomato toast, rabbit tagliatelle, and the bread and cultured served at the beginning. Dessert was great too.

What made the experience subpar was the service. We sat outside and ordered a bottle of wine, but bugs started to fall into our wine glasses that we barely drank so we let our server know. She was kind about it and even offered to seat us inside without us asking, which we were surprised about and took her upon her offer. However, once we were seated inside, the entire experience went downhill. We hadn't finished all of our food from outside, and they said they would take care of moving everything inside but they only brought in our appetizers and tossed our half eaten bread which we were hoping to finish. Our new wine glasses were filled with the remainder of the bottle of wine we ordered and we had to ask about the two glasses of wine that were taken from us due to bugs being in them (eventually someone came and refilled our glasses but I wish we didn't need to ask). We also waited 30-45 minutes before dessert was served and it only came because we had to ask for it.

Overall, I would recommend the restaurant for food but wouldn't recommend it for the service. Given its price point and reputation, my friends and I were all very disappointed and it definitely put a damper on our night and celebration. We appreciated the staff trying to improve our experience initially but we would've much rather stayed outside had we known this was the experience we were going to receive.

author: Rebecca & Caleb
text: Oh, how we love the Fernies!!! Chatting with Julia was not only incredibly helpful (we had no idea what we were doing) but also SO much fun (are we best friends?!). The whole Fern Botanica team is supremely talented, wonderfully kind, and ridiculously fun, and our florals were straight out of a dream. We would have Pinterest-ed our own wedding photos, which seems like the goal to achieve!! Julia entertained our odd requests & knew what we wanted, even when we didn‚Äôt. Our chuppah was breathtaking, and the bud vases across the tables were the subject of many guests‚Äô glowing compliments! Our friends even commented on the gorgeous color of the candlesticks. Truly, the Fern team pulled together the most beautiful design and exceeded all of our expectations. We couldn‚Äôt recommend them more. Thank you, Fernies!

author: Lily Momeyer
text: We gave Julia and her team little direction and full creative freedom, and they absolutely blew us away. The space was completely transformed with their ideas, designs, and florals-- it was more beautiful and unique than we could have imagined. We also loved our studio visit and felt like fast friends with the Fern Botanica team. They were responsive throughout the process, and really such a joy to work with from start to finish. We can‚Äôt recommend them enough!

author: Melissa Gaglio
text:
Julia, Sk and team are beyond talented. Flowers at least for me set the mood and are one of if not the most impactful portion of wedding visuals. I knew when I found Fern Botanica on Instagram I wanted them to curate my wedding. Julia and Sk are attentive, flexible and wonderful to work with. Julia came to see me in my apartment the morning of to tell me about my flowers. I was so thrilled and happy to finally meet her!!  Our family and friends gasped when they saw the room for our wedding reception (as did I ) it was everything I wanted it to be. Art Deco and Old Hollywood time travelled right to our wedding. My  bouquet is still thriving in water at my apartment!

Thank you so much for handling everything with such care!

author: Elle Kenwood
text:
How do you give 1000 stars ‚Äî because 5 just doesn‚Äôt cut it! I had the absolute HONOR of having Fern Botanica as my wedding florist, and I‚Äôm still in awe of what they created for us. Julia, SK, and Lenin are pure magic ‚Äî warm, kind, and the kind of people you instantly want to sit and have coffee with ‚Äî but also complete creative geniuses. They didn‚Äôt just deliver my vision; they elevated it into something more stunning than I ever could have imagined. Just beyond beautiful. If you‚Äôre lucky enough to work with Fern Botanica, you will not be sorry!

Signed,
Fern Botanica‚Äôs #1 Fan

author: emily rose kellerman
text: I used Fern Botanica's Fernies for my wedding and absolutely LOVED my arrangements! I ordered two Va Va Voom arrangements and flower girl crowns. I can't express enough what good vibes working with Fern Botanica was, they were collaborative and really listened to what I wanted. It was so nice to find such a wonderful florist who would do √† la carte orders! I got so many compliments on the flowers! Can't recommend them enough!

author: Donna S
text:
We had a fabulous date night here before our second baby arrives. Had the tasting menu so we were seated in front of the window. The views are spectacular.

Food was amazing, they even gave us several amuse bouche in between waiting for our main dishes on the chefs tasting menu. The BBQ portion was cooked in front of us so we didn‚Äôt need to cook or cut the meats ourselves. We had the regular prime rib menu and it was fantastic. The galbi was marinated for 24 hours and you could tell the marinade penetrated deep into the core of the meat. Every morsel was savoured. The basque cheesecake was the cherry on top to end the meal. Loved the overall presentation and the flow of the meal. Will come again next time.

author: Michael Moore
text: This is a really pretty place, basically fancy Korean bbq. There are set price options and the server does all the cooking and serving. So it has all the aspects of kbbq without any of the work. Great choices of meat, great service, love the view and drinks also. We had a great time. I will say it‚Äôs not the place if you‚Äôre looking for a more laid back place, it does have a certain aesthetic. But it‚Äôs beautiful so perfect for dates or dressier nights

author: Sapphira Bella
text: This place has pretty good reviews but the food was not great compared to the price- I did not eat any of the meat however. A plate of veggie bbq was at $18. The banchan was decent, dessert was good. Overall good but nothing mind blowing.

author: diana kelly
text:
I‚Äôve always loved this restaurant ‚Äî I even celebrated my birthday here once! After traveling a lot, I hadn‚Äôt visited in about two years and was really looking forward to coming back. Unfortunately, this time the experience was a bit disappointing.

We were seated but waited around five minutes without menus or attention. After calling someone over, we ordered water, but it never arrived before the waiter came to take our food order. My friend‚Äôs salad came out first, mine didn‚Äôt, and the wine we ordered never showed up. At one point, I was even served a dish I hadn‚Äôt ordered.

Eventually, one of the managers noticed and took care of us ‚Äî from that moment everything was great, and the wagyu was absolutely delicious. Still, all those small service issues added up and made the evening less enjoyable, especially since I‚Äôd been so excited to return.

author: Michael Fil
text: This isn't just any Ktown bbq. Gaonnuri boasts of beautiful midtown views from the 39th floor. Their tasting menu hinted at Korean flavors, but didn't overpower. I especially liked the white kimchi cod and the cuts of meat selected for the kbbq. Good service too. Also appreciated the recognition of our anniversary!

author: Joanne Uy (JT)
text: Thai cuisine is in my top 3 favorite cuisines ever. So much so that I've traveled to Bangkok to eat and learn to cook more than 3 times now. While I have my usual Thai restaurant go tos, Pure Thai is now my favorite when it comes to their noodle soups! I've just recently tried both their beef and roasted pork soups with rice noodles and they were so delicious and comforting! They also do their Thai iced tea just right and have good vegetable spring rolls! Service is warm and friendly even if they get so packed and busy. The restroom is spacious and clean especially in their expanded section which we usually enjoy better. Can't wait to come back soon for my Thai noodle soup fix! :)

author: Jennifer Jernun
text: The food here is absolutely delicious! The noodles have an authentic Thai flavor, and every single dish is packed with amazing taste ‚Äî yes, every single one. You can truly experience real Thai cuisine without having to fly to Thailand. The prices are very reasonable, and the staff are attentive and friendly without being overbearing. Highly recommended!

author: Madison McCanna
text:
Such a gem! Every single thing was delicious & the prices were so reasonable esp for being in NYC. Service was top tier and the restaurant is super cute and cozy.

Update: Just went here again during a day trip to NYC & it was so good once again! We got the app sampler (veg puffs are the best), chicken pad Thai, and the crab & duck noodles. Lovely service & delish food!

author: Adeline K.
text: I‚Äôve been coming here for almost 10 years and I still order the same soup every time ‚Äî Sukhothai. Over the years I became pescetarian, so they make it with tofu for me now, but I‚Äôve had it with meat before too and both versions are equally delicious. It always tastes exactly the same ‚Äî pure comfort. The place is tiny but the food is incredible, and I bring everyone I care about here when they visit. The staff is always warm and friendly. Pure Thai is truly a gem of Hell‚Äôs Kitchen.

author: Robbin
text:
12 years ago when I first visited Pure Thai Cookhouse, I was blown away. 12 years later when I came again, I was still impressed by the quality of their street style Thai food. Even better this time, it is slightly easier to get a same day reservation.

I'll take my friends to this place if we are looking for no frill high quality Thai street food with reasonable price. This may be the top one for me in this category.

author: Magda L
text: Absolutely amazing Korean spot! The flavors were out of this world ‚Äî every dish was packed with depth and spice, just like it should be. Hands down the BEST tofu I‚Äôve ever had ‚Äî perfectly cooked, flavorful, and addictive. The staff was super friendly and made us feel so welcome from the moment we walked in. Everything we ordered was top-notch. If you love Korean food (or even if you‚Äôre new to it), this place is a must. 10/10!

author: MO
text: Welcoming & attentive service but be ready to be inched out as they are very busy from early on and dishes come out fast. Kimchi cheese pancake was ok. Crispy but didnt taste any cheese, just something mushy inside. Bulgogi grill was very tasty and kepted warm on the skillet. Fried chicken was fine. Next time, will try the crab and the hot pots recommended by server. Cocktail was nice but too weak in any hint of liquor but, still a good compliment to the savory food.

author: Ivy Chen
text:
Came here for lunch and really enjoyed it! The atmosphere is cozy with a modern touch, perfect for a casual meal with friends. I didn‚Äôt order any drinks, just focused on the food ‚Äî the stew and BBQ were flavorful, hearty, and felt like real home-style cooking.

Service was friendly and the food came out quickly. Prices are reasonable for New York, and the lunch portions were very satisfying. Highly recommend if you‚Äôre looking for authentic Korean comfort food in the city!

author: Ally Xiong
text: The food was amazing!! Adding this place to my top 5 faves in Ktown! I definitely think you need to get out of the main 32nd St block and venture to 31st and 33rd-35th St because the food scene is so much better!! The restaurant does get packed so make sure you make a resy! You won‚Äôt regret trying this place out. We got spicy rice cakes which came with squash and peppers, slow cooked pork belly (so soft, not rubbery at all), and their sweet potato noodles with pork. You‚Äôll know the exact names when you look at the menu, but all of these were fire üòç

author: Wilson Ho
text: Nice place with a calm ambiance. The staff are considerate and the food is great. Got the KFC (can't go wrong with Korean fried chicken) also got the spicy pork BBQ, not to spicy and has a sweet aftertaste. All the side dishes that accompanied the dish balanced each other perfectly. Would definitely come again.

author: McKeith
text:
What an exceptional brunch experience. The cocktails were outstanding, with playful names inspired by music icons‚Äîone after my favorite Beyonc√© track, Alien Superstar, and another, Bidi Bidi Bom Bom, honoring the infectious Selena hit. Each drink was superb, with a subtly botanical character that felt especially fitting given the restaurant‚Äôs proximity to the Brooklyn Botanic Garden.

For brunch, I enjoyed the Huevos Rancheros and the French toast. The Huevos Rancheros featured perfectly cooked short rib, which proved to be the highlight of the dish. The French toast struck a harmonious balance between sweet and savory; fresh blueberries and raspberries, paired with a delicate caramel drizzle, eliminated any need for syrup.

I also sampled the shrimp and grits, which were equally impressive. Even before tasting the shrimp itself, the rich flavor of the seafood infused the grits beautifully. The shrimp were plump, generously portioned, and cooked to perfection.

The staff were exceptionally kind, attentive, and worked seamlessly as a team. I was fortunate to meet one of the owners, whose humility and graciousness left a lasting impression. I look forward to returning to explore the upcoming seasonal menu

author: Karlie Arkin
text:
Arden is darling.  Small and personal.
We had fried olives (because, what?) and they were good.  Kind of lost their oliveyness with the light breading and frying.
And the Emotional Rescue cocktails -
Delicious.
A cod special with mushrooms and eggplant and curry.  And the Roasted Hen of the Woods mushroom dish.  Everything was beautiful, balanced, had a lot of mmmmmmm going on.
Also, super cute journals carried the check to the table, with comments and drawings.  Very fun.
We would def go back again.

author: Bethlehem Gedion
text: Wandered into Arden looking for a quick bite after enjoying the Brooklyn Botanical Gardens and it was a treat! The Happy Hour menu offers a well rounded variety of bites and more hearty items. The Salmon tartare and the Hamachi on crispy rice were standouts and my companions enjoyed the burgers which were also solid. Great atmosphere and wonderful service. I look forward to coming back and trying their dinner menu. The toffee pudding was tasty, but be advised it‚Äôs less dense and more airy than a traditional pudding.

author: Mark
text:
Our first time here was a Sunday afternoon for brunch. We sat at the bar and thoroughly enjoyed everything - the food, wines by the glass, the people who work here.

Last Saturday we came back for dinner. Once again, it was lovely on all fronts. While we didn‚Äôt have anything from the happy hour menu, our meal (shared the little gems wedge; he had the octopus and shrimp starters for his main course, I had the chicken Marsala) was great. The portions were pretty large, and while I initially had hopes of bringing half my chicken entree home, I ate all of it. The side of corn cooked with miso was fantastic too

author: Jess Shen
text: a lovely small neighborhood restaurant with great drinks and the food was all very flavorful! We got the beef shoulder as our main with a side of brussels, and for starters we did salmon tartare, bone marrow, and pork belly. they also gave us a complementary bok choy dish which I loved the flavor of.

author: Victor Chau
text:
Came here for lunch on a Sunday. Took around 30 minutes to get seated after joining their waitlist around 12:30pm.

Everything here was exceptionally tasty. The banchan were all delicious and unlimited which was a nice plus.

We ordered the mini bossam, spicy tofu soup, and seafood pancake. The pork was excellent, tender and flavorful with no overly porky tasty. The seafood pancake had a great texture and had plenty of seafood. The soup also had plenty of seafood and was tasty.

We spent around $40/pp after tax and tip for two people‚Äôs lunch. I was very satisfied and would definitely come back since I felt it was decent value for my money.

author: Leo Zou
text: Really worth the long wait time. Some of the best Korean food I have. The thick slices of pork belly really hits different than the thinly sliced ones. The meaty taste is spectacular and pairs really well with the kimchi and jalape√±os. The bugolgi had a wonderful flavor that‚Äôs a bit on the sweet side. Really goes well either way the rice. The seafood tofu stew was also great but would appreciate it if the mussel‚Äôs shell didn‚Äôt break into the soup.

author: Bradley C
text:
Came here for the first time. I ordered a mini Bossam and CDG Dubu Duruchigi.

Before my food was ready. A bowl of fresh tofu was served first. It was so simple and delicious. You can tell they are really proud of their daily homemade tofu.

The first one was cooked 3 layers pork with sides of kimchi, jalapeno, garlic, and soybean paste sauce. It was so delicious. The pork was cooked perfectly. It was soft with nice bouncy texture. It pairs very well with the soybean paste sauce. I basically licked the saucer clean.

The tofu stew was also very nice. The broth was umami and spicy. The tofu was superb. Rich and elegant of natural soybean flavors. The server informed me that the broth was seafood based. The white noodles were a plus to the dish.

All the side dishes were so delicious. I think I asked refills for 3 times. Today I got stew potatoes and radishes, cold string beans with garlic, eggplant with mushrooms, pickled radishes, and a cold seaweed dish. My favorites were the eggplant and the string beans. The potatoes had nice flavor, too. I believe I tasted something like miso.

The servers were attentive and friendly. Even though they were all so busy, they still take time to make sure my needs were met. Overall, I had a great time dining here. I‚Äôll definitely come back with more people. The portions of the foods were great. PLEASE SHARE THE TOFU STEW. I was almost too full to walk after I finished all my foods.

author: Hannah Lee
text: My friends and I loved our dining experience here! The complimentary house-made tofu was absolutely delicious ‚Äî it had a firmer texture, which I actually prefer over silky smooth tofu. I ordered the spicy kimchi tofu stew and was very satisfied. The stew had a nice variety of seafood that complemented the spice of the broth perfectly, and the tofu was a real standout that brought the whole dish together. After we finished our meals, our waiter poured some tea into our rice bowls and served it to us, explaining that it helps with digestion. The tea was unsweetened, and the combination with the rice wasn‚Äôt my favorite, but the gesture was thoughtful. Our waiter was also very funny and extremely helpful in guiding us through the menu!

author: asmaa odeh
text: Food was amazing! We definitely picked the more indulgent foods and honestly they did not disappointed. So so so amazing. The sushi roll was one of the best I‚Äôve had, they packed it up with tuna and it was so fresh and tasty! I also really enjoyed the fried soft shell crab. Really good and the atmosphere was great.

author: Justin Ton
text: What an experience. Food and service were phenomenal and the food and drinks. Wow. Great Szechuan taste. Super authentic. My new favorite chinese spot in the city!! The Fried fish and green beans with eggplants were amazing. All the sides and appetizers as well were phenomenal.

author: Alex Zhang
text:
I have been wanting to try this place for a very long time. finally pop in for a visit during lunch time on a weekday. it really exceeded my expectation. there are so many sichuan restaurants in NYC and it's already hard to top one another. but the food here is really unique and the service is a top notch. Love their old shanghai decor makes it cozy and quiet enough to be able to talk to each other without screaming. there are multiple floors even seats that best for solo as well.

The dish most wows me is the spicy soft shell crab. there are so much crab in it and loaded with flavor.
Tea Smoked Duck is very juicy with smoky taste.
Pork Dumplings in Chili Oil is one of the best flavor in NYC, it's very authentic taste with a little sweet and a little spicy.
the lucky cup sake is very easy to drink if you want to take advantage of their happy hour price for only $8

There are some lunch bento specials as well, if you are not a person to share. there are also plenty to choose from.

author: Billy Xia
text:
Authentic Szechuan food with a creative twist. Every dish we ordered was delicious and hit the spot with the right amount of spice and flavor. Surprisingly reasonably priced.

Even though we didn‚Äôt try the cocktails the menu and names looked definitely interesting.

Very cute and chic decor inside. The only downside is that it was very loud so we had to shout to each other throughout our meal.

Will be coming back.

author: Kristine Stefanija
text:
One of my favorite spots for Chinese food and great peaceful atmosphere in New York!! It feels like you‚Äôre traveling in time to 1930‚Äôs Shanghai.

Peaceful, cozy, incredibly delicious! The loofah with dried scallops and mapo tofu are my favorites! I highly recommend this spot!

author: Jay Buggy
text: We visited this restaurant during weekdays at 2 pm. There was no wait, and there were plenty of tables available. The ambiance was pleasant, but the food was not particularly impressive, and the service was quite lacking. The staff seemed preoccupied with chatting in the hallway instead of attending to our needs.

author: Vanity Duran
text: Sylvia‚Äôs was good. I‚Äôm visiting from Florida and went because of its history. It‚Äôs nice to see the restaurant still maintain its charm. The service was a bit slow though and I heard that with the new owners, the vibe has changed. Nonetheless, I enjoyed the mac and cheese that came with complimentary cornbread. I drank my light meal down with Sylvia‚Äôs Uptown drink which I‚Äôd assume is her version of iced tea and lemonade. The space is cozy yet very spacious. It‚Äôs almost as if you‚Äôre stepping back into time going down the timeline of all the class act guests who‚Äôs stopped by.

author: Govind V
text:
I visited Sylvia‚Äôs after seeing it featured on the YouTube series Worth It, and it absolutely lived up to the hype!

The food is soul-warming and full of flavor. The fried chicken was perfectly crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside ‚Äî easily some of the best I‚Äôve had. The BBQ ribs were tender and coated with a delicious, tangy sauce. The collard greens had that comforting, slow-cooked depth of flavor, and the mashed potatoes were creamy and well seasoned. And of course, the cornbread was a highlight ‚Äî warm, fluffy, and perfect with a little butter.

The portions are generous, the presentation is inviting, and you can tell everything is made with care.

The atmosphere is cozy and welcoming, with a classic Harlem charm. We sat in the covered outdoor section, which was comfortable and had a nice view of the neighborhood. Service was friendly and attentive, making the whole experience even better.

If you‚Äôre in NYC and want true comfort food with history and heart, Sylvia‚Äôs is a must-visit. I‚Äôll definitely be coming back.

author: Tanisha Knott
text:
Yes the food was good, BUT‚Ä¶  Visiting my stepdaughter in New York for Thanksgiving 2025,  She suggested Sylvia‚Äôs Soul food Restaurant in Harlem. We made reservations for 5, for 5pm. We got seated at 5:10pm. One person received their food around 6pm (she ate by herself). The 4 of us got our food at 6:36pm. OVER AN HOUR LATER. We were told that the one person at our table got their food first because they thought it was a single order.  The waitress apologized but did not ask if we wanted to talk to the manager.  So one of our guest asked the waitress if we can get a 10% discount due to the long wait. That‚Äôs when the waitress said we need to talk to the manager.  The manager came and gave us 10% off.  Also, the waitress never brought out the dessert until we asked for it (comes with the meal.)  the sweet potato pie came out cold. HOWEVER, the food was really, really good. The greens were delicious, cornbread delicious. the cornbread stuffing was delicious. Yams, mac and cheese, Turkey‚Ä¶ delicious. Our desserts‚Äî  came at the end and we took it to go.  We also saw another waitress with a visible irritated face. But we take it as she didn't want to work on Thanksgiving. Next time‚Äî she should take the day off.

But Would I go back. Absolutely! The food was bomb! But I would go on a non-busy day.  I don‚Äôt cancel until the second strike.

author: Stacy Lewis
text: Service with a smile was great!  So was the hospitality.   Our waitress was pretty busy so she wasn't able to give top notch service but our needs were met.  The food... myuah!  Delicious and down home.  This will not be my last visit to Sylvia's.  We met people from the US and those visiting from abroad.  Don't skip Sylvia's!

author: Brook Riddick
text:
Honestly everything was fantastic and exactly what I'd hoped to show my friend about good soul food.
We had originally planned on somewhere else for dinner but I admit I saw the YouTube review @Jolly did and thought, okay I HAVE to try this place. Though the chicken was the big recommendation online I have to say that the ribs and the collard greens were some of the best I've ever had.
You know it's a good meal when you both feel "bad" about leaving food on the plate because it feels like you're insulting the chefs.
We sincerely couldn't have asked for a better experience

author: JoNo X
text: Break‚Äôn Eggs Creperie was a pretty good sit in breakfast/brunch place that heavily focused on crepes. I thought the food was good and cooked to perfection. I would have loved to see more traditional options that included some of the breakfast classics without having to pay an up charge. All in all, this place was a good visit and I‚Äôm glad I stopped in.

author: M D
text:
We came to Crepe ‚Äòn Breakfast in Amherst while visiting Buffalo and were so impressed, we came back twice during our trip ‚Äî and ordered the same exact thing both times: the Eggs Benedict. That‚Äôs how good it was. The eggs were perfectly poached, the hollandaise was rich and velvety, and everything was plated with care.

The atmosphere is warm and welcoming, and the staff made us feel right at home. It‚Äôs rare to find a spot that hits the mark so consistently. If you‚Äôre in the area, don‚Äôt skip this place ‚Äî it‚Äôs hands down one of the best breakfast spots around.

author: Eui Sun Chung
text:
The restaurant that was originally located on Main St. has closed and is now being run as a combined operation at this Express location.

There are enough tables inside, so you can enjoy a full dining experience just like at the original restaurant.

The omelette was as delicious as a top-tier hotel breakfast, and the French toast was incredibly moist. The coffee was pleasantly good as well. Each dish came with a small portion of fruit, adding a nice balance to the flavors.

author: James Schillinger
text: Here is my experience at this establishment 1st and last time I will ever eat there. I would give it zero stars if I could. First the portions in the menu were not as stated for the French toast the menu stated 3 slices and we got 2 on both orders. The pancakes tasted as if they were overcooked in oil and the French toast was soggy as left in the egg batter far too long and the eggs my other family member got were dry and disgusting. I am very upset not just with the food but also not once was it stated there would be a forced group charge of 20% ontop of being served this horrible food then to add complete insult to injury they charged me an additional 10 dollar tip when I clearly wrote 0 for additional tip. I cannot believe they are still in business like this. I have never in my 40 years of existence have I ever had experienced such a horrible breakfast from anywhere!!!!! I also paid 65.15  for this experience with 10 dollars being staight stolen from me. You have been warned.

author: L C
text:
Wonderful experience all the way around. Great selection of delicious food from daily egg plate specials to spectacular one of a kind crepes.
Coffee was hot and strong. The fruit was fresh and plentiful. The prices were reasonable for the amount of food offered.
The server was cheerful, friendly and attentive. She was busy but made all of us feel welcomed and appreciated.

author: Carla Daza
text: Delicious pizza and a range of other menu items available. We tried the Mediterranean summer vegetable pizza and the sunflower pesto pizza. Both were good, the pesto pizza was my favorite. Staff is nice. Depending on hunger, might be able to split one pizza for two people. Leftovers are yummy.

author: Isabella Grandic
text:
Ok actually quite good vegan mushroom pizza. That‚Äôs why they get 5 stars. Margarita would be 5/5 if it had a bit more of that cashew cream cheese‚Ä¶

Drinks were lovely. HUGE basil lemonade. Fab Arnold Palmer. Great.

Tacos were whatever ngl. Get the pizza!!

This restaurant is part of bar verde, the Mexican vegan restaurant, too. It‚Äôs a bit confusing.

They are super allergen friendly. Nut free, GF, even soy free!

They have tons of outdoor and indoor seating. Did not need a Rez for a Saturday @noon.

author: Shawn C
text:
Best vegan pizza in NYC. I could have sworn I reviewed Double Zero before and now I‚Äôm wondering if the review disappeared because it was for their old location. They moved (on the same block I think?) into a place that looks a little tighter inside but had an outdoor seating.

Came with a party of 3 and sat inside for a quiet Saturday night dinner‚Äîinterior seating was maybe half full and exterior seating was packed.

Warning interior didn‚Äôt have AC running.

Got two pizzas and jackfruit tacos

Jackfruit tacos: Good but lacked a sauce or spice that left it getting drowned out by the much more flavorful pizzas

Truffle cashew cream pizza: Excellent. Third time getting it and every time it‚Äôs been a hit. Flavorful spread of mushrooms on cashew cheese

Spicy Pepperoni Pizza: Pepperonis themselves quite good on a tomato, basil, cheese base. Note the pepperonis have coconut in them in case you‚Äôre allergic.

Also got two cocktails and a mocktail, but nothing to report there. My Moscow mule was largely ice.

Unfortunately, the owner is apparently a terrible person according to the April 22, 2024 NYTimes article, but the food is good especially for vegans.

author: Justin McClelland
text:
Had always wanted to go to the Double Zero in Venice, CA, so I was excited to finally try the location in NYC!

First off, I found the location to be a bit confusing. There‚Äôs two restaurants operating in the same space, so I nearly walked out thinking I was in the wrong place.

Now onto the food and experience! I tried the mushroom pizza and cacio e pepe (see pic of pasta in my review). The pasta was really good. Creamy, lots of flavor, and great texture. It‚Äôs not the same as cacio e pepe in Rome, but nonetheless enjoyable.

The pizza tasted good but violated the #1 holy rule of pizza making: limp crust. I couldn‚Äôt pick up the slice without it sagging. Whomp, whomp. You also have to be a big fan of truffle oil, it‚Äôs used pretty liberally on this dish.

The service was great, though. Nice servers, very eager to refill a glass or clear the table, and the food came out fairly quick. Done and dusted. Love it.

Note to kitchen: try to add some umami or fermented notes in the cacio e pepe to mimic cheese. A lot of places have a killer vegan cream sauce, but none have captured the special-ness (yes, I know that‚Äôs not a real word!) of cacio e pepe. There‚Äôs a lot of decent vegan cheeses out‚Ä¶it may yield a better result! If you crack the code I‚Äôll gladly come back to try it!! üòä

author: Jamila ‚ÄúJAM‚Äù Holman
text: The pepperoni pizza was delicious even the next day after being reheated.  However it is a bit pricey. Almost $30 for 6 schmedium slices. I savored it and ate 3 slices for dinner and the rest for lunch the next day. However I could have devoured all 6 slices in one sitting. If you're willing to splurge check them out.

author: Adam Rosenberg
text: From the lay-out of its website to the layout of its Lexington Ave. restaurant interior, Le Botaniste creates warm and inviting digital and real-life environments that reflect its emphasis on interconnected sustainability. On the website the company is open and transparent, from the philosophic values of its founders to the caloric count of its dishes. And when you walk into the restaurant, the space invites you in down a wide set of rounded stairs onto a black & white patterned floor with warm wooden cabinets and panels rising from it and boasting detailed carvings and scrollwork. Large, colorful pots sit on warmers next to tins of fresh fixings for grain bowls and salads, and the serving staff is extremely friendly and enthusiastic. My wife and I appreciated that we didn‚Äôt need to ask what was strictly plant based and what was gluten-free, since everything is! It was easy to place our order and the food was served quickly. The dining area is relaxing and inviting; my wife and I sat in the back section bound by white, brick walls and potted plants, and lit by a ceiling of skylights. Given all the positives mentioned above, I thought the food could have been better. The squash soup and the tomato sauce in the Spicy Chili Sin Carne each tasted like it came from a jar and, although it can be subjective, I felt the chili wasn‚Äôt at all spicy. The ingredients were fresh, but they just didn‚Äôt come together in a cohesive, flavorful way. I thought the same of the veggie balls, which lacked a definitive flavor. The chocolate pecan cookie was a little too sweet for me, and the omega 3 brownie a little too dry, although I did like the taste. Once Le Botaniste dials in its dish recipes, it will be firing on all cylinders!

author: Al Bunshaft
text:
We stopped in after a nearby evening event. They were only 30 minutes from closing, but they had no shortage of all of the menu items.

We chose the botanical therapy, 3 half-portion bowls to share. The bowls were prepared to order and each one was packed with flavor. Sometimes vegetarian meals are served with too much pasta or rice. This was not the case. The bowls were full of vegetables and sauces. Very tasty!

The decor looks like an old apothecary or pharmacy. Simple, clean, and welcoming. The staff were all friendly and helpful.

As vegetarians, this type of restaurant is a great addition to the New York food scene. Wish there were more of them and more similar choices of places to eat.

author: Diana S√°nchez
text: La Botaniste offers delicious, well-prepared food in a beautifully decorated space. Even as someone who isn‚Äôt vegan, I really enjoyed the flavors. While the atmosphere and food were great, the staff could have been a bit more welcoming. Overall, a tasty and visually pleasing spot.

author: Rylan Gordon
text:
If you‚Äôre looking for a meal that‚Äôs entirely plant-based, Le Botaniste is a great choice. The restaurant was thoughtfully designed, creating a calm and welcoming space that‚Äôs perfect for dining solo, with friends, or even catching up on work with your laptop.

The staff were warm and friendly, and the food presentation was beautiful. I ordered the Pasta Bolo and Tibetan Mama bowls‚Äîboth were excellent. The Tibetan Mama, in particular, was full with flavor and very filling.

Though I‚Äôm not vegetarian, I enjoyed the meal and appreciated the organic ingredients. There‚Äôs plenty of comfortable seating, and the peaceful interior makes it easy to relax and linger. Highly recommend whether you‚Äôre plant-based or just looking for a clean meal!

author: perle75nyc
text: I‚Äôm not a vegan, nor am I particularly interested in vegan food, but I ended up at this restaurant because someone in my group is. Since I generally love vegetables and eat them a lot, I was actually looking forward to trying some delicious vegan dishes. Unfortunately, I was quite disappointed. While the interior and presentation were impressive, the food itself was very dry or bland. The table, dishes, and silverware were noticeably dirty, it didn‚Äôt feel like the staff really cared about the customers. It was disappointing that, despite using a variety of ingredients, there seemed to be no real attention paid to the flavor.

author: Adriana De Pitkin
text: We‚Äôve visited this restaurant multiple times and we love it! It‚Äôs one of the best dim sum restaurants in New York City. Our favorites are the Roast Pork Bun, Scallion Pancakes, Spring Rolls, Shrimp and Bacon Rolls. While it can get busy with a long waiting line, the food is served incredibly quickly. Love the old diner-style ambiance and decor. There‚Äôs plenty of both indoor and outdoor seating. The staff is always friendly and welcoming. I highly recommend dining here!

author: Nhi Hoang
text:
All of these food and it was $23/person (tip included!!)

We got there early so there was no waiting at all. Highly recommend the Sui Mai, House Special Roast Pork Bun, Shrimp & Snow Pea Leaf!! Great comfort food and dont forget to get some tea!

Will definitely come back for good casual food:)

author: Natalie Krause
text: Great vibes and yummy dim sum! My favorite were the soup dumplings and shrimp dumplings. Excellent value for the price, just make sure you have cash :) Beautiful interior and they served us very quickly.

author: Bethany Cardona
text: this place is great. I do have to say the wait to get in is not ideal and I think you can get great dim sum at many places in Chinatown. maybe even better than here. the egg rolls are very interesting a soft creamy center wrapped in thin egg and tossed in batter and fried. I loved them but not for everyone. also loved the shrimp and onion shu mai. pan fried dumplings were great as well.

author: Konrad Strumidlo
text: Food at this establishment is phenomenal. I'm addicted to those fried sesame balls...literally. This restaurant gets packed out on the weekends due to high foot traffic and sometimes language barrier can be an issue, but the food makes up for that. Must try.

author: Des KF
text:
I got the chance to try this restaurant for lunch. When I arrived I found parking on the street nearby. I walked into a small cozy restaurant. This restaurant is on their last days which is sad so make sure you get there so you can get some good eats! I had:

BBQ Fried Chicken Sandwich
4 Piece Mexy Q Wings Chipotle Mayo Dipping Sauce
4 Piece Vietnamese Chile Mango Jalape√±o Ranch Dipping Sauce
Panko Crusted Brownie with compote Berry

I loved the food and the Mexy Q Wings were my favorite! Get to this restaurant before they close their doors in the coming weeks!

author: leothedragon inocente
text: Natalie Clark was an amazing kick ass server for us! Kicking ass taking care of tables and checking in on my fiance and me and all of my shenanigans lol. Great great great personality and great great customer service!! Definitely will come back as long as we can either have or at least see her here!!!

author: Farrah Faye Vasquez
text: Found this place on Eater and this place did not disappoint. I‚Äôve been craving traditional buffalo wings (original confession) and it was amazinggggggggg!!! I love that you can customize the crispiness. Deepak also went out of his way to make sure the sauces were pasteurized since I‚Äôm pregnant and I thought that was really thoughtful. Check this place out! I will definitely come back!!

author: Matthew Blewitt
text: Small little spot but definitely worth it.  Not a lot of seating if you are looking to eat there but I did take out and it was so good.  I got the Tandoori wing lunch special which was really good.  Tandoori is a dry rub that had a little heat but wasn't overpowering at all and thay it coming from someone who cannot handle heat.  Definitely get your fries dusted.  I went with the lemon pepper and it was delicious.  The star of the show was definitely the  chicken birria quesadilla.  IT WAS AMAZING! You cannot come here and skip this it really is thag good.  This place packs a lot of flavor and the price is very fair here.  Definitely will be back

author: Insiya Pardiwala
text:
We've been ordering in from this place frequently, but I was curious to experience the ambiance and savor a fresh, hot sandwich in-house. Regrettably, it's not a dine-in establishment, but the food is simply extraordinary. The wings are a standout, with flavors like garlic parm, chili mango, and black pepper teriyaki that were all exceptionally delicious. Alongside the wings, we indulged in two sandwiches; the BBQ fried chicken sandwich was a succulent and crispy delight.
If you are in the neighborhood definitely try their food. You will not regret it.

author: Judy J
text:
I‚Äôm giving Dirt Candy in New York a full five stars, and honestly, it deserves every bit of that rating. The food here is exceptional ‚Äî creative, flavorful, and executed with real precision. Every dish feels unique, thoughtful, and beautifully balanced. The atmosphere is relaxed but polished, making it an easy place to enjoy a long, satisfying meal without feeling rushed or overwhelmed.

One thing I strongly recommend is choosing the wine pairing. Each course comes with a different wine selected specifically to match the flavors of the dish, and they absolutely nail it. The pairings elevate the food instead of overpowering it. You can tell the team put real effort into curating drinks that enhance the entire dining experience. If you‚Äôre coming here, don‚Äôt skip that option ‚Äî it‚Äôs worth it.

The service was outstanding. The staff were attentive, warm, and genuinely enthusiastic about what they were serving. Dirt Candy is a no-tip restaurant, which I respect, but my server took such good care of me that I felt compelled to insist on giving her something extra. It took a bit of convincing, but she eventually accepted it with a big smile, and I could tell it truly made her day. That level of kindness and professionalism deserves recognition.

Dirt Candy isn‚Äôt just a place to eat ‚Äî it‚Äôs a place to appreciate food. If you‚Äôre looking for an excellent dining experience in New York, this spot should be at the top of your list.

author: Carter Moyer
text: I‚Äôve been here three times (Winter and Summer previously), and this season‚Äôs Fall tasting menu is the best yet. Truly phenomenal, abounding with creative flavor combinations and textures, and genuinely elevating the vegetables that serve as the base. The cauliflower dessert is one of the best desserts I‚Äôve ever had, and the candied beets and curry, the onion tart, and mushroom dish were standout as well. The kitchen always does an amazing job with the surprise dishes too, from radish carpaccio to sesame dumplings. Highly recommend the desert sunrise as an NA cocktail, and try to get a seat at the chef‚Äôs counter. Also love a restaurant that pays its workers a living wage and includes gratuity. Please go!

author: Aniket Fegade
