text: Amazing food all around, would 10/10 recommend going for a milestone celebration like anniversary or a birthday dinner. Definitely opt in for their wine pairing option, you won‚Äôt regret it. They not only handpick their wines but also pair those superbly with their food. My favorites dishes were hands down their dessert - which was an avocado dallop of ice cream with an egg cream and tortilla chips followed by their thai lasagna and then their onion tart, in that order. I‚Äôm so glad I chose this place for my first Michelin Star restaurant experience!

author: Daryl Allen
text: I posted a video review on YouTube (search for Sodafry and Dirt Candy), but this was an awesome experience. I'm not a vegetarian, but the menu is so creative and delicious. I never felt like I was missing meat. I took my teenagers with me and with a little preparation they had a great time. A highlight for me was the green bean pasta dish on the summer menu and the carrot tamal.

author: Brad Hover
text:
We have been to Dirt Candy four times, and every visit has been nothing less than outstanding. The fully vegetarian tasting menu is incredibly creative, beautifully presented, and always packed with flavor. It‚Äôs a place where both vegetarians and meat eaters can enjoy an inventive, satisfying meal.

The pacing of the courses is perfect, with each dish building on the last without ever feeling rushed. The staff is warm, attentive, and knowledgeable, which makes the whole experience fun and memorable. Dirt Candy continues to surprise us with thoughtful dishes and unexpected flavor combinations, and it remains one of the best dining experiences in New York.

Highly recommended for anyone looking for a unique and unforgettable night out.

author: Susan Seto
text: Little Owl was established in 2006. I have had this restaurant in my radar for many years but it took me 19 years to finally dine here. I wish I discovered this gem of a restaurant sooner. The vibe is of a comfy cozy neighborhood restaurant. We enjoyed the French onion soup, meatball sliders and the Bibb and Beets salad. The salad was absolutely delicious and worth coming back for that dish alone. I enjoyed my non-alcoholic drink but found the desserts a tad too sweet for my taste. The service was excellent. Jorge was especially hospitable and made us feel welcomed. I will be back soon.

author: Hannah Clark
text: I had an incredible experience at Little Owl. Suggested to me by a friend‚Äòs mother. It did not disappoint. If you‚Äôre going, definitely get the halibut. A very unique yet simple way of cooking the fish. The story goes that it used to be grilled until the grill went out in the first week and they‚Äôve decided to broil ever since. They really go over and above to make sure you‚Äôre comfortable as well. It was very nice to feel well taken care of.

author: M M
text: Little Owl ‚Äî tucked right under the iconic "Friends" apartment building ‚Äî is a must-stop in the West Village. Cozy, welcoming, and absolutely delicious. The meatball is non-negotiable: tender, perfectly seasoned, and sauced just right. Service is friendly, the vibe is intimate, and every plate feels thoughtfully made. Come hungry, order the meatball first, and grab a quick photo outside afterward. Perfect NYC spot!

author: Cosmin BƒÉdoiu
text: We honestly came just to have a few pictures of the location and we ended up having brunch. Probably one of the best meals we had in New York so far! Really nice! Also, staff was helpful, smiling and respectful. Congrats!

author: Aida Akhmetova Demir
text: Didn‚Äôt get to eat here since it was closed, but as a Friends fan, this spot is a must-see! The Little Owl sits right under the famous apartment building, and it‚Äôs such a surreal moment standing there in person after seeing it on screen so many times. Definitely worth a stop if you‚Äôre in the West Village, even just for the photo.

author: LM H. (BigRedd)
text: This is my most favorite restaurant ever!! I have been going here for about 30+ years. My whole family loves this place. The owner Peter and his staff are the best. You always feel seen.

author: Nat T.
text: Had high expectation for this place but was disappointed. Despite restaurant half full, service was not attentive with server forgetting request or walking away as soon as they ask what we wanted to order. Food was just ok and not justify especially when you look at the price. Ambiance was ok and the restaurant is a mix of locals and tourists. Would not come back again - lots of better other option nearby.

author: SANDY Sanchez
text: Well we weren't exactly dressed for it , so we sat outside. Inside look a bit  like u should be dressed right. . I ordered the short rib with mash potatoes. Omg was it good. It was sooooo good.  The portion was big enough.Not cheap.    Came here with my uncle , mom , aunt. They eat like they on a diet . Not me . I loved my food. Would def eat here again  next time.   Price is not low but not too high.  Parking is  street  parking. . .  Ladies bring a sweater inside  the A. C was great. Felt it as I went to bathroom.  All the waiters were all very nice.     . Thank u all u made dinner very very nice.  I didn't get a picture of my food. But I did get these 2 pictures.  A small video of this beautiful  fire place. .I loved it. Not sure if it was real.

author: Christopher Fiscus
text: Excellent Italian restaurant with wonderful service and memorable dishes like the chicken parm and shrimp and spinach over pasta. Espresso and tiramisu closed it out nicely.

author: Indio Comido
text:
For being an italian place at that zone, i was expecting so much more‚Ä¶
Service was great but we where really dissapointed on the food.
We even found a fetuccine in a spaguetti plate
I mean, i guess everything was well cooked, but the lack of flavor even from the calammari starter was kinda dissapointing
Bread was nice tho!

author: Ryan Leong
text: Great experience. Came here on Saturday of Halloween weekend. Our server was Brianna and she was waiting all the tables by herself as well as taking duties as the bartender. She was friendly, knowledgeable and very flexible. We came about 15 mins before happy hour. We got our first round and tried to squeeze in a second round she told us not to rush and she‚Äôd hold the happy hour prices for us. She brought the drinks out for happy hour price about 15 minutes after happy hour ended. As working in a restaurant before I can understand if you‚Äôre the only person it can be a daunting task, but our server held her composure and smiled and kept up great service to every table. She definitely deserves a generous tip we left her and hopefully everyone has been tipping her the same as we did. I split a cheese pizza with my girlfriend and cousin. This pizza was hot, crispy, and tasteful. Man. Perfect amount of cheese and perfectly cooked. A lot of variety on the menu but we didn‚Äôt want to eat too much and settled with the pizza. Didn‚Äôt get much, so I can‚Äôt cover much in this review but the happy hour drinks, pizza and service were all worthy of 5 stars!

author: Carly V
text: I like the place, in these summer days I really enjoy take dinner outdoors in the little area outside, the service is good and fast, the prices are reasonable and you have a few options if you are vegetarian. The bread portion at the beginning of the meal was really fresh and good and the food too.

author: Zenobia Godschalk
text: Was really good, one misplaced order but corrected quickly.  Pizza had delicious,fluffy crust and calamari was lightly crispy. I recommend this place.

author: Merve Karadag
text: I‚Äôve been eating from this place for years by now and I‚Äôve never had any issue. Always on time, always delicious! You can dine-in or order to go. Especially now in this pandemic, they have an outside dine-in option which is so pretty with the little lights hanging from the tent. They make one of the best pizzas in Manhattan. Must try!!!

author: D. Greham Davis
text: Amazing food. Excellent service. The Shrimp Scampi was perfect. My wife and I will definitely come back again.

author: Oi Lin ‚ÄúChinagirl568‚Äù
text:
10/8/25

We were in the neighborhood for an appointment and decided to stop for lunch.

BBQ Ribs are delicious, most Chinese restaurant makes them but are usually tough but these were tender and so flavorful.  I wish they were near home hehehe.

Peking Duck, while it was super crispy outside and tender inside it was not seasoned.  Without the hoisin sauce it would have been a waste of money...

Bok Choy with Garlic is delicious, I wish I could make it this good hehehe.

If we are ever in the area we would definitely go back.

Lots of pig related decorations, cute! Hehehe

author: Paul Brothe
text:
With a name like Pig Heaven, I would not expect, as a vegetarian, to give this restaurant a good review. However, they have delicious vegetarian options. The waiter made a record of vegetables with pancakes. It was excellent.

The background music was funny. Piano versions of Christmas carols - in August - without words.

I would go back. It was a great experience

author: Thomas Meyers
text: We got the ribs, pork soup dumplings, and pork chow fun. The dumplings were AMAZING, ribs were great too. Chow fun was good, though nothing particularly spectacular. Place was clean and staff was friendly. Great chinese restaurant!

author: Jacob Berrigan
text: I LOVE YOU PIG HEAVEN. When I think of this place tears well in my eyes and dro0l rolls down my neck. This place is GOOD. You cannot miss the lovely duck and of course the chongqing dry hot chicken. WOW, I wish that they would open a PIG HEAVEN inside my house so I could eat there EVERYDAY.

author: christine rona
text: I just moved down the street and wanted to try this place for lunch.I ordered take out pork lo mein .  But there weren‚Äôt any vegetables in the lo mein. It was all noodle. I was disappointed‚Ä¶I don‚Äôt think I will be going back there again.

author: Robin Seay
text: Food was mediocre at best. Everything on the menu is significantly overpriced for the quality of what you get, especially when we didn't finish 1/3 of our food because there ended up being a mouse running around our table. The star of our visit was our amazing server Gio! He was so friendly, served with a huge, warm smile, and was hustling the whole time. 10/10 recommend Gio!

author: Mookie
text: Booking a reservation for this store was nothing short of a miracle. When we arrived, they had to make accommodations for the additional seating of two kids plus 6 adults. Please if you get the opportunity to book in advance do so. They get packed on a Sunday. Our waiter , Gio was exceptional. He knew the best recommendations for all of our dishes. He made sure the kids got there food first as they were the first to get antsy. All in all , with gigantic proportions we managed to take most of the food home. It was a birthday for my nephew and he stated "This is the best restaurant ever!" Success. In a way that's all we needed to hear. Adorable decor for the entire family.

author: Victoria C
text:
This was very underwhelming and not worth $18 dollars, didn't even taste good. If I knew the hot chocolate would come out I wouldn't get it. But gratefully the management was super understanding and allowed us to take it off as we only had one sip of it.

The server was extremely kind and professional I have no complaints regarding my service with him.

The kids portion ice cream was perfect .

I enjoyed the grandmas chicken sandwich was amazing I added cheese to mine.

My kids enjoyed the grown up Mac and cheese the hostess explained the kids Mac cheese and regular menu Mac and cheese are different. So we got that one.

We had a really good experience here and would definitely come back one of the main reasons I would come back was managements understanding and the server being kind.

author: Hong Lee
text:
I booked a table at the Serendipity 3 Upper East Side restaurant for dinner on my wife's actual 60th birthday this evening as we really enjoyed our last visit there 10 years ago for her 50th birthday.
Although we arrived 20 minutes earlier than our 5:15pm slot that I'd booked online, we were shown to a table within a few minutes. There's very little space between tables in the very small & cramped restaurant, so don't expect any privacy as we could clearly hear and follow the conversations of the diners on both the tables either side of us.
Our super friendly server Randy asked if we were at the restaurant for any special occasion and my wife told him it was her 60th birthday without realising I'd already put all this in the 'what's the occassion?' section of their online booking form. He also asked if we had any allergies, which again I had already said we had none in the 'Any allergies or restrictions?' section of their online booking form. So clearly the servers don't see or don't bother to read the information provided online by their customers, rendering it a complete waste of our time!!!
The birthday girl had the American cheeseburger with fries, which was OK. I had the Grandma Holt's fried chicken sandwich with a pot of tea. The fried chicken was a bit dry, the bun was a bit stale and I found the fries to be a bit too salty. My wife was really looking forward to the superb peanut butter cheesecake dessert we enjoyed sooo much on our last visit. However, it was no longer on the menu so she had to settle for the Ultimate Creme Cheesecake, which came with side servings of hot fudge & strawberry sauce.
Our fabulous server Randy put a candle on the top of my wife's cheesecake, lit it and encouraged everyone in the restaurant to sing happy birthday, which made her feel special. Whilst we were dining in the restaurant there were 4 other people celebrating their birthdays as well.
There's a photographer at the restaurant now, who went around every table taking photographs of customers and returning later trying to sell commemorative prints, which I found a bit tacky and touristy - not something I'd expect at a high end restaurant.
The decor in the restaurant looked very tired and we certainly didn't enjoy our meal there this time, compared to our exceptional experience 10 years ago. I feel sadly it's more of a tourist trap now, feeding off the embers of its former glory days, which have long gone. We didn't have any alcoholic drinks with our meal and I left feeling the $100 we spent there could have been better spent in one of the hundreds of exceptional restaurants in NYC for the special occasion of my wife's 60th birthday.

author: Samantha Cyr
text: We loved Serendipity!!! I made a reservation online about a week in advance, thank God I did. It was so busy! My husband and I and our 2 girls (ages 6 & 9) loved all our food and desserts! My husband got a bacon cheese hot dog and I got the truffle burger. Both amazing. We all had more fries than we could eat. We also got the frozen hot chocolate to share, and each daughter got 1 scoop of ice cream with a topping, which was also more than they could eat. Despite it being packed and needing a reservation, our food came out super quickly. I was really impressed by that. And our waiter, Leo, was SO friendly, which made the overall vibe amazing. We hope to be back next time we visit the city!!

author: Lyss Wolfe
text:
My boyfriend and I had the best experience ever here at Beetle House. The atmosphere, performances, and food were perfect. I had the Cheshire Mac & cheese, the Sweeney Todd steak, the pumpkin cheesecake and two pumpkin espresso martinis ALL DELICIOUS!

Beetlejuice himself had us giggling and even Bob was there! Our waitress Claire was so sweet!

If you‚Äôre looking for a fun place to go to eat and have a good time‚Ä¶obviously go here! We can‚Äôt wait to come back again next time we‚Äôre in the city! :) First time best time!

author: Michelle Alvarez
text:
If you are a big fan of Tim Burton, you‚Äôll be pleasantly surprised by the atmosphere and performances. We had Beetlejuice, Bob and Edward Scissorhands as our performers for the night. Beetlejuice was incredible! All performers had charm, wit and were highly entertaining.

The service was great! We were greeted at the door and were asked to wait about 15 mins for a table (we didn‚Äôt get to reserve; and we went after 8pm). We were entertained by Beetlejuice outside and he gave us great laughs. We only waited about 5 mins til a table was free.
Our drink of choice was the Big Fish bowl, delicious! We had the Mac n cheese and lalaurie fries which both delicious! We both got the Sweeney Todd filet mignon and it was great. For dessert we got the death by chocolate and Emily‚Äôs wedding cake. Portions are medium to small but filling.

It‚Äôs a bit pricey but gratuity is included and the performers put on a great show. They love taking pictures with you as well.

We had a blast! Highly recommend!

author: Rafael Rosa
text: This was an amazing experience. I totally recommend it. The service was amazing. The food, oh the food, im a picky eater, I liked everything I got. The drinks are delicious as well. The staff are on point. The performers stay in character and are so fun. Just over all worth it.

author: Kimberly Donaldson
text: This is my second trip to beetle house, and I am so excited that I was able to come back. It is a unique, fantastic, creative place and a tribute to New York and something that everyone should experience at least once. It is so hard to run a successful restaurant in New York City, especially through Covid, so it is speaks a lot as to what kind of place this is. If you were a beetle fan or even if you were not, this is a place you must visit in the village. The food is phenomenal, especially the steak and the drinks are even better. Small children would enjoy it if they‚Äôve watched Beetlejuice and like the characters. So highly recommend. For NYC, the reasonable Price Fix menu is a treat.

author: Michael Knippenberg
text: Dark and loud but plenty of fun and the food was delicious. You won't go away hungry.  The risotto app and burger were really good.  No one is my family had a bad meal and we tried most of the menu.  The show and ambiance are on point.  Beetlejuice/Halloween fans should not miss this place.

author: Liv Lively
text: Just popped in there for a bite before going home. I've been here before and thought to revisit it. The night staff was wonderful and sweet. Waitress was very kind and positive and attentative, the chefs were amazing and the food was delicious.

author: Vinh Nguyen
text:
This is such a hard review to leave because we are also restauranteurs.

My wife and I wanted some nice hearty salads for lunch so we looked up a few places. We ordered two salads (the mango salad and the arugula, mango, duck walnut, goat cheese salad‚Äînever had there been a more literal name for a salad which is fine‚Äîjust hard to order on the phone).

We were told these two salads were going to be 35 minutes. Even during a busy rush (which would seem strange at 2:05), two salads shouldn‚Äôt take 35 minutes.

What makes it worse is that the Arugala Duck Salad (for short) is described as tradition ‚ÄúNew Orleans‚Äù style salad. We lived in New Orleans for 4 years and ate all over the city. It‚Äôs a culinary mecca. This is not close to anything traditional to New Orleans.

The salad was quite small for a $21 salad. Two salads totaled $56 which we don‚Äôt mind paying based on the food description. I‚Äôm in the food and beverage industry so I know the cost of goods. This was literally two handfuls of Arugal, some cubed mangos, a blob of coated goat cheese, and waaaay overcooked tiny slivers of duck breast. I understand the rising cost of business in this industry, but I could never to this to my patrons.

The duck was embarrassingly bad and the beef on my wife‚Äôs salad was so overcooked, it was almost inedible. The duck breast slivers were not only small and overcooked but rubbery. That‚Äôs strange because the fat wasn‚Äôt rendered properly so the skin was gelatinous and chewy so it being overcook was just a lack of care or  lack of training for the cook who cooked the duck breast. The packaging was so half hearted for $56 for two salads.

This was rough. I‚Äôd be willing to adjust my review with a response from the owners. But, as far as first impressions go, we won‚Äôt order again based off this experience.

So unfortunate in flavor and overpriced for the result.

author: Fiona H
text: Definitely want to eat here again soon! Lots of options for both drinks and food. I got the Traditional Macaroni & Cheese which was delicious once it cooled down. The Tropical Treasure cocktail was so gorgeous and I loved the combination of fruit juices. The ladies bathroom was clean and had one normal sized stall and one handicap stall that also had a baby changing station on the wall.

author: Lex Z
text: Excellent dinner spot! This place has something everyone can enjoy. Enormous portions. Super friendly staff. The bread was fresh and fluffy. The cocktails were perfect. The tomato florantine soup was incredible. The meals were savory and filling. You'll definitely have leftovers. My husband and I love coming here for a little date night.

author: Paul Gimson
text: Excellent lunch. Food was great, service perfect. I have always wanted to eat here. It was worth the wait.

author: Paul Harris
text: I live a 1 hour drive south and frequently drive up for awesome pizza by the slice, and enjoy them at the waterfront park across the street.

author: V M
text: Coworkers and I were just raving about this place! Great pizzeria located right near the swimming area on the lake. Fast, friendly service. Staff was helpful and answered all my questions. Amazing slices, at incredible prices. I had the spicy buffalo wing and the garlic, both were delicious! Would definitely go back next time we‚Äôre in Skaneateles!

author: Ryan Sanderson
text: Pizza was overall really great and well priced. Many different types of "by the slice" were ready to eat. I would give their cheese pizza a 3 star, as the sauce or cheese needs a kick but the 3 Cheese Chipotle Chicken pizza was a 4.5 star, as the crust and toppings were in perfect harmony. This place is worth a visit if you love pizza. The staff was very friendly too.

author: Mack Suleiman
text: Stopped by this place after walking through Skaneateles and it was an excellent decision! The service is great, I was helped almost immediately, even though it was lunch time and very busy in the place. I ordered the daily special (it was a wrap with corned beef, Russian sauce, lettuce, tomato, banana peppers and Swiss cheese). It blew me away! For under $9, I got a wrap packed with meat and veggies and cheese! I can confidently say that it‚Äôs one of the best sandwiches I have ever had! Everything just works together so well! I would strongly suggest this place for anyone looking for a hearty meal on the cheap!

author: Ames ‚ÄúTheGoogleReviewer‚Äù PA
text: Food was excellent.  Chicken salad 1/2 sandwich and a lamb gyro.  Place was super busy,  mostly for takeout.  Staff were fine but not very friendly. Would definitely go again but would take the food and eat elsewhere for some ambiance.

author: Amy Kang
text:
We‚Äôve been wanting to try this place and finally did! Pasta was tasty and seafood were cooked perfect.
There were some tout groups at the restaurant.

author: Svetlana J. Cemin
text: On a busy Bleecker Street, in the heart of West Village, I walked into this typical Italian trattoria which serves exelent seafood, pasta and fresh salads. No reservations were needed.

author: Tabitha Steemson
text: This was such a wonderful experience - feels like a proper New York institution. The staff were amazing. I made my own error of ordering my steak too well done (totally my fault) and when I ordered an additional chicken they took the steak away and didn‚Äôt put it on the bill, even though I never complained about it. It was so kind! I have a difficult allergy and they were so respectful and accommodating. When the waiter changed and so something came which I couldn‚Äôt have they took it back, no questions asked. Even without that it would have been reasonable, but it‚Äôs a rare gem of a lovely vibe, wonderful service, takes walk ins (we came at about 7 on a Saturday and there was space) and good value in a prime spot. What a gem.

author: chroma mcd
text: Lovely and hearty Italian fare‚Äîespecially their pasta and seafood dishes. The lobster ravioli stands out with a rich, flavorful sauce, and the seafood risotto is tomato-based, brimming with fresh shrimp, calamari, and scallops  Ôøº Ôøº. The mussels marinara delivers bold, authentic flavors‚Äîjust enough sauce to dip bread without overpowering  Ôøº. Portions are generous and comforting, true to classic Northern Italian style

author: Nicholas Rositano
text: Top tier traditional leaning Italian restaurant with a cozy atmosphere and a good selection of non-typically found  seafood. All while being on the low end of NYC restaurant prices.

author: Michael
text:
Relaxed atmosphere of a dive bar with killer food.

First note: they have the worst Diet Coke I have ever had in my entire life. Completely flat and tastes like it came out of a dirty gun.

HOWEVER every time I come here I get the chicken platter, Mac and cheese, and a tuna melt. The chicken is succulent with a beautiful breading and is piping hot every time. It is served with a sweet honey butter that goes beautifully with the biscuits as well. The biscuits are good but not mind blowing, they are small and served 3 per order. The Mac and cheese can be dry depending on the batch but this most recent visit was perfectly creamy but still firm enough to slice. It is a baked style. The tuna melt is one of my favorites in the city. It has a massive amount of tuna inside but feels lighter than others I have had. It almost takes like the tuna is whipped. I can‚Äôt figure out what they do to the tuna but it‚Äôs great. The best part about this place is that the kitchen is open late. We actually came this time because the restaurant we were trying to go to had closed their kitchen early. It‚Äôs really great having this option in the area.

author: Johnny Novo
text:
I got dinner here last night with my favorite food creator and big bro, Rob Martinez. I'd never been to the Commodore, but when he suggested it, I accepted without a blink. A Rob recommendation is literal pixie dust.

I entered 8 minutes before our scheduled time because my pops always told me "if you're on time, you're late." I entered and saw a 6'2 burly figure with a worn in nike hat and legendary beard sipping on a Negroni, and realized Rob beat me here. Damn... Negroni on a Monday is so beast though.

We got a little booth in the corner, and I decided to hop on the Negroni train. I normally don't drink during the week, but sometimes the Negroni gods just force your hand. My nickname in college was actually "Post Negrone."

Rob informed me that the hot chicken sandwich ($19) was the move, which checked out with my research from before dinner.

I never really stop and smell the roses, as comfort is the enemy of progress, but sitting in this dimly lit dive bar sipping negronis with one of the best food creators on the internet, and someone I really look up to, forced me to have a moment of appreciation.

Between bites of one of the best crispy chicken sandwiches I have ever had in my life, we were talking about writing, editing, our favorite restaurants, youtube thumbnails, algorithms, favorite authors, upcoming shoot schedules, and lofty long term goals that really had me pinching myself. Like damn I'm really doing this, you know? I felt like I was living someone else's life, not mine. I didn't even really know this was possible.

We deleted these chicken sandwiches, chips and queso, and 2 rounds of negronis as the table next to us turned 2 different times. What a night, provided by an iconic ambiance, sensational chicken sandwiches, and my old friend, the negroni.

IG @johnny.novo
Tiktok @jnov__
Substack @johnnynovo

author: Wen Jin Guo
text:
Came here in the afternoon just as the kitchen was closing. Debated for a bit and ultimately decided to stay because I‚Äôll not be denied of my chicken sandwich lol.

Started off with the Orange Julio, as if it‚Äôs the grownup Orange Julius. Two sips in and immediate brain freeze. The vibe is a bit chaotic but the bartenders did a great job making sure everyone is well-hydrated with drinks. Shortly before 5pm, my bartender gave me the food menu as if she could read my mind.

I got the mild breast sandwich and a small side of fries. The sandwich came out piping hot and prolly the juiciest chicken breast I‚Äôve ever eaten. Could it be a wet brine process..? However, the chicken was a tad too salty for my taste. Still, I inhaled the sandwich. The fries were okay..? Nothing special but an adequate companion to my sandwich.

All in all, I was a very happy camper. I love the Commodore and I‚Äôll be back for sure!

author: Osc√°r OA
text: I just don‚Äôt understand. Like how or why is it possible that this place has the most incredible chicken sandwich Ive ever tried in my life. Cheese sauce is  heaven‚Äôs magma . I started at the fish tank during all my sandwich consumption. Very interesting and fantastic experience. I hope that whoever is reading this review enjoys this place as much as i did.

author: Mike mandot
text: The fried chicken and a biscuit were fantastic! Definitely planning on coming back in for that! Atmosphere was pretty solid, it got really busy in the couple of hours we were there. A little frat boy/ broh'y.

author: Baba Gurjeet Bedi
text:
Slooooow. Waited 15+ minutes before anyone even showed up at an empty bar around 5pm the day before Thanksgiving.
And the guy would not take the order as he was 'not the bar tender'. Waited another 10+ mins for him.
Ordered a draft, was rung up for a $9+ draft. Then there was an issue with the keg. So was given a bottle ($6+) as a substitute of the same beer - see the picture of the empty bar and the bottle. But still charged for the draft (I have the receipt).
The attitude of the servers leaves much to.be desired. TGIF is going down the drain. No wonder they closed so many locations.
Had a beer and redeemed some points for an appetizer.  Did not argue and got out quickly after paying.
I don't think I'll ever go back.

author: Sharr Donn
text: Shut it down PLEASE! WORST FOOD IVE EVER HAD FROM TGI! ordered whisky glazed ribs and they were so hard and burnt! Mac and cheese was soup, pasta was undercooked. I was not given one of my sides either. Im so upset! $80 down the drain.

author: Nylra Arzuaga
text: Service  was üëç thank you! But I got food poisoning and it ruined my birthday üéÇ  I had upset my stomach. Not going there anymore. I don't know what happened  to one of my favorite restaurants üòï üò© üòû üò´ Also the Caesars salad was dressing drowing the lettuce. Awful üòñ Every bite was like a spoon full of dressing. Terrible, I couldn't  eat it. üò™

author: Erica Ri
text: I had the pleasure of visiting again for a 34th Birthday! We were greeted by Abdul, who was absolutely amazing! He made sure to check on us to see if we needed refills on drinks or to add on additional items such as a boneless wings order to go! We had a cake and he made sure to bring it out just in time! It was a memorable experience because we actually put all of our phones away(for once) and just engaged in meaningful conversation! All of the food was tasty and fresh! The tables and bathrooms  were extremely clean! I tried the Whiskey Glaze and Dragon Glaze sauce on the side! I will definitely be returning again for a new celebration!

author: Christopher Warren
text: The Friday‚Äôs franchise isn‚Äôt what it used to be. The pricing is misleading, and the food was overcooked. It tasted like it was cooked yesterday and warmed up today. I had a craving for their signature whiskey graze. Probably never step foot inside a Friday‚Äôs again.

author: Tina Copeland
text: The milkshake was the best part of the experience.  My wings was not cooked and I couldn't eat them. I didn't want to upset my child it was her bday so I didn't complain.  The burger fries and chicken tenders was great.  It was cold and the atmosphere got loud at times. The staff was wonderful friendly and made it a great experience.

author: Nino Cruz
text: One of the best burgers I‚Äôve ever had in NYC. Everyone needs to try this place. Our server Vaughn was great and friendly. Atmosphere was awesome. The burger I got was ‚ÄúThe Old Fashioned‚Äù. The patty was well seasoned, the bun could‚Äôve been a little bit more roasted, the horseradish sauce was not too much and the carmelized onions goes so well with the mushrooms. The fries were also just crispy and well seasoned I didn‚Äôt have to touch the salt. Overall would go back again!

author: Nicole Montana
text: The shakes are really the star of the show here the chocolate chip brownie flavor doesn‚Äôt disappoint. The Mexico City burger was tasty too with a juicy patty and pickled jalape√±os that make anything better. The Cesar salad was okay. The restaurant‚Äôs atmosphere is fun and our servers were nice, although aloof and some cleaning was definitely needed as both our table and condiments on them, were a mix of greasy and sticky. However, this could be specific to the SOHO location and not the chain as a whole. Overall, it‚Äôs worth it if you want a trendy burgers and milkshakes experience though.

author: Carmen Haigler
text:
I was recently here to celebrate my nephew‚Äôs birthday and we had a great time! The food was delicious. Vaughn and whole staff were funny, courteous and friendly!

We had the crispy chicken, pesto chicken sandwich and all American burgers & sweet potato fries, all were delicious! He also loved the Cookies & Cream supreme shake! We look forward to coming back!

author: Elizabeth O'Toole
text: Had a delicious cake shake that looked absolutely adorable. Definitely get the American burger if you are contemplating what burger to get!! It‚Äôs incredible. Had the most impeccable service from Vaughn last night. Made the night memorable and we will definitely be back :))

author: Kara S
text:
Food- Salmon was cooked to perfection with a nice crisp on top, bread pudding was soo tasty with the dulce de leche ice cream. I wish it was a little more moist, but the ice cream kinda helped that aspect. We also tried one of each of the empanadas. The kale one was the best and the caprese one threw me off because the filling was cold. It was all still very good, but room for little improvements.
Service- Appropriate length of time of time for each dish; dessert came really fast. Staff was very kind and welcoming.
Atmosphere- Nice and intimate inside with smaller tables, and something about this place is unpretentious. It's a bit rustic and inviting.

author: K.Z.
text:
Glad we tried this place. Nice lowkey vibes, great food, and the beef is from Argentina.
Empanadas were good, steak was cooked perfectly. Wonderful service, and we even got complimentary dulce de leche macarons, a very sweet touch.

Not pictured: Fifi drink, delicious and refreshing

author: Konstantinos Rizakos
text: Very cozy neighborhood Argentinian restaurant. Tasty salads, empanadas, and of course steak. We loved the entra√±a which was served with farro. Also the avocado flan was a surprise!

author: Imelda Suriato
text: Never skip this place when I go to gallery openings on Thursdays. Jorge the owner is always welcoming with his big smile. He introduced me to Torront√©s, the Argentinian grape variety, almost 20 years ago. Everyone who I brought here always find something they like, from the empanadas to the steak to the flan. West Chelsea has changed from gritty industrial warehouses where club kids used to hit the Tunnel, to a buzzy, gallery- and restaurant-filled Gen Z hub with luxury apartments. But Porte√±o retains its small restaurant charm, warm service, and quality food. To me, it always feels like visiting an old friend, and I always leave with a smile and a happy belly.

author: Nicholas
text:
Had dinner here last night and I‚Äôll definitely be coming back. The space is cozy, with butcher block tables and a relaxed, welcoming vibe. The staff was super friendly and attentive throughout the meal‚Äîthey even offered to move us to a bigger table after seeing how many dishes we ordered, which was a smart move.

Everything we tried was delicious, from the grilled veggies to the perfectly cooked New York strip steak. Our server recommended an Argentine Malbec that paired beautifully with the food and really rounded out the meal.

Overall, this place is a neighborhood gem‚Äîcomfortable, unfussy, and consistently great. Can‚Äôt wait to go back.

author: Kira Herbert
text: Hosted my father‚Äôs celebration of life at Storm King Lounge and Fare. The staff was easy to work with and reassuring. They answered all my questions and gave great advice. During the event, they were attentive and hard working. The food and drinks were delicious. The space was flexible to meet different guests needs. Thank you to all the staff, especially Natalie, Dave and Krista! Truly the best food, service and care for our private Saturday lunch event.

author: Alicia Dumser
text: I went here with my girlfriend for dinner and we were both very happy we did. We were quickly greeted by the very friendly and attentive staff. The restaurant was clean, spacious with a speak easy asthetic. The host and waitress couldn't have been nicer. We split the cauliflower tempura which was tasty without being overly spicy or saucy. I had the salmon for my entree which was cooked perfectly. Absolutely delicious. We tried two different cocktails and they were both so good. We will definitely be returning!

author: Heather House
text: I had no idea the restaurant had changed. Last time I was there, it was the Tressle. I absolutely LOVE the absence and decor of the restaurant and bar. Everything is electric blue and a little eclectic. The menu even has back lighting! Every menu needs this feature. The piano keys across the piano room was my favorite. Evidently, they also.habe live music on occasion. We only got drinks and apps and sat at the bar. We decided on Bang bang shrimp and Tempura Fried Cauliflower. Both were delicious... we had to get a second Cauliflower. The drinks were great and the bar tender took fabulous car of us. I will definitely be back for dinner.

author: Mike Smith
text:
We love this place! My wife and I have been here 3 times since it opened and we love the atmosphere and food. I know since 2020 staffing has been a difficult challenge to say the least! We've had 3 different servers and, for a newly opened restaurant in 2022 they were all attentive and knowledgeable... that is hard to come by for any restaurant new or old!

I must say I am a fan of anything blue and there is plenty of blue lighting, accents and d√©cor throughout but it is balanced by other textures and tones. There is a baby grand piano on the far end for the lounge/bar area. We haven't sat in the main dining room yet because the lounge is just too cool.

We've had the steak au poivre, stout braised pork chop and  prime rib entrees. For appetizers we have had the bao buns, smoked salmon that also comes with a tasty deviled egg. There is a bar/lounge menu and from that we've had the fried chicken, tuna tacos and pulled pork nachos. So, everything has been outstanding! The chef and his team are already in a grove.

When we've gone it was on the weekend and the place was pretty much full but I don't think you'd have to wait long for a seat because they have a lot of options between the bar, lounge and dining room. From what I've experienced so far the future looks bright (and blue) for Storm King Lounge and Fare.

author: Andrea Bruder
text: Everything was delicious ,atmosphere was inviting very pleased that our hometown has a new edition this location has had many incarnations over the years . Initially The Idlewild Mr. Corea‚Äôs bar and Nicky‚Äôs his son place as well as Drew‚Äôs , Painters and lastly the Trestle ‚Ä¶Super excited by the quality of the food . The staff is kind and gracious, and willing to learn, and in today‚Äôs current challenging economic climate  for the ownership to make such a large investment and commitment to our town I thank them. So please come out and support this local gem ‚Ä¶ Our meal consisted of the Tuna tartare app , Veal chop ,Chicken Cordon Bleu , Cr√®me Br√ªl√©e and Chocolate mousse cake ‚Ä¶

author: Sarah Nguyen
text: Tucked below street level, this cozy ramen spot feels like one of New York City‚Äôs hidden treasures. The space is small, with only a few tables and mostly bar seating, creating an intimate, authentic atmosphere that‚Äôs perfect for a quick pre-show meal. We went around 5 p.m. before a Broadway performance, and by the time we left an hour later, a line was already forming out the door‚Äîa clear sign of its popularity. The ramen was fantastic, with rich, flavorful broth and perfectly cooked noodles that hit all the right notes of comfort and depth. A delicious, no-frills gem that‚Äôs well worth seeking out.

author: Leisa Montgomery
text: My son and daughter-in-law took me to this hidden gem, as it is one of their favorite spots. It did not disappoint; the ramen was amazing. It is a tiny, cozy restaurant with just a few tables, but the food was so good!

author: Steph W
text:
Ambiance (4/5): This is a classic Japanese ramen shop feel‚Äîtight high top bar seating that overlooks the kitchen. There are a few tables on the side as well. It was cool seeing the solo chef prepare all the moving parts. Sadly, I did not feel like the seating was very comfortable, as the bottom part moved around on its own and there is no backing.
Service (5/5): Came in on a Friday afternoon and there was only 2 or 3 other solo patrons so I was attended to throughout my experience.
Toriburo Spicy (3/5): The noodles were a bit on the undercooked side so a little more chewy (which I like/prefer!) I like the homemade spicy paste that gave the dish another level of flavor! For the price point, I was definitely hoping that the pork charsiu piece would be a little more generous in portion size‚Äîhowever it‚Äôs really only 2 small slices. The flavor was there and a good blend of meat to fat ratio but just really to meager. The dish also does not come with any egg. I think I was hoping for a bit more flavor in the broth to wow me but it‚Äôs admittedly hard to compare paitan to tonkontsu.
Happy Hour pricing Monday to Friday 12-6:30pm during the summer looks like $3-4 discounts off beers/sake!

author: mithun suresh
text: Walkable from timesquare, delicious and quick place to grab a warm ramen and value for money. Perfect for a winter evenings. Place is really small, but the food is really good.

author: Danny Simon
text: We used to live up in Hell‚Äôs Kitchen, so this was a staple for us once we finally discovered it. Truly the best ramen in nyc, this one takes the cake! Great ambiance and quick service. Highly recommend!

author: j
text: Massive sandwiches for a reasonable price. Food was great I would definitely come back.

author: Robert Christian
text: Very unsuspecting but, some of the best Mexican food in New York City. Their Al Pastor is fantastic.

author: Emily Camacho
text: I wish I could not give a stat at all. The older lady who picks up the phone has an attitude all the time like she doesn‚Äôt want to be there anymore. I ordered food and the meat was old. The sauces they sent smelled so bad and were old. I called the lady to inform her not to give them out , out of courtesy and she had an attitude. Don‚Äôt come here to eat if you want to get food poisoning. I have been ordering here for such long time and they really have not been giving out the produce fresh like it should be. This is a violation and they should be shut down because people can get really sick from this. I currently don‚Äôt feel well eating their food, don‚Äôt bother on ordering from here. What a disappointment.

author: Katelyn Meyer
text: Hands down our favorite spot in bushwick. Seriously good authentic Mexican food. We love it, feels like we are right back in DF, Mexico City. The staff is always friendly, the food is always spot on and the al pastor tacos with their homemade avocado salsa is insanely delicious. Gracias por todo taqueria Sof√≠a. üî• üåÆ

author: Joshua Frueh
text: the birria burritos are SOOO good! the best i‚Äôve had in new york.

author: Dina R
text: My favorite Spanish tapas spot in NYC! The staff is always so attentive and polite; they truly know the menu and always recommend the best dishes. Don‚Äôt skip the bikini sandwich or the croquetas‚Ä¶ absolutely worth it every time

author: Oleg Polonsky
text: The ambiance inside of Boqueria makes you believe you are actually in Spain. We had calamari, croquettes, shrimps in garlic sauce, and Paella. All this with sangria. The chef is definitely an expert, and the staff is very friendly. Will not hesitate to visit them again!

author: CL
text: Cute little spot with amazing tapas. We got the mushroom truffle croquetas, the seafood paella and sangria which were absolutely delicious. On top of that our server Tim was super friendly as well. Definitely would go back!

author: VANESSA ZAPATA
text: Great ambiance and we sat on the patio, ordered the white sangria pitcher (amazing, tastes like juice but is indeed not juice). We got 6 things between me and my boyfriend (both eat a lot) and we were extremely full. highlights of what we got were the Gambas al Ajillo, 10/10, Patatas bravas also 10/10, great to pear with whatever meat/seafood you get. Also the Croquetas de Setas were amazing and the Montado de Bistec y Chorizo was perfection. Would recommend this place for a date night or girls night. 6 things + the pitcher was ~160 before tip so its pricey but can be made more affordable as most items are $14-$16.

author: Abril Gonzalez
text: Loved the dining experience at Boqueria! I was recently in Spain and missed the tapas atmosphere, so I was thrilled to come across this amazing restaurant while searching for authentic tapas. My friends and I ordered multiple dishes ‚Äî croquetas de setas, tortilla espa√±ola, and pimientos de padr√≥n ‚Äî and everything was absolutely amazing. Our server, Manuel, was very knowledgeable about the menu and even recommended that we try a new cheese on our charcuterie board! I‚Äôll definitely be back.

author: Vyacheslav ‚ÄúSlava‚Äù D.
text: For sure I will visit this place one more time! Charming atmosphere and big choices in menu! Our pancakes and quesadilla were delicious

author: Gavin Rogers
text:
I was there after a doctors visit and a waitress accidentally broke my cane walking by.  She tried to fix it with masking tape.  I was not worried about it but after the accident they never asked how they could help getting out or assisting with exit.  The manager avoided the situation the entire time.  I never went up to them for help or complained but their avoidance was very clear.

Had to change my mode of transportation and wait for driver at their establishment for quite sometime.

Will never return

author: Sharon M
text: The bbq chicken salad looks ordinary but it's so delicious. Had an ice coffee which was very good too. This is a quality diner, great staff there too.

author: LoMo Phillips
text:
Waited over 30 minutes for a table for 2 on a Sunday at around 1pm. It gave modern diner vibes, and it was a lil loud and crowded for my taste. It also didn‚Äôt help that we were seated close to the bathroom, so people were going back and forth by our table the whole time üòÖ
I saw they had a ‚Äúfamous‚Äù crunchy french toast, that included crushed corn flakes and slivered almonds. Thank god I ordered it with the homemade blueberry compote, because the toast was bizarrely flavorless, not even maple syrup saved it. I also thought the corn flakes and almonds would be crumbled on top, but instead it comes ‚Äúbattered‚Äù in that, creating a weird texture. I didn‚Äôt finish it, nor did I take it home.
The service was good though! Nice, fast, and attentive.

author: Maru Stern
text: The only positive about the food was the size of the portion. Soup was not good (not tasty and I could tell the chicken was super old, reheated). Pastrami tasted like anything but pastrami, it was sweet somehow and I could swear this had butter in the meat or the bread because of the consequences after, having clarified I am lactose intolerant (the server certainly did clarify as it was even specified in the check but kitchen must‚Äôve ignored it). Place is nice, the server too but certainly won‚Äôt come again.

author: Michael Pomarico
text:
We‚Äôre in Chelsea market and you need a small break in the action, especially during happy hour. This is a good stop.

We enjoyed a couple of glasses of wine in the middle of the market, which can often get very busy.

author: Manu Kashyap
text: Have visited the other locations in the past. First time here. Had quite a few wines and also some food- ham and cheese s/w and some hummus and bread. Enjoyed.

author: Zs
text: I could not recommend enough this place. The wine collection and wine quality is truly amazing, nice atmosphere. Perfect attention to detail with very professional and friendly service.

author: Vikram Prakash
text: Absolute 5 star experience. A bit less selection than the flagship location but what was cool is that there are also different wines on offer here! Champagne sold at retail prices?!?! Omg yes pleaseee!

author: Paula Cort√©s
text: Absolutely fantastic, we were visiting from Colombia, we don't regret, fresh and delicious food omg! Chef Laura and sever Mathew wonderful, good music and quick service. We will come back!

author: USUN
text:
I visited Ariari because I wanted to introduce it to friends visiting from the Bay Area. Every time I come here, I‚Äôm blown away by the quality of the food, the staff‚Äôs service, and the cozy atmosphere of the restaurant ‚Äî it‚Äôs a solid 10000/10 every time.

With the chilly weather, I was craving DAESUN soju and seafood like in Busan, and this place turned out to be the perfect choice.

We had assorted Mak-hwe, mackerel, and scallop gimbap topped with uni and sweet shrimp. The rice is the most important part of Gimbap ‚Äî and theirs is unbelievably good! The accompanying ssamjang and mayo sauces were just fantastic.

At one point, my friend accidentally dropped a spoon, and the staff immediately replaced it with a new one ‚Äî even bringing over a Tide stain remover stick just in case it got on her clothes. Their attentiveness and kindness were truly impressive...ü•π
We ended the meal with Dolsot Al-Bap and Hap-Cheon Pork Soup the perfect pairing with soju that just went down so smoothly.

My friends who were visiting said they were so touched by the taste and service that they almost cried.

Ariari is one of those rare spots in New York that never fails to make me happy. The food is amazing, complemented by the warm hospitality that‚Äôs rare to find in New York!!!!!!‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

Writing this review is making me crave it again ‚Äî I think I‚Äôll go back this week. Now that it‚Äôs getting cold, it‚Äôs the perfect time to visit Ariari. Highly, highly recommend!

author: Toffy Young
text:
I have a reservation at 6pm. When I arrived, it was a bit busy, but all the staff were so friendly, especially Nampu. I came with my boyfriend and wanted to try everything on the menu, but since it's just the two of us, we'll definitely come back to try more!
PS. I absolutely love the Kimchi here, and the Dolsot AI-BAP is the best dish. Must order!

author: Chau Giang
text:
One of the best Korean restaurants in Manhattan, hands down.

We ordered pork shoulder & stomach soup, fried sea eels, and seafood pancake. The flavors blended so well together and felt so complete, and the texture was right on point. I was especially impressed with the fried sea eels, a perfect combination of crunchy and soft, sweet and salty. I hadn't seen this dish anywhere else so credits to the restaurant's creativity.

Our waiter was very attentive, friendly and thoughtful. I brought a box coming in and he helped me put it away before dining. After we were done, he brought the box out along with a big paper bag (containing my leftover pancake) so that I could put my box in and carry it more easily. The lady who brought our receipt was very friendly as well.

Overall, incredible food and service! I'd love to come back and try other dishes on their diverse menu.

author: Glo Song
text: So glad my friend and I were lucky enough to get seated at this restaurant with no reservation. I wanted to order the Mak-Hwe, but the Seafood Butter Gui was much more tempting especially in terms of portion. The seafood melts in your mouth and the pita was nice and chewy w. a crisp. Be sure to order yourself the complimentary Seoul Night bottle they have on special when you download/pay through the Blackbird app. The service was on point and so was their dessert!

author: Nico
text: OMG this was the best Korean place I‚Äôve ever been: the fried chicken was so tender, juicy and tasty. Loved the fact the staff kept on refilling our complimentary kimchi. The duck and the domburi were to die for. Incredibly lovely stuff ‚Äî by far one of the best places I dined at in NYC.

author: D Lee
text:
Great seafood place in Texas! Never thought I would get decent sushi place while visiting in Texas, but yes I really liked the Mero seabass here. Sashimi sampler is also great for its price!
Food did take a bit to comeout but i guess they were cooking it from scratch. Would come here again!

author: snarkyguy
text: Really solid sushi restaurant. Although it‚Äôs Japanese, the waiter and the hostess were speaking Mandarin Chinese when deciding what table to put us at (totally fine, just outside my expectation). The atmosphere feels nice and relaxed. My wife got the bento box with eel and I got two types of rolls; Texas and Philadelphia. Really tasty!

author: Steven Hung
text: I ordered the California Roll, Squid Teriyaki, and Seafood Udon. Out of the three, the California Roll was the best. I was a bit disappointed to find that the seafood wasn‚Äôt very fresh‚Äîthe squid and the seafood in the udon weren‚Äôt up to par. The atmosphere inside was pretty comfortable, and the staff were friendly, but they really need to work on the freshness of the squid.

author: Savannah Grant
text: This is my absolute FAVORITE sushi spot. The nigiri is always so fresh and dressed up. I love the Kanpaccio & the Chili Escolar sashimis as well. Oooohhh and the garlic edamame!! If I could afford to eat her 3 times a week I would!!

author: Nannaphat Ann
text: This is my first time came here. The atmosphere of the restaurant is clean. The food is very fresh. There are many menus and it is very delicious. Price reasonable The staff is very nice service mild and good recommend  food for us. Also restroom  is clean. I recommend it for those who like Japanese food. ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

author: Mike Reviewed It!
text:
Interesting set up. Found tucked away in the middle of the busy k town block. If you are not looking for it you could just walk right by it.
Just like ok the sidewalk, inside the store also has Very high traffic. But just like the street it moves. Streams of people browsing past a sea of to go containers on seemingly temporary mobile shelving.
There is a variety of Asian food to choose from. Some familiar foods, some not.  Had to sift through the containers to find something I would like.
Basically,
Come in, get food, sit and eat or leave. Bargain prices. Quality is as expected for only 5.50 a tempora roll and 5 for spicey string beans.

author: Mia Huynh
text:
Not a bad spot for affordable and quick Korean food! Here, they have a variety of pre-packaged Korean bites from different banchan to japchae to even Korean soups. You grab what you want to eat (and/or a drink), then pay at counter. They have plenty of seating for you to sit down at as you enjoy your food.

I tried their kimbap and chicken and thought they were both solid. The kimbap was a good portion and made very well. And, the chicken was flavorful (although I wish it were so squishy/soft, but hey: what can you do about pre-packaged food). Although it was good, I would say that I would rather pay just a little bit more for fresher and higher quality items. But! Still not bad for a quick bite!

author: THE EXPLORER
text: We have been here to eat a few times over the years. This time we were guests at a large party of 10 people. Lots of delicious food ordered by the host. Restaurant was packed as always with a line of people waiting to get n.  Our table was downstairs in the back.  A wonderful night with good food and friends. Service was excellent.

author: Tian Carling
text:
Great service from cashier named James
(I think that was his name). Love all the selections and affordable prices. Everything is fresh and the place is clean and has ample seating! I've dined-in many years ago.

author: MaChaNillas
text: Someone tell me why this place was so hyped? Food was tasteless. Spicy was nonexistent, even their packet hot sauce was not spicy. Their staff stare at you for asking for soy sauce and hot sauce as if you‚Äôre stealing it and then they only give you 1 of each for an order of 4 items, what a joke! I‚Äôm disappointed because having lived in NYC, Korean food was much better in this area.

author: Allia
text:
This was my first time dining at Bryant Park Grill, and it was absolutely amazing! From start to finish, the experience exceeded expectations.

Our server Lena was a darling:  attentive, warm, and made sure everything was perfect. We started with the jumbo lump crab cake and salad, which was fresh and flavorful. My friend had the cashew-crusted salmon (he swapped the potatoes for asparagus,  great choice!), and I had the pan-roasted branzino, cooked to perfection. The blackberry nojito seltzer was a hit! We ended the evening with a chocolate brownie and vanilla ice cream that was the perfect sweet touch.

Despite the buzz of the city around us, the atmosphere felt calm and intimate.   A little oasis right in the heart of it all. I guess when you have an amazing date and great food, nothing else really matters üòä

Highly recommend and can‚Äôt wait to return!

author: Nina Buitrago
text: We had a nice meal, seated in the covered patio. Temperature was nice and the holiday decor was so nice for early November event. Our server Jose was very attentive and nice. Lots of options for all food restrictions vegan, veggie etc.  We will definitely be back!

author: Mister Man
text:
One of my favorite places to take visitors for a NY brunch. The main attraction is of course the wonderful Bryant Park location

Chill in the park before leisurely heading to Bryant Park Grill to eat ! If you want to sit inside then a reservation is necessary with a phone call and a confirmation via text day of.

The indoor seating was spacious and classy with friendly service.

The food is about what you expect. Not great but not bad either.

author: Stephane R.
text:
A spacious and very pleasant restaurant, in a quiet location opposite Bryant Park, with a magnificent terrace for sunny days. The food is easily among the best in New York, and the service is very friendly, warm, and attentive (thanks to Ren√©!).
I highly recommend it! A very good place to eat.

I took the opportunity to continue reading my feel-good thriller Honesty Bar, which I found on Amazon (in English and French)‚Äîa plot for the whole family set in Paris, Warsaw, and the Seychelles!üíï

author: Clint Watson
text: Bryant Park Grill never disappoints! The chicken sandwich was absolutely amazing ‚Äî perfectly cooked and full of flavor ‚Äî and the salad was just as delicious and fresh. Beautiful setting, great service, and outstanding food. Highly recommend!

author: Josh Ricketts
text: Fantastic bar, great atmosphere fantastic bartender. Bourbon, whiskey, and scotch selection is on point. The recommendations from the bartender on the fried artichoke hearts, and the bone in pork chop, also the cocktails he served and the cheesecake! This has made this one of my favorite spots in NYC

author: anar virji
text: The rudest bartender I‚Äôve ever had. Said the first drink I ordered - a grapefruit cocktail on their menu - sounded disgusting. So I ordered a Tom Collins instead. He brought me a gin and soda. After I tasted it, I asked him what he put in the drink and he said gin and soda. I pointed out that‚Äôs not a Tom Collins, it‚Äôs a different drink, which I would have ordered had I wanted that. He said he‚Äôs not from the 1900s, and I passed him my drink and asked him not to make me another. At that point I didn‚Äôt want a drink from someone who‚Äôs such a jerk. Not that I felt welcome at that bar, but I‚Äôd never go back.

author: Ms. Ratatouille
text: Great bar! Lots of drinks and food choices.

author: maddy lederman
text: This hip and cozy upper Midtown gem feels like Dublin‚Äôs Palace Bar married a farm-to-table steakhouse. We had another excellent meal last night, and really can‚Äôt think of how it could have been better!

author: Chan Woo Park
text: Visited for Saturday brunch with a friend and it was quiet and not crowded at all. The bar was very pretty and I liked the inside decoration. The price was reasonable, but the food was okay. The server was very attentive and kind.

author: Jeff
text:
Great food and ambience. The couscous with the chicken had a mild and pleasant flavor. There was some extra broth on the side to pour into the couscous.

The lamb shank tagine with dried plums and apricots was hearty and flavorful. The rice was deliciously bathed in the lamb stock.

The Moroccan music and eclectic crowd provided a lively atmosphere.

author: Lloyd Feng
text: Did brunch here.  The Moroccan eggs I ordered seemed like a deconstructed shakshuka.  It tasted fine, but didn‚Äôt really stand out to me.  The bread that came with it was very tasty so if I‚Äôm back here for brunch, I‚Äôd ask abt a dish that has more of this bread.

author: Tsering gurung
text: LOVED THE FOOD. First time in a Moroccan restaurant. It was delicious. The pita bread was so tasty. The eggs are cooked to perfection. The chicken is so tender and the spicy sauce on the side is perfect with it. Get the country breakfast and the other one. OMG and the orange juice so fresh and hydrating. Good experience and excellent to the point service ü´ìü•òüçΩÔ∏è

author: Pamela A
text: I reserved a 3 PM on a Sunday. It was still brunch time so options were limited, so I ordered halloumi eggs. They were delicious. The service was good. I think dinner might be a 5 star. I especially liked that they served a little salad on the plate to add some brightness to the plate.

author: Amir Y
text:
‚ú® Dinner at Caf√© Mogador last night did not disappoint. Drinks were smooth, food was on point, and the whole place had that cozy, late-night vibe I love.

The kebab was the star, super flavorful, unique, and honestly right up my alley (maybe I‚Äôm biased, but I‚Äôd order it again in a heartbeat). Wrapped things up with a raspberry sorbet that was light, refreshing, and the perfect finish.

Service was chill, not too in-your-face, which I liked, though I had to wave for attention a couple times. Nothing major, just the pace of the night.

If you‚Äôre after authentic flavors + great energy, Mogador is definitely worth a visit. üåøüç∑üç¢

author: ig K
text:
Tiny portions. Not suitable as a meal. I should have just gone to DIG.

For a $15 vegetarian plate, it was basically a rice bowl with a sprinkle of veggies. Barely any brocoli or cauliflower. $3 extra for the sweet potatoes. Mostly rice/couscous in the bowl, you can see it was one forkfull of brocoli and one of cauliflower.

Very disappointed. Definitely NOT worth it for $15.

First visit, and likely my last!

author: Abiose Wilburg
text: Blue Park Kitchen nailed their Roasted Chicken & Cauliflower bowl! The combo of juicy chicken, healthy roasted cauliflower, and zesty pickled onions over fresh greens hit all the right notes. Took my MealPal lunch to the next level.

author: RaeAnn Serra
text: A standout for healthy food in midtown. Everything I've had here so far has been flavorful, fresh, and made with care. There are so many spots like this in the area and they don't even come close to the thoughtfulness of Blue Park Kitchen. I had a salmon bowl the first time, and it was super moist and not overcooked. Wonderful selection of veggies and tons of sauce options (the pumpkin pesto is AMAZING). Will definitely keep coming back.

author: Maria Georgiadis
text:
Our office ordered lunch here for the first time - the delivery was so speedy! We submitted our order 11:48am and by 12:07pm the delivery was downstairs. The food came nicely and securely packaged.

All the meals ordered were correct and delicious! We also got the snickerdoodle and chocolate chip cookies and they were fantastic.

Very impressed already! Will definitely order again.

author: Max L
text: The place has a lot of space to sit comfortably. The ingredients are top notch. Super fresh. Even salad oil they use is top grade and it tastes as such and also contains a hint of vinegar and garlic, but not artificial tasting like most places, actually freshly made. They brought healthy food to the new level along with DIG. The server was super courteous and tried their best to please you.

author: J B C
text: While on my way to one of my favorite chocolate shops I wasn‚Äôt sure what to have for lunch on Saturday. So I decided to try Wagamamma. My uncertainty about what to have for lunch didn‚Äôt end with which restaurant to choose but also what to eat. I ended up ordering 3 starters. I went with the chili hoisin duck bao which was delicious. Their version of calamari, a chili squid which was interesting but I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll try again. And Tokyo fries which was also interesting but I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll be trying again. My sister‚Äôs birthday was on Monday so naturally on Tuesday I ran to Macys (Herald Square) to get her a little something & decided to try Wagamamma once again since I felt or was cold enough to have ramen. I sat at the bar this time & ordered the Korean fried chicken bao for my appetizer & the chicken gyoza ramen for my main. Oddly enough my main was served before my appetizer. The ramen was pretty good however I wasn‚Äôt a big fan of the Korean fried chicken. Since there was hardly any chicken involved. It‚Äôs a nice restaurant with polite staff however I don‚Äôt see myself going back anytime soon.

author: Kristina Zhegunova
text:
We had a fun and flavorful meal at Wagamama! Tried a variety of dishes ‚Äî some hits, some misses. The pad Thai was okay, but definitely not like the one you‚Äôd get in Thailand ‚Äî milder and less bold in flavor. The duck ramen, on the other hand, was rich, a bit fatty in the best way, and absolutely satisfying.

The chicken salad was light and fresh, a good balance to the heartier dishes. Their famous bang bang cauliflower came with high expectations, but it was just okay ‚Äî crispy but the sauce didn‚Äôt quite wow us.

We also had two bao buns: one vegetarian and one with chicken. Both were great ‚Äî soft, fluffy buns with flavorful fillings. The chicken one especially stood out, with tender meat and a nice crunchy contrast.

Fresh-pressed juices were a highlight ‚Äî especially the positive one, super refreshing and energizing. And the teas! One with lemongrass, the other with mint ‚Äî both fragrant and calming.

A nice spot for a casual meal with a twist, especially if you‚Äôre in the mood for variety and fresh drinks.

author: Alisa B
text: Delicious ramen on a surprisingly rainy and cold late summer day. Lunch special is a decent value. It‚Äôs a low key setting which for a late lunch was quiet and relaxed. Server was fast and very friendly. Only minor issue was it was a bit cold in the restaurant.

author: John Ouellette
text:
This has become one of my favorite places to eat. The options are varied and the taste is out of this world. Specifically the soup broth is almost like it's some sort of addictive substance it's so good...

I have found that they're very open to make some substitutions and mix things up a bit as far as what's on the menu, which is super helpful to me. The staff is always helpful and friendly and I would not hesitate to come here over and over again...

author: Jihyun Min
text:
I‚Äòve visited Wagamama in London several times and always had a great experience. When I came across this location in New York, I was excited to try it. Unfortunately, this visit was extremely disappointing, and I truly feel it was a WASTE of money.

Upon entering, a female server guided me toward a bar seat. I politely asked if I could be seated by the window instead, as there were plenty of empty tables. She did not verbally respond and seemed quite dismissive.

Shortly after, a male server, who was kind and attentive, brought me a glass of tap water.

However, the table was sticky and appeared dirty, which was concerning.

Regarding the food ‚Äî I wondered how they  are managing their ingredients and the recipe.

Pork Belly Bao ($11): The pork was extremely dry, and the toppings were poorly prepared.

Beef Brisket Tantanmen Ramen ($23): The bamboo shoots and the kimchi tasted spoiled, with a sourness beyond the normal flavor. The beef brisket was very dry, and the broth and egg were cold. For a dish that is meant to be served hot, the cold egg was particularly unpleasant.

I shared my feedback with the male server, who listened carefully and was understanding. I appreciated his attitude, which at least prevented the experience from being entirely ruined. Nevertheless, I spent $40 (including tip) for a deeply unsatisfying meal.

author: Timothy Johnson
text: Always been a great spot for drinks, but very happy to see how well they‚Äôve recently expanded into a cafe during the daytime! And unlike the thousands of NYC cafes serving mediocre coffee and the same stale pastries for $$$, they instead offer two things you really can‚Äôt get anywhere else; Tim Wendelboe coffee and fresh Norwegian Waffles with the traditional toppings! Additionally their matcha offerings are very solid as well actually! Pretty quiet vibe there during the daytime too, so perfect for some casual meetings or a quick work session as well! La Cabra and Kabin will be my go-to cafe spots in lower manhattan now!

author: Gjoni Shpati
text:
Came here last night to celebrate 2 birthdays and this was honestly the best choice we‚Äôve ever made on a reservation. Chris really went above and beyond with his service and his passion behind the drinks was so special. The whole table loved learning about the time that goes behind crafting a cocktail and we didn‚Äôt even want to order our own drinks, we just trusted Chris and his recommendations.

I can‚Äôt recommend coming here enough this really was an amazing experience. The mango lassi shot was honestly life changing and the celery margarita was crazy.

If you ever are here and Chris happens to help you, literally let him do all the choosing and really get to know what you‚Äôre about to drink, this was better service than I get at most Michelin stars in the city.

author: Ryan Reynolds
text: Stopped into Kabin during the day and was really impressed. Had a La Cabra oat milk cortado that was perfectly balanced, as well as an exceptional pour-over that showed real care in brewing. It‚Äôs could quockly become my new favorite specialty coffee spot in the city, whether it‚Äôs for the coffee itself or just the vibe. Highly recommend for anyone looking for quality and craft in their cup.

author: Isabella Watkins
text: Literally can‚Äôt rate this place highly enough! The vibe, food and drinks were unreal! The team is epic!! A must visit if you‚Äôre in town! Will definitely be returning

author: Vlada Khmarska
text: We had been here once before, but we came back a second time. It‚Äôs a wonderful bar with an amazing atmosphere and excellent service. And their Cremant is honestly one of the best ‚ù§Ô∏è

author: Eva Smeets
text: We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived at this cozy restaurant. We were greeted with a very warm welcome, and the atmosphere was intimate and inviting. The menu was fantastic, offering a variety of unique dishes  not the usual standard options, but truly delicious and beautifully presented. We had such a lovely evening! I can highly recommend this place!

author: ila Moravek
text: It‚Äôs a lovely intimate establishment with a fantastic food and drink happy hour. Sal, our bartender, was attentive and made great cocktails and conversation.  Highly recommend for a date night or catching up with friends.

author: Liana Warren
text: Everything tasted so cheap and low quality, and it is overpriced for how cheap it tastes. The cheese board tasted like it came from dollar tree. The wine tasted like a $5 wine.

author: Laurie Gerdemann
text: Darkish, wine cellar type of atmosphere with tall lit candles on each table.The service was cheerful and fast.The food excellent. I had the salmon and grilled vegetables.It was a 3 course meal special starting with zuchinni pancakes and ending with chocolate baklava.

author: SP
text: Cute wine bar with indoor and outdoor seating. Service was great all around from the food to the drinks. Responsibly priced which is nice as well. The meat and cheese board for 5 ppl was the only thing that wasn‚Äôt worth our while for the price.

author: ML SMITH
text:
We stopped here for a quick Sunday brunch.  Food was great, tasty, and spot on.  Cost for 2 meals were relatively expensive but doable.  I would recommend getting here at a decent time because the space is very limited and lacks private seating.

Restaurant did not offer a baby chair, but lucky our young child wasn't hungry.  Staff was friendly and the food served to us came out pretty fast.  For 2 people, prepare to pay about $40.00.  Overall, we enjoyed our time, food was delicious.

author: Jessica Murphy
text: Cozy spot near Union Square with flavorful falafel and warm, fluffy pita. Hummus bowl w/ sweet potato falafel was tasty, but next time I‚Äôm trying the amazing looking pita sandwiches!

author: Aika Ormanbetova
text:
Food & service was great and cashier Kennedy was friendly ! I had lamb sandwich on ü•ô pita bread with potato chips ( very oily) .

I enjoyed my dinner and would recommend to try their food !

author: Danielle
text: This is such a great little spot. There is community style seating and it isn‚Äôt super spacious so I wouldn‚Äôt recommend for large groups. But the menu has many wonderful options both vegetarian and non, and the prices and portions make sense. Staff is friendly and the taste is so authentic and delicious

author: Osher Assouline
text: Came in for the shakshuka since other places were too busy. Their attempt at shakshuka is a more accurate description. Instead of eggs cooked in matbiucha (=traditional tomato stew) I received friend eggs served on a bed of tomato pizza/ pasta sauce. That is not a shakshuka. Chat gpt could have told them that.

author: Ravi Kurani
text: You NEED to go here if you‚Äôre at Columbia or in the Upper West Side. Probably one of the best Thai spots I‚Äôve been to. We got the pad ki Mao & pra ram tofu. SO GOOD. The rice is perfect, and on top of that the service is amazing. They‚Äôre super quick, always come and ask if you want anything, their hot sauces have all 4 of the sauces (the spicy pepper, small fresh pickled peppers, chili sauce‚Ä¶ and one that I forget, because I don‚Äôt usually eat it). They have 2 bathrooms in the back, and the location is super cute.

author: Bridget Ortega
text: I gave a 4 because of the customer service but food overall was really good, the interior is nice, cool and chilled. The Steamed Thai dumpling were amazing and tasty, the pad kee mao was very good and I asked for mild, the kow soy was good, not too spicy at all, chicken was very tender and the sauce was flavorful and creamy.

author: Ameya Bhakay
text:
Overcast Sunday random walk-in got us here. The place was not busy and we got an amazing window seat and got straight to ordering which included Kow Soy ($17.95), Vegetable Curry ($17.95) and, Curry Rice ($2.50) - a side portion which was enough to feed our little one!

Food overall was inline with expectations; nothing spectacular, but not disappoint either. Not much spice kick, but the Kow Soy was packed with flavor and the Vegetable Curry, not so much! Decent portion sizes too.

Service was slightly slow, but food arrived within 25-mins of ordering. Noise levels on the lower end. Will visit again for sure!

author: Jeffer Sonian
text: The food at Thai Market is possibly the best Thai food I have had in the US.  Everything we have tried over many visits has been consistently delicious, including the Branzino, Salmon, Chicken Massaman, Pad Thai, Calamari and Chicken Sate.  The only problem is that is now so popular that there is often a 1 hour wait.

author: Leonard
text:
One of the few times I give 5 stars. Aside from price, the place was like perfect. The servers, serve in a way that is there but also non invasive. The atmosphere is clean, on theme, and we'll lit for a nice mood. And the food... well is like premium/quality Thai.
I had an aversion from a previous experience with Thai in another restaurant and this place helped me get over it.
I ordered the panang curry which they easily and without hassle substituted the meat with salmon. And it was beautifully plated, the salmon was perfectly cooked tender and flaky, flavor on point, and just ask around perfection. I also ordered a pomegranate ginger ale and it was alright. Not that good. Too much sugar but the curry was bomb.
Tried my friend's curry as well and it also slapped. So good!

author: Cassy Randolph
text: Always love some good sushi, and decided to try this place. The food to me is average, not exciting. Kind expensive and small portions, sashimi is fresh and decent quality. but it‚Äôs NY, so kind of expected. The tempura cheesecake was the highlight of the meal. The service is great üëç.

author: Nolan Rumble
text: Interesting little spot that offers some good sushi. Great for a quick snack before a theatre show begins! The staff are friendly and helpful. I wouldn‚Äôt suggest ordering wine by the glass here as it might have some slow turnover (ie. oxidize wine). The black miso cod was delicious and if you want to spoil yourself, I‚Äôd recommend this. Chocolate mousse cake was also ok‚Ä¶but lacked a ‚Äúwow‚Äù factor‚Ä¶.still ate all it though!

author: Angie R
text:
We had the tempura rock shrimp and fried chicken appetizer.  Both were excellent and we should have stopped there as that was enough food for the both of us.

We also had a couple of mixed drinks (peach one pictured here) and we enjoyed a Sapporo as well.

Shared the maki platter, I wouldn't order the Philly roll again, too much cream cheese and no cucumber, it was just overwhelming.  We shared the tempura, don't skip this during your visit - delicious!

author: GrAcIE W
text:
Nice & friendly service with mediocre sushi.
The Tuna Tartar Martini was delicious, Sushi and Sashimi were average, and the Ginger Citrus Duck Breast was tasty but really dry.
Overall experience was just okay, don‚Äôt think I would come back again.

author: Lexy
text:
