Can I have 100 stars? Holy moly! There are some amazingly unique treats on this menu, and of course I had to try! Green tea gnocchi? Probably easily one of the best gnocchi dishes Ive had! The capers scattered through the dish give a perfectly salty compliment to a savory dish that has the perfect dash of something almost sweet! I will be dreaming about this dish FOR-EVER! Stacy our server was an absolute delight!  To top off the meal; dessert a tempura cheesecake, crunchy and just absolutely melts in your mouth!
I will most certainly find myself here again when I visit...if not again before I leave!

author: Patrick McEvoy
text: Love this NYC restaurant every time I head into the city for NYU Epilepsy doctor appointments. Cool atmosphere.  The comfort food feeling takes some anxiety out of a doctor visit.

author: Ashay Doshi
text: Good sandiwches and burgers and great draft beer options! Spent the afternoon there for lunch! The chipotle pepper jack chicken wrap is my favourite because the chicken is soft and spiced to perfection. Draft beers have got something for everyone, from IPAs to Lagers, but there's also the regular can and bottle section.

author: Chris Zygo
text: Ate here two nights in a row because the wings and burgers were worth the trip back. Great food and very friendly staff.

author: Leah Fletcher
text: Visited this restaurant several weeks ago with some friends and I cannot stop thinking about the amazing salad I ordered. The other dishes looked and smelled delicious too! Cool vibe, felt very comfortable as soon as we walked in. Looking forward to my next time dining here

author: Marc
text:
Great place to grab dinner and a drink. Good food, good portions, and cheap drinks. Rotating nightly special menu.

The place is a little small but they have some additional seating in the back. Service is quick and friendly.

Grill burger was delicious, nice big solid burger. Side of fries was excellently crisp though a little unseasoned. Salmon salad had a nice piece of salmon which tasted good but the rest of the salad was a little plain.

Drink prices are great though. Happy Hour beer and cocktails are about $4-$6 and drink specials are $5-$7. Other cocktails are a little more but most of what you would want is available pretty cheap.

author: Sabahat Ali
text: For many people this will be FIVE STARS. I want to make that really clear because if you like a thick cut fry that‚Äôs golden on the outside with a high ‚Äúfuffly potato‚Äù ratio on the inside, you‚Äôll enjoy it thoroughly because they‚Äôve executed amazingly on that kind of fry. The problem in this case is me: I like a thin cut fry with more of the crunchy / crispy golden exterior and less of the interior of a fry. And they really are two different categories of fry. As far as execution on the former is concerned, it‚Äôs done well. I just don‚Äôt like that kind of fry. The black truffle mayo we got sounded great but fell very short of our expectations. Barely any truffle flavour and you have to buy truffle oil separately. The place does feel like a rendezvous for Diagon Alley‚Äôs shadiest wizards so that‚Äôs actually really cool especially because it feels like you‚Äôve entered an olden times tavern restaurant in 18th century England. All in all if you like the thick cut fry scene they guys have executed beautifully, but if you‚Äôre like me I wouldn‚Äôt choose to come back here simply because of my preference for cut fries. I‚Äôm sure these guys would do an amazing job making those.

author: Cem Simsek
text:
I have been running a traditional Belgian frituur ‚ÄúOma‚Äôs Frit‚Äù for 15 years üáßüá™. I walked in here out of pure curiosity, because Belgian fries are not just food ‚Äî they‚Äôre a network of tradition and perfection, built over generations.
The secret to real Belgian fries lies in the quality and variety of the potatoes, the type of fat used, and precise control of temperature and frying time. Even how many potatoes are added to the fryer at once makes a difference: if you add too many, the temperature suddenly drops, which immediately affects the texture.
A powerful fryer, the right fat, and especially the double-frying method with correct temperatures and timings are absolutely crucial.
In Belgium, potatoes are delivered fresh every day, and we mostly use Bintje potatoes because of their unique flavor and structure. Occasionally we switch to Agria, but nothing truly compares to good Bintjes.
With all that in mind, I was curious to give this place a try. I walked in‚Ä¶ and honestly, I walked back out rather quickly. The bar for fries in Belgium is simply very high, and what I saw here didn‚Äôt reach that level.

This is not meant as negative criticism, just an honest observation: real fries‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs something truly Belgian. üáßüá™üçü

author: Brian
text: Pommes Frites has always been a good to in order for me to satisfy my fries cravings. They serve great portions at a good price and there are sooo many options for sauces. They have great service , allowing you to try any of the flavors before you make you order and then in a matter of moments, youre meal is ready. The atmosphere is like an old tavern feel , but the seats and space is limited. But overall I love this place!

author: Maegan Wrubel
text: Love this spot in the west village! The fries are always fresh and perfectly prepared. This visit I got the truffle fries (pic attached) You can‚Äôt go wrong with any of the sauces - the truffle ketchup and Parmesan peppercorn are our go-to

author: Dalit Rosenfeld
text:
You MUST come here! Pommes Frites in New York is one of my favorite spots to visit whenever I come from South Florida. It is such a fun and unique concept with perfectly crispy french fries served in different sizes and an incredible variety of dipping sauces. SO MANY to choose. The flavors are creative and make this simple idea feel really special.
They have been around forever and it is always a must stop for me when I am in the city. Totally recommended for anyone who loves fries and wants to try something different in New York.

author: Heather
text: I had to swing by Lupe's while I was doing some Mr. Robot related sight seeing. The food was fantastic and the portion size was great. House marg was nice, too! By the time I was done with my meal there were a bunch of people waiting to be seated, so I'm guessing it's a local fave. I can see why! Luckily for me, the Dark Army was nowhere to be found. RIP Cisco.

author: Zoe
text:
Our Love Story (and Margaritas) Start at Lupe‚Äôs.
It‚Äôs time to write a review for the most important restaurant in Soho NYC to me and my husband. Lupe‚Äôs isn‚Äôt just a place; it‚Äôs where our love grew, from dating to marriage. I‚Äôll never forget how, when my husband was still my boyfriend, he‚Äôd always stop by before seeing me to grab a margarita. Three years later, it‚Äôs still his favorite bar,his ritual. After work, you‚Äôll find him here, greeted by the kindest bartenders who treat him like family (and pour the most generous drinks). and of course the margaritas are the best in town!!! Period‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

The corner spot, with its neon glow and lantern style lighting, feels like a secret hideaway romantic, cozy, and alive with energy. Summer nights on the patio under those red lights just so magic!

We‚Äôve ordered takeout many times, but tonight we sat at my favorite corner table outside and had a proper feast: the vibrant shrimp salad, crispy fish tacos, tender beef tacos, and the most perfectly cooked fish plate. And the flan? Hands down the best, tortillas are so yummy ü§§ üòã and authentic, the taste just can bring you back to Mexico! Portions are generous, flavors are bright, and everything tastes impossibly fresh, no surprise, since the entire kitchen team is from Mexico.

But what makes Lupe‚Äôs special isn‚Äôt just the food or drinksÔºåit‚Äôs the people. The staff radiates warmth, making every visit feel like coming home. You can always find the owner inside and make sure every dish and drink is perfect, so friendly to the customers. Lupe‚Äôs is the institution ‚ù§Ô∏è Funny enough, if I ever can‚Äôt reach my husband? I know exactly where he‚Äôll be: at Lupe‚Äôs, drink in hand, happy or (occasionally) mad at me. It‚Äôs his sanctuary.

To the team: Thank you for being part of our story. Here‚Äôs to many more years of tacos, margaritas, and memories. If you love Mexican food, Soho charm, or just feeling like family, Lupe‚Äôs is your spot. It‚Äôs not just a restaurant‚Äîit‚Äôs a piece of our hearts.

author: Amelia T
text: Good for for a good price, really fast service. We came on a Saturday night and it was relatively quiet. We ordered the chicken mole enchiladas and the beef enchiladas. They came out so quickly! Our favorite was the beef enchiladas. Server was friendly and efficient. Overall good experience and at a great price!

author: Lina Stef
text: Delicious! All the flavors of Mexico on top of fresh food, Mezcal, wine and beers. Salvador is amazing behind the bar and hosting. I got the Baja salad with grilled shrimp along with a Mezcal cocktail finished with a tasty Mexican hot chocolate. This spot has a very cheery fun colorful vibe. Highly recommend and I‚Äôll be back again. Cheers to the head chef, staff and Salvador!

author: Bellamy Woodside Ridinger
text: I was looking for a spot where I could gather a few friends for my birthday and have a margarita and something affordable to eat, somewhere that felt good to be in and fun but not so loud we couldn‚Äôt hear each other. Had an amazing time last night. The team was lovely, the food was amazing, and the space was cozy, cool, casual but beautiful

author: Kathy D
text: Typical NYC deli/diner.  Old school atmosphere with a decent sized menu and good food.  Nothing amazing but the food was exactly as I would expect.  Quickly served, basic but tasty and reasonable prices for NYC. Only surprise for me was they serve unsalted butter which you don‚Äôt usually see.

author: Alisha Kass
text: We dined in at Roxy last night 11/14 Friday. We are visiting NYC and wanted to try a diner . The food was delish. Our male server was very attentive and always checking on us to see if we need anything throughout the night. Nice evening out.

author: Celia Westrick
text: We loved this deli!! It was the cutest little street cafe for breakfast. We ended coming by every morning of our trip. It‚Äôs quiet with a perfect panoramic glass view to watch the city street. Also DO NOT sleep on the chocolate croissant! It was to die for, sadly I ate it all before I got a pic lol.

author: Candace Guardascione
text:
Great for families! Food was delicious. Service was very friendly and quick. Great location. We were so happy to stumble upon this place and we‚Äôll definitely be back.
My 6 year old was very happy with his giant bowl of yogurt and his bagel. It‚Äôs usually hard to find something on a menu he is happy about but he was super excited about his breakfast this morning!

author: Kelly Denham
text: Walked in for breakfast and was greeted by the most charming host, Pierre. The decor is also very charming. We sat by the window and had coffee and orange juice. I had the cheese and bacon omelet with potatoes and toast. The omelet was fluffy, hot, and full of bacon. The potatoes had a good seasoning. My husband had three eggs with homemade corn beef hash and potatoes and a bagel.

author: Mariam Kmh
text: Delicious spot for ramen and unreal bao. We booked a reservation for the same day but were about to sit at the bar. LOVED the spicy ramen, it‚Äôs definitely feeling. They had some popcorn chicken which was great as well as the pork bao‚Ä¶ do not sleep on it. I‚Äôd pass on the dessert or share it as it‚Äôs massive.

author: Mj Helmreich
text: Delicious food!  The chicken ramen was the show stopper!  Rich flavor!  Curry cauliflower seasoned beautifully. Cold noodles good as well with spice! And topped off the meal with pumpkin cheesecake! The empty bowls say it all!  Yum!

author: Ari Babis
text:
I had one of the best meals I‚Äôve had in NYC at Ivan Ramen. Every dish was a standout.
The small plates were perfectly balanced ‚Äî the potato salad with roe was creamy, savory, and unexpectedly addictive.
The ramen itself was spectacular: rich broth, vibrant flavors, perfectly cooked noodles, and the soft-boiled egg was unreal. You can tell every component is made with intention.

From start to finish, everything was fantastic.

author: Keti C
text: I first stumbled upon Ivan Ramen three years ago when I lived in the neighborhood, not realizing at the time that it would become my favorite ramen spot in the city. I‚Äôve probably visited every ramen place in New York by now and this one is still hands down the best. I often come back for my go to bowl - Tokyo Shio. It's just that good. The service is always warm and welcoming and the food is consistently excellent. For any ramen lover this place is definitely a must visit.

author: Kelsey
text: This is my third or fourth time here. It‚Äôs always a great time, no matter the time of day or week. I came for lunch today and tried their new spicy veggie miso ramen and it‚Äôs honestly some of THE BEST ramen I‚Äôve had in the area and city. As a noodle lover I‚Äôm always pleased when a place continues to elevate their menu.

author: Legends l
text:
I visited this restaurant a couple of times on a trip to New York. Food tastes good and is quick. Very generous portions and very competitive pricing.
Staff were friendly. If you are looking for a dining experience, this might not be suitable for you.
For me, it was perfect as I appreciated the vibe and cultural exchange/experience. If I had to be critical, I think the msg content in the meals were noticeable.

author: Rob H
text:
Taiwan Pork Chop House, tucked away on Doyers Street in Chinatown, offers a straightforward dining experience that caters to those seeking authentic Taiwanese street food.

Food:
The menu features classic Taiwanese dishes such as pork chop over rice, fried rice cakes, and wontons in chili oil. While the pork chop is tender and flavorful, some dishes may lack the depth of flavor found in other establishments. The fried rice cakes and wontons are popular choices among patrons.  Ôøº

Atmosphere:
The setting is modest, with a no-frills approach that emphasizes function over ambiance. It‚Äôs a casual spot suitable for a quick meal rather than a leisurely dining experience.  Ôøº

Service:
Service is efficient, with staff ensuring that orders are processed swiftly. However, the fast-paced environment may not lend itself to personalized service.  Ôøº

Overall:
For those in the area craving Taiwanese comfort food at reasonable prices, Taiwan Pork Chop House is a solid choice. While it may not offer the most refined dining experience, it delivers on authenticity and value.

author: Jiao Zhang
text: A good street food in a cozy alley. I wouldn‚Äôt say the quality is great but it tastes good as street food itself. I recommend salt and pepper chicken, which is very tender and flavorful. The taro ball dessert with ice is also good. The onion pancake is way too oil. The price is very reasonable. It is a place where you can just stop by and get some snacks and bathing in Chinatown vibe.

author: Isabelle
text:
The beef noodle soup was great. However I got the tofu and seaweed appetizer because I saw a photo of it on the window, but what came out looked nothing like it :( it wasn‚Äôt very good - it was kind of like boiled seaweed, topped with boiled tofu, and the sauce is drizzled on top and not mixed in. This was disappointing.
Also they only serve food in plastic bowls so will not be eating here due to this.

author: Chu Lin
text: This place is as iconic as it gets in Chinatown. Growing up in Taiwan, TPCH is definitely authentic. Their sour vegetable is delicious, I could eat that on its own. Their pork chops over rice is done nicely, sits on top of rice covered by minced meat, side of half egg and sour vegetables. The price is great. My favorite thing here is to eat on the street. Sitting on the plastic stools, eating and watching people walk by. It's a cool vibe

author: Nie Znany
text: Karczma never lets me down. It‚Äôs one of the last true Polish spots left in Greenpoint, and it honestly feels like a little piece of home. Whenever I‚Äôm feeling homesick or just need some comfort, this is where I go for food that warms my soul. The meals are always tasty, portions are generous, and there‚Äôs always something good on the menu. Love this place!

author: Monika Kraszewski
text: I‚Äôm Polish so I know what means good quality Polish food ! And this is what you would find in Karczma ! I‚Äôm really impressed! Sour rye soup aka Zurek in a bread is to die for! We came back next day for more food . Highly recommend for everyone! Do zobaczenia next time !

author: Tom Jones
text: A nice little place.  I‚Äôm maybe being a little harsh about the food.   I had pork shoulder w cabbage with a side of kielbasa.  The sausage and cabbage were respectable.  The pork shoulder was pretty gristly and not so flavorful.  But the place has a nice vibe and I will return to try other dishes.  It‚Äôs certainly great value for the money!  Whole meal with a drink was under $30.  Friendly staff.

author: Akinde Olagundoye
text: Classic Polish restaurant featuring traditionally prepared dishes. We got the sampler and the Spicy Goulash. The sampler was perfect for 2 people trying to explore several tastes from the menu.  I wouldn't call it spicy, but it was delicious.

author: Mark Garno
text:
My wife and I heard about this great polish restaurant/ bar HOME COOKING, grandparents recipe made just like my mama cooked rest her soul, specifically soup ‚Äú. Flaczki ‚Äú.  and we all know it takes 3 days to prepare the right way, Fish and chips frytki sea style.  Baked potatoes on brick stove made us feel at home.  Hey come by and check it out for yourself
You like it‚Ä¶..ps. european kitchen with brew at your discretion

author: perle75nyc
text:
As expected, the place was quite busy due to the hot weather. Watching a video of soba being made while waiting helped ease the boredom, and the food itself wasn‚Äôt bad. The tempura was crispy and tasty, but the dipping sauce for the soba was a bit too salty, and overall, the soba wasn‚Äôt particularly more flavorful compared to other soba places.

Considering how busy the restaurant was, the staff seemed understaffed. The team was moving around busily, but things didn‚Äôt seem well-organized, making their efforts appear somewhat inefficient. The host also came across as unfriendly. Rather than repeatedly telling every guest, ‚ÄúCan I put my name on the waitlist?‚Äù and ‚ÄúJust wait here,‚Äù it would probably be less frustrating for everyone‚Äîand easier for the staff‚Äîif they used a proper waitlist system like many other restaurants do. It felt like a missed opportunity to improve both customer experience and staff workflow. One staff member was clearing tables, wiping surfaces, handling new napkins, chopsticks, and cups, and then using the same hand to scoop ice from the ice bin and serve drinks‚Äîall without taking a single moment to sanitize or wash their hands. It definitely didn‚Äôt feel hygienic or sanitary. When I first received my food, something felt off. I noticed that the dishes were placed upside down on the tray, so I had to rearrange them myself. I understand they might have been busy, but it really showed how unprofessional the service was.

author: Joan V
text:
I‚Äôve gone to Sobaya even before their Michelin credentials. I was recommended here by a family member and recently rediscovered it while doing some solo-exploring.

I always grab their daily lunch combo as it gives you a bang for your buck. (If you‚Äôre a college student in the area, you‚Äôd be a fool not to give this place a chance.)
Both hot and cold soba options are solid (my brother prefers cold, I like hot) and we adore their dons.

There was one time I found something wrong with my order and they were so apologetic- immediately replacing my dish with a fresh one. I was happy to receive a fresh one (tempura deliciously hot out of the frier) and finished. That‚Äôs when they gave me a free green tea cr√®me br√ªl√©e for my troubles. They didn‚Äôt have to do that, but they were so kind and profusely apologizing for the earlier blunder that I couldn‚Äôt help but tip well and applaud their service. My water was never empty!

All the food was delicious. Not too salty, not too sweet, but just right. Love Sobaya and will definitely keep coming back :)

author: Laura R
text: First time going today this spot is good I like the style , a nice menu I went for there lunch special my friend introduced me to this spot and I really enjoyed it. The food is good as well. I am adding it to my list , i recommend

author: Kama K
text:
Didn‚Äôt expect to enjoy this experience so much! Very kind service and super accommodating.
I love the ambiance too! But mostly, the food. Truly the type of a meal you‚Äôd get in Japan. High quality soba and fish.
Spotlight on lunch menus ‚Äî great value!

author: Saahil Panikar
text:
Holy crap! This place was so good. We stopped in on the way and we're just blown away by how authentic and tasty the food was. The chicken nanban was one of the best things I've ever eaten. And the rice bowls looked so good.

Definitely stop by and try this! I also really loved their hot green tea

author: Bailey Jaworski
text:
Very fun Packer bar in the city! Come early for game days to get a table. There is also an awesome back patio for days the weather permits that allows for extra room. Love the game day specials that take you straight home to a Wisconsin tailgate. Who doesn't love a good bloody mary with all the fixings?
Great spot to come for game days.
Go Pack Go!

author: Kyana Ifill
text: Really fun packer atmosphere on game day! Only had the guacamole and chips and the guacamole wasn‚Äôt bad but the chips were not my favorite. The margarita was nice but over priced in my opinion (16.50) I saw someone sneak some food into the back so just come for the atmosphere and drinks. Skip the food if possible.

author: Christinaaa Clark
text:
Absolutely terrible service. The bartender was unbelievably rude‚Äîcondescending, short-tempered, and clearly uninterested in doing their job. Asking a simple question about music got my drink dumped out an eye roll and a snarky response, like I was wasting their precious time.

If I wanted to be talked down to and ignored, I‚Äôd go argue with a parking meter. This kind of attitude has no place in hospitality. There are plenty of bars in this city‚Äîones that actually want your business. Don‚Äôt waste your time or money here.

author: Connie Kwok
text: Woohoo Green Bay Packers bar with sound on! Love the relaxed and spacious vibe of this place, bartenders are attentive. No table service so order at the bar. GET THE CHEESE CURDS! Omg they are legit and pieces of heaven. Friendly crowd on game day, and there is more garden space outside (with a tv). Can't comment on the live music yet, but happy to come back and enjoy the games!

author: Joy St. Louis
text:
Campy western decor and a Fordham flag surround a bar and row of picnic type tables. The bar was busy which slowed down table service during the happy hour.  The waitstaff appeared after the happy hour ended. There is live entertainment and a nice if loud relaxed vibe. That vibe and the staff make the place.
The food is "mid" aa the kids say. Tex-Mex fare that is incredibly bland. The average queso can save the meal. Fresh corn tortilla chips with guacamole,  beans or queso are your best bet.  Everything else takes a while. The happy hour drinks are all ice.

author: Mario Valero
text: Place was packed. But for not having a reservation, we didn‚Äôt have to wait long to be seated. Very cool spot, a little loud but enjoyable atmosphere with decent music. The services after sitting, was fast and the food came quickly as well. I ordered the sausage and peppers personal pizza. Pizza was good for what it was ordered and old fashion as well and that was so so. It was more sweet than I‚Äôd like and very light on the alcohol.

author: Cho
text:
My little picky eater approved the pasta marinara. Chicken with garlic mashed potatoes. Not too impressed with chicken but the sauce and the rest definitely compensated. And also the portion was pretty big so yeah good.
And espresso ‚òïÔ∏è oh it was goooood!

author: Rocco Luongo
text: Great looking restaurant with a nice bar area, excellent food and service.   The weather was nice so we sat outside.  Good neighborhood vibe with lots of people walking by.   Neapolitan pizza was excellent.  Great crust. Crispy on the outside, tender on the inside with a nice undercarriage.  Delicious fresh toppings.  The waiter was friendly, professional, and attentive.  He showed pride in working here and talked with us about the restaurant and the neighborhood.

author: Nastya Dueva
text:
We came to Barbalu Bklyn just 45 minutes before closing time, not really expecting to be seated‚Äîthere were five of us, and we thought maybe we‚Äôd just be allowed to order takeout. But to our surprise and delight, two amazing guys, Matteo and Nick, welcomed us with warm smiles and no hesitation.

They seated us right away, took our full order with zero rush, and the food came out incredibly fast‚Äîand even more incredibly delicious! We honestly didn‚Äôt expect such a perfect experience so late in the evening.

I came specifically for the authentic Italian pizza, and it did not disappoint. Thin, crispy, fresh‚Äîit was exactly what I was craving. We also ordered the oven-roasted branzino with broccolini, and let me tell you‚Äîthe fish was tender and full of flavor, and the vegetables were the best I‚Äôve ever had.

And then‚Äîsomething truly special happened. It was my mom‚Äôs birthday, and Matteo and Nick surprised us with a beautiful tiramisu topped with a candle and a bottle of champagne, completely on the house. That moment made the whole evening unforgettable.

We left with full hearts, full bellies, and big smiles. This is not just a restaurant‚Äîit‚Äôs a place where you‚Äôre treated like family.

Huge thank you to the staff‚Äîyou guys are amazing. 100% recommend Barbalu Bklyn to anyone who wants a truly delicious meal and an experience filled with warmth and joy. We‚Äôll definitely be back!‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçüî•‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçüî•‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçüî•

author: Yolanda M
text: Great atmosphere, and we were seated right away. To be honest, I wasn't impressed with my meal, pasta with beef and I took a slice of my friends pizza and I felt the sauce was thin. Loved the calamari. The drink was good too, it was a flavored Moscow Mule.

author: Nick Ed
text:
Dorlan's, located in the historic South Street Seaport in New York City, is a fantastic spot that perfectly balances a classic pub atmosphere with high-quality food and drinks. I recently went there and was thoroughly impressed, especially by their take on comfort food classics.

My friends and I were craving something hearty, and we were not disappointed. We ordered a big chicken sandwich and a juicy burger to share, and both were outstanding. The chicken sandwich was a true showstopper‚Äîperfectly fried to a golden crisp while remaining incredibly moist and tender on the inside. It was a generous size and had a fantastic, flavorful crunch with every bite. The burger was equally impressive. It was cooked to a perfect medium, with a patty so juicy and rich that it practically melted in your mouth. The classic toppings and a toasted bun made for a flawless burger experience.

What made the meal even better were the sides and drinks. The fries were a perfect companion, hot and crispy, and just the right amount of salt. And the cocktails were excellent. We each had a few different ones, and they were all expertly mixed and well-balanced‚Äîthey weren't just an afterthought but a highlight of the meal. The entire place has a warm and inviting vibe, and the staff was friendly and attentive. For a spot that feels like a cozy neighborhood tavern but serves up incredible, elevated pub fare and great drinks, Dorlan's is a definite winner.

author: xyztech
text:
I‚Äôve been here a few times with the family, and the food has been excellent during previous visits, which is why we chose to return recently.

Most of the dishes were great, but unfortunately, the hamburger sliders were severely undercooked. One of the servers (not the one attending to us) took the sliders back with the intention of correcting the raw patties, only to return with them still undercooked. It appeared they put our half-chewed sliders back into the oven or a plate to try to cook them, but they were still raw.

We had to tell the server that we did not want the raw ground beef patties.

Our actual server was friendly and took the sliders off our bill.

We will be returning, but likely will not be trying the sliders again.

author: G Margary
text: By far, the BEST watermelon margarita I have tasted has been at this spot! Delicious!!üçâüçπüëåüèº Their buffalo chicken wrap and fries were very good too. The service was excellent. Recommend to try.

author: Jack Barry
text: Place is great - year round. An NYC Seaport staple. Food and service is awesome. I‚Äôve also hosted my wedding‚Äôs day-after party as well as a surprise 30th in the private room and I can‚Äôt recommend it enough. Jeanne and the owner are great to work with. Thank you again! Looking forward to the next event with your team soon.

author: Alexis Bohman
text: I had a post marathon celebration at Dorlan's after the NYC marathon this year. The food was great, service was amazing (especially Jeanne), and we had a perfect time! We had a bigger-than-expected crowd come to the party and we were able to just flood into the common room which ended up working out great! Would recommend having a party here and I will most definitely be having more in the future!

author: Kia Curry
text: Went here for a date last year and it was absolutely stunning.. the food was amazing, I had the prawns and grits and my date had the beef short ribs with eggs Benedict, both dishes was 10/10 . The drinks was hit and miss for me, ended up ordering a regular whiskey shot but the whiskey flights were fun and different

author: W E
text: Really nice service and great cocktails and tasting flight. Our waiter was attentive and had good suggestions. We went for the Jazz brunch and wish we also had a distillery tour booked! The food was good but not the main draw. We have no idea why it said that the Croque madame was recommended for two people because it is not big at all.. In fact, I was still quite hungry after the brunch!

author: Nicole Prien
text: Traveling to New York for the week and we decided to tour Great Jones to experience how New York compared to the Midwest - best decision ever! Right when you walk in your greeted with the BEST ambiance. It reminded me of old time Great Gastsby! The drinks were fantastic, the service was 20/10 - our tour guide was incredible! Such a fun personality and made our 2-1 such a fun and vibrant experience!

author: Marshall Peschell
text:
The first legal whiskey distillery in Manhattan since prohibition. The tour is brief but informative and fun, our tour guide was Amanda 10/10 very funny. The tasting was a nice verity. And they are reopening the speak easy.

The pics are of me eating all the food before we sat down

author: Tom Mustac
text: We had a wonderful time! Far beyond the big expectations I walked in with!! I even was able to sign up two new bourbon aficionados!! Miles and the entire team were extremely welcoming and knowledgeable!  It felt more like a gathering with friends I haven‚Äôt seen in a while that a tasting experience and I learned many new things about the process! Looking forward to going back soon and I am a new brand fan! By the way, I hate rye but your rye is fantastic!!

author: Amanda Moss
text: I‚Äôm not sure why everyone gives this place such a bad rating. The food is great. The soup dumplings are truly delicious. It is NOT expensive compared to other restaurants, but might be considered pricey for Chinatown. But I don‚Äôt think $5-$12 for a meal is pricey. I don‚Äôt find the service to be rude. It‚Äôs very distant, which is customary in most places outside of the states. They don‚Äôt coddle you, they just take your order and bring you food. Nothing wrong with that. There‚Äôs an ATM upstairs if you forget cash. Literally a delicious, must stop spot in Chinatown. This is my second visit and I‚Äôm just as satisfied.

author: Amanda Hahn
text: Went on a dumpling crawl and this place was second best. Soup dumplings couldn‚Äôt have been more perfect though! Super crowded spot

author: Tien F
text:
Very frustrating as this place used to be great and now the food is super expensive and it doesn‚Äôt even taste good! I‚Äôd been okay if the food is decent but it‚Äôs not.

The scallion pancake is dry and flakey. The soup dumplings have a weird taste. The dumplings are small and it‚Äôs not like the ones you‚Äôd seen at a proper dim sum restaurant.

Portion is bad and the taste is off. I really don‚Äôt want to be critical to local business but this place needs a complete rethink of their model otherwise it‚Äôll wash up on the shore of closed business

Really hoping for this place to come back!

author: Angela
text:
The elderly owner of this restaurant clearly doesn‚Äôt care about the quality of the food that comes out of her kitchen. While the wait staff were polite and professional, she herself was an absolute nightmare to deal with.
The food was truly disappointing. The oil used tasted old and rancid ‚Äî I immediately had to spit it out. My toddler was hungry, but there was no way I could feed him that food. We ordered a Shanghai-style dish that should have included shrimp and mushrooms, but instead it was made with cheap meat and vegetables. The cutbacks were obvious, and the scallion pancakes tasted frozen and flavorless.
When we politely gave feedback about the quality of the dish, the owner became defensive and tried to bully us, insisting that nothing was wrong. She claimed they ‚Äúonly use new oil‚Äù because they have ‚Äúso many customers,‚Äù yet the restaurant was completely empty on a Saturday night ‚Äî we only ended up here because our favorite Shanghai spot nearby had a 40-minute wait.
She even demanded we pay for the dish despite our concerns. The experience was unpleasant from start to finish. I will never visit this place again, and it‚Äôs a shame to see such a poorly run restaurant misrepresenting the neighborhood‚Äôs dining scene.

author: Sara Figueroa
text: Soup dumplings are good, I‚Äôve been here 4 times, each time I come the service gets worse. This will be my last time, not worth it. So sad though, they use to be so different. Worst service in NY.

author: –ê–ª—ñ–Ω–∞ –ö–æ–Ω–µ—Ç
text:
Nargis Cafe is our absolute favorite restaurant! My boyfriend and I go there all the time ‚Äî for lunch or dinner, almost every week. We‚Äôve never found a better place than this one! The food is always fresh, delicious, and served in big portions. Everything tastes amazing ‚Äî you can really feel the quality in every dish.

The service is excellent too. Everyone is so friendly and respectful. During Ramadan, they even asked if we were fasting and kindly brought us dates and water as a compliment ‚Äî such a thoughtful gesture! When it was time to eat, they brought our food right away.

What‚Äôs also great is the variety ‚Äî it‚Äôs not only food from Muslim countries like Uzbekistan and Tajikistan, but also Russian and Ukrainian dishes. There‚Äôs something for everyone, so you can always find something you‚Äôll love.

The atmosphere is cozy, the food is perfect, and the whole experience is always wonderful. Nargis Cafe truly feels like our go-to spot. Highly recommend! ‚ù§Ô∏è

author: Dmitry Tsatskin
text: We came with my family to celebrate my dad‚Äôs birthday. All the food was delicious, the atmosphere was great, a soft music playing was not so loud and was not annoying. All the staff was very polite and grateful. Said, who served our table, did his job perfectly! We‚Äôll definitely come back another day to have super tasty kebab, manti  and salads!

author: Kimberly Cordero
text:
‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
Absolutely loved my experience at Nargis Cafe in Sheepshead Bay! The food was bursting with flavor ‚Äî perfectly seasoned, fresh, and beautifully presented. The service was warm and attentive, and the atmosphere felt so inviting ‚Äî cozy yet vibrant. Whether you‚Äôre going for a casual dinner or a night out with friends, Nargis never disappoints. Definitely one of Brooklyn‚Äôs gems!

author: Anya G.
text: The most delicious and flavorefull food. The presentation is also amazing. Service is impecable, everyone is extremely professional, helpful and friendly.  We go often because the atmosphere is so nice and inviting as well as the food is out of this world. The only downside is- priece of coktails. So extremely expensive!

author: Chewy M
text:
This was our first time eating at Nargis and what a pleasant experience it was!  We‚Äôve had Mediterranean, Middle Eastern, & Turkish food many times in the past but this is the first time we had Uzbek cuisine. There are some similarities or cross influences I assume, but the food was unique & delicious in its own rights.  We had lunch & loved the food (see pictures of what we had & descriptions) we ordered and would definitely come back for more!  The atmosphere & ambience was beautiful & clean.  The service was very good‚Äîthe staff were polite & helpful.  No complaints overall.  Only reasons I didn‚Äôt give it 5 stars were minor‚Äîour water glasses were not refilled & staff didn‚Äôt come by to check if anything was needed as hoped.  Something minor but could be improved to make an excellent overall experience.  Here‚Äôs my TA$TE ratings of Nargis:

Taste:5 stars/delicious
Ambience: 5 stars/beautiful & clean
$: 5 stars/very reasonable
Treatment: 4stars/service was very good but can improve on attentiveness
Experience: 5 stars/overall experience was great & would definitely come back!

author: Rimma
text:
My fav shawarma spot in the city. That says a lot, because my standards are high.
Plus, the portion is huge - no way you‚Äôre finishing it in one go.

author: Ihor Chumachenko
text:
Not the shawarma you‚Äôd expect from home, but it gets the job done

I ordered the Mix Chicken & Pork Shawarma ‚Äì lavash, pork, chicken, tomato, onion, lettuce, pepper, and their signature sauce. It cost about $13 total with tax. They only have one standard size, no small or large options. Preparation was quick.

The lavash was soft at first, but in the parts where it was grilled, it had a better texture. The meat was somewhere in the middle ‚Äì not bad, not great. I‚Äôve already tried similar shawarma in another place run by a Georgian kitchen, and the sauce here had that same familiar taste. I couldn‚Äôt exactly identify the flavor ‚Äì not sweet, not garlicky, not sour ‚Äì but it reminded me of something I‚Äôve had before in that regional style. Ingredient balance was good.

The portion looked like a standard medium shawarma. It was filling, but by the end it started to fall apart, which made it messy to eat. There‚Äôs seating available inside, and they offered a choice between spicy or not spicy. That was a nice touch.

Overall, I‚Äôd rate it 3.5 out of 5. The place is decent, and the food is edible and filling. But if you‚Äôre looking for that crispy, bold Ukrainian-style shawarma ‚Äì this is not the place. Don‚Äôt expect the same flavor you‚Äôre used to from back home.

author: Jane Sh
text: A modest cafe with a modest interior. But this did not stop us from while away the time here with a friend before an apointment . We wanted to drink coffee, but there was none, but fortunately there was tea, we took a cake each, they were not bad, only a bit dry, I would have liked more cream. In general, the cafe is not for gatherings, it is better to take the order  and eat it at home

author: Azu S
text: My friends tagged this place on Instagram, and I wanted to try it too. When we received the shawarma order, it was huge, and I was very hungry. I thought, "Now I'll enjoy a tasty shawarma ." Unfortunately, the shawarma wasn't delicious. I'm not usually picky about food, but there was so much mayonnaise that it became unpleasant. The usually shawarma itself is very caloric, on top of that, there was so much mayonnaise.I thought it was just a lot of mayo at the beginning, but the entire shawarma was soaked in it. The chicken was very salty. Maybe I was just unlucky. Now imagine a large amount of salty meat, lots of mayonnaise, and a few vegetables. It lacked freshness and some additional sauce other than mayonnaise.

author: Nino Tchanturidze
text: My favorite shaurma place in Brooklyn! They make it so deliciously and the service is impeccable, especially their worker Tamara. She is always behind the counter with a big, bright smile and positive energy. 10/10, I would 100% recommend coming here.

author: Krandon
text:
Got tons of compliments because of how naturally pretty it is on its own ‚Äî string lights and lanterns are really a vibe especially at night! We were looking for a more intimate and casual setting rather than a more formal wedding in a reception hall and we fell in love with the food and the place going for dinner one night. Service was great on the night of and communication beforehand was top notch. Meryl was incredibly helpful with the logistics and provided not only reccomendations on vendors but also how to optimize the space (due to our large guest count). They were receptive to our thoughts and ideas of how we wanted the night to go and how it would fit with their space. They also lent us a projector to play a game and provided some of the decor (small candles, lanterns, and hanging linens). Overall they‚Äôre a well-oiled machine with the best food (3 course plated meal) ‚Äî they‚Äôre a restaurant after all! 100% would reccomend duck confit. Our wedding coordinator said that we were given a very good price for the superb level and quality of service that was included. Overall, the staff are lovely and shows how passionate they are about making our big day wonderful -- would rate this a 100 out of 10 experience.

Regardless if you‚Äôre looking to have your wedding here or not ‚Äî 100% you should come here in a regular day have dinner here!!! My husband and I sometimes just drop by to eat (p.s. don‚Äôt think about it and just get the bread and butter). Super accessible by train! :) We come all the way from Flushing -- that's how yummy their food is :P

author: Anastasiia Semenenko
text:
We had our wedding at Bacchus and it was everything we could have hoped for and more. From the very beginning, the team was attentive and caring, making sure every detail felt smooth and stress-free. On the day itself, the atmosphere was warm, beautiful, and intimate ‚Äî exactly the kind of setting we had imagined for celebrating with our closest family and friends.

The food was outstanding. So many of our guests kept telling us how much they loved every dish, and we couldn‚Äôt agree more. It really felt like we were sharing a meal that was crafted with love and intention, which made it even more meaningful for us.

What stood out the most was the way the staff handled everything with such calm professionalism while still being kind and personal. We never once had to worry about anything ‚Äî they made sure we could actually be present and enjoy the day.

Bacchus will always hold such a special place in our hearts. We‚Äôre so grateful to everyone there for helping us create memories we‚Äôll cherish forever.

author: Stanley Yashayev
text:
We captured a wedding (both photo and video) at Bacchus Bistro recently, and it was one of the most intimate and memorable celebrations we‚Äôve been part of.

The entire venue has such a warm, inviting vibe, starting with the beautiful outdoor space where the reception was held. It felt effortlessly charming and photographed beautifully throughout the evening. Inside, the bar and dining area gave off that cozy, timeless feel you only really get from a true restaurant venue.

The staff was fantastic, organized, welcoming, and clearly experienced with events. And the food? Genuinely incredible. It's something we always notice when weddings are hosted at restaurants instead of traditional venues: the quality and consistency of the food are just on another level.

The guest count was around 150, and it felt like the perfect number for the space, everyone was comfortable, and nothing felt overcrowded.

A really special spot for couples who want a celebration that feels personal, elegant, and food-focused. We‚Äôd go back in a heartbeat.

author: Olga NYC
text:
I recently dined at this French restaurant and had an enjoyable experience. The food was well-prepared and flavorful, showing clear attention to detail. The service was excellent, our main server was attentive, and another staff member on the floor kept us laughing with lighthearted jokes, which really added to the atmosphere.
For dessert, we tried the tarte Tatin. It was tasty but served with whole baked apple rather than the traditional peeled and sliced style, which I personally prefer. Even so, it was delicious.
Overall, I would recommend this restaurant for its great food, friendly service, and lively dining experience.

author: Collin Bowen
text:
Bacchus treats you like family. The owner of the restaurant, Bruno, gave us our first tour, the wedding and event coordinator Meryl helped us to plan every detail of an all-inclusive wedding and we were beyond satisfied every step of the way. Likewise, Meryl and her staff were responsive, kind, understanding, and patient with our persistent communication and innumerable questions. Holding to French tradition - they offered incomparable food and drink options, including options for vegan guests, and offered a variety of ways to reach the food and beverage minimum, like additional desserts and wine pairings.

On our wedding day, Meryl and her team were at our sides when we needed them and taking care of everything else such as setting up our unconventional guest book, and ensuring that we kept on pace with our wedding day schedule so we didn‚Äôt worry about it.

Bacchus Bistro offers unparalleled value, incredible familial service, and a neighborhood or backyard ambiance that made it an easy choice for my wife and I. Their food and drinks are truly incredible, change seasonally, and will always leave you dreaming for the next time you can return.

We have a special place in our hearts for Bacchus. So much so that when we returned a year later to celebrate our anniversary, Meryl and Francois greeted us by name, wished us a happy anniversary, and helped us to celebrate even while they were hosting another wedding.

author: ADI N
text: Food was moderate. If you wanna chill out and relax with good vibe this is the place where you‚Äôre looking for. Cocktail was so good and creative. Staffs were friendly and attentive. I love the atmosphere and surrounded. Recommend to reserve table!!!

author: Mimi Coleman
text: Loved the overall vibeü§ç super chill with gorgeous decor, and the outdoor seating is perfect for warm nights. My favorite cocktail was the lychee one (forgot the name), but it was so fresh and well-balanced. The food was just okay, but the drinks and atmosphere totally make up for it. Definitely coming back!

author: Alyssa Kearney
text:
My husband and I had a great time at Jungle Bird. It's located up a flight of stairs and has a fun, vacation-bungalow vibe. We went on a Saturday evening and loved the atmosphere‚Äîlively without being overly packed.

We sat at the bar, enjoyed a few snacks and rum cocktails‚Äîeverything was great! The entire staff was friendly, and the bartender was attentive and fun to chat with.

We visit NYC often and will definitely be back but if you're a local, check this place out!

author: Jared Davis
text: Jungle Bird is a spectacular dimly-lit bar in Chelsea. Me and my friends enjoy coming here. They have a wonderful happy hour and in the summer they have outdoor seating which is great. Yesterday I had the delicious mezcal spicy margarita on the happy hour menu and it came out great. I also want to highlight the La Bailadora which is fruity and delicious. The food menu is not as expansive or daring. The staff are amazing - shoutout to Angie, he‚Äôs great!

author: Nicholas Hester
text: Really exotic cocktail menu I though. All the drinks are super fun and they tell you what glass you‚Äôre going to get them in!!!!! Absolutely love that. Good spot to step in for a post shift drink, also a lot of sidewalk seating which I love

author: Lauren S
text:
Golden Wuish is an absolute gem for anyone who loves Peking duck. Their signature Peking duck is exceptional perfectly fatty, salty, crispy, and full of rich flavor. The Flaming Peking Duck is a true standout, not only for the impressive presentation but for the quality and taste that fully deliver. Paired with scallions, cucumber, and soft pancakes, it captures everything I love about authentic Peking duck.

The menu blends Asian and Latin flavors in such a creative way, making every dish feel bold and unique. I also loved the duck bone soup that comes with the meal; it‚Äôs comforting, flavorful, and the perfect complement to the duck. You can choose half Peking duck and half smoked duck or go for the full Peking duck which I definitely recommend.

If you‚Äôre a duck lover, Golden Wuish should be at the top of your list. The food, flavors, and overall experience truly make it worth the visit.

author: xuqi zhang
text:
We had an absolutely wonderful dinner at Golden Wuish last night! Four of us ‚Äî friends and family ‚Äî went together, and everything from start to finish was excellent. The restaurant has a warm, inviting atmosphere, and the staff made us feel right at home.
The food was outstanding ‚Äî every dish was beautifully prepared and full of flavor. The highlight of the night was definitely the Peking duck experience. It was carved tableside to perfection ‚Äî crispy skin, tender meat, and served with the classic accompaniments. You can tell a lot of care and skill goes into every step of the meal.
A big shout-out to Angelina, who provided truly exceptional service. She was attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable, guiding us through the menu and making sure everything was perfect. Her warmth and professionalism really stood out and made our evening even more special.
We left completely satisfied and already planning our next visit. Highly recommend Golden Wuish for anyone who loves authentic flavors, excellent service, and a memorable dining experience!

author: Mario Alex Gonzalez
text: A gem of a restaurant tucked away in the financial district. Great service, fantastic food, and relatively solid prices for a high quality dining experience. The half duck was absolutely phenomenal, and I would highly advise you get that or even the whole duck if with another person. Making the buns is a fun and delicious experience, but eating the duck on its own was the true star of the show. It was the most beautifully crispy skin combined with the perfectly tender meat of the duck, with fat that was like candy between it all. Get the duck and have a time

author: Jacob Kyle
text: Golden Wuish (The Duckhouse) is a true gem that delivers an unforgettable dining experience every time. From the moment you step inside, you‚Äôre welcomed by a warm and elegant atmosphere that perfectly complements the restaurant‚Äôs exceptional cuisine. The staff is courteous, attentive, and genuinely dedicated to ensuring guests feel comfortable and satisfied. The food is absolutely outstanding‚Äîespecially the duck, which is tender, flavorful, and perfectly cooked.

author: Jonathan (Flavor Wanderer)
text:
Had a very good experience at the Golden Wuish. The main event is definitely the Flaming Peking Duck. The show was definitely cool (If you order the HALF duck, there is NO SHOW), but the duck itself was a little on the greasy side, but the meat was definitely tasty.

Besides the Peking Duck, we also ordered the following:

Black Truffle Soup Dumplings: 8/10
Steam Clams: 9/10
Duck Egg Pea Shoots: 9/10
Squid Ink Fried Rice: 9/10
Lucky Tao: 8/10
Sunset Daiquiri: 7/10

Overall, it was was a good experience but for the price of the Full Peking Duck, it'll be just a one time experience.

author: Aa Aa
text: Ate outdoors with live bluegrass music, and the ambiance was nice. The beet salad itself was disappointing, beets seemed canned, there were barely any nuts in the salad either. The pierogi were clearly mass produced and cooked from frozen. The pork schnitzel was very tasteless, literally tasted like nothing. Chicken was dry.

author: Summer Wick
text: We have a cabin in North River and frequent Beck's Tavern often. As a vegan, I super appreciate their attention to dietary needs (they have a special menu to share so you know what's in your food). I love their house made veggie burger - seriously one of the best around! So many places only offer a beyond burger, so I truly appreciate the effort they put in. They have a pretty extensive menu. My hubby loves the pierogies, the kraut and the potato pancakes, and my kiddo loves the chicken tenders and fries. There have salads, schnitzel, sausages, so many options for all dietary needs. They have a great beer selection and the outside area is awesome - they often have acoustic sets on the weekends. The yurts are also really fun to just go and grab a drink. I highly recommend stopping by Beck's Tavern when in town - both in winter and summer!

author: Kate
text:
Stopped for food and was pretty good. The portions are big but pricey. Small menu. It‚Äôs a german based menu which was weird because the atmosphere is more Adirondack and ski vibes so I don‚Äôt understand the german reference. The service was not too good. Both of our servers were awkward and didn‚Äôt know how to take our order or answer easy questions about beer/food. However the food came out fast.
After the food we explored outside and it is such a cute neat little place. There are a couple yurts with a cozy atmosphere inside. There‚Äôs a bar, tables, TV, games, darts and more to hang out. The outside area is also so cool with live music and tons of chairs.
Overall, probably wouldn‚Äôt go back for food but if you‚Äôre looking for a neat place to hang out with friends/family this is it!

author: Michael Pomarico
text:
Great for drinking. Good vibe. But the food, not so good.  The schnitzel was tough and had no taste.

Be best to stock with beer and wings.

author: JS O'Connor
text: Fun local bar with a German-inspired full menu and big beer+cocktail selection. You can book lodging right across the parking lot and not have to worry about driving after an evening of apres fun.

author: Lisa J
text:
Because of the comments in the reviews, we started the line in front of the door at 5:20 pm on a Sat.  By opening time, there were10 people behind us.  By 6 pm, the restaurant was full, including seating at the bar.  There are only 6 two-tops, 6 seats at the bar and ?5 booths that can seat 6.  They do take names and numbers to contact later arrivals when a table opens.  Tonight, it was after 7 pm before one did.
We absolutely enjoyed our meal with an excellent 2006 Pomerol.  There was a large lag before our main arrived, and I forgot to take a picture until we had already dug in.  Service was friendly and efficient.  The Beef Tartare was prepared classically and was delicious.  The c√¥te de boeuf was somewhat tough inn places, but the demi-glace was heavenly and made up for it.  It was served on the rare side of med.-rare.  I splurged on chocolate cake, and it was worth every calorie! (light and fluffy with excellent cocoa flavor).  My husband loves Pedro Ximenez sherry, and deigned to eat it over vanilla ice cream. ;)

author: Mario Alex Gonzalez
text: An absolutely incredible dining experience in every aspect. The food, atmosphere, and service all complimented each other beautifully and made for a stunning night. The meal is ordered all at once and coursed out, allowing to be continuously one upped by the last item and be continuously impressed by the dishes. The appetizer dishes blew me away and somehow the food maintained or surpassed the quality at every turn.  Service was impeccable and very well informed on all the dishes, exactly what you would expect from a restaurant of this caliber. No weak points in this dinner at all. Highly highly recommend coming here if you are looking for an elegant and delicious meal that will blow you away, as long as you‚Äôre prepared to pay accordingly, but it will be worth it.

author: Sally Freeman
text:
Not sure I quite understand the ‚Äòhype‚Äô around this restaurant. We were advised by our waitress to order 2-3 plates each (hors d‚Äôoevre, salad etc) and a main course. By ordering it all at the same time, the kitchen could plan our meal experience accordingly.
However we only really wanted a main course each (and dessert) and were told that was fine but if we didn‚Äôt order a starter, we would have quite a long wait for our main courses.
45 minutes later our main courses arrived (steak frites). No idea why it needed to take so long. We‚Äôd never had steak frites served this way (steak was pre sliced) and the steak was excellent, however the frites were luke warm at best and so crispy you couldn‚Äôt eat them with a fork. We mentioned this to the waitress who said ‚Äòthat‚Äôs how they‚Äôre supposed to be served‚Äô‚Ä¶..wrong. She did then go back to the kitchen and in due course we received a basket of perfectly cooked, hot frites, just as we were finishing our steak. Clearly the first batch had been regenerated and were not fresh. At $40 dollars a piece I would have expected better quality control from the kitchen. This totally spoilt our experience so we left without ordering dessert.

author: B. E.
text:
Excellent service and exceptional food, best of the sit-down dinner restaurants I've eaten at in Ithaca.

Photos:
French 75
Salad Lyonnaise
Ricotta Gnocchi
Duck Breast

author: Sophia Chiang
text:
Fantastic French onion soup. Also ordered the steak for two (daily special) upon recommendation by waiter - disappointing (no flavor and a little tough) the gnocchi was also mid. The celeriac salad was very good.

We arrived 20 minutes before opening and just made the first seating.

author: Joe Bergovoy
text: I just visited this location and it did not disappoint! First of all, Patrick who was behind the counter was so patient and kind. Eventually I ordered and it was a wholesome and hearty chili tofu noodle bowl! The space was clean and quiet and I thoroughly enjoyed my lunch there.

author: Anthony Khalifeh
text:
After a full week in New York‚Äînavigating a minefield of processed indulgences, seed oils, and dopamine-loaded distractions‚ÄîSpringbone wasn‚Äôt just a meal. It was a realignment.

I walked in at the tail end of a 24-hour fast, gut inflamed, spine tense, and nervous system fried. What I found was clean fire‚Äîreal food engineered for recovery, regeneration, and performance.

I ordered the BBQ Chicken Bowl and the New Roots Beef Bone Broth. Here‚Äôs the breakdown:
‚Ä¢	The Bowl delivered on all levels: clean protein from chicken breast, glycogen-replenishing sweet potatoes, cruciferous detox from cabbage and kale, and a kick of fermented brightness from pickled turnips. The BBQ sauce? Subtle, smoky, and not a sugar trap‚Äîflavor without compromise.
‚Ä¢	The Broth was elite: grass-fed beef simmered into liquid collagen, infused with ginger, garlic, and vitamin C. It wasn‚Äôt just warm‚Äîit was ancestral. My gut thanked me. My brain rebooted. My joints softened their complaints.

What hit hardest? This entire meal was free of seed oils, gluten, and refined sugar. It didn‚Äôt just nourish‚Äîit upgraded.

In a world full of food that numbs, Springbone fuels. Approved for all my clients because it honors the code: intellect, precision, optimization, evolution.

author: Ariel Smith
text: Ordered the honey Dijon salmon bowl and this is what I got. The man helping me was extremely rude from start to finish and this portion is unacceptable for $18. I‚Äôve ordered from this restaurant before via uber eats and the food has been great but the in person experience was awful.

author: anna
text: Today I decided to try Springbone for the first time and the food was delicious and fresh and the customer service experience was amazing. A kind employee named Earl took my order and gave me great recommendations for my bowl which I greatly appreciate as I was not familiar with the options! As someone with food sensitivities and hoping to eat healthier the service and quality I received at this Springbone was very meaningful. I will definitely be returning!

author: Lee-Bee
text:
DELICIOUS !  Everything gluten free!  We spent about $39 for two people including a drink.
My kid got: Bone Broth with chicken, veggies, hot sauce and immunity mix. FABULOUS!
Mine was Grandma's chicken with rice (roasted carrots & veggies) Yummy!  Wish I'd gotten the bone broth to add to the chicken, one trial of that was heavenly. It was a bit dry without the hot sauce added, I got that on the side but adding it made it amazing.

Leftovers for 3 of us as a hearty snack later, 2 who hadn't been there, everyone really enjoyed it. And those 2 are picky.

Two workers there extremely nice.  One spoke English pretty well, though we had a small misunderstanding in the order, I caught it.  No big deal. She was so sweet helpful and efficient. Warm and kind person.  Other employee had little English, and was amazingly caring and attentive to her job and excellent, healthy delicious fast meals were provided to us and many others in short period of time. Most others were pickup or delivery, high volume handled well. For English speakers I recommend double checking the info and orders patiently and gracefully.  The intention to provide accurate excellent service is fully there, with the women we met.

This was yesterday, 6/26/24 around 7:45.  Even though it was so close to closing time, they balanced clean up and making sure we felt 100% welcomed every moment.  ¬°Muchas gracias!  Looking back wish I'd tipped more.  Give them both a bonus!

author: Jenna Kroeger
text: Hot Jalape√±o! Much love to the staff, especially our server and the live singer. I had beef fajita (27$ w tip in cash - credit card fee). So good; ate that UP! Our server kept us hydrated and was very nice and approachable. The singer invited us to do karaoke which I very much wanted to do but ultimately wasn‚Äôt up to it. I did make a song request which she honored, and I adored. So scrumptious all around. We loved the queso w chorizo!!!! What would be great is complimentary chips and salsa

author: Robin Mandel
text: Adorable restaurant with authentic Mexican food. I loved the outdoor patio and music. Good happy hour & Taco Tuesday. Get the guac!

author: Tip Tip
text: My husband and I stopped in here while hanging out in Harlem. The food was delicious! It was very flavorful, wonderfully seasoned. We had nachos, fajitas, enchiladas, tres leches cake, & churros. The desserts were the best I've had in years! I'd definitely recommend dining here and I'll absolutely be back.

author: Wendy LES
text: This place must use the grimiest oil to cook ever. I‚Äôm not one to have digestive issues. I‚Äôve come here 3 times and every time I get the worst heartburn, and I never get heartburn. Do as you please with this information. I would not recommend. Also the pre-made margaritas are weak.

author: Joe Steele
text: Great little Mexican place in East Harlem.  The happy hour has drinks discounted (from 4-7pm M-F I believe) and the drinks were very tasty.  We even came back the next night just for drinks.  The food and service was excellent.  The atmosphere was perfect and relaxing.  They do have a ramp over the entrance stairs.  I would highly recommend stopping by after work for some great food and tasty drinks.

author: Rowan
text: This place is SO GOOD!! Service is so fast and everything is delicious! The broth the tikka masala comes in is so good I could eat it like soup! Lovely atmosphere and gorgeous decorations.

author: Judy Hahn
text: It was a hot Saturday night at 6:30pm, and we had the most delicious, aromatic, perfectly plated, nicely served dinner. Our waiter answered our endless questions and shared great recommendations. We felt like the cook was thrilled that we ordered too much food because there weren't many people there.  Don't overlook the essential tomato salad. The salmon was perfect.  And the  fig& fire chicken tagine was an absolute star.  Our friends loved their food as well. Oh and even if you think you don't like couscous,which a couple of us were meh on, you have to try the couscous. Yuuummm.  An A is on the window, the music- perfect, the decor charming, & it is easy to get to.  We will go backüíØ

author: Jada Knight
text: If you're looking for Moroccan style food, but in a modern way, this is definitely your place to go with full flavors on your tongue, the best food in the city honestly, and very healthy too. Being Woman owned makes it 1000√ó times better! A must place to eat in the city, hands down, never disappoint üòé Check out our video and follow on Instagram @JadaExploresAll

author: He Wi
text: Perfection! Great food, great service, great ambiance, other patrons weren‚Äôt too loud (because the music wasn‚Äôt too loud!). We ordered chicken harissa for the appetizer then for the main course we ordered lamb shepherds pie and lamb kebab, all of which was very tasty and boy, their portion‚Äìfor the price‚Äìwas generous! On top of that, if you drink, the have all-day happy hour for 5 bucks! You can‚Äôt beat that. Service was very friendly, warm, profesional, and quick! Again, the volume of the music was so important because it was not too loud and everybody didn‚Äôt need to yell. What a perfect Friday afternoon. Thank you Tara Kitchen! Btw, since the portion was so generous, we didn‚Äôt have space to order dessert. Next time tho. Oh, and sorry if the photo of the chicken harissa was blurry.

author: Jovana Isevski
text: Wow, what an experience this was! This is definitely one of my favorite restaurants in NY, I wish I had discovered it earlier. The food was so delicious, I can‚Äôt quite name my favorite because all of them were favorite! We got some pita bread with dips, carrots with hummus (which was far from the ordinary), egg rolls (wow! maybe my favorite?), chicken sandwich, orange salad, mango dessert, and more. And I shouldn‚Äôt forget the cocktails! Go for the salt and pepper martini if you like non-sweet drinks. The service was also outstanding. Omar really made us feel welcomed and took great care of us. Will be counting days to my next visit‚Ä¶

author: Mia Huynh
text:
A LIC staple, this diner is open 24/7 and has been a consistent go to spot for my friends and I after a long night out. The interior has lots of seating, with both booth and table seating, and bright lights. The service here is fairly quick and staff are nice.

When my friend and I went, we got some wings and two sandwiches. The wings were pretty solid and came with a bleu cheese sauce. The sandwiches were also great (considering it was 4am). Both dishes came with fries, which I thought were alright (but I'm not the biggest fry person). Overall, decent and reliable spot for some good American diner food.

author: Alexandra F (Alex)
text: Very kind service, and an authentic American diner experience. Locals and tourists alike should visit. Menu was extensive, and everything tasted GOOD. Not your usual ‚Äúdecent diner food‚Äù. I had the best Belgian waffle here I‚Äôve ever had, and everything was absolutely delicious. Truly authentic American cuisine.

author: Food Soul
text: Amazing breakfast!!! The toasts were amazing!!! Perfect sweet, crispy on the ouside, soft and fluffy on the inside, warm and on top wirh icing. Eggs were also good. How perfect to start the day!! The atmosphere was nice and cozy. We got good service too. They also have all the condiments on the table for you.

author: trevon brow
text: Great vibes me and my wife we bought the calamari as Appetizer And then we had a triple-decker turkey sandwich that was good as well, but should‚Äôve bought something else but I love the experience a very great time. We went there at 12 o‚Äôclock at night. Definitely coming back with me and my wife. Definitely enjoyed it. Five stars for me.

author: DBe
text:
Came for a 4 am bite to eat after an evening out.
The place had a significant amount of people dining after a lively Friday. We were able to get a booth within a couple of minutes. We ordered a chicken noodle soup, waffle, chicken triple decker with curly fries and a cup of coffee. Everything was great. It was what was needed to get some energy to head home.
Glad we still can count on the court diner for 24hr food options.

author: Yoyou
text:
We ordered the steak and blackened chicken fajitas.   The sangria was well made.   The staff, owners were very accommodating, gracious and friendly.
This was our 1st visit and it won't be our last.  We can't wait to dine there again!

author: Nancy I M
text:
With a diner-like appearance and colorful plates to add a southwestern palette, this place is like a Mexican / Diner hybrid. Upon entry, I noticed a cozy enclosed outdoor seating area, followed by a few steps up to the main entrance. Evening street parking was a breeze. Famished, we sat toward the back and commenced with two appetizers: guacamole with hearty tortillas chips (they don‚Äôt break when you scoop up the guacamole), and Choriqueso (melted cheese, chorizo, Picolo de gallo, guacamole, flour tortillas), I wasn‚Äôt crazy about the salsa, however, the guacamole was very good.
I decided to try the Toro Narte√±o (grilled steak, jalape√±o, pico de Galli, Monterey cheddar cheese). Which was very tasty, I found the jalape√±o to be very fresh and crunchy, and My husband ordered the Enchiladas Suizas (pulled chicken, green salsa, corn tortillas, cheddar cheese, Monterey, Avocado, pickled red onions, rice & black beans). I didn‚Äôt like it at all, the tortilla tasted like it was made with all-purpose flour and the chicken was soggy. Rice and beans were ok. Our friend ordered the Burrito Classico (ground beef, shrimp, steak), he liked it. Our waiter was very friendly and attentive. His recommendations for desserts that were made on premises were everything on the menu except the ice cream and mexican coffee cake. So we ordered the tres leches and the Mexican coffee cake (because I heard it‚Äôs made with mascarpone cheese! So it‚Äôs like tiramis√π without the coffee). They really aced the Tres Leches. As a side note, if you have a sensitivity to msg, you should let them know because they do use adobo in their cooking.

4 stars are for cleanliness, wait staff, appetizers and dessert.

author: David Wallman
text: Delicious local Mexican food! Sometimes when I visit my fianc√©‚Äôs family in SI we will come here for lunch and it never disappoints! Today we went with guac to start and then tacos. They refilled our chips multiple times for no charge! The Pina el pastor and el ranchero tacos were delicious and we‚Äôd definitely get them again!

author: J Cee
text: 20/10 recommend!!! Ordered from Grubhub and the food was still HOT!! Tacos and chimichangas are amazing!!! Definitely a new go to!!

author: Nicole Puma
text: Not only is the staff awesome they enjoyed Cinco de Mayo  they made are night...The food was outstanding short rib tacos, shrimp chicken and steal fajitas outrageous ....guacamole was soo fresh ... beef nachos were amazing  I will be coming back again and again love this place ...

author: Ray Wu Adventures
text:
Woooow such an amazing experience! Stepping into this restaurant was like going back in time 60 years to a bygone era of the godfather and goodfellas. Tuxedo clad waiters and a dress code with classy 1960s era of fine dining was such a cool experience. Our waiter Jerry was soooo classy, funny, and friendly! He was able to explain everything in the menu with detail and gave us awesome recommendations.

The food was spectacular 60s era Italian dining with baked clams, veal Parmesan, and an absolutely massive seafood pasta platter that they served on still in the pan.

Absolutely spectacular gargiulo‚Äôs is a must visit when you come to Coney Island, grazie mille!

author: Diane Stevers
text: We had just arrived in town and needed a nice meal. Wow, did we hit the jackpot! Greeted at the door by the owner, atmosphere was gorgeous yet comfortable, food was amazing, Emilio, our server, was not only professional, but friendly, and made our dining experience that much more special. Very reasonably priced for this quality of food and level of service.  On the way out we spoke to George, the bartender, I can‚Äôt wait to come back and try one of his espresso martinis! Thank you!

author: Rev Dr. Leon Daryl Williams, Jr
text: Held 60th Birthday, 10th Anniversary combined celebration. Had a great time. Service was outstanding and atmosphere perfect. Anthony and his team are to be commended. Reasonably priced also. Thanks again.

author: Douglas Considine
text: It's been way too long since my last visit to Gargiulo's. It was even better than I had remembered. We'll worth the trip, you won't be disappointed.

author: Jean Farrell
text: The food here is absolutely divine, and the atmosphere is simply electrifying! The live music adds a whole new level of excitement. It's impossible to resist the urge to jump up and dance! We decided to celebrate Valentine's Day here, and let me tell you, it was an exceptional experience. I cannot recommend this place enough.

author: Infinite Charmz
text: Top tier service and quality food/drinks. Every Wednesday night is Bingo and every Thursday is happy hour & karaoke and it‚Äôs always the absolute best.

author: Brian McKain
text:
My server was extraordinary. Such a nice kid and seemed genuinely interested in what this old man was doing in Astoria on a Monday evening.

And the Chano's Burrito was excellent. My server did recommend the Broccoli Burrito (not vegetarian) after I ordered.

And great prices on Happy Hour beers (this isn't Manhattan).

author: Tristen Huang
text: Very lovely place to dine. Food was delicious and the restaurant is very beautiful inside. Absolutely loved the mofongo, but every dish we ordered was awesome. The molcajete is great to try a bunch of different things, and it comes with tortillas. The sauce is quite salty and tangy, but still I highly recommend it. They have pretty generous ‚Äúhappy hour‚Äù hours, so before 7pm on weekdays you can get a good deal on some drinks!

author: Madeline Little
text:
Whatever you‚Äôre doing, whatever you THINK you know about great New York food - shut up and GO TO CHANOS.

It‚Äôs the best food you‚Äôve put in your mouth. Period.

It‚Äôs the best drinks you‚Äôve had. Period.

It‚Äôs the most fun you‚Äôll have, and if you don‚Äôt come back time and again feel free to @ me because you just don‚Äôt know what you‚Äôre missing.

Incredible. Chano cannot be beat. It‚Äôs one of those places that you think back to when you‚Äôre eating subpar Mexican for triple the cost. It‚Äôs the only place in nyc I recommend to everyone I can. I feel like a broken infomercial but I cannot deny how damn good ALL the food, drink, and deserts are!

Just go. Stop reading this, GO.

author: Gwisun Kim
text: If you're looking to enjoy a taste of Mexican-style decor and flavors, and want to savor simple summer dishes with a refreshing beer, I highly recommend this place!

author: Andr√©s Berl
text: Another average Italian restaurant on the UES

author: Lara
text: Lovely neighborhood spot for a date night! The pasta here is always on point! This restaurant has become one of our go to‚Äôs, will be back again soon.

author: Laura Grubb
text: We walked in with a reservation for Saturday lunch. The gnocchi was fantastic. As was the the ravioli. A short walk from Bloomingdales. Very romantic and the service was superb. Pricing  was reasonable for upper east side dining. The Gnocchi was  reasonably priced   for lunch at  $14.  The portion was generous. A must in upper east side. In a nutshell quiet and romantic setting with superb Italian fare.

author: MEGA_ nem
text: Wonderful hospitality and service. Great local spots with warm and welcoming staff ! Traditional italian eatery.

author: Casey Golden
text: The most kind gem in NYC, as a regular solo diner I find this the most cozy to treat myself to a very long dinner and enjoy whatever the chef selects. Perfect in summer outside and cozy in the winter. Prices are perfect and the food is always amazing. Servers‚Äî- ask for Charlie‚Äî so sweet and attentive.

author: Paulina
text:
I have had my fair share of tikka masala and biryani. To date, their version is one of the richest in flavor profile. The vegetable pakora is filling by itself. As for service, it is superb as our server was very attentive. He brought us sauces without us asking and our water was always full. The bathroom is all the way inside the kitchen. As you walk, the chefs in the back were so courteous.

I recommend paying a visit for some great indian food in the area.

author: Michael Fink
text: Great place for a healthy lunch.  Lunch specials are great.  I come here at least 2-3 times a month.

author: Salmaan Mulla
text:
Great experience we had James our server was very attentive and very kind throughout our experience.

The food was tasty we had some of the barbecue chicken which came with separate white rice which was very good. Pro tip ask for some hot chutney on the side. The chicken biryani was very flavorful. The garlic naan and paratha were great as well.

Special thanks to James for making our evening unforgettable.

author: G Frye
text: Our Indian family friends recommended this place and commented Mint Masala dishes were closed for what they had back home. We are so glad that we got to have lunch together there and enjoyed a wonderful with friends and delicious food. All the dishes were amazing: chicken tikka masala (red sauce), chicken tikka (no sauce), fish masala, garlic naan, and chicken vandaloo.

author: Luna Mart√≠nez
text: Cute, yummy, and cozy! Mint Masala is one of my regular go-to restaurants in the area. The different curries are creamy and delicious, and they can adjust the level of spiciness to your needs. Their vegetable samosas are great and their lentil soup is perfect for a winter day. They have a vegetarian section and other options that can be made vegetarian. It‚Äôs a small spot, so I recommend checking in before heading there!

author: Martha B.
text: Get great place to stop in for an inexpensive sandwich order to pick up a small coffee on the way to work. Expect to wait for food to be prepared.

author: Hiran Beatrine
text:
Best Food in the neighbour hood
Sucha humble crew

They chef is a nice guy
(Food is spectacular)
The lady at the counter so sweet and humble

The delivery guy
(He is awesome guy as well)

You guys earned a permanent customer

author: Eurybios ‚ÄúKado‚Äù
