text: Second time grabbing food from this place ,first time i wasn't as vigilant as this second time around , i noticed the man Handling my food , he grabbed raw meat that he tossed in to fry, while waiying for my food to fry as well and even though he had gloves on he didn't change into a new pair or wash hands after being done with the raw meat. And proceeded to handle my food for serving . With raw meat juice still on the gloves ,holy cow man if thats not a red flag I don't know stay vigilant people . If only I hadn't seen that.

author: Edwin Enriquez
text: I love the food here! My mom put me on and LORDD it buss

author: AMF
text: What restaurant has a near perfect rating? I had to check it out and try something special. Could I have tried 2 eggs, bacon, and home fries? Anyone can cook that! I went with the traditional huevos rancheros. The black beans tasted like they came out of abuela‚Äôs pot at home. I will admit that I did not leave feeling completely full but every bit was perfect. Stop and say hello to the hard working friendly folks at Johnny‚Äôs Cafe.

author: Kristina Zhegunova
text: Pastrami Queen was great! The sandwiches were truly excellent ‚Äî especially the roast beef, tongue, and brisket. The beef broth served as a dipping sauce was rich and flavorful. The coleslaw was fresh and perfectly balanced, and the local soda was just the right touch. The place was clean (even the restroom!), we found a table right away, got served quickly, and finished our meal without any delays. The check for three was a bit over $100 ‚Äî definitely worth it for the quality and experience.

author: Neil Becker
text: Don‚Äôt get me wrong, I‚Äôm not complaining about the $50.00 per pound pastrami, that‚Äôs always delicious, BUT the packets of prepared mustard just cheapens the entire experience. Here‚Äôs some free advice: fill plastic souffl√© cups w/lids with the same brown, spicy mustard you serve at the tables. Isn‚Äôt that what you used to do? I‚Äôm sure it will be greatly appreciated by others as well.

author: Melissa Ribeiro
text: I really wanted to try a typical pastrami sandwich, and I think I chose a great place. It's very small and modest, but it has a unique and authentic atmosphere. The staff was very attentive and friendly. I ordered the traditional sandwich with fries, and there were two of us. It was very tasty.

author: Mae Bornillo
text: Loved this pastrami. My top pastrami place along with Katz. We had the pastrami sandwich with noodle soup. Soup was okay but sandwich was phenomenal. I like that they don't add sauce and you do it yourself to suit your taste. We had to wait a little for the table but worth it. Service is fast as well and efficient. They have a decent restroom. Prices are normal as per nyc standard. Would recommend ‚ú®

author: Donton
text:
Lets get right to it: $30 for the sandwich wasn‚Äôt worth it. Sandwich wasn‚Äôt horrible, a bit dry and had basic flavor but still edible (for $2 a bite of course) I just feel there shouldn‚Äôt be reviews or ravings of ‚Äúknown for huge sandwiches‚Äù. A huge sandwich should have me full or saving half for later. Im still hungry and Im definitely not a big back. I can appreciate great food for the price but this didn‚Äôt add up for me and I work all over the city to queens and brooklyn. Try it and form your own opinion of course but don‚Äôt go in with high expectations. I didn‚Äôt even have enough dressing to finish the other half of my sandwich.

Ps dont let the photo fool you, sandwich is barely 2 lbs Id say

author: Andy Kimball
text: I love this place!  They have amazing bagels.  My favorites are French Toast & Asiago.  Nothing better than a well made L-E-O (Lox, Egg & Onion) on an asiago bagel.  The offer locally sourced meats, wonderful coffee, both hot & cold brew.  A local staple!!!

author: Meagan Wilcox
text: Friendly young staff who always give service with a smile. Superior fresh bagels, amazing sandwiches, and cold brew coffee I would travel for. Also if you like flavored cream cheese their house made flavors are plentiful and better then store bought.

author: Heather Phillips
text:
They have some great bagels, Sundried Tomato is my go-to, but don't pass on the Emlnergy Wheat Bagel with Peanut Butter!

Get a cup of Recess Coffee while you are there. You won't be disappointed.

Stopped today after an appointment.  Got the Veggies lunch sandwich...lettuce, hummus, sprouts, tomatoes, and cucumber. A nice break from a salad.

author: Christopher Graham
text: Got lunch bagel special sandwich and was absolutely delicious, bagels are fresh and ingredients as well. Worth the stop and will visit again

author: Michael
text: Food has been excellent, reasonably priced and staff is friendly and great!

author: Krystal Gill
text: La  is a great pizza place. The people behind the counter were very attentive and helpful. My family and I ordered a plain pie, a buffalo chicken pie,a white slice and a chicken and broccoli Alfredo slice. They all were delicious. The front of the place is inviting as well. They also have seating area to dine in. It‚Äôs a great place to go for lunch or a quick dinner during the week.

author: Phil Gill
text: La Piazza in Staten Island is a standout destination for Italian-American cuisine, particularly renowned for its generous portions and specialty pizza slices. Located at 1445 Richmond Ave in the Stop & Shop Shopping Center, this pizzeria offers a diverse menu featuring classic dishes like pasta, salads, and sandwiches alongside their signature oversized slices loaded with toppings like chicken or calamari.

author: Kerie S
text: Great pizza and great service every time. It is our go to on Staten Island. I gave it five stars for everything.  Atmosphere is typical pizza place, not a fancy white glove restaurant but it‚Äôs clean and if you‚Äôre looking for a good old-fashioned pizza place, this is it.  They even know how to make a gluten-free pie taste good.  I already loved the regular pizza before I went gluten-free.  I‚Äôm glad there is still an option for me and there  is great food  for my whole family.

author: Donnamarie
text: USE to be my go to place..New owners...noticed soon as I got my delivery. The portions are half of what they were. Also, something tastes different in the all around quality. I dont know if they changed kitchen cook too however I will not be placing anymore orders...I do wish the New owner the best this is just my personal experience. And to the old owner..Thank you for the many years of providing excellent quality food & portions...Best of luck to all

author: Rare Warrior
text: I ordered delivery twice from this Pizzeria & Restaurant. I must say I‚Äôm highly impressed with the fresh ingredients, how good the the pizza is, the love the chef puts into the food, the service is good and the staff is extremely friendly which is a plus. I will definitely order from here again because I‚Äôam truly satisfied with everything.

author: Artem Bakatov
text:
Time out says that it is a #1 place for fried chicken in NYC. Well, they are wrong.

The chicken isn't bad but it's not the best and I know a good fried chicken when I have it. The seasoning is there but my thing is not juicy enough and at times it's dry. Plus they only have tenders - I want a bigger variety.

Buffalo chicken wrap is very nice - it's a bit spicy, it is juicy and saucy. I would get it again for sure.

The sauces are very nice. Fries are a bit soggy but they look and taste homemade. Biscuits are very good - I enjoyed them. I must add that the sweet iced tea is also delightful - not overly sweet but still feels sugary.

author: Jeffrey Gomez
text:
I initially tried the famous Bobwhite Counter chicken Caesar wrap at a food festival and it was pretty good but I never went to the actual restaurant until now.

Me and a friend decided to pull up and it did not disappoint.

Atmosphere is small with a limited amount of seating. Plus they have a kiosk where you can digitally order your food.

If you ask me, this is a better version of Chick-fil-A. They specialize in chicken but have a variety of flavors and options to choose from.

I wasn‚Äôt too hungry so I ordered the famous chicken Caesar wrap with a lemonade.

The Caesar wrap was nice and warm. With the perfect amount of dressing. That chicken was fresh, crispy, and juicy. I enjoyed this Caesar wrap. Also, it wasn‚Äôt too heavy.

The lemonade was sweet and refreshing. Can‚Äôt complain.

I ordered through the kiosk, but service is good here. My food didn‚Äôt take too long. Honestly they may see me again in the near future‚Ä¶

I came back a couple days after. I got the truffle chicken sandwich, Mac & cheese, and lemonade.

I love the simplicity of the menu I feel like I could come in here and order anything and be satisfied.

I brought a friend from out of town here and they got the same items as me. They enjoyed it too.

I forgot his name but shout out to the guy with the dreads who works here. He helped me decide to get the Mac & cheese which was really good.

author: Dezzie Symone
text: Even though my food came cold (long distance) it was still good. The barbecue sauce had a little kick to it and I see why people are saying it taste like Popeyes, but it‚Äôs BETTER. The biscuit was cold and it was still soft the pickles were good. I also ordered the chocolate pudding.

author: Willmary (Will)
text: Bobwhite food was amazing. Food was super fresh, yummy and satisfying. I order the jalape√±o guy burger with fries. spicy was perfect! The service was superb. My pictures are not the best as I already had taken a bite but believe me the best!

author: Patrick Zajac
text:
Y‚Äôall this wrap was FIREEEEE!!! I got the buffalo chicken caesar wrap y‚Äôall that ish was so refreshing yet the chicken stayed so crunchy I was actually impressed. The buffalo and the caesar dressing flavors worked perfectly and the wrap was a pretty decent size.

I also got the raspberry tea which on first sip felt a little watered down with not as much flavor as I‚Äôd hoped, but the more I ate the wrap the more the drink tasted so delicious.

author: Ivan Klugman
text: We returned to Nearys after a long break due to Covid and our relocation.  It's was an amazing evening seeing our old friends. Jimmy has passed but his legacy is in good hands with Mary and Una taking over the "Master of Ceremonies" position. All the staff is the same.  Let's talk about the food the Lamb Chops are legendary. We also love the French Onion soup , Prime Rib and Liver. Don't forget to leave room for desert and Irish Coffee !!  The Irish Coffee is fantastic !!

author: Valerie Mae
text: I had the Broiled Lamb Chops with mint jelly.  It was tasty and tender.  The baked potato tasted like it was just harvested.  My meal came out within 30 minutes, and it was worth the wait.  I will definitely return to try something else on the menu.

author: NYC Guide
text:
This is a classy place with great service. The best lamb chops I ever had!
Excellent service by  Eugenia and Mary. Don‚Äôt forget to wear your collared shirt.

author: Gail Melisa
text:
The calves liver with bacon and onions (first photo) is the tastiest one that I have ever had in The City.

The mashed potatoes (second photo) were a creamy delight.

Mary is one of the friendliest managers there is.
Rochelle, the waitress,  provided me good service.

I will return to try the famous lamb chops.

author: G Mek
text: A greatly underated establishment in New York. Superb customer service. The friendliest homliest bar/restaurant in New York. The staff are there years which speaks for itself but then so are the customers. You never know who you will meet when you drop in. Great front of house with Mary and Una. 2 brilliant and knowledgeable barmen. Overall 10/10 I'll be back

author: John Gonsalves
text:
Llama Inn is a beautiful restaurant with a really inviting and stylish atmosphere. The decor is stunning lots of warm tones, plants, and an overall design that feels both modern and cozy. There‚Äôs even a subtle smell of Palo Santo in the air, which adds a relaxing and unique touch to the experience.
I tried the mariscos dish, which was excellent very flavorful and perfectly balanced. The fried calamari on top was a nice surprise that added great texture. The tuna with cantaloupe ceviche was another standout sweet yet acidic in just the right way, refreshing and layered with flavor.
The staff was very friendly and attentive throughout the meal, making sure everything was just right. The only thing I would have liked to see was a larger variety of non-alcoholic drinks, as that part of the menu felt a bit limited. Overall though, it‚Äôs a wonderful place to dine, and I‚Äôd definitely come back again.

author: Isabella Grandic
text:
Very delish food. Ceviche was the STAR! Loved the skewers too. Modern restaurant and not too difficult to get a reservation. A little light on the seafood, wish there was more per dish, but that‚Äôs the nature of upscale dining I suppose üòÇ

Constantly changing menu, modern twists on Peruvian food

author: Cass
text:
Objectively fire food. The ceviche was my favorite thing - really tangy and fresh. Deliciously cooked octopus.
The chicken skewers were also great.
The paella was a bitttt creamy for my liking. But it‚Äôs still really good.  Seafood was of course really well cooked.
We could get a reservation for 3 ppl for Saturday night the same week.

author: Andreas Kaiser
text:
Another jewels of the ‚Äúin‚Äù scene of Brooklyn: Llama Inn, a Peruvian restaurant with cool ambiente, friendly and knowledgeable staff and spectacular dishes. Chicken Anticucho, Trout tartage, Ceviche caretillero, tuna ceviche, ¬Ω chicken, and Lomo saltado all were outstanding with beautiful presentation, super tenderness, and colorful flavors.

(Originally posted by me on yelp)

author: Yolandy D
text: Food was great, everyone was kind and had a relaxing time. Arroz con mariscos was my favorite, I like Lomo salteado but I will say is in the pricey side. Evrything else 10/10. Lemon pie GREAT.

author: Anne Vogt
text: The decor at casino creates a lovely setting, and you can tell they've put effort into the atmosphere. Unfortunately, the food didn't quite live up to the same standard. While the portions were substantial, the dishes were ultimately unremarkable and didn't offer anything particularly exciting or memorable. It felt a bit pretentious, with prices that seemed inflated for the quality of the food. This could be a decent choice for a special occasion where ambiance is a priority, but for a regular dining experience, it's not worth the cost. With so many incredible dining options in New York, this is likely a "one and done" for me. I'd prioritize trying other places before considering a second visit.

author: carlos borges
text:
Casino restaurant envelops diners in a warm, inviting atmosphere that perfectly sets the stage for an extraordinary meal.

The Insalata mista is perfect for salad lovers‚Äîsimple, fresh, and lightly dressed to let the ingredients shine. It‚Äôs a refreshing start that feels effortlessly balanced.

The Heritage chicken is a standout dish that keeps me coming back. Featuring a fragrant ajwain gastrique and a velvety Vidalia onion soubise, this dish is pure perfection. It's so good that I, someone who rarely orders chicken at restaurants, find myself craving it regularly. That alone speaks volumes about its quality.

I‚Äôm also endlessly impressed by their Romano Beans, available year-round. Somehow, Casino manages to make this humble ingredient a star in a dish I make a point to enjoy every single visit.

author: Clara Park
text: I came here for my friend‚Äôs bday dinner. First, food and vibes are really really great. But we were very disappointed by service. Our server James never came to check on us and we couldn‚Äôt ask/order things on right time. We also ordered three bottles and when we finally got it we poured our own drinks as nobody came to help us. Also we called ahead to ask for candles as we were celebrating a birthday and he said okay, but he didn‚Äôt provide it. We had to ask a manager to get the candles she was very nice and helpful. I would like to come back for food but not for service.

author: Meredith Goossen
text: Probably more of a 3.5. Pretty restaurant, upstairs and down. Very active noise level and very close to one another tables. Cocktails were good, appetizers (eggplant faratini, radicchio salad, gulf shrimp) fine. I had the pesto pasta and it was really under seasoned. My friend had the clam pasta. We shared the pavlova for dessert and it was, again, fine. Good not great but an energetic lively vibe. Probably worth a revisit in the future.

author: Daria Dunne
text:
The vibe was great, very beautiful interior and feels like you go back in time. The espresso martini was great, not sure if it‚Äôs worth its price though. Food was a 3.5 out of 5, can‚Äôt say I‚Äôll be coming back for a dinner, but for a drink and atmosphere I would. If I could leave 3.5 stars I‚Äôd do that. Overall not a bad experience, however the service could be better.

Updated: Don‚Äôt order the chicken dish.
